column1: text

once upon a time, there was a big race between two animals. a rabbit and a turtle wanted to see who was the fastest. the race started and the rabbit ran very fast. the turtle was slow, but he kept going. suddenly, the rabbit got tired and slept. the turtle kept going and won the race! the turtle had a victory!

the rabbit was very sad, but his friends were helpful. they told him to not give up and try again. the rabbit listened and practiced every day. soon, he was ready for a new race. this time, he didn't stop and he didn't sleep. he ran and ran until he reached the finish line. he had a victory too!

but the rabbit learned a lesson. he learned that being too confident can strike you down. he was happy that his friends were helpful and that he could try again. from that day on, the rabbit was a little more careful and a little more humble.

once upon a time there was a little girl named maria. she was a very happy daughter who lived in a small house with her mum and dad.

one day maria heard a noise coming from the kitchen. she walked in and saw a big tall window with no glass, so the wind was blowing inside. maria's mum and dad were busy trying to shut the window, but it just wouldn't stay shut.

maria's dad saw her and said: "maria, can you help us shut this window?"

so maria stepped forward and grabbed hold of the window. she pushed it as hard as she could and it shut tight. maria beamed with pride knowing that she had helped mummy and daddy.

maria's dad smiled and said: "well done my little daughter!"

and ever since that day, all the windows in the house have been kept safely shut!

once upon a time, there was a girl named red. she went to her grandma's house in the woods. red had a basket with food for her grandma. she saw a wolf on the way. the wolf was big and had smooth fur. red was scared, but the wolf was nice. he helped her unpack the basket and they had a picnic together. the wolf then showed her the way to her grandma's house. red was happy and thanked the wolf.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. amy loved to play with her friends. one day, amy and her friends wanted to go to the theater. they wanted to watch a movie. the theater was a fun place where they could see stories on a big screen.

amy's mommy said, "you can choose the movie, but it must be a harmless one." amy and her friends were very excited. they looked at the movie posters and saw a movie about a friendly bear. they all agreed, "let's watch the friendly bear movie. it looks harmless and fun!"

so, amy and her friends went into the theater. they sat in big, soft chairs and ate yummy popcorn. they laughed and clapped as they watched the friendly bear on the big screen. the friendly bear made them all very happy. after the movie, they went home and told their mommies and daddies about the fun time they had at the theater.

once upon a time, there were two friends, jack and jane. they went outside to the park and saw a flagpole. jack said, "let's shoot the flag!" jane was excited and said, "yes!"

so jack got out his gun and aimed carefully. he shot the flag, and it flew high into the sky. soon, their friend paul arrived and asked, "what are you shooting at?" jack said, "we are shooting the flag!" paul said, "how spicy!"

jack laughed and said, "that's right! it is a very spicy flag!" they all had a good laugh and watched the flag move around in the air. then they went home and had a delicious dinner. the end.

once upon a time there was a big, tidy whale swimming in the sea. the whale was so shiny and clean; it was like it was made of diamonds!

then, one hot summer day, the sun melted the whale's skin, and it started to get very hot. the whale tried to find a cool spot in the water, but it was too hot.

suddenly, the whale had an idea; it jumped out of the water and started to splash around in the sun. the water droplets felt like little rainbows, and the whale felt so much cooler!

the whale continued to splash around until the sun started to set. then, the whale said goodbye to the sun, hopped back in the water and swam away, feeling soft and refreshed.

once upon a time there was a boy who really wanted to explore an island. the island was different from his home because it had many exciting things to explore! 

the boy asked his mom if he could go to the island. but his mom shook her head and said no. she said it was too dangerous and wanted to prevent the boy from getting hurt. 

the boy wasn't happy but he understood. he asked his mom what he could do instead. his mom thought for a minute and then said he could use his imagination. 

the boy closed his eyes and imagined he was standing on the island. he imagined different animals that he could find and all the fun things he could do. he almost forgot he was at home!

when he opened his eyes, he was happy his mom had prevented him from going to the island because it was much more fun to explore it in his imagination. and that was the end of the story.

once upon a time, there was a little dog named spot. spot loved to chew on things. one day, he found a candle on the table. he thought it was a toy and started to chew on it. as he chewed, the candle broke into pieces.

spot's mommy saw what happened and said, "spot, you should not chew on candles. they are not toys." spot felt sad because he didn't know that candles were not for chewing. he wanted to make his mommy happy again.

spot had an idea. he waited until his mommy was ready to eat dinner. then, he brought her a new candle from the cupboard. spot's mommy smiled and said, "thank you, spot. you are a good dog." spot wagged his tail, happy that he could help his mommy. from that day on, spot never chewed on candles again.

one day, a little girl named lily was walking to school. she saw a puppy on the side of the road. "can i take him home?" she asked her mom. her mom replied, "no, lily. we can't keep a puppy right now."

lily was sad, but she knew her mom was being helpful. 

on the way to school, she saw a lovely garden full of lilies. lily asked her mom, "can i pick one lily to take home?" her mom replied, "yes, you can use it to decorate your room." 

lily was very happy and thanked her mom for being so helpful. that night, lily found the lily in a vase on her bedside table. she remembered why her mom said no to the puppy - she wanted lily to have something special from the garden instead. 

lily was so happy. she knew her mom always had something special waiting for her!

once upon a time there were two boys who were very competitive with each other. they both wanted to have the nicest yacht. so they decided to have a sorting game to decide who would get the yacht.

the boys looked at the boats and sorted them by size. the smaller boats went to one side and the bigger boats went to the other side. the one with the biggest boat would get the yacht.

both boys worked hard to sort the boats. one by one they put them in the right places. finally they both finished and they compared the sizes.

the boys looked at the boats and saw that the biggest boat was the yacht! so, the boys decided to share the yacht and have lots of fun together.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named bobby. he had many toys, but his favorite was a red race car. bobby loved to zoom around the living room with his car.

one day bobby's mom decided to give him a special treat. she said, "bobby it's time for your special massage". bobby was excited. he had never had a massage before.

bobby's mom gave him a massage for a long time and he loved it. after the massage, bobby hopped onto his red race car and zoomed around the room. he was having so much fun. from far away he heard a voice calling. 

it was bobby's mom. she said, "it's time to go now, bobby. we're visiting your distant relatives on the other side of town." bobby quickly hopped off his car and followed his mom out the door. he was already looking forward to his visit with his distant relatives.

once upon a time, there was a little dog named spot. spot lived in a small house with his friend, tim. one day, it was very hot outside, and tim felt helpless because he didn't know how to cool down.

spot saw tim frown and said, "don't be sad, tim! i will help you!" spot ran to the kitchen and brought a big fan. he turned it on, and cool air blew all around. tim smiled and said, "thank you, spot! you are a good friend."

from that day on, tim and spot always helped each other when they felt helpless. they learned that when you help a friend, you feel happy too. and that is the moral of the story: helping others can make you feel good.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sally. she loved to play with her toys and her friends on the playground.

one day, sally and her friends decided to play tag. sally was chasing them, but she was not very fast. suddenly, sally tripped and fell. her knee started to hurt.

sally's friends ran to get help. they found a grown-up who was very organized. he had bandages and medicine.

the grown-up asked sally, "are you okay?"

sally said, "my knee hurts. it really hurts!"

the grown-up said, "let me take a look." he carefully cut away the fabric of her pants and examined her knee. "it looks like you have a cut. i'm going to strike it a few times with this medicine. it may sting a bit, but it will help." sally was a bit scared, but she trusted the grown-up.

the grown-up applied the medicine to sally's cut. it did sting a bit, but soon enough, she felt better. the grown-up said, "let me wrap it up for you." he wrapped her knee in a bandage and helped her to stand.

sally thanked the grown-up, hugged her friends, and ran back to the playground!

john loved to play with his friends outside. every day they explored the outdoors, found bugs and talked about what they wanted to be when they grew up. one day, john's friends started teasing him. they said, "john, you look too slow to catch us!" 
john got very mad and ran home. he went straight to the fridge and opened it, looking for a snack. inside was a yummy snack, so he grabbed it and started eating it. 

john was surprised when his friends knocked on the door. they said that they had come over just to apologize for teasing him. when he heard their apology, john's heart filled with joy. he smiled and gave each of them some of the snacks that he had taken from the fridge. 

john quickly realized that his friends had only been teasing him because they wanted him to have fun with them, not because they meant to hurt his feelings. the next day, john and his friends went outside to play again and teased each other in a fun, friendly way.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to pack her toys and go on adventures. one day, lily's mommy told her they were going on a trip. lily was so excited, she packed all her favorite toys and put them in her backpack.

as they were driving, they saw a man who looked troubled. lily's mommy stopped the car and asked if he needed help. the man said he lost his keys and couldn't get into his car. lily's mommy tried to help, but they couldn't find the keys.

suddenly, they heard a loud noise and saw smoke. a big truck crashed into their car! lily and her mommy were hurt and had to go to the hospital. sadly, lily's toys were lost forever. it was a very bad ending to their trip.

once upon a time, there was a stitch. it was very small but very brave. it was flexible, so it could do lots of things. 

one day, the stitch was in danger. it needed to be protected. it looked around, but it was all alone. 

suddenly, the stitch heard a voice. it was coming from a butterfly. the butterfly said, "don't worry little stitch, i will protect you!" 

the butterfly fluttered around the stitch, keeping it safe from harm. it spread its wings wide to create a shield around the stitch. the butterfly stayed with the stitch until it was out of danger. 

the stitch was so grateful for the butterfly's help. from then on, the butterfly and the stitch were the best of friends. they looked out for each other, and that is why we should always look out for our friends.

ben was a lazy boy. he did not like to help his mom and dad with the chores. he only liked to play with his toys and watch tv. one day, he saw a big black beetle on the floor. he thought it was funny and wanted to catch it.

he ran after the beetle and tried to grab it with his hand. but the beetle was fast and smart. it ran under the sofa and hid from ben. ben was angry and tried to reach under the sofa. he felt something soft and furry. he pulled it out and saw it was his cat, max.

max did not like to be pulled by his tail. he was scared and angry. he hissed and scratched ben's hand. ben cried out and let go of max. he slapped his hand to make the pain go away. he looked at his hand and saw blood and fur. he felt sorry and sad.

he ran to his mom and showed her his hand. she cleaned it and put a band-aid on it. she hugged him and told him not to chase beetles or pull cats. she told him to be gentle and kind to animals. she told him to help her with the chores and learn new things.

ben nodded and said he was sorry. he said he loved his mom and his cat. he said he would not be lazy anymore. he went to find max and said sorry to him too. he petted him and gave him a treat. max purred and licked his hand. ben smiled and felt happy. he learned his lesson.

mia woke up happy. she was going on a vacation with her family today. she bounced out of bed, happy to start the day. 

mia and her family ate breakfast and got ready for their trip. mia was so excited that she could hardly be still. 

after a long drive, they arrived at their vacation spot. it was a lazy beach day. mia loved playing in the sand and collecting seashells. she even went swimming with her dad. 

the sun was setting and it was time to go. mia hugged the beach goodbye and fell asleep in the car. she had a wonderful time and was looking forward to her next vacation.

once upon a time, there was a girl called sarah. she had a lamp in her room that she loved very much. one day, sarah was feeling very dizzy and did not know why. she decided to look at the lamp in her room to get her mind off her dizzy feelings. suddenly, sarah heard a rip. she turned around and saw that the lamp had been torn in half. 

sarah was beside herself with shock. she knew she had done nothing wrong, so she was very confused. 

a voice behind her spoke up. â€œi did it! i got too excited to see your lamp and i tore it in half!â€ it was sarahâ€™s little brother, who had been watching her from behind. 

sarah had been so dizzy that she hadnâ€™t noticed him there. she gently said, â€œitâ€™s ok buddy, donâ€™t worry. letâ€™s try and fix it.â€

together, sarah and her brother worked hard to repair the lamp. after a few hours, it was just like new. sarah was so proud that her and her brother had worked together to mend the lamp. from then on, when she was feeling dizzy, sarah just looked at her lamp and was reminded that anything is possible.

once upon a time, there was a lively girl. she wanted to go for a ride, so she hopped on her bike. she rode around the block and then came back. when she came back, she saw a wiggly tooth on the ground.

the girl was so excited and showed it to her mom. they laughed and smiled. her mom told the girl that something special will happen if she puts the tooth under her pillow. 

so the girl went to bed and put her tooth under her pillow. in the morning, she woke up to find a surprise. a nice little fairy had left her a present of some tasty candy. 

the girl was so happy and excited she jumped up and down and gave a big hug to her mom. she was so happy and excited to go for another ride on her bike. 

the girl grabbed her bike and took off to explore the neighborhood, feeling more lively and adventurous than ever.

once upon a time, there was a spider named spidey. spidey was a fancy spider with shiny black legs and a red spot on his back. one day, spidey wanted to race his spider friends. they all lined up and started to run as fast as they could. spidey was the fastest spider of them all and won the race!

mavis saw the doctor with her mummy. he was wearing a white coat, and she knew he was different. he had big glasses and funny hair. he talked a lot to mummy, but she didn't understand. 

mavis was scared, so she wanted to cry, but mummy said not to. she felt the tear in her eye, but she didn't let it go. 

mummy took mavis's hand and held it tight. she knew mummy was scared too, but they had to be brave. 

the doctor was very kind and looked at mavis. he smiled and showed her some pictures. she liked them, so he gave her one. it was so nice, she smiled.

mavis was glad that she went to the doctor's, even though she was scared at first. she knew that people were different and it was ok. the picture made her feel better.

once upon a time, there was a friendly dog named max. max liked to walk and play with his friends. one day, max found a cup in the park. max thought the cup was a toy, so he started to play with it.

max's friends saw him with the cup and wanted to play too. they all took turns running and jumping with the cup. they were having so much fun. max and his friends played with the cup all day long.

but then, max and his friends got very tired. they wanted to go home and rest. max tried to pick up the cup to take it with him, but he was too tired. max and his friends left the cup in the park and went home. the next day, when max and his friends came back to play, the cup was gone. they were sad because they could not play with the cup anymore.

once upon a time there was a poor mouse who was very unhappy. he had suffered from the rudeness of some other animals. he felt sad and alone. 

one day the mouse was walking around a garden, trying to find something nice to eat. suddenly he spied two big cats playing in the sun. the mouse was scared, but stood very still, hoping that the cats wouldnâ€™t notice him. 

unfortunately, the cats noticed the mouse and began to chase him. the mouse ran and ran, but the cats were just too fast. eventually, he found a small hole in the ground and managed to squeeze through. he was very relieved, but sadly he was still stuck in the hole. 

the cats were still determined to get the mouse. they continued to paw at the hole and scream rude words. but then a kind rabbit came by and heard the poor mouse's cries. the rabbit quickly ran to the farmers house. the farmer was not happy with the cats' behaviour and shooed them away. 

the mouse was very thankful to the rabbit, and they both danced in the garden together. from then on, the mouse never suffered from the rudeness of other animals again.

lily and tom are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big tree with many bees. they hear a buzz.

"look, tom, bees!" lily says. "they make honey. honey is sweet and nice. i like honey on my bread."

"me too," tom says. "but we can't take the honey from the bees. they will sting us. it will hurt."

"maybe we can ask them," lily says. "maybe they will share some honey with us. bees are nice, too."

lily and tom go near the tree. they see a hole with honey inside. they smell the honey. it smells good.

"hello, bees," lily says. "can you please bring us some honey? we want to taste it. we will be nice to you."

the bees hear lily. they are surprised. they are not used to people talking to them. they fly out of the hole. they see lily and tom. they are not afraid. they are curious.

"hello, children," one bee says. "you want some honey? why do you want honey?"

"because honey is sweet and nice," tom says. "we like honey on our bread. but we don't have any honey at home."

the bee thinks. he likes honey, too. he knows how hard it is to make honey. he wants to help the children. he talks to the other bees. they agree.

"okay, children," the bee says. "we will bring you some honey. but you have to promise something. you have to be nice to the bees. you have to respect the tree. you have to not waste the honey. can you do that?"

"yes, yes, yes," lily and tom say. "we promise. we will be nice to the bees. we will respect the tree. we will not waste the honey. thank you, bees. thank you very much."

the bees nod. they fly back to the hole. they bring out some honey. they put it in a small jar. they give it to lily and tom.

"here you go, children," the bee says. "enjoy the honey. but remember your promise. be nice to the bees. respect the tree. don't waste the honey."

lily and tom take the jar. they smile. they thank the bees again. they go home. they share the honey with their families. they put some honey on their bread. they taste it. it is sweet and nice. they are happy. the bees are happy, too. they have made new friends.

tom and jen are friends. they like to play with toys and draw with crayons. one day, they find a big box of markers in the closet. they are very happy. they want to make colorful pictures on the paper.

"look, jen, i have a red marker. it is bright and pretty," tom says.

"i have a blue marker. it is cool and nice," jen says.

they start to draw on the paper. they make flowers, stars, and cars. they have fun.

but then, tom gets bored. he thinks the paper is too dull. he wants to draw on something else. he looks around. he sees jen's neck. he thinks it is white and plain. he has an idea.

"hey, jen, can i draw on your neck?" he asks.

"no, tom, you can't. that is not nice. that will hurt me," jen says.

but tom does not listen. he grabs jen's neck. he tries to mark it with his red marker. jen screams. she is scared and angry. she pushes tom away. she runs to the teacher. she shows her neck. it has a big red mark on it. it is sore and ugly.

the teacher is mad. she takes the markers away. she scolds tom. she tells him he is very naughty. she makes him sit in the corner. she calls his mom. she tells her what he did.

tom is sad and sorry. he knows he did a bad thing. he wishes he did not mark jen's neck. he wishes he was still her friend. but jen does not want to talk to him. she does not like him anymore. she thinks he is mean and bad. she stays away from him.

tom has no friends. he has no markers. he has no fun. he has a bad day.

one day there was a good dog. his name was steve. steve always wanted to learn more and do good things, so he went on a journey.

steve asked people, "do you know any news that can help me?" most of the people he asked ignored him, but then one day he met a nice lady. she said, "i know some news that will help you be even better!"

the lady smiled as she said to steve, "i heard that every day if you do good things then you will become an even better person!" so steve thanked her and said, "thank you for not ignoring me!"

and from then on, every day steve made sure to do good things. he learned more and had a better life than before.

once upon a time, there was a rabbit named benny. benny loved to eat celery, but one day he got stuck in a big hole. he tried to hop out, but he couldn't. he was scared and didn't know what to do.

just then, a polite turtle named tommy came by. "hello, benny," said tommy. "are you okay?"

benny explained that he was stuck and couldn't get out. tommy knew just what to do. he went to get his friend, a strong and brave dog named max. max came back with tommy and they worked together to rescue benny. they pulled him out of the hole and benny was so happy to be free again.

as a thank you, benny shared some of his delicious celery with tommy and max. they all became good friends and benny learned to be more careful when hopping around.

once upon a time there was a charming potato. he was happy and green, and liked to play in the dirt all day. every day he saw the sun in the sky and smiled.

one day, the farmer came by and saw the potato. he liked the potato very much and decided to remove it from the dirt and take it home with him.

the potato was scared at first, but soon he felt excited! he was going on an adventure to the farmer's house.

when they arrived, the farmer put the potato in a big cupboard and left. the potato was so happy he wanted to explore. after a little while he found a bowl filled with delicious cream!

he was very happy and ate it all up. all day he played in the farmer's house and even made a few new friends.

the next day the farmer came back and saw the charming potato. he was very pleased with what he saw and decided to keep him. so the happy potato stayed with the farmer and they lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named mia. she loved to write in her journal. her journal was not fancy, it was cheap. but mia did not care. she wrote about her day, her friends, and her dreams.

one day, mia wanted to learn how to ride her bike without training wheels. she tried and tried, but she fell down many times. mia was sad, but she did not give up. she wrote in her journal, "i will succeed."

the next day, mia tried again. she fell down a few times, but she kept trying. and then, something amazing happened. mia was able to ride her bike without falling down! she was so happy. she succeeded!

mia ran inside and wrote in her journal, "today, i succeeded in riding my bike without training wheels!" she was very proud of herself. and every time she read her journal, she remembered that she could do anything if she tried hard and never gave up.

once upon a time, there was a little ant who lived in a big desert. every day, the ant would walk far and wide to find food and water. one day, the ant stumbled upon a beautiful oasis. the water was clear and the trees provided shade from the rough sun. the ant was so happy to have found this oasis, but he was also cautious. he knew that not everything was as it seemed.

so, the ant decided to test the water before drinking it. he took a small sip and waited to see if he felt sick. luckily, the water was clean and refreshing. the ant was so grateful for the oasis and promised to always be careful and test things before trusting them. from that day on, the ant lived a happy and safe life, thanks to the lesson he learned at the oasis.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had a bag that she loved to carry around everywhere she went. one day, lily went to the park with her bag. she played on the swings, went down the slide, and had a lot of fun.

suddenly, lily saw something shiny on the ground. she picked it up and put it in her bag. when she got home, she opened her bag and saw that the shiny thing was a rare coin. lily was so happy and excited to reveal her new treasure to her family.

from that day on, lily always carried her bag with her, hoping to find more rare things to add to her collection.

lily and tom are brother and sister. they love to play together. one day, they want to make a surprise for mom. they go to their room and look for things to use.

they find some paper, crayons, glue and scissors. they cut the paper into shapes and color them. they glue the shapes together to make a card. they write "we love you mom" on the card. they also find some flowers in the garden and put them in a vase.

they hide the card and the vase behind the couch. they wait for mom to come home. they hear the door open and run to the living room. they shout "surprise!" and show mom their gifts.

mom is very happy and hugs them. she says "thank you, lily and tom. you are so sweet and creative. this is the best surprise ever. i love you too." she puts the card and the vase on the table and smiles.

lily and tom are proud and happy. they made mom's day open and bright. they love to make surprises for mom.

once upon a time, there was a lonely little flame who lived in the woods. the lonely flame had no friends and always felt sad. it wanted to make friends with the animals in the woods, but they were all scared of the flame.

one day, a kind bird flew to the flame and said, "why are you so lonely, little flame?" the flame replied, "i want to make friends, but everyone is scared of me." the bird thought for a moment and said, "i have an idea! let's put you in a safe place where you can meet the animals without scaring them."

the bird picked up a small stick and put the lonely flame on it. it then flew around the woods, showing the flame to all the animals. the animals saw that the flame was not scary when it was on the stick, and they started to become friends with the lonely flame.

the flame was no longer lonely, and it was happy to have so many new friends. from that day on, the flame and the animals in the woods lived happily together, and the flame learned that sometimes all it takes is a little help from a friend to find happiness.

jimmy was playing at the beach. he was so excited to see the big wave that was coming. he squealed with joy and started running towards the water.

but then he saw one of his friends, emily, standing at the edge of the beach, looking very nervous. jimmy stopped and asked her, "what's wrong, emily?"

"i'm too scared to go in the water," emily said, her voice trembling. "i'm afraid the wave will tear me apart!"

jimmy felt her fear and put his hand on her shoulder. "it's ok, emily, the wave won't do that," he said in a comforting voice.

emily looked up at jimmy with a relieved smile. she finally trusted enough to take a few steps forward and soon enough she was running into the water, laughing and jumping over the small waves.

jimmy was so happy for her, but he knew that he had helped her overcome her fears. he stood there with a smile on his face and watched as emily laughed, waves crashing around her.

once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little boy named tim. he had a big, white dog named spot. they loved to play together in the park.

one day, tim and spot were playing catch with a ball. tim threw the ball far, and spot ran to get it. but when spot came back, he had a hat on his head! "spot," tim said, "where did you find that hat?" spot wagged his tail and barked, but he could not talk.

just then, a man came running up to them. "oh, thank you!" he said. "i lost my hat in the park, and your dog found it for me!" tim smiled and said, "you're welcome! spot is very good at finding things!" the man patted spot on the head and said, "yes, he is a very good dog!"

as they walked home, tim's mom saw them and called out, "tim, don't forget to wash your hands before dinner!" tim looked at his hands and said, "oh, that's right! thanks for reminding me, mom!" tim and spot went inside, and tim washed his hands. then they all had a nice dinner together.

once upon a time there was a boy who wanted to ride a bike. he did not know how so he asked his mom for help. the mom lead the little boy to the bike and taught him how to use it. she showed him how to pedal the bike with his feet and the boy was so excited to learn. after the mom showed him how to ride, he was very independent. he could go on long rides on his bike and always had lots of fun. he was so happy and proud to be able to ride the bike all by himself. the end.

once upon a time there was a trusty little town. all the people in the town were very nice, but something strange started to happen. one by one, the people died and the town was left dead and quiet. everyone was scared, so they locked the doors and the windowsâ€¦

suddenly, one morning the town woke to a bright light. a big, friendly giant was standing in the middle of the street and all the people rushed out of their houses to see him.

the giant smiled and said he was here to help. he said that if the people trusted him, he could bring life back to the town. everyone was so excited, so they all nodded their heads and agreed to trust him.

the giant started to work, and soon the town was alive and happy again. all of the houses were fixed up and the streets filled with music and laughter. the people of the trusty town were all very happy and blessed to have a friendly giant show them that trust and life go hand in hand.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he liked to bake cakes with his mommy. one day, they decided to make a chocolate cake. timmy put the flour and sugar in the mixer, but it was tough to mix. he had to rush to finish the cake before his friends came over.

when the cake was done, timmy and his friends ate it all up. but, something bad happened. timmy's tummy started to hurt really bad. he had eaten too much cake and got sick. his mommy had to take him to the hospital, but it was too late. timmy had to stay in the hospital for a long time and he never got to bake with his mommy again.

lily had a big cut on her knee. it hurt a lot and it was bleeding. she cried and ran to her mom. her mom hugged her and said, "don't worry, lily. it will heal soon. i have a secret that can help."

lily stopped crying and looked at her mom. "what is the secret, mom?" she asked.

her mom smiled and said, "the secret is honey. honey is sweet and sticky and good for you. it can also heal your cut. it will make it stop hurting and bleeding and keep it clean."

lily was curious and said, "how can honey heal my cut, mom?"

her mom said, "honey has something called magic in it. magic is a good thing that can do amazing things. magic can heal your cut by fighting the bad things that can make it worse. the bad things are called germs. germs are very small and you can't see them, but they can make you sick. honey has magic that can stop the germs and make your cut better."

lily said, "wow, mom. honey is amazing. can i try it?"

her mom said, "of course, lily. but first, we have to wash your cut with water and soap. water and soap can also help heal your cut by washing away the dirt and the blood. dirt and blood can also have germs in them. washing your cut will make it ready for the honey."

lily nodded and said, "ok, mom. let's wash my cut."

her mom took lily to the bathroom and washed her cut gently with water and soap. lily said, "ouch, mom. it stings a little."

her mom said, "i know, lily. but it will only sting for a little while. it means that the water and soap are working. they are making your cut clean and safe. it will feel better soon."

lily said, "ok, mom. i trust you."

her mom dried her cut with a soft towel and said, "now, it's time for the honey. are you ready, lily?"

lily said, "yes, mom. i'm ready."

her mom took a jar of honey from the kitchen and a spoon. she scooped some honey with the spoon and said, "now, lily, i'm going to put some honey on your cut. it might feel a little sticky and wet, but it will not hurt. it will feel sweet and warm and nice. it will make your cut heal faster and better. ok?"

lily said, "ok, mom. i'm not scared."

her mom put some honey on lily's cut and said, "there, lily. how does it feel?"

lily said, "it feels good, mom. it feels like a kiss from you. it doesn't hurt anymore. it feels like magic."

her mom said, "i'm glad, lily. you are very brave and smart. now, we have to cover your cut with a band-aid. a band-aid is a sticker that can protect your cut from the air and the dirt. it can also keep the honey in place. it can also have a picture on it that can make you happy. do you want a band-aid, lily?"

lily said, "yes, mom. i want a band-aid. can i have one with a unicorn on it?"

her mom said, "sure, lily. i have one right here. let me put it on your cut. there, lily. how do you like it?"

lily said, "i love it, mom. it's beautiful. thank you, mom. you are the best."

her mom said, "you're welcome, lily. i love you, too. now, your cut will heal soon and you will be fine. but remember, lily, honey is a secret. you can't tell anyone about it. it's our special thing. ok?"

lily said, "ok, mom. i won't tell anyone. honey is our secret. but can i ask you something, mom?"

her mom said, "of course, lily. what do you want to ask me?"

lily said, "mom, if honey can heal my cut, can it also heal other things? like a broken toy or a sad friend or a disgusting bug?"

her mom said, "well, lily, honey can heal some things, but not everything. honey can heal things that are alive, like you and me and plants and animals. but honey can't heal things that are not alive, like toys and books and rocks. and honey can't heal things that are already dead, like bugs and leaves and flowers. and honey can't heal things that are in your heart, like feelings and dreams and wishes. those things need other things to heal, like glue

lily and tom are friends. they like to play with toys and make noise. one day, they find a big box in the garage. they open the box and see many things inside. they see a hat, a scarf, a guitar, a drum, and a microphone.

"wow, look at all these things!" lily says. "we can perform a show with them!"

"yes, let's do that!" tom says. "i want to play the guitar and sing!"

"i want to play the drum and wear the hat and scarf!" lily says.

they take the things out of the box and go to the backyard. they set up a stage with some chairs and a blanket. they invite their parents and their dog to watch their show.

"welcome to our show!" lily says into the microphone. "we are lily and tom, and we are going to make some lively noise for you!"

they start to play their instruments and sing. they make up funny songs and dance. they have a lot of fun and make their parents and their dog smile and clap.

"thank you for watching our show!" tom says into the microphone. "we hope you liked our lively noise!"

they bow and hug each other. they are happy and proud of their show. they put the things back into the box and say goodbye to their parents and their dog. they go inside to have some juice and cookies. they are good friends.

once upon a time, there was an amazing race. all the people in the world wanted to join it! everyone was super excited.

on the morning of the race, everyone cheered loudly and hugged each other. they said they would support each other no matter what.

as the race began, everyone started running quickly. everyone ran as fast as they could.

at the end of the race, everyone cheered for each other. they were so excited and happy that everyone had finished!

the amazing race was so much fun for everyone. they all felt a big sense of accomplishment. and everyone had each other to thank for the support they gave each other. together, they made it to the finish line!

once upon a time, there was a little girl called ellie. ellie was three years old and enjoyed playing in her garden. she loved running around and exploring the many colours of the flowers and trees.

one day, when ellie went out in her garden, she found something extraordinary. it was a big envelope with incredible words written on it. she had never seen mail before, so she was very excited. she took it inside and opened it up.

inside, she found a special surprise! it was a birthday card from her grandparents. ellie couldn't believe it. she hugged the card, then ran outside to tell her mommy. 

ellie enjoyed opening the card and seeing her grandparents' kind words. she thanked them for sending it, then ran back outside to play in the garden. she ran around, smiling and laughing - feeling very lucky to have such incredible mail.

once upon a time, there was a little car named red. red loved to race on the track with his friends. one day, red's tire got stuck and he couldn't move. his friends tried to help but nothing worked. 

then, a kind mechanic came and fixed red's tire. red was so happy that he could race again! but, he realized that his tire was on backwards. the mechanic said he needed to reverse the tire so it would fit right. 

red trusted the mechanic and let him reverse the tire. now, red's tire fit perfectly and he was able to race with his friends again. red learned that sometimes things need to be reversed to fit just right.

once upon a time, there was a brave little girl. she wanted to try and find a lion. so one day she decided to go on an adventure. she walked and walked and eventually came to a forest. she was a bit scared but she kept going.

she walked through the forest until she saw a lion. the little girl wanted to be safe so she sat down and watched the lion from a distance. the lion seemed gentle, so the little girl tried to get closer.

she took one step at a time. the lion started to purr and move closer to the girl. she stayed very still and held her breath. the lion sniffed her and then rubbed against her. she was so excited!

the little girl had been so brave. she had made a new friend, the lion. and she was safe.

every day she would come back to the forest to visit her lion friend. she learned about animals and felt very happy. she had achieved her goal and it was all thanks to her bravery and determination.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who found a berry bush growing near his home. the berries were so big and so fancy that he couldn't wait to try them. he picked one of the big berries and took a bite. it was so sweet, he forgot all about the other berries he had picked. 

he picked more and more berries, taking only one bite of each one. soon, he had eaten so many that he became full. he put the rest of the berries in his pocket, thinking he'd save them for later. 

but when he got home and reached into his pocket, the berries had all disappeared! he had forgotten to take them out!

the little boy was very sad. he wished he'd remembered the berries so he could have enjoyed them for longer. but at least he had one good memory of the fancy berry bush.

mia and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys and their dog, spot. spot is a big, brown dog with a long tail and a wet nose. he likes to run and jump and lick mia and ben.

one day, mia and ben have a plan. they want to surprise their mom. they find a big box and some paper and tape. they make a big gift for their mom. they put spot in the box and wrap it with paper. they write "to mom, from mia and ben" on the paper.

they wait for their mom to come home. they hear her car in the driveway. they run to the door with the box. they say, "mom, we have a surprise for you!"

mom smiles and hugs mia and ben. she says, "thank you, my sweeties. what is it?" she opens the box and sees spot. spot jumps out of the box and wags his tail. he licks mom's face and nose.

mom laughs and says, "oh, what a wonderful surprise! you gave me spot!" she hugs spot and mia and ben. she says, "you are the best twins ever. i love you and spot so much."

mia and ben are happy. they say, "we love you too, mom. and we love spot. he is our chubby, furry friend." they all cuddle on the couch and watch tv. spot snores on mom's lap. they are a happy family.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called sue. sue loved to crawl around. she would happily crawl up the stairs and down the hall. one day, sue decided to crawl down the path to grandmaâ€™s house.

on the way, sue saw a beautiful pink flower in the garden. she crawled up to it and touched it, and suddenly a wonderful feeling of love spread through her. she smiled, feeling so grateful.

when sue arrived at grandmaâ€™s house, she was greeted with lots of love. grandmaâ€™s hugs were warm and cuddly, and she always had tasty treats available for sue.

sue felt so happy to be surrounded by love and to be able to crawl wherever she wanted. she loved her visits to grandmaâ€™s house and the feeling of being in a place filled with so much love and kindness.

once upon a time there was a girl named anna. she was very curious and liked to explore. 

one day, anna went for a walk. she found a red jar in the tall grass. it was filled with jam. she looked at it, feeling excited. 

anna decided to try the jam, so she opened the jar. but the jam inside did not look right. it seemed fake.

"oh no!" anna said. "i don't think this jam is real!"

just then an old lady appeared. she was smiling.

"don't worry," she said. "i made that jam with fruit from my garden. it's real and delicious!"

anna felt relieved and excited. she thanked the old lady, then ate the jam with a smile. it was sweet and yummy!

once upon a time, there was a little bird with smooth wings. the bird loved to watch the other animals in the forest. one day, the bird saw a butterfly with pretty wings. 

"hello butterfly! can i watch you fly?" asked the bird. 

"of course! watch me flap my wings!" said the butterfly. 

the bird watched as the butterfly's wings fluttered in the breeze. the bird was amazed at how smooth the butterfly's wings were. 

"wow, your wings are so smooth! can i touch them?" asked the bird. 

"sure, go ahead!" said the butterfly. 

the bird gently touched the butterfly's wings and felt how smooth they were. from that day on, the bird loved to watch the butterfly fly with its pretty wings.

once there was an animal. he stood by the beach looking out to sea. he waved his hand to the waves that were coming in. he watched them sway back and forth like a familiar dance. 

the animal looked around and noticed the sand was so dry. he wasn't sure why it was so dry, but he liked the feel of it. he started hopping around the sand, trying to find something to do.

suddenly he spotted something on the horizon. it was a boat! he waved his hands happily, trying to get the boat's attention.

the boat came closer and eventually stopped. a little girl got off the boat. she waved back at the animal, who was so happy!

the girl said hello and the animal smiled at her. he was so glad that she was here! they talked and laughed and the animal showed her around the beach. they made sand castles and watched the sun set over the ocean. 

the animal waved goodbye as the little girl got back on the boat. he felt sad but he knew he'd see her again soon. with a happy grin, he watched the boat sail away.

tom and sam were brothers. they liked to play in the backyard. one day, they saw a big grill. it was black and shiny. it had a lid and a handle.

"let's play with the grill!" tom said. he ran to the grill and lifted the lid. he saw some metal bars and some ashes.

"no, tom, don't touch the grill!" sam said. he followed tom and grabbed his arm. "the grill is hot. it can hurt you. mom and dad said so."

tom pulled his arm away. he was curious. he wanted to see what was inside the grill. he thought it was harmless. he reached for the handle again.

"stop, tom, stop!" sam shouted. he pushed tom away from the grill. he was scared. he did not want tom to get burned.

tom fell on the grass. he was angry. he did not like sam pushing him. he thought sam was mean. he glared at sam.

"why did you do that?" tom asked. he rubbed his arm. it was sore.

"because i love you, tom," sam said. he hugged tom. "i don't want you to get hurt. the grill is not a toy. it is for cooking food. we can choose another toy to play with. how about the ball?"

tom looked at sam. he saw sam's eyes. they were kind. he felt sam's hug. it was warm. he realized sam was right. the grill was not a toy. it was dangerous. he smiled at sam.

"okay, sam," tom said. he hugged sam back. "i love you too. let's play with the ball. you can choose who goes first."

once upon a time there was a crayon. the crayon was very fine. it was so fine that it could print pictures on the wall.

every day the crayon made something new. it printed a sun. it printed a tree. it printed a boat. the prints were so beautiful!

the crayon was very happy making pictures. but then one day it ran out of colour. it was very sad.

a little girl saw the sad crayon. she gave it a nice bright crayon and said,"now, you can print again."

the crayon was so happy! it started printing colorful pictures on the wall again.

everyone was happy that the crayon was back with new and colourful prints. the crayon was happy too.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and look up at the big blue sky. one day, she saw a little bird flying high in the sky. the bird was so happy and free, and it made lily smile.

lily decided she wanted to be happy and free too, so she started to skip around in her backyard. she skipped and skipped until she felt like she was flying just like the little bird. the sky was so big and beautiful, and lily felt like she could touch it.

as the sun started to set, lily realized it was time to go inside. she looked up at the sky one more time and said goodnight to the little bird. lily went to bed feeling happy and free, just like the little bird in the big blue sky.

sara was a stubborn girl. she did not like to drink water. she only liked to drink juice and milk. but her mom said water was good for her. water helped her grow and stay healthy.

one day, sara and her mom went to the zoo. they saw many animals from different parts of the world. they saw lions, monkeys, elephants, penguins, and more. sara was very happy and excited. she wanted to see everything.

but it was a hot day. sara got thirsty. she asked her mom for juice. her mom said, "no, sara. you need to drink water. water is what the animals drink. water is what we drink. water is everywhere in the world. it is in the sky, in the rivers, in the oceans. water is very important."

sara did not listen. she said, "no, mom. i don't want water. i want juice. juice is yummy. juice is what i drink. juice is better than water."

her mom sighed. she said, "sara, you are being stubborn. you are not a baby anymore. you are a big girl. you need to try new things. you need to drink water. water is not bad. water is good. water is what makes the world beautiful. water is what makes you happy."

sara looked at her mom. she saw her mom's eyes. they were blue like water. she saw her mom's smile. it was bright like water. she saw her mom's hand. it was holding a bottle of water. she thought for a moment. she said, "okay, mom. i will try water. maybe water is not so bad. maybe water is good. maybe water is what makes me happy."

she took the bottle from her mom. she opened it. she drank some water. she felt the water in her mouth. it was cool and clear. she felt the water in her throat. it was smooth and refreshing. she felt the water in her body. it was soothing and energizing. she smiled. she said, "mom, you are right. water is good. water is what the animals drink. water is what we drink. water is everywhere in the world. water is very important. water is what makes the world beautiful. water is what makes me happy."

her mom hugged her. she said, "i'm proud of you, sara. you are a smart girl. you are a brave girl. you are a good girl. you are my girl. i love you."

they both smiled. they both drank some more water. they both enjoyed the rest of the day at the zoo. they both learned something new. they both had fun.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy was very hungry and wanted a snack. he asked his mom for some money to buy a cookie. 

mom said, "i don't have any money available right now, timmy. maybe later."

timmy was sad and started to cry. his mom tried to cheer him up by saying, "let's go play outside instead!"

as they were playing outside, timmy saw a big dog. he got scared and said, "mommy, the dog might bite me!"

mommy said, "don't worry, timmy. the dog is friendly and won't bite you."

timmy felt better and they continued to play. later, when they went back inside, timmy's mom surprised him with a cookie. timmy was so happy and said, "thank you, mommy! i love you!"

one day, a little girl was playing in her backyard. she noticed a vehicle driving down the street and it made her very excited. the girl begged her mom to take her for a ride in the vehicle.

mom warned the girl that the vehicle didn't have a steering wheel and she couldn't drive it. but the girl was too playful to care so she jumped into the car. 

as they began to drive, mom warned the girl to be careful. she explained it was dangerous and the vehicle could go too fast. but the girl didn't listen. she was so excited and she only wanted to go faster and faster. 

eventually, mom had to tell the girl to slow down. she didn't want her daughter to get hurt. if the girl hadn't taken mom's warning seriously, who knows what could have happened? it's always important to listen to the warnings of your parents!

once there was a little boy who was feeling very sad. his tummy suddenly grumbled and he remembered he was hungry. he looked around and found a big pit full of grapes. he was surprised to find such a big pit so high in the sky. he picked some grapes and felt happy as he ate them. 

but soon he was feeling tired, so he decided to take a break and relax on the pit. he stretched his arms and legs and closed his eyes, breathing in the warm air. he stayed there for a long time, just relaxing and enjoying the sun. 

when he felt full of energy, he climbed down the pit and ran back home. his mom was happy to see him back and gave him a big hug. from that day on, the little boy was never afraid of heights - because he knew that inside a high pit full of grapes, he could always relax!

once upon a time, there was a very angry number. he sat in his pitch all day and thought about how angry he was.

he tried counting to make himself feel better, but nothing seemed to work. he shouted at all the other numbers and made them scared.

then one day, a magical pitch appeared. it had a rainbow in the middle and it was very bright and shiny. the angry number was amazed and he decided to take a closer look.

as he stepped onto the rainbow, the angry number felt his anger wash away. he realized that all he wanted all along was to be happy like all the other numbers.

he stayed at the magical pitch forever, smiling and glowing with joy. and from then on, he was the happiest number of all.

once upon a time, there was a very noisy billboard. sitting on top of the billboard was a little bird named peter. peter had a very big dream. he wanted to succeed.

but there was a problem. since the billboard was so noisy, peter couldn't concentrate enough to take the steps to reach his dream. he felt stuck.

but then one day, a magical fairy flew by and saw peter's struggle. she had a special ability to make things quieter so people could think. she waved her wand and the billboard went from noisy to quiet.

with all the noise gone, peter was able to focus on the steps he needed to take to succeed. he felt hopeful and excited.

so the next day, peter thanked the magical fairy, and he worked hard. thanks to the fairy's help, he was able to reach his dream and succeed!

sam and ben are brothers. they like to play with their toy cars and trucks. they have many cars and trucks of different colors and sizes. sometimes they pretend to be drivers or mechanics or police.

one day, sam and ben find a big box in the garage. the box says "university" on it. they do not know what that means, but they think it is something fun. they open the box and see many books and papers and pens. they also see a small laptop. they think it is a toy computer.

sam and ben take the laptop out of the box and turn it on. they see many pictures and words on the screen. they try to touch them and make them move. they hear some sounds and music. they think it is a game.

but then, something goes wrong. the laptop makes a loud noise and the screen goes black. sam and ben are scared. they think they broke the laptop. they do not want to get in trouble. they try to turn it on again, but nothing happens.

they hear their dad coming home. he works at the university. he is a teacher. he uses the laptop for his work. he needs it to write and read and talk to other teachers and students.

sam and ben hide the laptop under the box. they hope their dad will not see it. they run to their room and pretend to play with their cars and trucks.

their dad comes into the garage. he sees the box and the laptop. he is surprised. he takes the laptop out of the box and tries to turn it on. he sees that it is broken. he is angry and sad.

he goes to sam and ben's room. he asks them what happened. he tells them that the laptop is not a toy. he tells them that it is very important and hard to repair. he tells them that they should not touch things that are not theirs. he tells them that they have to say sorry and help him fix the laptop.

sam and ben feel bad. they say sorry to their dad. they tell him that they did not know what the laptop was. they tell him that they wanted to play with it. they tell him that they did not mean to break it.

their dad hugs them. he tells them that he loves them. he tells them that he is not mad at them. he tells them that he understands that they were curious and wanted to have fun. he tells them that he will teach them what the laptop is and how to use it. he tells them that he will take them to the university and show them his work. he tells them that they can learn many things and have fun there.

sam and ben smile. they hug their dad. they tell him that they love him. they tell him that they are sorry. they tell him that they want to learn and have fun. they tell him that they want to help him repair the laptop. they tell him that they want to go to the university.

once upon a time, there was the most charming magical creature. he was very small and had rainbow wings! he went on the most wonderful adventures.

one day, the creature needed to find supplies for his travels. so he flew very high in the sky and he saw a magic surprise! it was a real magic supply shop! he went inside and was amazed.

the shop was filled with beautiful colors. there were so many supplies that he couldn't believe it. he found magical wings, hats, and even toys!

the creature was so happy and excited with the supplies he found. he thanked the shopkeeper and flew away with his new treasures. 

the creature used the supplies to make his journeys even more charming and magical!

once upon a time, there was a sunflower. she was so beautiful, with her bright yellow petals and her tall, slender stem. every day, the sunflower would get ready and wait for the sun to come out. she wanted to dance in the sunshine.

one day, the sunflower saw a bird hovering above her. it was singing a sweet song. the sunflower smiled and began to sway in time with the melody. suddenly, the bird flew down and perched on the sunflower's leaves. it flapped its wings and made a sign to the sunflower.

the sunflower understood the sign and smiled at the bird. then, the two of them joined hands and began to spin round and round in the sun's warm light. they kept spinning until the sun went down. they said goodbye, and the bird flew away.

the sunflower was ready to start the next day, ready to dance in the sunshine once again.

lily and tom were playing with their toy plane. they liked to make it fly in the air and make noises. they pretended they were pilots and went on adventures.

one day, they decided to fly the plane over the pond. they thought it would be fun to see the water and the ducks. but when they threw the plane, it went too far and landed in the pond. they could not reach it.

they started to panic. they did not want to lose their plane. they did not want to get wet. they did not know what to do. they looked around for help.

they saw a big stick on the ground. they had an idea. they were creative. they used the stick to try to get the plane out of the pond. they pushed and pulled and poked. they worked together.

after a while, they managed to move the plane closer to the land. they were happy. they grabbed the plane and dried it with their shirts. they hugged each other and cheered. they had saved their plane. they learned a lesson. they decided not to fly the plane over the pond again. they went home to play some more.

lily and ben were playing a game. they had to find things that were red. lily saw a big red purse on the sofa. she ran to get it.

"look, i found a red purse!" she shouted. "i win the game!"

ben was not happy. he wanted to win too. he saw a red ball on the floor. he picked it up and threw it at lily.

"hey, that's not fair!" lily cried. "you can't throw things at me!"

the ball hit the purse and made a loud noise. the purse opened and a lot of things fell out. there were keys, a phone, a wallet, and some candy.

"uh-oh," ben said. "that's mom's purse. we are in trouble."

lily and ben looked at each other. they were scared. they heard mom coming.

"what's going on here?" mom asked. she saw her purse and her things on the floor. she was angry.

"mom, we're sorry," lily and ben said. "we were playing a game and we made a mess."

mom sighed. she picked up her purse and her things. she put them back in the purse.

"you two are very spoiled," she said. "you can't play with my purse. it's not a toy. it has important things in it. you could have lost them or broken them."

lily and ben felt bad. they knew mom was right. they hugged her and said they were sorry again.

mom smiled. she hugged them back. she gave them each a candy.

"i love you, but you have to be more careful," she said. "now, let's clean up this mess and play a different game. how about we find things that are blue?"

once upon a time, there was a little spider named spidey. spidey lived in a big tree with his spider family. one day, spidey wanted to make a big cobweb to catch some yummy bugs to eat. but when he tried to make his cobweb, he kept getting stuck and it wouldn't be complete. 

spidey felt sad because he wasn't as smart as his spider brothers and sisters. they all had big, beautiful cobwebs that caught lots of bugs. spidey didn't know what to do. 

one day, a big fly came buzzing by the tree. spidey tried to catch it, but his cobweb wasn't complete and the fly got away. spidey felt even sadder. 

but then, spidey had an idea! he asked his smart sister for help. she showed him how to make a complete cobweb without getting stuck. spidey was so happy and proud of himself. he made a big, beautiful cobweb just like his siblings and caught lots of yummy bugs to eat. from then on, spidey felt just as smart as his brothers and sisters. the end.

once there was a daddy who took his daughter on a walk on a bright, sunny day. they went along the road and noticed a little bird lying on the ground. daddy told his daughter that the bird was sick and needed help.

so they picked up the bird and daddy took it to the vet. the vet used special powers to help the bird heal. the bird was soon happy and fit again.

when the daddy and daughter were walking back along the road, the daddy thanked the reliable road for helping them reach the vet. he said the road had been so reliable and always took them to the places they needed.

the happy daddy and daughter continued their walk home together, feeling thankful for the reliable road that had helped them help the bird heal.

once upon a time, in a small house with a porch, there lived a little boy named tim. tim loved to play outside, even when it was cold. one cold day, he put on his warm coat and went out to the porch.

tim saw his friend, sam, walking by. "sam, do you want to play?" tim asked. sam nodded and said, "yes, let's play catch!" so tim and sam started to throw a ball to each other. they laughed and had fun.

after a while, they felt cold and went inside tim's house. tim's mom gave them hot cocoa to warm up. they sat on the porch, sipped their cocoa, and watched the snow fall. they were happy to be warm and cozy with their friend.

once upon a time there was a humble little girl named sarah who lived in a small village. one day a special visitor came to the village in a big yellow car. everyone was so excited to meet the visitor. sarah was especially excited to meet the visitor too.

when sarah finally met the visitor, she looked up at them with wide eyes and smiled. the visitor saw sarah and smiled too. then the visitor nodded at sarah. sarah nodded back at them and wanted to be their friend. the visitor said they wanted to be her friend too.

the two spent the afternoon walking around the village and visiting all of sarah's favorite places. sarah showed the visitor all her favorite places and told them lots of stories about them. the visitor was very kind and listened carefully to all of sarah's stories.

at the end of the visit, the visitor nodded at sarah once more and said goodbye. sarah smiled and said thank you for coming. before the visitor drove away, they gave sarah a special gift. sarah smiled and nodded. she was very happy to receive the gift.

once upon a time, there was a child who lived in a little house. she was feeling very upset one day and she wanted something special to make her feel better.

suddenly, there was a loud knock on the door. the child ran to the door, expecting to see a friend. instead, there was a large white van at her door. the van had a big yellow logo on the side.

the driver of the van smiled and said, "good day! i'm here to deliver something special for the child."

the child was thrilled! she was so excited to see what was in the van. the driver opened the door and pulled out a large box. he put it down on the doorstep and said, "this is for you!"

the child opened the box and gasped. inside was a beautiful purple bicycle. she squealed with joy and thanked the driver. the driver smiled and said, "you're welcome! have a wonderful day!"

the driver drove away, leaving the child very happy and no longer upset. she quickly hopped on her new bike and rode around the neighbourhood, feeling happier than ever.

anna and ben are twins. they like to play in the park with their mom and dad. one day, they see a big dog in the park. the dog has long, black hair and a loud bark.

"can we pet the dog, mom?" anna asks.

"maybe, but we have to ask the owner first," mom says. "and we have to be gentle and alert. some dogs don't like strangers."

they walk to the dog and the owner. the owner is a nice lady with a red hat. she smiles and says, "hello, do you want to meet my dog? his name is rex."

"yes, please," ben says.

the lady holds rex's leash and lets the twins approach him. anna and ben reach out their hands and touch rex's hair. it is soft and warm. rex wags his tail and licks their faces. anna and ben giggle and feel happy.

"rex likes you," the lady says. "you are very good with dogs. you know how to be calm and alert. that makes rex feel safe and friendly."

"thank you," mom says. "you have a very nice dog. can we come back and play with him again?"

"of course," the lady says. "rex loves to make new friends. he is always here in the park in the morning."

anna and ben hug rex and say goodbye. they learn that dogs are fun and kind, but they also need respect and care. they feel proud of themselves for being good with rex. they look forward to seeing him again.

once upon a time, there was a strong boy named tim. he liked to play outside with his friends. one day, tim found a big log in the woods. he wanted to show it to his friends.

tim decided to reveal the log to his friends. he asked them to come to the woods. when they saw the log, they were very happy. they all wanted to play with the log.

together, tim and his friends rolled the log to their play area. they took turns jumping over it and sitting on it. they had so much fun with the strong log. and they played together all day long.

once upon a time there was a little girl named sam. she was only three years old and loved to explore outside. one day she went to a special garden and she saw a beautiful shiny green tree.

sam went up to the tree and asked if it could tell her a story. the tree said yes and began to tell her a story about a yummy green apple.

the apple was as green as the grass and so yummy that everyone wanted to eat it! but suddenly, a giant came along and said he wanted to have the apple. the tree and sam knew the giant could be very mean so they told him to go away.

the giant began to stomp his feet and roar but the tree and sam just kept telling him no, and eventually he went away. sam and the tree were so happy that sam gave the tree a big hug and thanked it for saving her from the giant.

the tree was happy too and told sam to come back anytime she wanted to hear another story. so every day sam would go back to the garden and listen to the stories from the green tree and they both lived happily ever after.

once upon a time there was a boy named jack. he wanted to play in the sea so he ran outside and shouted for his mum.

his mum said no and told him to stay away from the water. but jack insisted. he said he wanted to swim in the sea and began to pout. 

mum became embarrassed that her son was acting so happy while being so careless. she asked him to be more careful. still, jack insisted and went to the beach. 

this time mum followed him and finally gave in. she said yes and jack was happy. he put his toes in the sea and felt the cold water.

he was so excited he let out a loud cheer. together, they built sandcastles with the wet sand and played games in the warm sun. 

they had lots of fun and mum was so glad that jack listened to her. it was a happy day at the beach!

once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and her friends in the park. one day, lily and her friends were playing hide and seek when they heard a loud noise coming from the sky.

"what's that noise?" asked lily's friend, timmy.

"i don't know," said lily, "but i think it's a plane."

suddenly, a big plane flew overhead, and lily and her friends saw something fall from it. they ran over to see what it was and found a package with a note attached.

the note said, "to the nation of children, please accept this gift from us. thank you for being so kind and playful."

lily and her friends were so happy and thanked the people who sent the package. they opened it up and found lots of toys and games inside. from that day on, lily and her friends played with their new toys and thanked the kind people who sent them.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and read books. one day, she went to her room to put her toys on the shelf. but when she tried to put her favorite toy on the top shelf, she couldn't reach it.

lily's big brother, max, came into the room and saw her struggling. he said, "i can help you, lily. let's have a competition to see who can reach the top shelf first." lily thought this was a funny joke and giggled.

max lifted lily up and she was able to put her toy on the top shelf. lily was happy and thanked max for helping her. from then on, she knew that if she ever needed help, she could always count on her big brother.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to visit her grandma's farm. there were many animals on the farm, like cows, pigs, and chickens. lily loved to pet the animals, but she was scared of the cows because they were very big.

one day, lily was playing in the hay when she saw a little mouse. she wanted to catch it, so she tried to be very quiet. but when she got close, the mouse ran away. lily was sad, so she went to find her grandma.

her grandma was in the garden picking vegetables. lily told her about the mouse and how she wanted to catch it. her grandma smiled and said, "sometimes, things are too deep to catch. but you can always try to pinch them!" lily didn't understand what her grandma meant, but she was happy to hear her grandma's kind words.

once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named spot. spot loved to help his family. one day, his family asked him to collect something special. they wanted him to find an envelope.

spot looked everywhere for the envelope. he looked in the house, the yard, and even under the bed. finally, he found the envelope under a big tree. spot was so happy!

he took the envelope back to his family. they were very proud of him. spot felt good because he was dependable and helped his family. from that day on, spot always helped collect things for his family. and they all lived happily ever after.

anna and ben were playing hide and seek in the living room. anna was the seeker and ben was the hider. ben ran to the window and hid behind the curtain. he hoped anna would not find him there.

anna looked around the room. she saw the sofa, the table, the lamp, and the toys. she did not see ben. she thought he was very good at hiding. she said, "where are you, ben? i can't find you!"

ben heard anna's voice. he wanted to answer, but he knew he had to remain quiet. he did not want to give away his hiding spot. he peeked through the curtain and saw anna walking towards the window. he felt scared. he wished he had picked a better place to hide.

anna reached the window. she saw the curtain was open a little bit. she wondered what was behind it. she pulled the curtain aside and saw ben's face. she shouted, "i found you, ben! you were hiding behind the curtain!"

ben jumped out from behind the curtain. he smiled and said, "you got me, anna! you are a good seeker!" he gave anna a hug and said, "let's play again. this time, you hide and i seek!"

anna nodded and said, "ok, ben. let's play again. but don't look while i hide!" she ran to find a new hiding spot. ben closed his eyes and counted to ten. he was happy to play with his sister. he loved hide and seek.

once upon a time, there was a young little boy named jake. jake loved to pick wildflowers. he always found the prettiest ones and brought them home to his mommy.

one day, jake went to the nearby park. he was looking for the most beautiful wildflowers. then, he saw a large bush with many colorful flowers. jake ran over to the bush and picked out five of the prettiest ones. 

suddenly, a strange old man appeared. he said, "you know, if you take those flowers, then you will not restore the bush. you must put them back."

jake frowned, but the old man offered a solution. "if you collect discarded twigs and leaves and stick them back into the bush, then you can restore it and still pick some of the flowers."

so, jake collected twigs, leaves and pebbles from around the park and stuck them in the bush. he also carefully tucked the flowers back in. 

once he was done, the old man smiled and said, "look, now you have helped to restore the bush, and you can still pick some of the flowers."

jake smiled too and said, "thanks, old man! i'm so happy i could help." then, he carefully selected a few flowers and brought them home to his mommy.

tom and mia are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big red ball. it is on the grass. tom and mia run to the ball.

"wow, look at this ball!" tom says. "it is so big and red!"

"can we play with it?" mia asks.

tom nods. he picks up the ball. he throws it to mia. mia catches it. she throws it back to tom. they have fun.

but then, a boy comes. he is bigger than tom and mia. he has a mean face. he walks to the ball.

"hey, that is my ball!" he says. "give it back!"

tom and mia are scared. they do not want to fight. they do not know the boy.

"but we found it on the grass," tom says. "we did not see you."

"i don't care. it is mine. it belongs to me. i left it here. now give it back or i will hit you!" the boy says. he has an urge to take the ball. he is crazy.

tom and mia do not like the boy. they think he is bad. they do not want to give him the ball. they want to keep playing.

"no, you can't have it. it is ours. we found it. you are mean. go away!" mia says. she holds the ball tight.

the boy gets angry. he tries to grab the ball. he pushes mia. mia falls. she cries.

tom sees mia. he is sad. he is mad. he throws the ball at the boy. he hits him in the face. the boy yells. he runs away.

tom and mia hug. they are happy. they have the ball. they are friends. they do not like the boy. he is crazy. they do not want to see him again. they play with the ball. they have fun.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she was playing with her toys when she smelled smoke. she looked outside and saw a big fire burning in her neighbor's house.

lily ran to her mommy and said, "mommy, fire! neighbor's house!" her mommy quickly called the firemen and they came with their big trucks and hoses.

while they were putting out the fire, lily saw a smart firefighter carrying a big jug of water to help. she asked him, "why you carry jug?" the firefighter smiled and said, "to put out the fire, little one."

after a while, the fire was finally out and lily was happy that everyone was safe. she hugged her mommy and said, "fire bad. firefighters good."

once upon a time, there was a sailor named jack. he was very adventurous and loved to explore the ocean. one day, a big storm came and his boat started to shake. jack was scared and didn't know what to do.

suddenly, a group of dolphins appeared and helped jack to steer the boat to safety. jack was very grateful and said "thank you" to the dolphins. they swam away, happy that they could help.

from that day on, jack knew that he wasn't alone in the ocean. he continued to explore and have adventures, but he always remembered to be careful and to say "thank you" to those who helped him.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and her favorite toy was a teddy bear. one day, lily's mom told her to be careful with her teddy bear because it was a special symbol of love from her grandma.

lily said, "okay, mommy. i will be careful with my teddy bear."

later that day, lily's little brother accidentally knocked over her teddy bear and it broke. lily was sad and started to cry.

her mom asked, "what happened, lily?"

lily replied, "my teddy bear broke. it was a symbol of love from grandma and now it's broken."

her mom hugged her and said, "don't worry, lily. we can fix it. and remember, accidents happen. just be careful next time."

jim was a very stubborn little boy. he wouldn't listen to a word his mom said. one day, his mom said,"jim, hurry up and get dressed. we are late." but jim didn't listen. he kept playing with his toys. his mom went to get him and said,"jim, we are very late now, you must hurry!" but jim didn't even look at her. he just kept playing. 

his mom got a bit angry. she said,"jim, i'm not going to say it again, lets go now!" but jim still didn't hurry. 

suddenly, his mom got an idea. she pretended that she heard something outside. she shouted,"oh no! a bear! run, jim, run!" 

jim couldn't resist this. he jumped up in shock and ran to his mom. he learned a lesson that day to always listen to his mother and to hurry.

once upon a time there was a clever bird called zoom. zoom liked to fly high in the sky. one day, he flew to a big farm. he saw lots of soil and wanted to explore.

zoom noticed a hole in the soil. he went inside and found lots of delicious worms! he quickly gobbled them up.

suddenly, zoom heard a loud noise. it was a farmer coming to work on the farm. zoom was scared and he began to fly away. he zoomed really fast and flew away over the farm.

he was safe and went to look for more delicious worms. he was very clever and soon found lots of them. he ate until he was full and flew back home.

once there was a little girl called may. she was only three years old, but she already had a big heart. one day, may decided she wanted to go pick a rose from the garden. she thought it would make a nice surprise for her mom.

as she tiptoed through the garden, may heard her mom call her name. she quickly hid behind a big bush and waited. her mom looked around and found her.

"may, i need to remind you something," her mom said in a gentle voice. "no matter how hard it can be, always be kind and do the right thing. that's very important."

may nodded her head, but she still wanted her rose. her mom smiled and gave her a funny look. she then put her arm around may's shoulders and brought her back to the garden.
