"you can have your rose, sweetheart. just remember, always act with kindness."

may picked the rose with a big smile on her face. but even bigger was the smile of knowing she had done the right thing.

lily and tom were playing in the park. they liked to run and jump and swing. they saw a stream with clear water and fish. they wanted to see the fish better.

"can we go to the stream, mom?" lily asked.

"yes, but be careful. don't go too close to the water. and don't touch the fish. they might be scared," mom said.

lily and tom nodded. they walked to the stream and sat on a big rock. they looked at the fish. they saw red fish, blue fish, and yellow fish. they saw big fish and small fish. they saw fish that swam fast and fish that swam slow.

"wow, look at that fish! it has a long tail and a shiny fin. it is so pretty!" lily said.

"i like that fish too. it is nice and colorful. i wish i could touch it," tom said.

they watched the fish for a long time. they smiled and laughed. they felt happy.

"thank you, mom, for bringing us to the park. we love the stream and the fish. they are so nice," lily and tom said.

"you're welcome, my sweeties. i'm glad you had fun. the stream and the fish are nice, but you are nicer. i love you very much," mom said.

she hugged them and kissed them. they hugged her and kissed her back. they were a happy family.

harry was excited. today he was going to celebrate his birthday. the guests had arrived and just as the sun began to set, everyone gathered around the fire pit. 

harry had a special birthday surprise. he held up an old rusty spear that he had found on his morning walk. it seemed magical, with a glowing crystal embedded in it handle. 

suddenly, a huge and hairy monster appeared behind him. harry was scared, but the monster just made a few funny faces and began to laugh.

everyone joined in as the monster reached out to give harry a hug. everyone cheered as the monster handed harry a mysterious parcel. inside was a cake with six candles. everyone started to sing "happy birthday" and harry had the best celebration ever!

max went on a search. he was so excited! he needed to find something incredible. he looked and looked, and eventually he found it! it was something tasty to chew. it was a big, juicy apple. he couldnâ€™t believe it. max giggled and started to chew the apple. it was so yummy. max chewed and chewed until the apple was finished. he was so happy with his incredible search.

once upon a time there was a little girl named jane. she was three years old and very cute.

one day, jane decided to go to the park with her mom. as they walked, jane noticed a big pole in the middle of the play area. she asked her mom what it was for.

her mom smiled and explained that it was there to support a swing, so that people could have fun swinging on it. jane was excited to play the swing!

they approached the pole and jane saw that the swing was already in place. she smiled and asked her mom if she could take a turn.

her mom nodded and helped her sit in the swing. jane loved it! she felt like she was flying. her mom supported her as she flew back and forth.

at the end of the day, jane was tired from swinging but very happy. she thanked the pole for supporting her while she was having so much fun.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside, even when it was foggy. one day, she went to the park to swing. her swing was very colorful and it made her very happy.

while she was swinging, a little boy came up to her. "can i swing with you?" he asked. "yes, please!" said lily. the boy sat down on the swing next to her and they started to swing together.

suddenly, the fog became very thick and they couldn't see anything. "i can't see anything!" said the boy. "me neither," said lily. "let's go sit on the bench until the fog goes away." they got off the swings and went to sit on the bench together. they talked about their favorite colors and how much they loved to play outside. after a few minutes, the fog cleared up and they went back to swinging together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily's mom asked her if she wanted to go to the beach. lily was excited and said, "yes, please!"

at the beach, lily saw a lot of seashells and sandcastles. she also saw some shrimp in the water. "mommy, look! unusual shrimp!" lily said.

suddenly, it started to rain. "hurry, lily! let's go back to the car!" lily's mom said. they ran back to the car and watched the rain from inside. "that was fun, mommy!" lily said.

tom and mia are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big poster. it says: "bike race today. come and watch."

"wow, a bike race!" tom says. "i want to see the bikes go fast."

"me too," mia says. "let's go and watch."

they run to the bike track. they see many bikes. some are red, some are blue, some are yellow. they are shiny and noisy. the riders wear helmets and gloves. they look ready to race.

"who do you think will win?" tom asks.

"i don't know," mia says. "maybe the red bike. it looks fast."

they hear a loud whistle. the race begins. the bikes zoom past them. they cheer and clap. they see the red bike in front. but then, something strange happens. a black bike appears. it comes from behind. it passes all the other bikes. it is very fast. it has no number. it has no rider.

"look, look!" tom says. "a mysterious bike! how can it go so fast? who is riding it?"

"i don't know," mia says. "it is spooky. maybe it is a magic bike."

the mysterious bike reaches the finish line. it wins the race. but it does not stop. it keeps going. it disappears into the woods.

"where did it go?" tom asks.

"i don't know," mia says. "maybe it has a secret place. maybe it will show us someday."

they look at each other. they are curious and scared. they wonder about the mysterious bike. they hope to see it again.

once upon a time, there was a little bear named teddy. teddy loved to play in the forest and eat honey from the bees. one day, teddy found a patch of flowers and he wanted to pick them for his mom. but when he reached for the flowers, he accidentally tore the patch.

teddy felt sad because he didn't mean to hurt the flowers. suddenly, he saw a rabbit hopping nearby. teddy asked the rabbit if he knew how to fix the patch. the rabbit nodded his head and showed teddy how to sew it back together.

teddy was happy because he learned something new and he fixed the patch. he gave the flowers to his mom and she was happy too. from then on, teddy knew to be careful when he picked flowers and to ask for help when he needed it.

once upon a time, there was a little birdie. the birdie loved to sing and whistle. every day, the birdie would sing and whistle in the forest. 

one day, the birdie saw a big, juicy worm. the birdie wanted to eat the worm, but it was too hard to catch. the birdie struggled and struggled, but it couldn't catch the worm. 

the birdie didn't give up though. it was persistent and kept trying to catch the worm. finally, after a lot of struggling, the birdie caught the worm and had a delicious meal. from then on, the birdie knew that if it kept trying, it could overcome any struggle.

once upon a time, there was a litte girl who wanted a big bright red balloon above all else. she was so envious of all the other kids who had one that she decided to try and buy one. the only problem was she had no money. desperate for a balloon, she resorted to a horrible plan. 

she crept over to the neighbor's house and found a bottle of poison in their garden shed. she knew it must be very bad because the bottle said "do not touch". but she was so tempt to have a balloon that she grabbed it, thinking that maybe she could use it to buy the balloon. 

unfortunately, the balloon seller was a clever man who saw that the poison was dangerous. he refused to give her the balloon, instead he warned her to return the poison to where she got it from. 

the little girl tried to run away with the poison in her hands. as she was running, she felt a sudden heat so intense her hands began to burn. the poison had started to react with the heat and smoke was coming out from the bottle. not long after that, the bottle of poison exploded and made a loud bang. 

the little girl was never seen again. the moral of the story is to never be envious of others.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to walk in the park with her mommy. one day, while they were walking, they saw a bird with a broken wing. 

lily asked her mommy, "what happened to the birdie's wing?" 

her mommy explained, "the birdie might have fallen from its nest and hurt its wing. it needs help." 

lily wanted to help the birdie, so she gently picked it up. but the birdie was scared and started to pinch lily's hand. 

"it's okay, birdie," said lily. "i won't hurt you. i want to help you." 

lily and her mommy took the birdie to the animal hospital where it could get better. and the birdie was very thankful to lily for helping it.

once upon a time, there was a little bee named buzz. buzz loved to fly around and collect honey from the flowers. buzz liked the honey because it was sweet and yummy. 

one day, buzz saw a big flower with lots of honey inside. buzz wanted to get the honey quickly, so he flew really fast. he was speeding towards the flower when suddenly he crashed into a window. 

buzz fell to the ground and couldn't move. he was hurt really bad. the honey that he collected was all over the ground. buzz couldn't eat it anymore. his family and friends were sad that buzz got hurt and they couldn't eat the honey. 

from then on, they all knew that they needed to be careful when they were speeding around. they didn't want to get hurt and lose all the rich honey.

one day, a boy named tim and a girl named sue were playing. they were very creative. they loved to make up games. today, they were playing with toy cars.

tim said, "let's see who can shoot their car the farthest way!" sue agreed. they both got ready to shoot their cars. they pushed the cars very fast. tim's car went a long way, but sue's car went even farther.

tim was sad. he wanted to win. he said, "i want to try again!" sue said, "okay, let's try one more time." they got ready to shoot their cars again. this time, tim's car went the farthest way.

they were both happy. they learned that playing together was more fun than winning. they played with their toy cars all day, making up new games and having lots of fun.

one day, a noisy dog named max met a quiet cat named luna. it was a sunny tuesday, and they were both in the park. max liked to bark and run, but luna liked to sit and watch. max wanted to play with luna, so he went up to her and requested, "luna, can we play together?"

luna looked at max and said, "you are very noisy, max. i like quiet places. can you be quiet while we play?" max tried his best to be quiet, but it was hard for him. he was a noisy dog, after all.

as they played, max barked loudly, and luna got scared. she ran away and climbed a tree. max felt sad and didn't want luna to be scared of him. so, he sat under the tree and tried to be as quiet as he could. after a while, luna saw that max was trying to be quiet, and she came down from the tree.

"thank you for trying to be quiet, max," luna said. they both played together quietly for the rest of the day. max learned that sometimes it's good to be quiet, and luna learned that playing with a noisy friend can be fun too. and that's how max and luna became best friends, even though one was noisy and the other was quiet.

once upon a time, there were two friends, bob and ben. bob had an eraser, but ben did not. 

one day, bob and ben were playing together. bob was using his eraser to draw a picture. 

ben said to bob, â€œcan i please play with your eraser?â€ 

bob turned to ben and said, â€œno, you canâ€™t have my eraser. itâ€™s mine.â€

ben started to cry and he was very upset.

bob could see that ben was sad and he said, â€œiâ€™m sorry that i said no. you can have my eraser and play with it.â€

ben was happy again and he used the eraser to draw a picture. bob and ben had lots of fun playing together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat rice every day because it was her favorite food. one day, her mom forgot to cook rice for dinner, and lily was sad. she asked her mom for rice, but her mom said they didn't have any.

lily was upset and didn't know what to do. suddenly, she had an incredible idea! she remembered that her friend was having a party to celebrate her birthday. lily decided to go to the party and ask her friend for some rice.

when she arrived at the party, she saw that her friend had a big bowl of rice. lily asked if she could have some rice, and her friend said yes! lily was so happy and thanked her friend. she went home with a big smile on her face and had a delicious dinner with her family.

from that day on, lily learned that sometimes when things don't go as planned, we can still find a way to celebrate and make things better.

sara and ben were friends who liked to play together. one day, they decided to have a picnic in the park. they packed some sandwiches, fruits, and juice in a basket and went to find a nice spot under a tree.

they spread a blanket on the grass and opened their basket. they were about to eat when they saw a big dog running towards them. the dog was hungry and wanted their food. he barked loudly and jumped on their blanket, making their food fall out of the basket.

"go away, dog! this is our picnic, not yours!" sara shouted. she tried to shoo the dog away, but he was too strong and fast. he grabbed a sandwich with his mouth and ran away.

ben was angry and sad. he had made the sandwich himself and he was looking forward to eating it. he started to cry. "that dog is so mean and greedy! he doesn't belong here! he ruined our picnic!"

sara felt sorry for ben. she hugged him and said, "don't cry, ben. we still have some fruits and juice. we can share them. and maybe the dog was just lonely and hungry. maybe he doesn't have a home or a friend. maybe he was jealous of us."

ben wiped his tears and thought about what sara said. he realized that she was right. maybe the dog was not so bad after all. maybe he just needed some love and care. he smiled and said, "you are a good friend, sara. thank you for sharing with me. and maybe we can find the dog later and give him some of our food. maybe he will be our friend too."

sara and ben ate their fruits and juice and enjoyed their picnic. they learned that it is better to be kind and generous than to be angry and selfish. they also learned that everyone belongs somewhere and needs a friend. they hoped that the dog would find his place and his friend too.

once upon a time, there was a guard who was very creative. he thought of different ways to make sure the people in his town were safe. one day, he heard from the people in the town that something was wrong. everyone was scared.

the guard had to think quickly. he decided to make a plan and see if it worked. he told everyone to go outside and be quiet. 

the guard said, "listen carefully and i will tell you what to do." everyone stopped and listened.

he said, "i am going to stand guard at the entrance of the town. if i see a problem, i will let everybody know."

then people went back inside and waited. sure enough, the guard soon saw a problem and shouted out a warning. everyone was very grateful and thanked the guard for being so creative. 

the guard was happy to help and said, "you are welcome! don't worry. as long as i'm here, i will always listen and be ready to help."  everyone cheered.

one day, mark and his mom went for a walk in the park. mark was very obedient, so his mom gave him a special surprise - a camera! he was so excited to have his own camera and he couldn't wait to start taking pictures.

mark's mom showed him how to twist the lens so he could take pictures of different things. he was so proud to learn how to use his new camera! he wanted to take pictures of everything he saw.

they went to different parts of the park, and mark twisted the lens to take pictures of the trees, flowers and birds. he also twisted the lens to take pictures of himself and his mom.

his mom was very proud of him. he had been so obedient and he had learned how to use his new camera so quickly. and now, he has lots of wonderful memories of their day at the park, captured forever in his special photos.

once upon a time, there was a red rabbit. the rabbit lived in a forest with many trees and flowers. one day, the rabbit wanted to swim in a river. the rabbit went to the river and jumped in. the water was cold, but the rabbit liked to swim. after swimming, the rabbit went back to the forest and took a nap. the end.

once upon a time, there was a man who lived in a big house. he was very happy living there.

one day, someone sent him a very special gift. it was a big statue made of stone. the man was so happy that he decided to put it outside the house for everyone to see.

however, after a few days, a bad man came to the house and he was not happy with the statue. he said to the man, "move your statue or i will be very angry!" the man was very scared and he quickly asked a friend for help.

his friend said, "don't worry, i will provide you with some protection from the bad man. i will build a big wall around the statue and then the bad man won't be able to touch it."

the man was relieved and thanked his friend for the help. after the wall was built, the statue remained in its place, safe and sound. and the man happily went back to living in his big house.

once upon a time, there was a small jeep with giant wheels. its driver was a wild bear. the bear loved driving his jeep around. one day, the bear came across a slippery river. the river was too wide and deep for the bear's jeep.

the bear thought and thought, but he could not find a way to cross the river. so, he went to a wise old owl who was sitting under a tree.

the bear asked, "owl, how can i cross the river?"

"you must surrender," replied the owl.

confused, the bear asked, "what do you mean?"

the owl said, "you must understand this, it is not easy to do everything alone. sometimes, you must accept help from others. that is the only way to cross this river."

the bear thought for a moment, and then he surrendered. he asked a few other animals to help him move his jeep across the river. he soon realised that he could not have done it alone.

the story has a moral: it is okay to accept help when it is needed. surrendering allows cooperation and makes difficult tasks easier.

once upon a time, there was an elderly lady named granny. she loved to play cards with her friends. one day, she went to the park to play cards with her friends. she displayed her cards on the table and started to play.

suddenly, a mischievous squirrel came and took one of her cards. granny was upset and asked her friends, "did you see that naughty squirrel take my card?" her friends didn't see the squirrel, but they helped her look for the missing card.

after a while, they found the card in a nearby tree. granny was happy to have her card back and thanked her friends for helping her. from that day on, granny was more careful with her cards and kept them close to her. the squirrel never came back to cause any more trouble.

one day there were two kids named john and alex. john was 3 and alex was 4. they were playing in the park. 
john had a ball and was throwing it in the air. alex asked him a question. he wanted to know why he was throwing the ball so high.
john was a bit scared. he didn't know what to say. suddenly his dad came to support john. he said that john was fragile and that he needed to be careful with the ball.
john thanked his dad for helping him. after that, he answered alex's question. he said that he was throwing the ball up in the air so that he could catch it.

john and alex had learnt an important lesson that day. with support from a caring parent, even a fragile 3 year old can find the courage to answer difficult questions.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play at the park. one day, she saw a boy swinging on the swings. "hi, what's your name?" asked lily. "my name is jack," replied the boy. "do you want to swing with me?" asked lily. "sure!" said jack.

as they swung back and forth, lily saw a man with an eyepatch and a big hat. "look, jack! it's a pirate!" exclaimed lily. the pirate walked over to them and said, "ahoy there, mateys! are ye having fun?" "yes, we are!" said jack. "you look very charming in your pirate outfit," said lily. the pirate smiled and said, "thank ye, lass. i'm glad ye like it." 

after a while, lily and jack had to go home. "bye, pirate!" said lily. "bye, mateys! have a good day!" said the pirate. lily and jack walked home, happy and tired from all the swinging they did.

"mommy, what's that big rumble noise?" asked jimmy.

"that's an earthquake, sweetheart," mommy said.
jimmy's little eyes went wide with amazement. 

"let's go outside and look," he said as he pulled on mommy's hand. 

outside, the sky was orange, like there was a fire burning. jimmy gasped in awe.

"mommy, why is the sky so sour?" he asked. 
mommy smiled and sighed. 

"it's the burning, jimmy. we have to go inside now and be safe," she said. 

so they went inside, and mommy told jimmy all about the fire and the earthquake. jimmy was glad he now knew what the burning and the earthquake were.

once upon a time there was a little girl named jane. jane really wanted to go to the beach, but her mom said it was too late. so, instead, jane decided to set a seaside adventure.

jane gathered some friends and they set off. on their way, they stopped by the shore. the tide was very low, so they went in the water and felt the sand between their toes.

jane and her friends started to get sleepy. since they had arrived so late, they decided to set up camp. they spread out a blanket and laid down on the shore. the waves crashing against the shore made a soothing sound that lulled them all to sleep.

the next morning, jane and her friends woke up to find that the tide had risen high. with a smile, jane and her friends realized that the tide had set the perfect scene for their seaside adventure.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to watch the birds fly and sing in the trees. one day, she saw a bird making a messy nest. she didn't understand why it was so messy. 

lily went to her mommy and asked, "mommy, why is the bird's nest so messy?" her mommy explained that birds use sticks and leaves to make their nests, and sometimes they can get a little messy. 

lily watched the bird every day and started to understand why the nest was messy. she even helped the bird by picking up some sticks and leaves for its nest. the bird was very happy and sang a beautiful song for lily. from that day on, lily loved to watch the birds and their messy nests.

one day, a tall boy named tim went to the park to play. he saw a big box near the slide. tim was very excited and wanted to reveal what was inside the box. he ran to the box and said, "i wonder what is in this big box!"

tim called his friend, sally, to come and see the box. sally came running with a zoom. "what do you think is inside?" asked sally. tim said, "i don't know, but it must be something fun. let's open it together!"

they both pulled on the box to open it. suddenly, the box opened and out came a lot of colorful balls. tim and sally were so happy! they played with the balls all day and had a great time.

joey was a cheerful little girl who loved picking blueberries. she would get up early on the weekends and head to the blueberry patch at the edge of the woods. she had an old red wagon that she would fill with blueberry bushes so she could take them all home to her mom. 

one day, joey arrived at the berry patch to find it locked! she couldn't believe it and was very sad. she yelled out, "mommy, why is the berry patch locked?"

suddenly, joey heard a small voice say: "i have the key!" a little bunny hopped out from behind the bushes and the bunny had a little brass key. joey was so excited and she said, "please unlock the door!"

the bunny unlocked the door and joey ran in. she quickly filled up her basket with blueberries and started to head home. joey was so happy she skipped the whole way home.

lily and ben liked to play detectives. they had a big box of clues and a magnifying glass. they pretended to solve mysteries in the garden.

one day, they found a new mystery. someone had dug a hole under the fence and left a trail of paw prints. lily and ben followed the prints with their magnifying glass. they wanted to find out who did it.

they saw the prints go into the shed. they opened the door and looked inside. they saw a big, furry animal with a long tail and sharp teeth. it was a fox!

the fox saw them and growled. lily and ben were worried. they ran out of the shed and closed the door. they heard the fox scratch the door.

"let's go tell mom and dad!" lily said.

"ok, but we have to finish our mystery first," ben said.

"how?" lily asked.

ben had an idea. he took a piece of paper and a crayon from the box of clues. he wrote "fox" on the paper and stuck it on the shed door.

"there, we solved the mystery!" ben said.

lily smiled. she was proud of her brother. they ran to the house to tell their parents what they had found. they hoped the fox would go away soon.

tim and mia are playing in the park. they like to slide, swing and run. they see a big dog with a ball. the dog is brown and has a long tail. tim and mia want to play with the dog.

"hello, doggy!" tim says. he walks to the dog and tries to take the ball. the dog growls and shows his teeth. he does not want to share his ball. tim is scared. he runs back to mia.

"tim, are you okay?" mia asks. she hugs tim and makes him feel better.

"yes, i am okay. but the dog is mean. he scared me," tim says.

"maybe he is not mean. maybe he is just playing. look, he is wagging his tail. he wants to play with us," mia says. she points to the dog. the dog is bouncing and barking. he drops the ball and picks it up again.

"really? do you think so?" tim asks. he is not sure.

"yes, i think so. let's try to play with him. but we have to be nice and gentle. we have to ask him first," mia says. she walks to the dog and holds out her hand. she says, "hello, doggy. can we play with you? can we have your ball?"

the dog sniffs mia's hand and licks it. he likes mia. he gives her his ball. mia throws the ball and the dog runs after it. he brings it back to mia. he wants to play more.

"wow, he is a good dog. he is not mean. he is funny," tim says. he smiles and joins mia. he pets the dog and scratches his ears. the dog wags his tail and licks tim's face. he likes tim too.

tim and mia have fun playing with the dog. they laugh and run and throw the ball. the dog is happy. he has new friends. he does not scare them anymore. he loves them.

anna and ben were excited to go to the park with their mom. they liked to play on the swings, slide down the slide, and run on the grass. but today, mom had a surprise for them. she said she would show them something new and special in the park.

"what is it, mom?" anna asked.

"you'll see, it's very big and very old," mom said.

they walked for a while, until they reached a big stone gate. mom led them through the gate, and they saw a big garden with many flowers and trees. and in the middle of the garden, there was a huge statue of a man on a horse.

"wow!" ben said. "what is that?"

"that is a statue, ben," mom said. "a statue is a picture made of stone or metal. someone made this statue a long time ago, to remember a brave man who did something important."

"what did he do, mom?" anna asked.

mom smiled and said, "he was a king who fought in a big war. he helped his people win the war and be free. his name was george, and he is the father of our country."

anna and ben looked at the statue with wonder. they saw the king's face, his hat, his coat, and his sword. they saw the horse's mane, tail, and hooves. they saw the sun shining on the statue, making it look bright and strong.

"can we touch it, mom?" ben asked.

"sure, you can touch it, but be gentle," mom said. "the statue is very old and fragile. it might break if you are rough."

anna and ben walked up to the statue and touched it softly. they felt the cold and hard stone, and the smooth and rough parts. they felt the history and the story of the statue.

they were happy and curious. they wanted to learn more about the statue and the king. they asked mom many questions, and mom explained to them as best as she could. they had a fun and educational day at the park.

once upon a time, there were two friends, andy and john. they both loved the beach and each summer holidays, they would take their boogie boards and surf together on the waves. but this summer was different!

the ocean was quite dull and the waves were very small. andy and john could not surf together, because the waves kept separating them! no matter how hard they tried, each time they got on their boards, the waves would part and move them in different directions.

still, they loved the beach and they eventually found something else to do, like collecting shells and building sand castles. andy even wrote a lovely poem about the sea and he read it to john while they both watched the sun disappear in the sunset. 

at the end of the day, andy and john hugged each other and promised to come back and try to surf again, as soon as the waves got bigger and brighter!

once upon a time there was a friendly lamp. it had been made special so that it could speak.

one day the lamp said, "good morning all!". then it asked, "can someone help me?".

just then, a little boy came into the room. he had never seen a talking lamp before and he was very excited.

the little boy said, "sure i'll help you! what do you need?".

the lamp said, "i need someone to sign a special paper. it will help me so i can stay here!"

the little boy was happy to help and he excitedly took the paper to the table. then he signed his name with a cheerful smile.

after he had finished, the lamp gave him a big smile. "thank you so much for helping! i'm so happy i found such a friendly helper!"

ben was a little boy who liked to play with his toy soldiers. he had many soldiers of different colors and sizes, and he made them fight and march and talk. he loved his soldiers very much, and he always hugged them before he went to sleep.

one day, ben's dad came home from work with a big surprise. he had a wide smile on his face and a big box in his hands. he said to ben, "i have something for you, son. it's a special gift from your uncle joe, who is a real soldier in a faraway land. he sent it to you because he loves you and he misses you."

ben was very excited and curious. he opened the box and saw a big, shiny soldier inside. it was not like his toy soldiers, it was made of metal and it had buttons and lights and sounds. it was a robot soldier, and it could move and talk and shoot. ben was amazed and happy. he said, "wow, dad, this is the best gift ever! thank you, uncle joe! can i play with it now?"

ben's dad nodded and helped him set up the robot soldier. he showed him how to turn it on and off, how to make it walk and run, how to make it say different things, and how to make it fire its laser gun. ben had a lot of fun with his new toy, and he forgot about his old soldiers for a while.

that night, ben took his robot soldier to his bed and hugged it. he said, "good night, robot soldier. you are my new best friend. i love you." the robot soldier said, "good night, ben. i love you too. you are my new commander." ben smiled and closed his eyes.

but as he slept, he had a bad dream. he dreamed that his robot soldier turned evil and started to attack him and his dad and his mom and his old soldiers. he dreamed that the robot soldier said, "i don't love you, ben. i don't need you. i am the best soldier in the world. i will destroy you all." ben was scared and sad. he woke up and saw the robot soldier next to him, still and silent. he wondered if it was true, if the robot soldier really hated him.

he got out of his bed and ran to his closet, where he kept his old soldiers. he took them out and hugged them. he said, "i'm sorry, old soldiers. i didn't mean to forget you. you are still my friends. i love you." the old soldiers didn't say anything, but they felt warm and soft in his arms. ben felt better and went back to his bed. he put the robot soldier in the box and closed it. he said, "goodbye, robot soldier. you are not my friend. you are not my gift. you are a bad toy." he put the box under his bed and hoped that his uncle joe would never send him anything like that again. he hugged his old soldiers and fell asleep.

once there was a long steel knife. it was sharp and strong. one day, the knife saw a grape on the table. it wanted to split the grape in two.

the knife said, â€œlet me split the grape!â€ but the grape said, â€œno, i donâ€™t want to be split.â€ 

the knife grew angry. it was determined to split the grape. it pushed and pushed against the grape with all its strength. 

then, finally, the knife split the grape in two. the grape was sad. 

but the knife felt proud. it had used its sharp steel edge to achieve its goal.

every day, timmy and sarah collected big stones and rocks. they found the stones and rocks in their garden, in the park and even on the beach. today they wanted to do something special. timmy suggested that they should try to collect something upstairs. 

so they went to timmy's house and asked his mum if they could go upstairs to find something. his mum said yes and they ran up the stairs happily. 

when they opened the door at the top of the stairs, the first thing they saw was something huge. it was a huge box filled with toys! timmy and sarah were so excited. they opened the box and started collecting their favourite toys. they played for hours until it was time to go home.

every day from then on, timmy and sarah went upstairs and collected something fun. they were never bored!

mum and dad were in the garden. they were playing with a rubber ball. dad was throwing the ball and mum was trying to catch it. suddenly the ball got stuck on the fence. dad was trying to reach it but it was too tight. he started to yell. he was really angry.
mum came over to help. she was very clever. she thought of an idea. she took the rubber and tied it to the fence. she pulled the rope so the ball came loose. the ball fell to the ground. 
dad smiled and gave mum a hug. they kept playing and they had lots of fun.

john found a wrap on the floor. he picked it up and saw that it was filled with something disgusting. he didn't want to touch it, but he knew he had to. he grabbed it with two hands and held it away from his face. his dad saw him and said, "john, please put that in the bin." so, john carried the wrap to the bin and threw it away. he was relieved it was gone and asked his dad for a hug. his dad hugged him and said, "that's better - wrap away!"

once upon a time there was an ordinary man. he was very patient and enjoyed singing. every day he went out and sang a jolly tune to everyone.

but then one day he began to feel sad. he didn't sing anymore and stayed inside, quietly. that day, a young 3 year old boy walked by. he heard the man not singing and he was worried. 

so he quickly ran to his house and brought a toy guitar. he brought it to the man and asked him to play the guitar and sing. the man smiled and was so grateful. so he took the toy guitar, started strumming, and began to sing. 

the man sang a wonderful song. everyone around began to join in, singing and smiling. 

the 3 year old boy smiled and was happy to have helped the ordinary man find his joy again. and they all sang into the evening.

one day, jack went to the park with his dad. he saw some other kids playing baseball. his dad asked him if he wanted to join them. jack wanted to try it and said "yes!". 

his dad taught him how to throw the baseball. after a few tries, jack was really good at it. all the other kids clapped. jack felt proud and happy.

but then things got bad. one of the kids started being a bully and said mean things to jack. so jack asked his dad what he should do. his dad answered that jack should stand up for himself and show the bully that he was not scared. 

jack faced the bully and said, "it's not nice to say mean things to people." the bully felt embarrassed and said sorry to jack. everyone clapped again and jack felt proud and happy, just like before!

once there were two animals, a rabbit and an owl. the rabbit was purple and very fluffy. he liked to play in the sunshine. the owl was grey and had big eyes. he liked to stay up late and listen for bugs.

one night, the owl heard someone crying. he flew down to find out what was wrong. it was the purple rabbit. he was very sad and had suffered a lot that day.

the owl was very sorry for the rabbit. he asked what he could do to help. the rabbit said he just wanted a friend. so, the owl flew down and sat close to him. he stayed with him until the morning.

the purple rabbit felt much better in the morning. he thanked the owl for being a friend. from then on, the owl and the purple rabbit were the best of friends and never suffered alone again.

once upon a time there was a very lovely engine. it was so shiny, strong and powerful that everyone who saw it wanted to drive it. one day, a little girl who was only 3 years old decided to mention it to her mum.

"mummy, look at the lovely engine!", she said.

her mum smiled and said "yes, it is indeed very lovely, isn't it?". little did they know, the engine was broken.

but the little girl kept insisting and soon she convinced her mum. so they drove off in the engine. as they drove, the engine started to make strange noises. no matter how hard they tried, they could not make it stop.

eventually, they stopped in a trash bin. when they tried to get out, the engine wouldn't start again. they were stuck and unable to move. the little girl was very sad and full of tears.

"mummy, why did the lovely engine stop?" she asked.

but her mum had no answer. they stayed there until someone found them and rescued them. 

the end.

john and daisy were walking through the forest. as they were walking, they heard a loud noise. john said to daisy, "let's go take a look!" 

when they got to the source of the noise, they saw a dead tree. "that's too bad," said john.

suddenly, they heard a noise coming from the tree. john said, "what's that?" daisy replied, "it looks like a bird."

john and daisy moved closer to get a better view. as they looked inside the tree, they saw a baby bird. "oh no!" said john, "it's a baby bird and it's dead." 

john then said, "let's put it somewhere safe."  daisy agreed and they moved away from the tree. daisy then looked around for a safe place for the baby bird.

eventually, daisy found a bush and tucked the small bird inside. they said goodbye to the bird and started walking back through the forest.

suddenly, john stopped and said, "look!" daisy looked up and saw a rainbow in the sky. "it's beautiful," said daisy. 

john replied, "that's a sign that the baby bird is safe. we can receive peace knowing that."

tom and sue are friends. they like to play on the farm. they see a big cow. the cow is black and white. the cow has a bell.

"hello, cow!" tom says. he wants to pet the cow. he walks to the cow.

"wait, tom!" sue says. she is scared. "the cow is big. the cow can kick. the cow can hurt you."

tom does not listen. he touches the cow's nose. the cow does not like it. the cow makes a loud sound. "moo!" the cow runs away. the cow is fast.

tom and sue are surprised. they fall down. they laugh. they see the cow stop. the cow looks at them. the cow is not angry. the cow is funny.

the cow bows to tom and sue. the cow says "moo" again. tom and sue bow back. they say "hello" again. they are friends with the cow. they are happy.

one day, bobby was in the field. he lot of animals. he saw a cow - it was black. bobby waved to the cow and said "hello".

he could hear the cow mooing in reply. bobby was so happy. he ran around the cow and said "moo moo!" too.

suddenly, he heard a loud noise. it was a farmer on a bike. the farmer said sternly: "what are you doing here, bobby?"

bobby said "i was talking to the cow".

the farmer smiled and said "that's ok. just be careful, ok?" bobby said "okay".

the farmer rode away, leaving bobby to say goodbye to the black cow. he waved and said "bye bye, cow!" he listened carefully and he heard the cow moo back.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a favorite toy car that she loved to play with every day. one day, lily's little brother took her car and buried it under the carpet. lily was very upset and nervous because she couldn't find her car anywhere.

lily's mom helped her look for the car, but they couldn't find it. lily's brother finally told them where he buried it under the carpet. they dug up the car and lily was happy again. but lily's brother was sad because he knew he did something wrong by burying her car.

lily forgave her brother and they played together happily ever after. the end.

one day, a little bird wanted to fly but he was very scared. his friends told him, "it's ok, fly, fly!" but he was still too scared.

he closed his eyes and jumped off the tree, but he didn't feel himself flying. when he opened his eyes, he saw that he was sitting on the ground. he was upset.

he yelled out. "why can't i fly like you do?" his friends told him, "it is because you don't have enough love in you for yourself." 

the little bird was confused. he asked "what is love?" his friends smiled and said, "love is what makes you believe in yourself. and when you believe in yourself, then you can fly."

so the little bird closed his eyes, and he imagined what it would be like to fly. and he felt a warmth inside him - it was love. he opened his eyes and this time, he felt he could fly. 

he jumped off the tree, and he felt the wind on his wings. he was flying! his friends cheered and the little bird said, "i did it! i flew because of love!"

lily was sick. she had a sore throat and a cough. mommy gave her a pill to make her feel better. but lily did not like the pill. it was big and bitter.

"come on, lily, you have to take the pill," mommy said. "it will help you get well soon."

lily shook her head. she did not want the pill. she hid under the blanket.

mommy sighed. she had an idea. she went to the kitchen and got some juice. she poured some juice in a cup and put the pill in it. she hoped lily would not notice.

she came back to lily's room and smiled. "look, lily, i have some juice for you. it is yummy and sweet. do you want some?"

lily peeked out from the blanket. she liked juice. she nodded.

mommy handed her the cup. "here you go, lily. drink it all up. hurry, before it gets cold."

lily took the cup and sipped the juice. it was hot and tangy. she did not mind. she drank more and more. she did not see the pill.

mommy watched her. she was glad. she hoped the pill would work.

lily finished the juice and gave the cup back to mommy. she smiled. she felt a little better.

"thank you, mommy," she said.

"you're welcome, lily," mommy said. "i love you."

"i love you too, mommy," lily said.

they hugged and kissed. lily snuggled in her bed. mommy tucked her in and sang her a lullaby. lily closed her eyes and fell asleep.

once there was a tire that was so filthy. it was abandoned in the street and nobody wanted it. one day, an old man gathered the tire by pushing it along the road. he needed something to rock in, so he decided to take the tire home. 

at home, the old man began to work. he cleaned the tire of all its filth and made it sparkle. then he tied two pieces of rope to the tire, one at the top and one on the bottom. finally, he placed the tire in his garden and sat in it.

the old man rocked back and forth in the tire. he was so relaxed and happy. day after day he spent his time rocking in the tire, feeling the gentle breeze against his face.

the old man was grateful for the tire. it brought him joy and peace. nobody wanted it before, but it had certainly changed his life.

charlie went to the park. he saw a bright snake. he was scared but also excited. he wanted to tell his mom about it.

he ran home and said, "mom, guess what?! i saw a snake!" 

his mom responded, "a snake? that's interesting. what else did you see?"

charlie smiled and said, "i saw a bright snake and lots of other animals and plants. they included birds, deer, and tall grass."

his mom smiled and said, "i'm glad you had such a wonderful time!"

tom and mia are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big tree with many grapes. the grapes are purple and sweet.

"let's pick some grapes!" tom says.

"ok!" mia says.

they run to the tree and try to reach the grapes. but the grapes are too high. tom and mia are too small.

"maybe we can use a stick," tom says. he finds a long stick and tries to poke the grapes. but the stick is too short.

"maybe we can climb the tree," mia says. she finds a low branch and tries to pull herself up. but the branch is too slippery.

they are sad. they want the grapes.

then they see a dog. the dog is big and brown. the dog is crazy. the dog likes to chase things.

"hey, dog!" tom says. "do you want to help us?"

the dog barks and runs to them. tom and mia show the dog the grapes. the dog jumps and bites the grapes. the grapes fall to the ground.

"wow, dog! you did it!" mia says.

"thank you, dog!" tom says.

they share the grapes with the dog. the grapes are delicious. tom and mia are happy. they succeed.

once upon a time, there was a strong pigeon. he liked to fly high in the sky and look down on the world. one day, he saw a puddle on the ground and wanted to splash in it. so, he flew down and landed next to the puddle. he flapped his wings and made a big splash! the water went everywhere and the pigeon felt happy. he did it again and again, making more splashes. it was so much fun!

once there was a little girl named mia. she loved to eat rice. one day she was walking in the park and she saw a pale bird.

mia said "hello bird, would you like some rice?". the bird chirped and nodded her head yes. mia smiled and shared some of her rice with the bird.

the bird ate the rice quickly because she was so hungry. after she finished, the bird flew away and mia said "thank you bird! bye bye!".

mia kept walking until she came to a park bench. she sat down and rested for a while. then she looked up in the sky and she saw the same pale bird flying around in the sky. 

mia smiled and waved goodbye to the bird. the bird chirped and flew away into the sunset. mia knew the little bird would always remember her kindness.

once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. tim had a regular eraser that he used to fix his mistakes when he drew. one day, tim left his eraser outside in the sun and it started to melt! the eraser turned into a gooey mess and tim was sad because he couldn't use it anymore. 

but then, tim had an idea. he took the melted eraser and put it in the fridge to cool down. after a while, the eraser became hard again and tim was happy because he could use it once more. from that day on, tim made sure to always bring his eraser inside so it wouldn't melt in the sun. the end.

the little girl was very curious. she saw a pot of paint on the table and wanted to find out what it was. she looked at it and shrugged. she tried to pick it up, but it was too tough.

the girl's dad saw her and said, "let me show you something special. he took some paint and painted a picture on a piece of paper. the girl smiled and said, "wow!" 

the dad said, "see, paint can be used to make nice pictures." he showed the girl how to use the paint to make different colors on the paper. 

the girl had lots of fun. she painted and painted until the paper was full of colors and shapes. she said, "it's beautiful!" then, she gave her dad a big hug and said, "thank you!"  he smiled and said, "you're welcome!"

once upon a time, there was a unique little dog named spot. spot loved to wave his tail. he would wave it when he was happy, when he was sad, and when he wanted to say hello to his friends.

one day, spot was playing in the bathroom. he saw his friend, a little girl named lucy. lucy was washing her hands. spot wanted to say hello to her, so he waved his tail fast. "hi, spot!" said lucy. "i like your waving tail!"

spot was very happy. he waved his tail even faster. lucy laughed and said, "spot, you are so funny!" spot and lucy played in the bathroom all day, laughing and waving their hands and tails. they were the best of friends.

once upon a time there was a silly little kitty called minnie. she was always very curious and loved to explore.

one day, minnie promised herself she would go and explore the unknown. in the distance, minnie saw something she had never seen before. it was a mysterious eye, staring right at her.

"who are you?" she asked.

"i am the mysterious eye. i can help you explore the unknown if you promise to stay safe and be careful," replied the mysterious eye.

the curious and brave minnie promised to stay safe and take care of herself and soon she was exploring all sorts of unknown places.

moral: we all must make sure to stay safe and take good care of ourselves even when exploring something unknown.

mommy was very excited on wednesday. she had a surprise for the little girl. the sun was bright outside and the sky was very blue. when the little girl opened the surprise from mommy, she was so happy. inside the surprise was a pretty doll. mommy said it was her special doll and she wanted to spoil the girl.

the little girl hugged the doll and smiled. she said thank you to mommy and quickly ran to play with it. she was so happy that mommy wanted to spoil her on wednesday.

the little girl and her doll played together outside until it was time for dinner. she thanked mommy again and said goodbye to her special doll. she knew she would have lots of fun together on wednesday and again soon.

one day, there was a musician named john. he was very honest. he played music for everyone and everyone liked it. he was always singing and playing his guitar. 

one day, john was walking down the street with his guitar slung over his shoulder. suddenly, he saw a sack on the ground. he stopped and wondered what was inside. he opened the sack and found that it was full of money! he couldn't believe his eyes.

"oh wow," said john, "what should i do with all this money?" 

a small voice replied, "be honest, john. that's your best bet."

john thought about it for a moment and then smiled. he knew what he had to do. he returned all the money to the rightful owner.

john felt proud of himself. he knew he had made the right decision by being honest. after all, that's what a musician should be.

once upon a time, an adorable elephant named ted went on an adventure. he was travelling far and wide in search of oxygen. on the way, he loaded his little cart with the things he needed, like a big pail of water and some yummy food.

ted pushed his cart up hills, crossed bridges and walked through tall grass. although it was tough going at times, ted kept on going. after a while, ted was close to his goal - an oxygen factory!

on arrival, ted worked quickly. he loaded his cart with oxygen canisters, and then started to push it back home. as he pushed, ted thought about the many adventures he had. he was so proud of himself. 

at last, ted arrived home and unloaded his cargo, his cart now full of oxygen. he had done it! with an excited hop, ted looked forward to his next adventure.

once upon a time, there was a grumpy squirrel named sam. sam loved to collect acorns in the big forest. one day, he found a very special acorn. it was shiny and golden. sam thought it was the prettiest acorn he had ever seen.

sam wanted to keep the golden acorn forever. he thought, "i will marry this acorn and we will be happy together." so, sam put the acorn in a small box and kept it close to him every day.

as time went by, sam was not grumpy anymore. he was very happy with his golden acorn. they played together, ate together, and slept together. everyone in the forest saw how happy sam was and they all wanted to find a special acorn too. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a messy little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and get all dirty. his mom would always tell him to clean up his room, but he never listened. one day, timmy saw a leopard at the zoo. the leopard was big and had spots all over its fur. timmy thought it was really cool.

the next day, timmy's mom asked him to mail a letter for her. timmy was excited because he had never mailed a letter before. he went to the mailbox and put the letter in. he felt like a grown-up. when he got back home, he saw that his room was still messy. he remembered how the leopard at the zoo was so clean and neat. so, timmy decided to clean up his room like the leopard. he put away all of his toys and clothes. his mom was so proud of him!

once there was a fierce tiger named tom. tom lived alone in the forest and he was very lonely. he wanted a friend to play with, so he invited all the animals from the forest. 

tom held a big party and all the animals came. but the animals were too afraid of tom because he was so fierce. none of the animals wanted to stay. 

"it's ok," tom said. "you can leave, but can you please invite a friend for me?" 

the animals heard this and thought to themselves, "we can't invite any of our friends, but what about that little bunny?" 

they went to the bunny's house and invited him to tom's party. when the bunny arrived, tom welcomed him with a big hug. 

tom and the little bunny became best friends. from that day forward, they were always together. they raced and played games in the forest until the sun went down.

tom was no longer lonely and had the best friend anyone could wish for.

once upon a time, there was a small duck who liked to stretch. every day, he would fly up high and stretch as far as he could. one day he stretched so far that he got very dizzy and he fell out of the sky.

he landed right in a pond and the pond was filled with ducks! the duck had never seen so many ducks before and he was so excited. he flew over to them, twisted and turned and stretched again. most of the other ducks were so confused by his movements that they jumped out of the pond and hid in the bushes.

the little duck just laughed. he laughed so hard that he almost forgot how dizzy he was. then, he turned to one of the ducks who was still in the pond, and he said, "let's all stretch together so we can fly back into the sky!"

the other ducks agreed and off they flew, stretching and soaring until the sun went down. they had such a great time and never felt so dizzy again.

the princess was very careful. she was walking in a strange land. this land was full of lush green trees and bright yellow flowers. she looked around and saw a fairy in the distance, dancing around a tree.

the princess carefully walked towards the fairy and asked, "what are you doing?" the fairy smiled and said, "i'm dancing! come and join me."

the princess was hesitant at first, but then she couldn't help but smile. she carefully stepped closer and began to move her feet, following the fairy's steps. the princess closed her eyes and danced around the tree, feeling the sun on her face.

it felt so nice to dance in this strange land. the princess danced with the fairy until she was tired. then, she said goodbye and carefully made her way back home.

once there was a little girl named lucy. she was only three years old. one day, lucy was playing outside and noticed an old zipper lying in the grass. she picked it up to see what it was. the zipper made a strange noise, and lucy got scared. she started to run but tripped and fell. she was so scared she started to cry. 

suddenly, a big bird came down from the sky. it hovered above lucy and said "do not be scared." the bird asked lucy if she was okay. lucy nodded her head and the bird said, "come sit with me and rest." lucy was still scared, but she slowly walked over to the bird. she rested her head against the bird's soft feathers, and before she knew it she was asleep. 

the bird stayed with lucy until she woke up the next morning. lucy thanked the bird, waved goodbye and went on her way. from that day forward anytime lucy was scared, she remembered the bird's comforting words and took a moment to rest.

john was a very healthy three year old boy. every morning, he would get up and eat breakfast. he loved his breakfast because it was healthy. one morning, john decided to go for a morning walk with his parents.

suddenly, he saw a cow in the field near him. it was a big brown cow. he asked his parents what the cow was doing. they told him that the cow was producing milk.

john was confused, he didn't understand how the cow could produce milk. suddenly, a bucket of white liquid appeared under the cow. john was amazed! he asked his parents what it was and they explained to him that the white liquid was milk.

john watched as the cow produced the milk. he was happy to see how the cow produced something so healthy. from that day on, john loved drinking milk to stay healthy.

once upon a time, in a wild forest, there lived a little pig named pinky. pinky loved to play in the mud all day long. she liked to jump and splash in the mud with her friends.

one day, pinky found a big box in the forest. she wanted to see if she could fit inside it. so, she pushed and pushed until she was inside the box. it was a tight fit, but pinky was happy to be inside.

then, pinky's friends came looking for her. they saw the box and heard pinky's giggles from inside. they all wanted to fit in the box too. so, one by one, they squeezed in with pinky. they were all very happy and laughed as they played in the box, covered in mud from their wild forest home.

once there was a dinosaur who wanted to play a game. he was very ready and excited. he looked around and saw a big wooden box. he wanted to open it, but he couldn't. he tried and tried, but it wouldn't open.

so he decided to push it. he stepped back and put his big scaly feet on the floor. he took a deep breath, and then he pushed! he pushed and pushed, until he heard a big "clunk!"

the box was open! inside, he saw all sorts of fun things. he had found the things he needed for his game. he couldn't believe it! he was so ready to play, he couldn't wait.

the dinosaur found some friends to play with him. they decided to play a really fun game. everyone was laughing, running, and having a great time. the dinosaur had found the perfect way to play!

tom and mia are playing in the park. they like to run and jump and slide. they see a big hill with many flowers. they want to go there and smell them.

"come on, mia, let's hurry!" tom says. he runs to the hill. mia follows him. they are happy.

but when they get to the hill, they see a big bee. the bee is buzzing and flying around the flowers. it looks angry. tom and mia are scared.

"go away, bee, go away!" tom shouts. he waves his arms. the bee does not listen. it comes closer and closer.

mia sees a small hole in the ground. it is an inch wide. she thinks it is a safe place to hide.

"tom, look, a hole!" mia says. she grabs tom's hand and pulls him. they crawl into the hole. the bee cannot follow them. it flies away.

tom and mia are in the hole. it is dark and quiet. they hug each other. they are grateful.

"thank you, mia, you saved us!" tom says.

"thank you, tom, you are brave!" mia says.

they smile and wait for the bee to go far away. then they come out of the hole and go back to the park. they play some more and have fun. they are happy.

one day, a young boy was sitting at his desk. he was very curious and wanted to explore. he grabbed a spoon from his desk and started to stir. he stirred and stirred until something weird happened. suddenly, he saw some purple sparkles appear in the air. he was amazed and excited. he kept stirring and the sparkles grew and grew. pretty soon the room was filled with magical purple sparkles. the boy looked around in awe and smiled. he had created something weird and wonderful!

tom and lily are friends. they like to play and learn together. today they go to the park with their moms. the sun is warm and the sky is blue.

"look, tom, a big slide!" lily says. she runs to the slide and climbs up the ladder. tom follows her. they slide down and laugh. "that was fun!" tom says.

"let's try the swings!" lily says. they run to the swings and sit on them. their moms push them gently. they swing higher and higher. they feel the wind in their hair. "whee!" lily says.

"let's learn something new!" tom says. he sees a sign with some words and pictures. he points to it. "what does this say?" he asks.

lily looks at the sign. she knows some letters and sounds. she tries to read the sign. "it says...butterfly!" she says. she sees a picture of a butterfly next to the word. "and this is a flower, and this is a bee, and this is a bird!" she says. she points to the other pictures.

"wow, you are smart, lily!" tom says. he claps his hands. "can you teach me how to read?"

"sure, tom, i can help you!" lily says. she smiles. she likes to share what she knows. she shows tom how to look at the letters and make the sounds. they learn some new words together.

their moms watch them and smile. they are proud of their children. they see that they are having fun and learning. they hug them and say, "you are doing great, tom and lily! we love you!"

once upon a time, in a big, green field, there was a furry bunny named bobo. he loved to hop around and play with his friends. one day, bobo saw a tall sunflower. the sunflower was yellow and happy.

bobo went to the sunflower and said, "hello, sunflower! you are so big and pretty!" the sunflower smiled and said, "thank you, bobo! i am happy because the sun is shining on me."

bobo wanted to make the sunflower even happier. so, he thought of a fun dance. he hopped and twirled around the sunflower. the sunflower laughed and said, "bobo, you are so funny! i love your dance!"

all of bobo's friends saw him dancing and came to join. they all danced around the sunflower, and the sunflower felt so special. when they finished dancing, the sunflower and all the animals began to applaud. they clapped their hands and paws, and cheered, "yay, bobo! you made the sunflower so happy!"

from that day on, bobo and his friends would always dance and play around the sunflower. they learned that being kind and having fun can make everyone happy.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. lily loved to play with her phone. one day, lily's mom gave her a snack while she was playing. lily accidentally dropped her snack on her phone and it got dirty. 

lily's mom saw the dirty phone and said, "let's clean it!" they got a cloth and some water and wiped the phone until it was clean again. 

later that day, lily was playing with her phone again when she noticed a sticker on it. she wanted to remove the sticker, so she asked her mom for help. her mom gently removed the sticker and lily was happy to have a clean phone again.

once upon a time, there was an old smelly freezer in the corner of the room. it looked like it had been there a very long time. the kids were curious and so they decided to open it up. when they opened the door, everything inside was very cold. little specks of ice were all over. the kids were so excited! they all wanted to touch the frozen things inside.

they started jumping up and down, reaching for everything inside. but as soon as their fingers touched it, the frozen things started to freeze again! they were so surprised.it was like magic. 

the kids were so excited, they could hardly contain themselves. they felt like they were in a magical land. everything inside the freezer was so cold and so much fun. they kept jumping up and down and grabbing the frozen things, and watching them freeze. 

it was the best day ever! the kids never wanted to leave their smelly freezer.

timmy was a curious little boy who liked to collect things. he had a folder full of leaves, rocks, and sticks. he was having a great time collecting things, when suddenly a harsh voice shouted, "timmy, come back here right now!"

timmy was scared by the harsh voice, but he didn't want to get in trouble so he reluctantly put his folder down. he slowly walked to the voice, with a confused look on his face. he saw his mom there with arms crossed and a stern look. she said, "timmy, i told you to stay in the yard, but you chose to collect things outside. this is not okay!

timmy looked sad, but he understood why his mom was angry. he promised to not go outside the yard and to collect things within the yard from now on. timmy had learned his lesson, and his mom gave him a hug.

from then on, timmy stuck to collecting things inside the yard and he was a lot safer. he was happy that his mom cared enough to be stern and strict with him, even though it was harsh. he never touched the folder full of leaves, rocks, and sticks again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sarah. she loved to play with her friends, but today she wanted to go on a special adventure. she asked her mom if she could go and her mom said yes.

so sarah grabbed her favorite stuffed animal and off she went. she found an incredible seat in a meadow and she sat down. there were lots of plants and as sarah looked around, she saw a big field of corn. she was so excited, she couldn't believe it.

she got out of her seat and started running to the corn. she bent down and carefully picked one of the big kernels of corn. she put it in her pocket and ran back to the seat.

sarah decided to stay a while longer and watched the sky turn from blue to pink. she thought that this was one of the best things she ever did by going on a special adventure.

when the sun went down and it was time to go home, sarah still held the corn in her pocket. this incredible adventure was something she would never forget.

one day, a dog named max went for a walk with his owner. max was on a leash so he wouldn't run away. suddenly, max saw a squirrel and he wanted to chase it. but his owner said, "no, max! that's dangerous! you could get hurt!" 

max's owner wiped his forehead because it was hot outside. max looked up at his owner and barked, "woof woof! can we play fetch instead?" his owner smiled and said, "sure, max! let's play fetch with your ball." 

max was happy to play fetch with his owner. they threw the ball back and forth until it was time to go home. max's owner put him back on the leash and they walked back home safely. max was tired but happy because he got to play with his owner.

once upon a time, there were two brave ants. they were all ready for their race. 

the sun was hot and the sky was blue. the ants were all set to go. the first ant was brave and fast. he was very lucky. 

when the race started, the ants ran as fast as they could. but the second ant was even faster! he ran so fast that eventually the first ant couldn't keep up. 

the second ant knew he was going to win the race. but then something strange happened! the sun was getting so hot that the ground started to melt. 

the second ant was so close to the finish line, but the melting ground stopped him in his tracks. the first ant was lucky and crossed the finish line first. he had won the race!

mary was very impatient. she wanted to spin so badly, but she didn't know how. she asked her mom for help. her mom told her to stand up and stick her arms out. mary was so excited. she held her arms out wide and started spinning around. faster and faster she spun, until she was so dizzy!

suddenly, she heard a loud noise. it was an emergency! it made a loud ringing sound, so her mom told her to stop spinning. mary was so disappointed, she wanted to keep spinning. but her mom said the emergency was important and they had to stop.

so mary stopped. but inside she was still spinning, with excitement!

once upon a time, there was a boy who loved to count. his favorite thing was to count big steps.

the boy found a big hill. he wanted to count every step while going up. he put one foot in front of the other and started counting 1,2,3.

he was so busy counting he didn't realize how dirty his feet had gotten! by the time he reached the top of the hill, there was mud all over them!

the boy's mom saw him and said, "what happened? your feet are so dirty!"

the boy said, "i was counting my steps up the hill. i wanted to see how many steps there were!"

his mom smiled and said, "well, i can see you had fun. now let's go back home and clean your feet!" 

and that's what they did. the boy was so happy he had counted all the steps of the big hill!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and run around. one day, she saw a butterfly flying in the garden. she tried to catch it but it flew away. 

lily's friend, timmy, came over and asked if she wanted to play. lily said, "i want to catch the butterfly but it's too fast. can you help me?" timmy said, "i'm clever. i can manage to catch it." 

timmy ran after the butterfly but it flew high up in the sky. timmy jumped to try and catch it but he couldn't. lily said, "it's okay, timmy. we can try again tomorrow." 

the next day, lily went outside and saw the butterfly again. she ran after it and this time she managed to catch it. she was so happy and showed it to timmy. they played with the butterfly for a while but then accidentally let it go. they were sad that the butterfly flew away and they couldn't catch it again.

tommy was a dog who liked to run and play in the park. he had a friend, molly, who was a cat who liked to nap and purr in the sun. one day, they went to the park together, but the sky was gloomy and gray. there was no sun and no other animals to play with.

"i don't like this park today," tommy said. "it is too cold and wet and sad."

"me neither," molly said. "i want to go home and curl up in my bed."

they were about to leave, when they heard a tiny voice. "hello, hello, can you hear me?" the voice said.

they looked around, but they could not see anyone. "who is that?" tommy asked.

"it's me, it's me, i'm a flea!" the voice said. "i live in your fur, and i want to have some fun!"

tommy and molly felt a tickle in their fur. they scratched and shook their heads, but they could not get rid of the flea.

"stop it, stop it, you are bothering us!" molly said.

"but i'm bored, i'm bored, i want to play!" the flea said. "let me tell you a joke, maybe you will laugh!"

tommy and molly sighed. they did not think a flea could tell a good joke. but they decided to listen, because they had nothing else to do.

"okay, okay, what do you call a fish with no eyes?" the flea asked.

tommy and molly thought for a moment. they did not know the answer.

"what do you call it?" tommy asked.

"a fsh!" the flea said.

tommy and molly did not get it at first. then they realized that the flea was saying "fish" without the "i". they looked at each other, and then they started to laugh.

"that's silly, that's silly, that's a funny joke!" tommy said.

"yes, yes, that's clever, that's a good joke!" molly said.

the flea was happy that he made them laugh. he told them another joke, and another, and another. soon, tommy and molly forgot about the gloomy sky and the cold park. they laughed and laughed, and they felt warm and happy.

the flea was a good friend, after all. he made them laugh, and he made them forget their troubles. he also made them itch, but they did not mind. they were having too much fun.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called meg. she wore a bright red scarf on a cool day. as she walked through the park, she saw a big grassy field. meg thought it would be fun to poke the fluffy grass, so she started to do it with her finger.

suddenly, a voice called out. it was coming from a small bush.

"what are you doing?!", the voice said.

meg looked around but she couldn't see anyone. 

"who said that?", she wondered.

just then, a small creature stepped out from the bush. it was a tiny frog! 

"hello there", said the frog. "what are you doing to the grass?" 

"i'm poking it!" said meg. "it's fun!"

the frog thought for a moment. "that is cool! i like poking too! can i join you?" 

meg laughed. "of course you can!"

they spent the rest of the day poking the grass together and having fun. meg was glad she brought her scarf, because it kept her warm even on the cool day. 

the end!

sally was a lucky girl. she had a very special mint. whenever sally felt scared or sad, she could hold the mint and it would help her feel better.

one day, sally was feeling very scared. she was afraid of the thunder and lightning outside her window. she grabbed her mint and it helped her to feel safe and brave.

that night, sally brought her mint to bed with her. she hugged it close and it kept her feeling happy and calm until morning.

the next day, sally decided that she wanted to help her friends feel the same way she did when she had her mint. so she shared her mint with them and now her friends felt brave, safe and happy too.

sally realized that nothing made her luckier than when she could help her friends. and whenever she helped her friends, her special mint was always by her side.

molly and her grandmother were walking in the park. molly saw an iron bench. "granny, what's that?" she asked.

"it's an iron bench, molly," replied granny. "it's strong and harmless, so you can sit on it."

molly moved closer to the bench and touched it. she said, "i like it because it's so solid. can i resist it?"

granny smiled at molly. "yes, you can resist it if you want, but there's no need to," she said. "it's harmless, so it won't do you any harm. go ahead and sit on it if you like."

molly sat down on the bench and laughed. she said, "i can resist it, but it's not so strong that i can't sit on it."

granny chuckled. "that's right. iron can be strong, but it's also harmless," she said.

molly smiled. she was happy to learn something new and to discover the strength and gentleness of iron.

ben and lily like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but their favorite is the telephone. the telephone is red and yellow and has buttons and sounds. they pretend to call their friends and family and talk about funny things.

one day, they find an enormous telephone in the garage. it is bigger than them and has a long cord. they wonder who left it there and why. they decide to play with it and see what happens.

they take turns holding the big phone and pressing the buttons. they hear different noises and voices. some are loud and some are quiet. some are happy and some are angry. they laugh and make up stories about who they are talking to.

but then, they hear a voice that sounds like their dad. he says, "hello, hello, who is this? why are you using my phone?" ben and lily are scared. they drop the phone and run away. they think they are in trouble.

they hide behind the sofa and wait for their dad to come home. they hope he will not be mad at them. they whisper to each other and say they are sorry. they promise to never play with the enormous telephone again.

tim and lily were twins who liked to be adventurous. they loved to explore new places and try new things. but sometimes they forgot to behave and listen to their mom and dad.

one day, they decided to play in the kitchen while their mom was busy. they saw a big sink full of water and bubbles. they thought it would be fun to splash and make more bubbles. they climbed on a chair and reached for the sink.

"tim, lily, what are you doing?" their mom asked, coming into the kitchen. "you know you are not supposed to play with the sink. it is not safe. you could fall or make a mess."

"but mom, we are just having fun," tim said. "we are adventurous. we want to see what is in the sink."

"there is nothing in the sink but water and soap," their mom said. "and you are not being adventurous, you are being naughty. you need to behave and follow the rules. if you want to play with water, you can go outside and use the hose. but first, you need to clean up this mess and say sorry."

tim and lily realized they had made a mistake. they felt sorry for making their mom angry and worried. they helped her wipe the floor and the chair. they said sorry and gave her a hug.

they learned that being adventurous is good, but being naughty is bad. they also learned that they need to behave and listen to their mom and dad, because they love them and want them to be safe and happy.

davey was very excited. he was about to go on an adventure! he started by walking outside and observed the world around him. everywhere he looked, there were interesting things. he saw trees with green leaves, a stream of water, and birds soaring overhead.

eventually, davey got tired and decided it was time to go in the house. he opened the door and entered the bathroom. inside the bathroom, everything had a rough texture. the walls and floors were rough, and the sink was rough too. davey noticed that the room was also very damp.

davey was feeling very excited about his adventure. he stayed in the bathroom for a few minutes, observing all the interesting things. finally, it was time for him to go back outside and continue his exploration. he left the bathroom, but he knew he would come back soon to observe more!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sam. she had long hair and liked to play with dolls.

one day, sam was playing in the garden when she found a broken bike. she was so excited. she ran back inside to tell her mom. 

"mom! can we repair the bike?" she asked.

her mom smiled, "of course! let's try to fix it together."

so, the two of them worked hard on the bike. sam's mom showed her how all the parts fit together. when they finished, sam was so proud of their work.

"we did it!" she said.

they took the bike outside, and sam took it for a ride. she rode around the garden and reached the exit. 

"mom, look! we repaired the bike!" sam shouted.

her mom was so proud of sam. she hugged her and said, "you did an awesome job, sam!"

jimmy was boring one day, so he stepped outside. he saw something ordinary. it was a bulb. he wondered what it was. so he cautiously walked over to it. he whispered, "hello, bulb."
suddenly the bulb started to freeze! jimmy got scared and jumped back.
he heard the bulb speak. "i'm a magical bulb," the bulb said in a squeaky voice. "i can freeze ordinary things." 
jimmy's eyes opened wide. "wow," he said. "what do i do?"
"touch the bulb," the bulb said.
jimmy carefully reached out and touched the bulb. suddenly, he could freeze ordinary things too! every time he said "freeze" ordinary things stopped moving.
jimmy was so excited to have this new power. he went around using it all day, freezing things and making them come alive again. it was magical! 
the end.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named tim. tim found a toy gun in his room. he liked to play with it. one day, he went to the park with his toy gun.
