at the park, tim saw a girl named sue. sue was pale and looked sad. tim went to sue and asked, "why are you sad?" sue said, "i lost my toy, and i can't find it." tim wanted to help sue. they looked all around the park. 

finally, they found sue's toy behind a tree. sue was very happy, and tim was happy too. they played together and became good friends. tim learned that helping others can make you feel good. and that was the day tim and sue learned the joy of sharing and helping each other.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his blocks. he would stack them up and knock them down, over and over again. 

one day, timmy's friend came over to play. they were having so much fun building towers and castles with the blocks. but then, timmy accidentally knocked over his friend's tower. 

his friend started to cry and said, "that hurt my feelings!" timmy felt bad and said, "i'm sorry. let's build it again together." 

so they worked together to build an even bigger tower. they repeated this process, building and knocking down towers, until it was time for timmy's friend to go home. they hugged goodbye and promised to play with the blocks again soon.

once upon a time there was a robot. it was so smooth and shiny! everyone was amazed by the robot and watched it in excitement.

the robot did all kinds of tricks. it could move its arms, blink its eyes and even fly. the robot flew so high in the sky that it made the children gasp in shock!

the robot kept on doing amazing things. it sang happy songs, danced around in circles and even jumped up and down. everyone loved watching the robot and it made them super excited.

eventually it was time for the robot to go home. everyone said goodbye to the robot with big smiles on their faces. they were so sad to see the robot go but they were also very excited to watch it again soon!

once upon a time there was a little girl who lived in a big house with a garden full of flowers. every day, in the middle of the day, the sun shone bright and made it feel cool outside. the little girl liked to go out and play in the garden at noon. 

her mom always encouraged her to play outside in the garden because it was good for her to get some fresh air and sunshine. when it was noon, the little girl would ask her mom if she could go play outside. 

her mom always said yes, and gave her a big smile when she went out to play. she would go explore and find beautiful flowers, insects and even friendly animals. playing in the garden made the little girl happy and encouraged her to take on new adventures. 

at the end of the day, the little girl always felt tired from all her exploring. she would be so happy and content, knowing she'd had a great day in her garden- full of sunshine and encouragement!

once upon a time there was a clumsy bear called benny. benny liked to drink cool, sweet drinks with all his friends. one day, benny and his friends were walking through the dark woods when they came across a giant puddle.

"let's drink up the puddle!" said benny.

but his friends were scared.

"we can't do that!" they said. 

benny didn't listen and climbed down into the puddle. he started to take big gulps of the murky water but it tasted awful.

benny's friends shouted at him: "you shouldn't drink out of the dark puddle! it's not safe!" 

benny stopped drinking and looked at his friends. he knew he had been clumsy but he was glad his friends had looked out for him. benny thanked his friends, and they all went home together.

lily liked to draw with her crayons. she made many pictures of her family, her friends, and her toys. she was very creative and used many colors. she hung her pictures on the wall with tape.

one day, her mom said, "lily, i want to teach you how to write your name. it is easy and fun. you can use your crayons or a pencil." lily was excited. she wanted to learn how to write her name.

her mom gave her a piece of paper and a pencil. she showed her how to make the letters l, i, l, and y. she said, "this is how you write lily. you can copy me or make your own letters. try it, lily."

lily tried to write her name. she made a big l, a small i, a big l, and a small y. she was proud of her name. she showed it to her mom. her mom smiled and said, "good job, lily. you are a smart girl. you can write your name."

lily wanted to write her name again. she took another piece of paper and a crayon. she wrote her name in red. then she wrote it in blue. then she wrote it in green. she filled the paper with her name in different colors. she was happy.

she showed her paper to her mom. her mom said, "wow, lily. you are very creative. you made a beautiful rainbow of your name. i love it."

lily said, "thank you, mom. i love you. you are a good teach."

her mom hugged her and said, "i love you too, lily. you are a good learn. now, let's wipe the table and put away the crayons and papers. then we can have a snack."

once upon a time there was a boy named tom. tom was three years old and he loved to go on adventures. 

one day, tom went on a journey to a faraway place. he walked through a peaceful forest and when he reached the end he discovered a secret garden. it was full of colourful ornaments. they sparkled in the sun and shone in the moonlight. 

tom was so excited by this discovery that he decided to mark the spot, so he placed a special yellow ornament on a tree. he knew that it would act as a marker so he could find his way back here. 

tom smiled as he said goodbye to the secret garden, safe in the knowledge that he could return here when he wanted. he returned home, happy and peaceful. 

the

anna and ben were playing with their toys in the living room. they had a lot of fun making noises and pretending to be animals. but then they saw something shiny on the shelf. it was a big red ball with stars on it. it looked amazing.

"wow, look at that ball!" anna said. "i want to play with it!"

"me too!" ben said. "let's get it!"

they ran to the shelf and tried to reach the ball. but it was too high for them. they jumped and stretched, but they could not touch it.

"maybe we can use a chair," anna said. she dragged a chair from the table and climbed on it. she was closer to the ball, but still not close enough.

"maybe we can use a book," ben said. he grabbed a book from the floor and gave it to anna. she put it on the chair and stood on it. she was very close to the ball, but still not close enough.

"maybe we can use a rope," anna said. she saw a rope hanging from the ceiling. it was part of a lamp that their dad had made. she reached for the rope and pulled it. she hoped it would bring the ball closer to her.

but it did not. instead, it made the lamp fall down. the lamp hit the shelf and knocked the ball off. the ball bounced on the floor and rolled away. the lamp broke into pieces and made a loud noise.

anna and ben were scared. they jumped off the chair and the book and ran away. they heard their mom coming from upstairs. she had heard the noise too.

"what happened here?" she asked. she saw the mess and the broken lamp. she was not happy.

"sorry, mom," anna and ben said. "we just wanted to play with the amazing ball."

tom and sam are friends. they like to play with toys. one day, they find a pistol in the park. it is shiny and black. it is different from their other toys.

"look, a pistol!" tom says. he picks it up and points it at sam.

"bang, bang! you are dead!" he says.

sam is scared. he does not like the pistol. he thinks it is not a toy.

"stop, tom! that is not a toy! that is a real pistol! it can hurt us!" he says.

tom does not listen. he thinks it is fun. he pulls the trigger. but nothing happens. the pistol is empty.

"ha, ha! it is a toy! see, it does not work!" he says.

he throws the pistol on the ground and runs away.

sam is still scared. he does not want to play with tom anymore. he runs to his mom and tells her what happened.

mom is angry and worried. she hugs sam and says:

"sam, you are a good boy. you did the right thing. you should never play with pistols. they are dangerous. they are not for children. they can hurt you and others. do you understand?"

sam nods. he understands. he says:

"yes, mom. i understand. i will never play with pistols. i am sorry."

mom smiles and says:

"it is okay, sam. i am glad you are safe. come, let us go home and have some cookies."

ben and sam were best friends. they liked to play with their toys and pretend they were heroes. one day, they found a big box in the garage. inside the box, there were many things that looked like guns. ben and sam were curious and excited. they took two guns and ran outside.

"let's play space cowboys!" ben said. "we can soar in the sky and fight the bad aliens!"

"ok!" sam agreed. "i'll be the captain and you'll be the pilot!"

they climbed on their bikes and made zooming noises. they pointed their guns at the trees and the birds and said "pew pew pew!" they felt brave and happy.

but then, they heard a loud bang. it came from the house next door. they saw smoke and fire and people screaming. they saw a man with a real gun and a scary face. he was shooting at the police. ben and sam were fearful. they dropped their guns and hid behind a bush.

"what's happening?" sam whispered.

"i don't know," ben whispered back. "but it's not a game. it's very bad."

they hugged each other and prayed for the shooting to stop. they wished they were home with their moms and dads. they wished they never found the box with the guns. they learned that guns were not toys. they learned that guns could hurt and kill. they learned that guns could make people fearful.

lia and ben were playing in the forest. they liked to pretend they were hunters and look for animals. they had a large spear that they made from a stick and a stone. they lay on the ground and waited for a deer to come.

"shh, be quiet," lia whispered to ben. "i see a deer over there. it is big and brown and has horns."

"wow, can we catch it?" ben asked.

"maybe, but we have to be careful. it can run fast and kick hard. you hold the spear and i will make a noise to scare it," lia said.

lia picked up a pine cone and threw it at the deer. the deer heard the noise and looked around. it saw lia and ben and got scared. it started to run away.

"now, ben, now!" lia shouted.

ben jumped up and threw the spear at the deer. he tried to aim well, but the spear was too heavy for him. it flew past the deer and landed in a bush.

"oh, no, we missed!" ben said.

the deer ran away and disappeared in the trees. lia and ben ran to get their spear. they were sad that they did not catch the deer, but they were also happy that they had fun.

"maybe next time we will get it," lia said.

"maybe, but we need a better spear. this one is too large for us," ben said.

they decided to make a new spear that was smaller and lighter. they looked for a new stick and a new stone. they lay on the ground and worked on their spear. they did not give up. they wanted to be good hunters.

lily and tom were playing in the park. they liked to slide, swing and run. but they did not like to share. they always wanted the same toy or the same spot.

one day, they saw a green bike near the fence. it looked cool and shiny. they both ran to it and tried to grab it.

"mine!" lily shouted.

"no, mine!" tom yelled.

they pulled and pushed and fought over the bike. they did not see the man who owned the bike. he was angry and came to them.

"hey, stop that! that's my bike!" he said. "you are very naughty. i will punish you. you have to sit on the bench and say sorry."

lily and tom felt scared and sorry. they let go of the bike and followed the man. they sat on the bench and said sorry to him and to each other.

they learned to be nice and share. they did not fight over the bike again. they played with other toys and had fun. they were happy and the man was happy too.

once upon a time, there was a tiger. the tiger was big and strong. he was so high that he could whisper to the birds and the clouds.

one day, the tiger was looking for something new. he walked and walked until he found a little pond. he peered in and saw a tiny fish. the fish was sparkly and it made him smile. he bent down and whispered to the fish, "come out and play'

the fish was a little scared but he knew the tiger was just being kind. he swam out and followed the tiger up the hill. it was getting very high and the tiger stopped. he pointed and whispered, "look, a beautiful rainbow". the fish smiled and the two friends enjoyed the sights together.

the tiger and the fish played tag beneath the rainbow. they ran and laughed and had lots of fun. when it was time to leave, the tiger gave the fish a hug and whispered, "see you soon". the two friends waved goodbye, as the tiger walked off in the sunset.

once upon a time, there was a big, hungry lion. he was so hungry he decided to go looking for food. he roamed and roamed, but he couldn't find anything to eat.

finally, he came across a tent in the desert. from inside he could see people drinking from mugs. he roared so loudly it scared the people inside the tent, and they quickly ran away.

the lion thought he was so lucky! he sniffed the mugs and found food inside each one. he ate until he was full, and then he lay in the sun to take a nap.

finally, the lion was no longer hungry. he thanked the mug for keeping him fed, and he promised to never roar again unless he was in trouble.

lila and ben were twins who liked to play with their toy rockets. they pretended they were astronauts who could fly to the stars and planets. one day, they found a big cardboard box in the garage and decided to make it their spaceship.

they cut out windows and doors and painted it with bright colors. they put their toy rockets and some snacks inside and got ready for their adventure. "are you ready, ben?" lila asked. "ready, lila!" ben answered. they closed the door and counted down. "three, two, one, blast off!"

they imagined they were zooming through the sky, past the moon and the sun, and into the universe. they saw many beautiful things, like stars that sparkled, planets that had rings, and comets that had tails. they pretended to land on different places and explore them. they had so much fun.

but then, they heard a loud noise outside. it was their dog, rex, who had smelled their snacks and wanted some. he scratched and barked at the box, trying to get in. lila and ben were scared. they did not want rex to ruin their spaceship or eat their food. they had to escape.

they quickly grabbed their toy rockets and opened the door. they ran out of the box and into the house, leaving rex behind. rex was envious. he wanted to play with them and share their snacks. he whimpered and wagged his tail, hoping they would come back. but lila and ben did not hear him. they were too busy telling their mom about their amazing adventure in the universe.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her shiny coin. one day, lily went to the park to play. she put her coin in her pocket and started to swing on the swings. 

suddenly, lily heard a loud ring. it was coming from her pocket! she reached in and found that her coin was missing. she was very upset and started to cry. 

just then, a boy came up to her and asked, "are you okay?" lily told him what happened and the boy said, "i found a coin over by the slide. is this yours?" 

lily was so happy and thanked the boy. she learned that sometimes things can make us upset, but they can also make us happy again.

lily and ben were playing with their toys in the living room. they saw a big box under the tree. it had a shiny paper and a red bow. they wanted to know what was inside.

"can we open it?" lily asked ben.

"no, we can't. it is for christmas. mom and dad said so." ben said.

"but i want to see. maybe it is a doll or a car." lily said.

she went to the box and tried to peek under the paper. ben followed her and tried to stop her.

"stop, lily. you will ruin the surprise. and you will make mom and dad sad." ben said.

but lily did not listen. she pulled the paper and tore it. she saw a teddy bear with a blue hat and a scarf. she smiled and hugged it.

"look, ben. it is a teddy bear. it is so soft and cute." lily said.

ben looked at the box and the paper. he saw a tag that said "to lily and ben, from mom and dad". he felt guilty. he knew they did something bad.

"lily, we have to put it back. we have to wrap it again. mom and dad will know we opened it." ben said.

he took the teddy bear from lily and put it in the box. he tried to fix the paper and the bow. but it was too late. the paper was ripped and the bow was loose.

mom and dad came into the living room. they saw the box and the paper. they saw lily and ben with guilty faces.

"what happened here?" mom asked.

lily and ben looked at each other. they did not know what to say. they felt sorry. they lowered their heads and covered their ears. they hoped mom and dad would not be angry.

once upon a time, there was a girl who loved mornings. she thanked her mom each morning for breakfast. then one morning, the girl was feeling dizzy. her mom said, "sweetie, i think it's time to visit the doctor." the girl was nervous and wondered what would happen.

when the doctor saw her, he said, "let me run some tests." after a few minutes, the doctor said, "i'm concerned about what's happening in your body. we need to go to the hospital so specialists can help you." 

the girl was scared. she had never been to the hospital before. but, she trusted the doctor and hugged her mom before getting in the car. 

at the hospital, the girl was checked over. the doctors found out that her dizziness was because she had an infection. once they gave her medicine, she gradually started to feel better.

the girl thanked the doctors and nurses for helping her get better. she was happy that her mornings wouldn't have to be dizzy anymore.

once upon a time, there were two friends named timmy and tommy. they loved to play together every day. one day, timmy brought some chocolate to share with tommy. they ate the chocolate and it was yummy. 

but then, they started to fight over who had more chocolate. timmy said tommy had more and tommy said timmy had more. they started to push and hit each other. 

their mom came in and saw them fighting. she said, "stop it! fighting is not nice. you are friends." timmy and tommy felt stupid for fighting over chocolate. they said sorry to each other and hugged. from that day on, they shared their chocolate and never fought again.

once upon a time there was a little girl called sarah. sarah loved to play with her toys and pretend she was an army soldier with a shiny uniform. she would put on her uniform and parade around her bedroom, waving her arms and singing a made-up army song. one day sarah noticed something funny. she picked up her uniform and saw that it was fake. it had no buttons, only made-out ones. sarah started to cry, but suddenly her mum came in and gave her a big hug. sarah felt so much better. 

sarah's mum told her that she had been to the shop and brought a real uniform just for her. sarah was so excited and put it on straight away; it felt soft and the buttons were real this time. feeling happy again, sarah gave her mum a big hug and thanked her for the new uniform. they hugged and laughed together in sarah's bedroom until it was time to go to bed. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to dream. in her dreams she saw a beautiful crystal. it sparkled in the sunshine and it made her very happy.

one day, the little girl saw the same crystal in real life. it was clumsy and it seemed to be stuck in a tree. she tried to reach it, but it was too high. so she started to cry.

suddenly her guardian angel appeared. she said "don't worry little one, i will help you get your dream crystal". with a wave of her hand and a twinkle of her eye, the crystal came tumbling down to the ground.

the little girl was so happy. she hugged the crystal and thanked her angel for making her dream come true. she carried the crystal around with her all day, and when she went to sleep at night, she dreamed of all the wonderful adventures she and her crystal would go on.

once upon a time, there was a naughty little boy. he was always in trouble and didn't like to listen to grown-ups.

one day, his mommy asked him to be quiet, but he didn't listen. instead, he shouted, so his mommy sent him to his room.

on his way to his room, the naughty boy passed a lawyer. he asked the lawyer what he did, and the lawyer replied, "i work with the law."

the naughty boy was happy with his reply, so he asked the lawyer more questions. the lawyer answered them all, and then the naughty boy smiled and ran to his room.

one night, a little boy named ben could not sleep. he wanted to see the stars in the sky. he got out of his bed and put on his coat and shoes. he opened the door and went outside. he did not tell his mom or dad.

ben wandered around the yard and looked up at the stars. they were bright and shiny. he saw a big star and a small star. he thought they were friends. he wished he had a friend like that. he felt lonely and cold.

suddenly, he heard a loud bark. it was a big dog from the next house. the dog was angry and ran towards ben. ben was scared and tried to run away. but he tripped and fell. he cried for help.

his mom and dad heard his cry. they came outside and saw the dog. they shouted at the dog and scared it away. they picked up ben and hugged him. they asked him why he was outside. ben told them he wanted to see the stars.

his mom and dad were sad and angry. they told him he was naughty and dangerous. he could have been hurt by the dog or lost in the dark. they told him he should never go outside without them. they told him he should always listen and obey.

ben felt sorry and ashamed. he said he was sorry and he loved them. he learned his lesson. he never wandered outside again. he realized the stars were not his friends. his real friends were his mom and dad. they loved him and protected him. he was happy and warm.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, it rained so much that the water started to come inside her house. lily's mom said, "we need to go to a safe place, the flood is coming!" 

lily was scared and asked, "what is a flood?" 

her mom explained, "a flood is when too much water comes and covers everything. it's not safe to stay here." 

lily looked outside and saw the water was getting higher. she said, "i don't want to leave my toys behind." 

her mom replied, "we can't take everything, but we will take the important things. we need to quit worrying about the toys and focus on staying safe." 

they packed their bags and went to a clear and safe place. lily was happy that they were safe and she knew her toys would be okay too.

once upon a time, there was a big, big elephant. he had a friend, a little monkey. the monkey liked to play with the elephant, but he was too small to carry the enormous elephant on his back. 

one day, the elephant and the monkey went for a walk in the jungle. the elephant saw a big, juicy fruit on a tree, but he couldn't reach it. the monkey climbed up the tree and picked the fruit. he carried it down to the elephant and they shared it together.

after that, the elephant was happy he had such a good friend who could carry things he couldn't. and the monkey was happy to have a friend as big and enormous as the elephant. they continued to play and explore the jungle together, always helping each other when they needed it.

once upon a time, there was a little baby named timmy. timmy loved to sleep in his crib. his crib was big and white. one day, timmy's mom took him to the store. timmy saw a big orange ball and he wanted to own it. 

"mommy, i want to own the orange ball!" said timmy.

"okay, we can buy it for you," said timmy's mom.

when they got home, timmy played with his new ball. he bounced it around the house and then went to sleep in his crib. timmy loved his new ball and his cozy crib.

once upon a time there was an octopus. the octopus was orange and he swam in the sea looking for a place to fit. he was so small that it seemed impossible that such a small octopus would fit anywhere in the sea. everywhere he went the octopus looked for a place to fit, but he never found one.

one day, he came across an orange rock. it was an orange rock fit for the octopus! it was just the right size for him! he was so happy, he scrunched up his tentacles and snuggled right in! on that rock, the octopus felt so safe and snug he could stay there forever!

the octopus was so happy that he found a place he fit. he stayed there happily forever and ever!

once upon a time there was a little boy named jack. he was only 3 years old and so curious.

one day, jack was walking up a big hill. he wanted to see what was at the top. when he got to the top, there was a big field called a meadow. jack thought it looked fun and exciting, but it was so big and dull!

"where do i begin?" asked jack. he didn't know which way he should go. after a few minutes of thinking, he decided to pick one way and just keep walking.

suddenly, he saw something. it was a small tree and it looked very different from the other trees. but even more interesting was the sign on the tree. it said "magic tree!"

jack couldn't believe it. he was so excited and he had to find out if it was true. so he started walking toward the tree. as he got closer, he started to feel a little scared. he wasn't sure if he wanted to keep going. 

he stopped and sighed. but then he remembered that he was brave and he opened his eyes. he was still scared but he kept walking and he made it to the tree.

jack couldn't believe it: the tree was magical! he was so happy and he knew it was worth the risk. he was so glad he didn't give up!

once upon a time, there was a grumpy bear. his name was grumby. he was always walking around with a grumpy face.

one day grumby went for a walk and he saw a box at the top of a hill. grumby went up to the box and he saw that it was locked. 

grumby huffed and puffed, but he couldn't open the box no matter what he tried. he was getting more and more grumpy. 

suddenly, a fox came up to him and said, "why you look so grumpy, grumby bear?"

grumby replied, "i am trying to open this box, but it's locked." 

the fox smiled and said, "let me help you. i have a key that unlocks any box." 

grumby was so excited! in no time, the fox had opened the box and grumby saw that inside was a beautiful crown sitting on the top. 

grumby thanked the fox and put the crown on his head. from that moment on, grumby was never grumpy again!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat waffles for breakfast every day. one day, she went to the kitchen and saw her mom making waffles. but something was different. the waffle maker was twisted.

lily asked her mom, "why is the waffle maker twisted?" her mom replied, "i accidentally dropped it yesterday and it got twisted." lily said, "oh no! will the waffles still be good?" her mom smiled and said, "of course, they will still taste just as good as always. they might just look a little different."

after a few minutes, the waffles were ready. lily took a bite and said, "wow, these taste just as good as always! even though the waffle maker is twisted, the waffles are still yummy." her mom smiled and said, "that's because even though things might look different on the outside, they can still be ordinary and delicious on the inside."

john was so jealous of his sister, amy. she had a big, beautiful squash she got from the store. 

john wanted a squash too so he asked his mom if he could have one too. 

johnâ€™s mom said, â€œno john, you canâ€™t have one now.â€

john was unhappy and turned to his sister. he wanted to make her feel as bad as he felt. so he said, â€œlet me twist your squash!â€

amy said, â€œno! thatâ€™s not nice! donâ€™t twist my squash!â€ but john was too jealous to listen. he took the squash and started to twist it.

amy felt scared and ran away to find her mom.

johnâ€™s mom came running when she heard what john did. she was very mad at john and said, â€œthat was not nice! donâ€™t ever do that again or else!â€ 

john felt so sorry and promised he wouldnâ€™t ever twist anybodyâ€™s squash again.

once upon a time, there was a big dog named max. max had a big rug that he loved to lay on. one day, max was very tired and he yawned a big yawn. he walked over to his rug and lay down. but max was so big that he didn't fit on the rug anymore! he tried to curl up, but his legs stuck out. max was sad because he loved his rug very much. so, max decided to give his rug to his little friend, a small puppy named daisy. daisy was very happy and snuggled up on the large rug. max was happy too because he knew his friend was cozy and warm. from that day on, max and daisy shared the rug and took turns napping on it.

one day, a peaceful cat named kitty was playing near a pond. the sun was shining and the birds were singing. kitty liked to play in the grass and watch the fish in the pond.

soon, the rain came and the pond began to flood. the water was rising and the fish were scared. kitty wanted to help the fish, so she went to her friend, doggy. "doggy, can you lend me your big bowl? the fish need help," kitty asked. doggy was happy to lend kitty his big bowl.

kitty took the big bowl to the pond and scooped up the fish. she put them in a safe place until the rain stopped and the pond was not flooded anymore. the fish were very thankful to kitty and doggy for their help. after the rain stopped, kitty and doggy played together in the sun, happy that they could help their friends.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to hop around in the springtime. one day, benny saw a carrot patch and he really wanted to eat a carrot. but benny knew he had to resist because the carrots weren't his. 

benny hopped around some more and found a thoughtful friend, a little bird named billy. billy asked benny what was wrong and benny told him about the carrot patch. billy said, "don't worry benny, i know where we can find some yummy berries instead." 

benny was so happy that he followed billy to a bush full of delicious berries. benny realized that sometimes it's better to resist doing something wrong and find a better option. from then on, benny and billy were the best of friends and they always found thoughtful ways to have fun together in the springtime. the end.

once there was a fat cat. he wanted to balance on the fence. he carefully stepped onto the fence, but he was too fat and he almost fell off! he tried again, but he just couldn't balance. 

the cat nosed around and saw a stick. he grabbed it and put it in the middle of the fence to help him balance. he stepped onto the stick and he stayed there! the cat was so happy that he could balance on the fence at last. 

he stayed on the fence for the rest of the day until it was getting dark. then he jumped off the fence and ran into the house. he had a great day of balancing on the fence!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play on the beach and look for seashells. one day, she saw the tide coming in and it made her happy. she imagined that she could swim with the dolphins.

but then, something sad happened. lily's little brother ran into the water and got caught in the tide. lily tried to help him, but she was too small. she ran to get help, but it was too late. her brother had drowned.

lily was very sad and missed her brother very much. she never went to the beach again and always felt a little bit sad whenever she saw the tide coming in.

once there was a little girl who loved the ocean. every day she went for a swim and talked to the animals she saw. one day when she was swimming, she saw a shark. she was so excited, she had never seen a shark before. she started to go closer to the shark so she could have a better look, but then the girl felt something tickle her nose. she started to sneeze. the shark was scared, and it swam away quickly.

the girl was so sad that the shark was gone, but she never stopped hoping. every day she went back to the same spot and waited, but the shark never came back. until one day, the girl was swimming and she felt a tickle in her nose again. this time she didn't sneeze. she just kept swimming with the slow and steady hope that the shark might come back.

lo and behold, the shark came back! the shark was excited to see the girl again and they swam together all day. the girl's heart was so full of joy. she was so happy that she had finally made a friend in the ocean. it was like she had waited for a long time for the shark to return.

once upon a time there was a weight. it was scared and wanted to hide away. it slowly crawled up the side of the sack, slowly, so no one would see it.

suddenly, a 3 year old saw the weight. 

the 3 year old cried out, â€œwhatâ€™s that?â€ 

the scared weight replied quickly, â€œiâ€™m hiding in this sack. itâ€™s my safe place.â€ 

the 3 year old understood and said, â€œi wonâ€™t tell anyone. you can stay here.â€ 

the weight was so grateful and hugged the 3 year old with a big hug. from then on, the weight felt safe in the sack.

once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. tim loved aeroplanes. he liked to watch them fly up in the sky. one day, tim saw a fat man who was designing an aeroplane. the man was drawing pictures of the aeroplane on a big piece of paper. tim was very interested in what the man was doing, so he went over to see. 

the man showed tim his designs for the aeroplane. tim thought they were very cool. the man explained that he was making the aeroplane bigger so that more people could fit inside. tim thought that was a great idea. he wished he could fly in the aeroplane too. 

after a while, the man finished his designs and left. tim went home, but he couldn't stop thinking about the aeroplane. he decided that one day, he would design his own aeroplane, just like the fat man did. and maybe one day, he would get to fly in it too.

the sun was out and it was a beautiful day. a little girl was outside playing with her friend. they were exploring the garden and seeing what they could find.

suddenly, there was a loud sound in the sky. it was thunder! the little girl was scared. her friend said "it's okay, it's just lightning! we have to be careful."

the moment passed and the little girl forgot all about it. she and her friend continued to explore the garden until it was time to go home.

at night, the sky lit up with bright lightning. the little girl was so excited! she wanted to see it again. she asked her mom if she could watch it from the window. her mom said "yes, just be careful not to get too close".

so the little girl carefully watched the lightning streak across the night sky. it was a beautiful sight and she couldn't help but get a little bit closer. but she remembered her mom's warning and stayed back.

the little girl watched the lightning until it was time to go to bed. as she drifted off to sleep, she could still remember the excitement of watching the beautiful lightning light up the night sky.

the sun was shining clear in the sky when sarah walked outside with her mom. as they strolled around the park, sarah noticed a wallet lying on the ground. mom said, "oh sarah, that must belong to someone. let's pick it up and look inside."

sarah carefully picked up the wallet and opened it up. inside she saw a picture of a boy with a big smile. sarah smiled too and said, "mommy, the boy looks nice!" 

mommy replied, "yes, he does. maybe we can give him back his wallet and make him happy." then they headed out to find the boy.

soon they saw him walking down the street. mom called out, â€œhey, little boy!â€ sarah held up the wallet and waved it.

the boy's face lit up and he ran over. mommy gave him the wallet and asked if he was okay. he nodded and said, "thank you so much!" then he smiled and gave sarah a big kiss.

sarah felt her face getting warm and giggled. mom said, "it's nice to do something kind for others. that was very clear."

the boy thanked them again and waved goodbye as he skipped down the street. sarah and mommy smiled and went home, feeling warm and happy inside.

once upon a time there was a hurricane. it was very big and strong. it blew very hard and made a lot of noise. all the birds and animals sat down and were scared. the sky got very dark and the wind blew very fast. one cloud was very thick and it made a lot of rain. everywhere was wet and lots of trees were knocked down. everything was still until the hurricane stopped blowing. everyone stayed safe and the storm passed quickly. now the trees are back up and the sky is bright again. everyone is happy and they sit and play.

lily and max are twins who like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but they do not like to share them. they are very competitive and always want to have the best toys.

one day, their mom tells them to organize their toys and put them away in their boxes. she says they have to do it before lunch, or they will not get any dessert. lily and max agree, but they do not want to work together. they each take a box and start to put their toys in it.

lily sees that max has a big red car that she likes. she wants to have it for herself. she sneaks to max's box and takes the car. she puts it in her box and smiles.

max sees that lily has a soft pink bear that he likes. he wants to have it for himself. he sneaks to lily's box and takes the bear. he puts it in his box and smiles.

lily and max finish organizing their toys and go to their mom. they show her their boxes and say they are done. their mom looks at their boxes and frowns. she sees that they have taken each other's toys. she is not happy.

she says, "lily and max, you did not organize your toys well. you took each other's toys and did not share. that is not nice. you have to learn to play together and be fair. you have to give back the toys that are not yours and say sorry. and you have to do it now, or you will not get any dessert."

lily and max look at each other and feel ashamed. they realize they were wrong and selfish. they go back to their boxes and take out the toys that are not theirs. they give them back to each other and say sorry. they hug and say they will share and play together from now on.

their mom sees them and smiles. she says, "that's better. i'm proud of you. you organized your toys well. now you can have lunch and dessert. and after that, you can play with your toys on the carpet. but remember, be nice and have fun."

lila and sam were twins who liked to play dress-up. they had a big box of clothes and hats and scarves and jewels. one day, they found a pretty veil in the box. it was white and soft and had shiny beads on it.

"let's play princesses with the veil!" lila said.

"ok, but i want to wear it first!" sam said.

they both grabbed the veil and pulled hard. the veil was not strong and it split in two. the beads fell off and rolled on the floor.

"oh no! we broke the veil!" lila cried.

"it's your fault! you pulled too hard!" sam yelled.

they started to fight and shout and hit each other. they did not hear their mom come into the room.

"what is going on here?" mom asked. she saw the torn veil and the beads and the angry twins. she was not jolly at all. she was very cross.

"you two have been very naughty! you ruined the veil and you hurt each other! you need to say sorry and share your things!" mom said.

but lila and sam did not say sorry. they did not share. they kept fighting and crying. mom took away the box of clothes and hats and scarves and jewels. she said they could not play dress-up until they learned to be nice.

lila and sam were very sad. they had no veil and no fun and no friends. they wished they had not split the veil.

the moral of the story is: do not be greedy and selfish. be kind and gentle. share your things and play nicely.

lila and ben love to go to the beach with their grandma. grandma is elderly, but she still likes to watch the waves and the surfers. sometimes she tells lila and ben stories about when she was young and learned to surf.

one day, they see a man with a big surfboard. he is also elderly, but he has white hair and a long beard. he smiles at them and says, "hello, little ones. do you want to see me surf?"

lila and ben nod eagerly. they think he looks like a wizard. the man walks into the water and paddles his surfboard. he waits for a big wave and then stands up. he rides the wave all the way to the shore, balancing and turning on his surfboard.

lila and ben clap their hands and applaud. they think he is amazing. grandma also applauds and says, "wow, that was impressive. you are very good at surfing, sir."

the man comes out of the water and thanks them. he says, "thank you, thank you. you are very kind. i have been surfing for a long time, but i still enjoy it. it makes me feel young and free."

he asks them their names and introduces himself as sam. he says he is a friend of their grandma. he tells them he used to surf with her when they were young. he says they had a lot of fun and adventures.

lila and ben are surprised and curious. they ask grandma and sam to tell them more stories. grandma and sam laugh and agree. they sit on the sand and share their memories. lila and ben listen and imagine. they think surfing is cool and they want to learn it too. they hope they can be like grandma and sam when they are elderly.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lucy. she loved to play outside in the sun. one day, it started to rain. lucy was sad because she could not play outside. she had to be patient and wait for the rain to stop.

while she waited, lucy thought about what to do inside. she could choose to play with her toys, read a book, or draw a picture. lucy decided to choose drawing a picture. she picked up her crayons and started to draw a big, bright sun.

after some time, the rain stopped. lucy looked out the window and saw the sun shining again. she was so happy! she put on her shoes and went outside to play. lucy was glad she was patient and waited for the rain to stop. and she learned that she could have fun inside too, by choosing to draw a picture.

once upon a time there was a man who was cold. he had not eaten all week and was feeling so hungry and tired. as he walked down the street he noticed a yawning cat sitting in the window. he said to the cat, "hello sleepy cat, why are you yawning?" the cat replied, "i'm so tired, i'm so cold that i just can't stop yawning." 

the man thought for a minute and had an idea. he said, "i know a place we can go to get warm and eat something yummy. come with me." and so he and the cat walked down the street together until they came to a warm house. inside was a bowl of food and a cozy spot near the fire. 

the man said, "cat, here is something to eat and you can sit here and get warm. you can stay here all week so you don't have to be cold and hungry." the cat said, "thank you, kind man!" and the cat curled up near the fire and fell asleep with a satisfied yawn.

once there was a little puppy whose name was joe. joe was very happy and he loved to play outside. one day, joe was out in the garden playing with a ball when he saw something strange. he peered through the grass and saw that the ball had started to shrink! joe was confused and he shouted out, "what's happening to my ball?!"

suddenly, a big gust of wind blew across the garden. joe felt something heavy on his head, and then he saw it: it was his ball and it had shrunk to the size of a pea! joe gasped in surprise.

he asked the wind, "why did my ball shrink?!" the wind replied, "it's a magical ball that shrinks when the wind blows!" 

joe smiled and thanked the wind for telling him. he said, "i know what i'm going to do with this tiny ball now. i'm going to keep it and play with it inside the house." 

joe picked up the tiny ball and carefully placed it in his pocket. he ran back into the house and played happily with his new toy.

once upon a time there was a little girl who was very obedient. one day, as she was walking from her house to the park, she stopped to rest on a big cushion. she wanted to know what was inside the cushion, so she started to question it.

the cushion was quiet and she couldn't hear anything. but then she thought maybe if she listened very carefully she could hear something. she put her ear very close to the cushion and suddenly she heard a sound. it sounded like a squeak!

the little girl was very excited. she asked the cushion, "what is in you? where are you from?"

the cushion didn't answer her, but she continued to ask question after question until she was too tired to ask anymore. she lay on top of the cushion and fell fast asleep. in her dream she saw a tiny mouse come out and answer all her questions.

when she woke up the mouse was gone, but she was happy that she had seen something so wonderful. from then on, she was always obedient and never stopped asking questions so she could learn more about the world.

once upon a time, there was a line of ants. they were all friends. they were dependable ants. they always helped each other.

one day, a new ant wanted to join the line. the other ants did not know this ant. but they were kind and wanted to accept him. they said, "come, be part of our line."

the new ant was happy. he joined the line and became a dependable ant too. they all worked together and had fun. they were a strong line of ants. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time there was a girl who was very gifted. she had lots of special skills that made her unique and special. one day she was exploring a new place when she discovered something different. she saw a texture that was so smooth she had to kneel and touch it! she felt the texture with her fingertips and knew that something special was happening. she could feel happiness that seemed to be coming from the texture and it filled her heart with joy. from that day on she kept going back to the special place to kneel and feel the special texture. the girl was so grateful to have discovered this wonderful feeling and was full of joy and happiness.

one day, a brave little boat named bob lived in a harbor. bob loved to go out and play in the big sea. his best friend was a big boat named ben. they liked to race each other and have fun.

one day, bob and ben were playing near the harbor. bob said, "let's race to that big rock and back!" ben agreed, and they started to race. they went very fast, and the water splashed all around them.

as they raced, they saw a little fish stuck in some seaweed. the fish was scared and asked for help. bob and ben stopped their race. bob said, "we need to help the little fish!" they worked together to free the fish from the seaweed. the little fish thanked them and swam away happily. bob and ben felt good about being brave and helping their new friend.

once upon a time there was a goose who wanted to paint a surprise for her mom. she had a lot of colors and she knew exactly what she should draw. she began to mix the colors and found the perfect combination.

while she was painting, a rabbit hopped close by. "what are you doing goose?" asked the rabbit. 

"i'm painting a surprise for my mom. i'm almost done," answered the goose with a smile.

the rabbit was so curious that he sat and watched the goose carefully. when she was finished, the rabbit said "what a charming picture you have painted!"

the goose smiled and said, "i hope my mom likes it when she sees it. do you want to help me keep it safe until i give it to her?"

the rabbit smiled and agreed. together, they hopped off and hid the painting in a very safe place. 

the end.

lily liked to learn new things. she liked to look at books, play with toys, and ask questions. one day, she saw a small black thing on the ground. it had six legs and two feelers. she wanted to learn what it was.

she picked up the thing and held it in her hand. she said, "hello, what are you? are you a bug? do you have a name?" the thing did not answer. it tried to bite lily's finger. lily felt a sharp pain. she dropped the thing and cried.

mama heard lily's cry and came to see what was wrong. she saw the thing on the ground. she said, "lily, that is an ant. ants are not nice to hold. they can hurt you. you should not touch them. you should leave them alone."

lily was sad and sorry. she said, "i did not know, mama. i wanted to learn about the ant. i did not want to hurt it or make it angry. i thought it was a friend."

mama hugged lily and said, "i know, lily. you are curious and smart. but some things are not safe to learn by yourself. you should always ask me or daddy before you touch something you do not know. we can help you learn in a good way."

lily nodded and said, "okay, mama. i will do that. i am sorry for the ant. i hope it is okay." mama said, "it is okay, lily. the ant will find its way back to its home. but you should be careful next time. ants are not nice to play with." lily said, "i understand, mama. i will be careful." mama kissed lily and said, "i love you, lily. you are my good girl." lily said, "i love you too, mama. you are my nice mama."

once upon a time, there was a chubby little bear named benny. benny loved to play outside in the forest with his friends. one day, benny's mom told him that they were going to have a special dinner that night. benny was excited and asked, "what's for dinner, mom?"

his mom replied, "we're going to have hot dogs and marshmallows cooked over the fireplace."

benny was even more excited because he loved hot dogs and marshmallows. he asked, "what else does dinner include?"

his mom smiled and said, "it includes a surprise for you and your friends."

benny and his friends couldn't wait for dinner. when they arrived at benny's house, they saw a big fire in the fireplace. they cooked their hot dogs and marshmallows and had a great time. after dinner, benny's mom brought out a big cake with candles on it. benny was so happy and surprised. he blew out the candles and everyone sang "happy birthday" to him.

benny was so grateful for the special dinner and the surprise. he hugged his mom and said, "thank you, mom. this is the best dinner ever!"

once upon a time, there was a little girl named emily. emily liked to explore and go on adventures. one day, emily was walking in the woods and saw something strange. it was a rag lying on the ground. she picked it up, but suddenly she heard a deep and fierce voice order her to put it back! emily was very fearful and dropped the rag. then she saw a big, huge bear walking towards her! emily was so scared she started to cry. but the bear smiled and said "emily, you were brave and did the right thing by ordering me to put the rag back!" emily was so relieved and smiled back at the bear. the bear then asked her if she wanted to join him on an adventure. emily did not hesitate and was so excited! they spent an entire day exploring and playing together, and emily never forgot about the fearful voice that ordered her to put the rag down.

once upon a time, there was a big alligator. he lived in a pond. he had many friends like fish, frogs, and ducks. they all played together every day.

one day, a crazy bird came to the pond. the bird wanted to play too. the alligator said, "okay, you can play with us." so, they all played together and had a lot of fun.

the next day, the crazy bird told the alligator to enter a new pond. the alligator said, "i will try." so, the alligator, the bird, and all their friends went to the new pond. they played and had even more fun than before. they were all very happy.

tommy was a nosy boy. he wanted to see what was inside his mom's boot. he tiptoed to the closet and opened it ever so slowly. he spotted her red boot and grabbed it. he opened the boot and saw lots of buttons and a zipper so he started pressing the buttons and pulling the zipper. suddenly, a loud noise came up and his mom came running over.

she saw what he was doing and told him in a stern voice that he was not allowed to do that. she said the boot was only for grown-ups and closed it up. she saw the disappointed look in tommy's face and said he will one day understand why he can't always do what he wants. 

the next day, tommy told his friends about the boot and they all had the same thought; if it was only for grown-ups, then it must be special. so they all sneaked around to tommy's house and looked for the boot but they couldn't find it. 

it turns out that his mom had to move the boot because she was mad at tommy for being so nosy. the moral of the story is to always listen to your mom and not be so nosy!

once upon a time there was a little girl. her name was jenny. jenny was three years old and she had hair. every day, she brushed and brushed her hair, but she hated it when her mommy and daddies cut her hair. she thought it looked silly and felt terrible! 

one day, jenny was walking with her mommy. her mommy was talking about getting jenny's hair cut. jenny started to get sad and she said, "mommy, i don't want a haircut! please don't make me get one!"

her mommy said, "jenny, you need a haircut. it will look nice."

jenny refused and shook her head 'no'. but her mommy was determined and said, "jenny, haircut tomorrow. it will be fun." 

jenny didn't think so. she was mad and said, "i hate haircuts! they are stupid!" 

the next day jenny woke up and knew she had to go to the haircut place. she was very sad, but she went. when the barber was done, jenny looked in the mirror and found she looked pretty and the haircut wasn't so bad! she thought to herself, "sometimes haircuts are not so stupid after all!"

jack and jill were best friends. they liked to play together every day. one day they decided to play a game.

jack said, "let's record what we do today".

jill was excited and said, "okay!"

so they went outside to play. first, they played tag. they ran and laughed and had lots of fun. then they looked for something to eat. jack found some celery and they each ate some.

jack said, "this celery is so crunchy! what do you think, jill?"

jill said, "it's yummy and juicy!"

next, they went exploring in the garden. they saw a big, hairy caterpillar. jill was scared, but jack said it was okay. they watched it for a long time.

jack said, "let's record this caterpillar".

so they watched it and recorded it until it went away.

at the end of the day, jack and jill were very happy. they had a great day playing together and recording all the fun things they saw.

once upon a time, there was a chubby rhinoceros. he had a big horn and squishy, chubby feet and he was always happy. he loved to explore the savannah and look for new things to eat. 

one day, he decided to leave the savannah and venture into the dark, swaying forest. he plodded along, looking for something new. but the trees were so tall and dark that he began to feel a little scared. suddenly, he heard a loud noise coming from a bush!

he was so scared that he quickly rushed away. he ran for a long time until he felt safe again. he stopped and looked around, realizing he had arrived at a beautiful meadow. he was so excited! he rolled around in the soft grass, feeling happy again.

he decided to leave the meadow and head back home. he soon reached the savannah and he was so glad to be back. he trotted back to his cozy burrow and snuggled up with a warm, chubby belly. he was so pleased to be home.

once there was a little bird who dreamed of soaring through the sky. every day it watched the birds fly above, and listen to the beautiful music the wind made as it flew by. the bird decided it wanted to soar and make similar music, so it tried its best to climb and flap its wings.

one day, it saw a friendly cat down below. the cat said, â€œif you follow me, i will help you soar!" the bird was so excited, it couldn't believe its luck, and soon enough it was riding the air currents as if it had wings of its own.

the bird felt so free, it could hardly believe what it was doing. as it flew, it made its own music and it reached higher and higher. but then, something bad happened. the bird suddenly flew too close to the sun and got too hot! the heat was too much and the bird started to lose strength.

the bird frantically tried to keep up with the cat, but its wings were tired, and soon enough it started to falter and eventually it fell. the cat looked back but it was too late. the little bird was gone.

the moral of the story is that you should never chase a dream that takes you too far away from what you were meant to do. the bird's dream was wonderful, but if it had not gotten carried away, it would have still been around. so if you have a dream, make sure

one night, jenny was sleeping in her bed. suddenly, the loud alarm started to ring. she jumped up and looked around. it was a bright red alarm! jenny wanted to turn it off, so she tried her best to listen. but no matter what she did, the alarm kept ringing and ringing. 

jenny began to cry. she tried to explain to her mom and dad why the alarm wouldn't turn off. but they were so busy trying to turn it off that they didn't listen to her. 

in the end, jenny's mom and dad had to take the alarm apart. but it was broken and they couldn't get it working again. so the alarm kept ringing and they had no way of making it stop. 

jenny wanted the loud alarm to be quiet, but it just kept ringing and ringing. in the end, jenny had to just go to sleep with the loud alarm ringing in her ears.

lily was a gifted dog. she could do many tricks that other dogs could not. she could sit, roll, shake, and even bow. she loved to show off her skills to her family and friends.

one day, lily went to the park with her owner, sam. there were many other dogs and people there. lily saw a big, fluffy dog with a long tail. she wanted to say hello and play with him. she ran over to him and wagged her tail.

the big dog did not like lily. he growled and bared his teeth. he did not want to share his ball or his space. he snapped at lily and made her yelp.

lily was scared and sad. she ran back to sam and hid behind his legs. sam hugged her and said, "it's ok, lily. you are a good dog. he is a mean dog. you don't need him. you have me and your other friends."

lily felt better. she looked up and saw a small, spotted dog with a curly tail. he was smiling and wagging his tail. he came over to lily and sam and said, "hi, i'm spot. do you want to play with me? you look like a fun dog."

lily liked spot. she said, "hi, i'm lily. i can do tricks. do you want to see?" she got up and did her best bow. spot clapped his paws and said, "wow, you are a gifted dog. i can't do that. can you teach me?"

lily and spot became friends. they played and learned from each other. they shared their toys and their treats. they had a lot of fun. lily was happy. she had found a new friend who liked her for who she was. she wagged her tail and gave spot a lick. spot licked her back and said, "you are the best gift i ever got."

once upon a time, a young girl lived in a small village with her parents. she was very wise for her age, and already knew so much. but she wanted to learn even more.

one day, the girl asked her father, â€œcan i cut a rod?â€ her father thought for a moment and then said, â€œyes, but you have to be very careful. make sure you are wise when you use the knife.â€

the girl nodded and took out a knife. she carefully cut the rod into pieces, each piece of the same size. when she was finished, her father said, â€œwell done! you did a very good job.â€

the girl smiled proudly and thanked her dad for his guidance. from then on, she was very wise whenever she used a knife. the end.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named mia. mia had a yellow mask she loved to wear. one day, she went to the park to play.

at the park, mia saw a big boy named tom. tom wanted mia's yellow mask. he said, "give me your mask!" mia said, "no, it is mine!" they did not like each other.

tom was mad, so he tried to lift the mask from mia's face. mia cried and ran away. tom kept the yellow mask. mia was very sad and went home without her favorite mask.

ben and mia liked to swim in the big pool at the park. they had fun splashing and kicking in the water. sometimes they played with the other kids, and sometimes they made up their own games.

one day, they saw a new thing in the pool. it was a statue of a fish. it was very big and shiny. it had scales and fins and a tail. it looked like a real fish, but it did not move. ben and mia wondered who put it there and why.

they swam closer to the statue. they wanted to touch it and see how it felt. they thought it would be cold and smooth. but when they reached the statue, they heard a loud noise. it was a siren. it was coming from the park gate. they saw a man running towards them. he was wearing a uniform and a badge. he looked angry.

"stop! don't touch that statue!" he shouted. "it's very expensive! it's a prize for a contest! you're not supposed to swim near it!"

ben and mia were scared. they did not know it was a prize. they did not know it was a contest. they did not know they were doing something bad. they quickly swam away from the statue. they got out of the pool and ran to their mom. she was sitting on a bench with a book. she looked surprised.

"what's wrong, kids?" she asked. "why are you so wet and nervous?"

ben and mia told her what happened. they told her about the statue and the man and the siren. they said they were sorry. they did not mean to cause trouble.

mom hugged them and said it was okay. she said they did not know the rules. she said the man was just doing his job. she said they should be more careful next time. she said they should always ask before they touch something that is not theirs.

ben and mia nodded. they learned their lesson. they decided to play somewhere else. they did not want to swim near the statue anymore. they thought it was too big and shiny and scary. they liked the pool better when it was just water and fun.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim loved to drink juice. he would drink it every day, with his breakfast and lunch. one day, tim's big brother wanted to tease him. he told tim that the juice he was drinking was dangerous and would make him sick. tim got scared and didn't want to drink his juice anymore. 

but then, tim's mom came into the room and saw what was happening. she explained to tim that his brother was just teasing him and that the juice was actually very good for him. tim felt better and drank his juice happily. 

from that day on, tim knew that his brother liked to tease him sometimes, but he also knew that he could always ask his mom if he wasn't sure about something. and he continued to drink his juice every day, knowing that it was good for him and not dangerous at all. the end.

once upon a time, there was a farmer. he was not a happy farmer. some people said he was ugly. he did not care. he only wanted his farm to be nice.

one day, it was very hot. the sun was so bright. the farmer's plants were not happy. they needed water. the farmer was sad. he did not want his plants to be dry.

the farmer thought hard. he had an idea! he would ask his friends for help. they all came with buckets of water. they watered the dry plants. the plants started to dance! the farmer was happy. he thanked his friends. the ugly farmer's farm was nice again.

once upon a time, there was a heavy lemon sitting on a table. it was bright and round. suddenly, a strong wind blew in the window and knocked the lemon onto the floor. the lemon rolled across the room very fast.

the little boy in the house saw the lemon and he ran to pick it up. he was so happy to see the lemon. he wanted to keep the lemon safe, so he closed the window. with the window closed, the wind couldn't make the lemon roll anymore.

the little boy was so pleased that he decided to eat the lemon. it was a heavy lemon, so it was full of juice. every time the boy took a bite, his face would scrunch up. the lemon was so sour! the boy and the lemon had a lot of fun together.

once upon a time, there was a dog named spot. spot was an obedient dog. he always did what his owner, tim, told him to do. tim and spot were best friends.

one day, tim's friend, jane, asked if she could lend spot for a day. tim said yes. jane wanted spot to play with her cat, fluffy. tim told spot to be a good dog and listen to jane.

spot went to jane's house and played with fluffy. but fluffy did not like spot. fluffy was not a nice cat. they fought and fought, and spot got hurt. spot was sad and wanted to go home.

in the end, tim came to get spot. they went home, but spot was still hurt. tim was sad too. they were not happy friends anymore.

once upon a time, there was a little chair. it was in a room with many other chairs. but this chair was unknown. no one knew where it came from. it was sad because it wanted a friend.

one day, a little girl named lily came into the room. she saw the unknown chair and thought it looked nice. she sat on it and felt happy. the chair felt happy too, because it finally had a friend.

lily played with the chair every day. one day, she accidentally spilled juice on the chair. she felt bad and said, "i'm sorry, chair. please forgive me." the chair forgave her, and they stayed friends forever.

once there was a small puppy. he was happy and full of life. he wanted to explore the world around him. he looked around and he discovered a hidden heel. he grabbed the heel and started to grow. he grew bigger and bigger. soon he was the biggest puppy in the neighbourhood. everyone started to love him. he was so big he could even reach the heel on the top shelf. he happily chewed on it. everyone was so proud of him. he had grown so big! he was the best puppy ever.

once upon a time, there lived a spoiled 3 year old boy named paul. every day he liked to stand outside and watch the planes fly in the sky. one day, he heard a loud noise coming from the sky and he looked up. he saw a big, white plane flying by. he was so excited, he started clapping his hands and shouting.

a lady walking by heard his noise and came to talk to him. she asked him why he was so excited. paul told her, "i heard a loud noise, and i saw a plane!" 

the lady laughed and said that she was surprised he could hear the plane from so far away. paul said, "i'm very special. i have great hearing!" 

the lady smiled, put her hand on paul's shoulder, and said, "that's very true. you are a very special little boy." paul smiled, proud of himself for hearing the plane. and, from that day on, he would tell everybody about how he heard the plane!

once upon a time, there was a happy little girl called lucy. every tuesday, lucy would do something very exciting - she would go to the park with her mom and dad.

it was always great fun. on tuesdays, they would run around and play. they ran fast around the slides and swings, laughing and giggling. it was so much fun.

one day, lucy and her family went to the park and had an extra special day. after running around, they went to the pond nearby to go for a swim. lucy was so happy to splash around in the water. it was so much fun.

at last, it was time to go home. but before they left, they all hugged each other, and thanked each other for the best tuesday ever. they raced home as fast as they could, because they were all so excited.

and that was how every tuesday went. lucy, mom, and dad always made sure that it was special and full of lots of fun.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the mud and dirt. one day, she went outside and got her jacket all dirty. it was filthy!

her mom saw her jacket and said, "lily, your jacket is filthy! you need to wipe it off before you come inside."

lily didn't want to wipe off her jacket. she wanted to go inside and play. so she just ignored her mom and went inside with her filthy jacket.

later that night, lily got sick because of all the dirt on her jacket. her mom had to take her to the doctor. the doctor said lily got sick because she didn't wipe off her jacket. 

the moral of the story is that it's important to listen to your parents and take care of your things. if you don't, bad things can happen.

mia and her mommy were walking to church on a sunny sunday morning. mia looked around and saw the beautiful flowers, the dogs barking in the distance and the birds chirping. she felt so happy and excited to go to church!

when they arrived, mia looked up at the tall, white building and said: "mommy, what do we do at church?". "we pray to god there," her mother answered with a smile.

mia stepped inside the church and was amazed by the colorful stained-glass windows, the big wooden cross and the kind faces of the people praying. as her mom knelt down, mia saw something disgusting in the corner: a big spider web with little spiders crawling all over it!

mia was scared, so she ran to her mom and said: "mommy! i don't like it here, there's something disgusting in the corner!" but her mommy just hugged her tight and said: "it's ok my love, god will protect us".

as she said this, mia and her mommy both closed their eyes, put their hands together and began to pray. mia felt safe, and knew that nothing bad would happen if god was with them.

once upon a time there was a brave knight. he had a shiny sword and a shield. he was going on an adventure to a far away kingdom. as he got closer to the castle, he could feel danger in the air. he took a deep breath and shrugged.

the knight bravely marched towards the castle gates. he saw lots of guards standing in the way, but he was not afraid. he held his sword and shouted for everyone to move out of the way. 

suddenly a dangerous man charged at the knight. the knight was ready and raised his sword to defend himself, but the man was too fast. just when the man was about to hurt the knight, a gigantic lion leaped in and scared him away. 

the knight was safe. he sighed in relief and the brave knight shrugged with a smile, and continued on his journey.

once upon a time there were two friends, jack and jill. they were very good friends and always liked to play together. one day, jack found a special zip. he was so excited about it that he forgot to tell jill about it. 

still, jack wanted to keep it a secret. but one day when jill saw jack playing with it, she became very curious and asked jack to let her play with it too. 

jack felt guilty, so he decided to talk to jill. he told her all about the zip and how he had found it. then, he said that if they were going to share it, they should both take turns playing with it. 

jill was very pleased with jack's honest words and they happily shared the zip between them, taking turns playing with it. from then on, they both knew how important it was to be honest, even with their very best friends.

once upon a time, there were two little kids: jack and jill. jack was bored one day and wanted to find something fun to do. he saw a box full of masks and told jill, "let's choose a mask to wear!"

jill thought for a moment and then chose the hairy mask. when jack asked her why she choose the hairy mask, she replied, "it looks like the most fun mask!" 

once they put on the masks, they started playing. jack noticed that the more they played, the more the mask started to tighten around jill's head. he tried to help her remove it, but he couldn't. the hairy mask had become too tight and jill started to cry.

jack and jill quickly learned a hard lesson: never choose something just because it looks fun. in the end, the only thing they got was sadness.

once upon a time, there was a cute little bunny. the bunny wanted to go west to see the sunset. so, the bunny started hopping and hopping until it reached the west. the bunny was so happy to see the beautiful sunset. 

as the bunny was watching the sunset, it saw a carrot that was too far away. the bunny tried to reach it but it was too far. the bunny kept trying and trying until it finally reached the carrot. the bunny was so happy to have the carrot and it ate it all up. 

after eating the carrot, the bunny felt tired and decided to rest. the bunny found a cozy spot to sleep and dreamt about all the adventures it had that day. when the bunny woke up, it realized it was getting dark and decided to go back home. so, the bunny hopped and hopped until it reached its cozy burrow. the end.

claire was a little girl and she had a rare car. she just loved that car and she always kept it safe. 

one day, she was playing with the car in the garden when her mum said, â€œclaire, donâ€™t forget to keep your car safe!â€

claire said, â€œi always keep it safe, mum.â€

mum smiled and said, â€œthatâ€™s good! your car is very rare and special so you must take extra care of it.â€

claire gave her mum a big hug and promised to keep the car safe. from that day onwards, she made sure she held onto her car when she was out and about. she did her best to keep it safe and she never let it out of her sight.

once upon a time, there was a furry little rabbit. the rabbit was very hungry and sad, so it started to pray. it prayed and prayed, begging for food.

suddenly, a big hand reached down from the sky! the hand was holding a big carrots and some lettuce. the rabbit was so happy. it ate the food and was no longer sad. 

the rabbit thanked the big hand for the food. then it jumped, hopped and twirled all around the garden in gratitude. the rabbit thanked the big hand in heaven for sending it such a yummy meal. 

the moral of the story is that when we pray, good things can happen!

once upon a time there was a very big and enormous plane. the plane was so big it could barely fit in the park. everywhere it went, it could be seen in the sky. 

one day, the plane decided to come down and landed in the park. all the children cheered when they saw the enormous plane. they ran up and excitedly touched the plane. 

the pilot of the plane said â€œoh my, what a surprise! follow me and i'll show you around the plane.â€ the children happily followed the pilot around the huge plane. 

inside, the children saw how big the plane was. they ran around and climbed up the steps. they were surprised to see how many buttons and switches there were. 

after they explored the plane, the pilot flew it back up into the sky. they waved goodbye and said they would never forget their enormous day at the park in the plane. 

the end.

once upon a time there was a monkey named jim. jim was a mischievous monkey who loved to explore. one day jim saw a bowl of fruit in his tree. he eagerly reached for the bowl with his opposable thumbs.

jim tasted a banana and found it to be sweet and delicious. he ate the banana and was about to reach for another one when suddenly he saw a harsh face. standing in the tree was a man with a stern look on his face.

the man said, "i brought you these fruits to feed. never take food without permission!" jim shivered with fear.

little jim quickly bowed his head in apology and said, "i'm so sorry, i didn't mean it."

the man seemed to have softened his harsh face a bit and said, "it's okay jim. just remember to ask permission before taking food."

jim nodded, thankful to have been let off so lightly. from then on, whenever jim found food he would always remember to ask permission first.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside with her friends, but she was always very restless. one day, her mom told her to take a nap so she could rest. lily didn't want to nap, but her mom said she had to.

lily closed her eyes and tried to sleep, but she couldn't stop thinking about playing. suddenly, she heard a voice saying, "lily, if you don't rest, you won't have any energy to play later." it was her dad! he always knew what to say to make her feel better.

lily realized her dad was right, so she closed her eyes and fell asleep. when she woke up, she felt better and had more energy to play with her friends. she was happy she listened to her dad and rested. her dad smiled and said, "lily, you paid attention to what i said and now you feel better. that's a good thing to do." and lily smiled back, knowing she had learned an important lesson.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and color. one day, she was drawing a picture of a flower with her friend, tom. tom said, "your flower is so pretty, but it needs more colors."

lily said, "what colors should i add?"

tom said, "you should add some pink and yellow. that will make it more colorful."

lily added the pink and yellow and her flower looked so stylish. she was happy that tom helped her make her picture better.

jill had a birdcage with a very smart bird. she wanted to teach the bird how to do tricks. she tried to show the bird how to do lots of things, but nothing seemed to work.

jill was getting a bit frustrated, because she couldn't make the bird understand what she wanted it to do. then one day, she had an idea. she got some treats and used them to help the bird learn.

using the treats, jill showed the bird what it had to do when she said a command. after lots and lots of practice, the smart bird started to understand and do its tricks. jill was so happy that she had finally succeeded. 

the bird was happy too, because it could now do lots of cool things and it was getting treats every time. now jill and the bird have lots of fun together!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the park to play with her friends. while she was playing, she saw a puppy. the puppy was very cute and lily wanted to meet him. 

lily went to the puppy and said hello. the puppy was very friendly and they became friends. they played together until the sunset. the sunset was very pretty and lily loved the colors in the sky. 

after the sunset, lily went home. she was very happy because she had a fun day with her friends and she made a new friend, the puppy. lily's heart was open and she felt grateful for the beautiful sunset she saw.

once upon a time, there was a noisy party in the forest. the animals were dancing and singing, but a little rabbit named benny didn't like the loud music. he went to his burrow and found a book with a page missing. benny wanted to find the missing page, so he asked his friends for help.

the squirrel, the bird, and the fox looked everywhere, but they couldn't find the missing page. suddenly, a big bear appeared and wanted to join the party. the animals were scared and didn't know what to do. benny had an idea. he surrendered the missing page to the bear and asked him to dance with them instead of scaring them.

the bear was happy and danced with the animals until the party was over. benny learned that sometimes it's better to surrender and make friends instead of being scared and alone. from that day on, the animals had a new friend and the forest was a happier place. the end.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to the park with her mom. she was playing on the swings when she saw a person she didn't know. the person was sitting on a bench, looking sad.

lily went over to the person and said, "hi! are you okay?" the person looked up and smiled. "no, i'm not okay," the person said. "i lost my phone and i don't know what to do."

lily realized she could help. "don't worry," she said.
