"i can help you find your phone." they looked all around the bench and the person's bag, but the phone was nowhere to be found. then, lily had an idea. "let's go ask the park ranger if they found an unknown phone," she said. they went to the ranger's station and, sure enough, the phone was there! the person was so happy and thanked lily for her help. from that day on, they became friends and would often meet at the park to play together.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. they have a hoop. the hoop is huge. it is red and blue.

anna and ben take turns with the hoop. they roll it on the grass. they jump inside it. they laugh and have fun.

but then, a big boy comes. he wants the hoop. he says, "give me the hoop. it is mine." he tries to grab it from anna.

anna and ben are scared. they say, "no, it is ours. we share it. you can play with us, but you have to be nice."

the big boy is angry. he pushes anna and ben. he takes the hoop. he runs away.

anna and ben are sad. they cry. they want their hoop back.

a lady sees them. she is the big boy's mom. she says, "what is wrong? why are you crying?"

anna and ben tell her what happened. they point to the big boy. he is still playing with the hoop.

the lady is sorry. she says, "that is not nice. he should not take your hoop. he should share. i will talk to him."

she goes to the big boy. she says, "give the hoop back to anna and ben. they were playing with it first. you have to share. you have to say sorry."

the big boy is ashamed. he knows he was wrong. he gives the hoop back to anna and ben. he says, "sorry. i was mean. can i play with you?"

anna and ben are happy. they say, "yes, you can. but you have to be nice. we share the hoop. we can all have fun."

they play with the hoop together. they roll it, jump inside it, and laugh. they are friends. the lady smiles. she is proud.

lila and ben were having lunch with their mom. mom made salad for them. she put lettuce, tomato, cheese and dressing in a big bowl. she gave lila and ben each a plate and a fork.

"here you go, kids. eat your salad. it's good for you," mom said.

lila looked at her salad. she did not like salad. she thought it was dull and boring. she wanted something else. she pushed her plate away.

"i don't want salad, mom. i want pizza," lila said.

ben looked at his salad. he liked salad. he thought it was fresh and tasty. he wanted more. he picked up his fork and started eating.

"i want salad, mom. i like salad," ben said.

mom smiled at ben. she was happy that he liked salad. she gave him more salad from the bowl.

"good for you, ben. i'm glad you like salad. you are a good eater," mom said.

she looked at lila. she was sad that she did not like salad. she wanted her to try it.

"lila, please try your salad. it's not dull. it's yummy. you might like it if you taste it," mom said.

lila shook her head. she did not want to try it. she wanted pizza.

"no, mom. i don't like salad. i want pizza," lila said.

mom sighed. she did not know what to do. she wanted lila to eat something healthy. she did not have pizza.

"lila, i don't have pizza. i have salad. salad is good for you. it has vitamins and minerals. it makes you strong and smart. please try it," mom said.

lila looked at her mom. she saw that her mom was sad. she did not want to make her mom sad. she loved her mom. she decided to try her salad.

"okay, mom. i will try it. but only a little bit," lila said.

she picked up her fork and took a small bite of her salad. she chewed it slowly. she was surprised. it was not dull. it was crunchy and cheesy and sweet. she liked it.

"mom, this salad is good. i like it. can i have more?" lila said.

mom smiled at lila. she was happy that she liked salad. she gave her more salad from the bowl.

"of course, lila. i'm happy you like salad. you are a good eater, too," mom said.

lila and ben ate their salad. they finished their plates. they were full and happy.

"thank you, mom, for the salad. it was yummy," lila and ben said.

"you're welcome, kids. i love you," mom said.

they hugged their mom. they had a good lunch. they liked salad.

once upon a time, there were two fat cats. they were best friends. they loved to play and eat together. one day, they found a big ball of yarn. they both wanted to play with it.

one cat said, "let's separate the yarn in two parts, so we can both play." but the other cat did not want to share. he wanted to keep the whole yarn for himself. so, they began to fight over the yarn.

while they were fighting, a dog came. the dog saw the fat cats and the yarn. the dog took the yarn away from the cats. the cats were sad because they lost their yarn.

the cats learned that they should share and not fight. if they had shared the yarn, they could still play with it. now, they had nothing to play with, and they were not happy. the moral of the story is to share and not be greedy.

tom and lily were playing in the park. they saw a big slide with a triangle on top. tom wanted to go on the slide, but lily was scared.

"come on, lily, it's fun!" tom said. "i dare you to go on the slide with me."

"no, tom, it's too high and too fast. i don't want to go on the slide. it looks dead." lily said. she pointed to the triangle. "see, it has no eyes or mouth or nose. it can't see us or talk to us or smell us. it's dead."

tom laughed. "that's silly, lily. it's not dead. it's just a shape. a triangle is a shape with three sides and three corners. like this." he drew a triangle in the air with his finger. "it can't be alive or dead. it's just a thing."

lily looked at the triangle again. she saw that it had three sides and three corners, like tom said. she thought maybe it was not so scary after all. she took tom's hand and said, "okay, tom, i'll go on the slide with you. but you have to hold my hand and go slow."

tom smiled and said, "okay, lily, i'll hold your hand and go slow. but you have to say 'weee' when we go down."

lily nodded and said, "okay, tom, i'll say 'weee' when we go down."

they climbed up the stairs and sat on the slide. they held hands and looked at the triangle. they said, "one, two, three, weee!" and slid down the slide. they felt the wind in their hair and the sun on their faces. they laughed and had fun. they were not scared of the triangle anymore. they liked the slide. they liked the park. they liked each other.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. she was so excited for the morning. she wanted to see the sun and all the birds. but when the morning came, it was so miserable.

the sky was grey, and the air felt heavy. the little girl felt sad â€“ it wasnâ€™t the morning she wanted. she felt an urge to go outside and find something that was fun.

the little girl decided to pick flowers. she found some pretty daisies and pink roses! she put them in a bunch together and showed them to her mom.

her mom smiled and said she loved the flowers. suddenly, the little girl didnâ€™t feel so miserable anymore. she knew that it was okay to feel urges, and that sometimes the best things to do are the most fun.

once upon a time, a little girl was walking in the woods. suddenly, she heard a lot of water coming. she looked around and saw a flood! the flood was so big that she was scared. she felt weak and started to cry.

but then a friendly bear came and told her not to be scared. he said, "let's walk together away from the flood." the girl felt better and held the bear's hand. they walked and walked until they got to safety.

the little girl and the bear were both so happy. they had beaten the flood and were safe. then they said goodbye and the little girl had the best adventure ever.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to drink juice from her cup every day. one day, she went to play in the park and forgot her cup at home. she was sad because she wanted to drink juice. 

then, a kind lady saw lily and asked her what was wrong. lily told her about her cup. the lady was grateful to help lily. she went to her car and brought a cup for lily. lily was happy and said, "thank you for carrying the cup for me!" 

lily drank her juice and played happily in the park. she learned that sometimes we forget things, but kind people can help us. she was grateful for the lady's help and carried her new cup home with her. the end.

once upon a time, there was a mysterious shark in the sea. the shark was big and scary. all the fish were afraid of the shark.

one day, a small fish named tim saw the shark. tim was not afraid. he thought the shark was interesting. he wanted to talk to the shark. so, tim swam up to the shark and said, "hi, shark! can i follow you?"

the shark looked at tim and said, "yes, you can follow me. but be careful, little fish." so tim followed the shark. they swam together in the sea.

as they swam, a big wave came and took tim away. the shark tried to help tim, but he was too late. tim was gone. the shark was sad. the other fish never followed the shark again.

once there was a funny bear and a funny bunny who were best friends. every day, they played together in the big, green field.

one day, the bear said to his bunny friend, "let's separate and try to find each other again!" so the bear ran one way and the bunny ran the other way. 

the bear couldn't find the bunny, but he heard the ambulance coming. he thought, "oh no! i hope the bunny is ok!" he had a bad feeling. 

the ambulance stopped in front of the bunny's house. the bear came over to see if his friend was ok. he saw the bunny waving his little hands, and he was full of joy. the bunny was fine! 

the bear and bunny hugged. they were so happy to be together again! they learned that day that there's nothing more important than friendship.

once upon a time there was a farmer named tom. tom lived on a big farm with lots of animals. one day he was feeling grumpy and decided to take a walk. as he was walking through the fields and past the animals, he noticed something strange. there was a top spinning on the ground. he stopped to pick it up and as soon as he touched it, a voice said "let's play together!"

he looked around but he couldn't see who had spoken. the voice said "i'm up here! i'm the crow! would you like to play?" tom thought for a minute and then he invited the crow to play the top. the crow was very excited and hopped up and down.

tom and the crow played together for quite a while. when the sun went down and it was time for tom to go back to the farm, the crow said "thank you for spending time with me, tom. you showed the importance of kindness and friendship!"

tom smiled and thought to himself that sometimes it's good to take a break and invite new people into your life. this experience taught him that no matter how grumpy you may feel, a little kindness goes a long way.

once upon a time, there lived three friends; a bee, a butterfly, and a bird. they were all very good friends.

they decided to go on an adventure one day. they flew over the trees and saw a blue branch.

"let's go explore it!" said the butterfly.

the three friends flew over the blue branch and decided to use it as a supply to make a great fort.

the bee was very talented and worked hard to build the fort. it was soon completed. the butterfly said, "it looks fabulous!"

the bird was so excited and started chirping, "i love it! it's the best fort ever!"

the three friends laughed and hugged each other. they were so happy and had lots of fun in their new fort. 

their adventure turned out to be a day to remember!

once upon a time, there was a bunny named benny. he had soft fur and loved to hop around in the meadow. one day, benny saw his friend, a squirrel named sammy, sitting on a tree branch looking sad. benny asked, "what's wrong, sammy?"

sammy replied, "i lost my acorn. it was my favorite one." benny felt thoughtful and said, "don't worry, sammy. i'll help you find it." so, benny hopped around the meadow searching for sammy's acorn.

after a while, benny found the acorn and brought it back to sammy. sammy was so happy and said, "thank you, benny! you're such a good friend." benny felt proud and replied, "i'm happy to help. that's what friends are for." from that day on, benny and sammy were even better friends and would hop and play together in the meadow every day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and run around in the park. one day, she saw her friend timmy and ran up to him.

"hi timmy! what's new?" asked lily.

timmy looked sad and said, "i lost my toy car. i hope i can find it."

lily wanted to help her friend, so she said, "don't worry timmy, i'll help you look for it. we can search the whole park together!"

they looked everywhere, under the trees and on the swings, but they couldn't find the car. timmy started to cry, but lily wasn't careless. she gave him a hug and said, "don't worry timmy, we'll find your car soon. i promise."

just then, they heard some good news. a kind lady had found the car and was bringing it to the park. timmy was so happy and gave lily a big hug. "thank you for helping me, lily. you're the best friend ever!"

once upon a time there was a bear named patrick. patrick loved the zoo. he would go there every day and he was always very excited.

one day, he was walking through the zoo and he got very tired. he struggled to keep going and he started to feel sleepy. 

just then, he saw a group of monkeys playing in the trees and he smiled. he called out: "hello little monkeys!"

the monkeys heard him and came over. they jumped onto his back and said, "let's play!" 

patrick was so happy that he forgot he was tired. he laughed and struggled to keep the monkeys on his back. 

the monkeys laughed and jumped around, and patrick could feel his energy coming back. at the end of the day, all their energy was gone and they lay down on the grass. 

patrick was still happy, because he knew his zoo was a magical place. he smiled and closed his eyes, knowing his struggles that day had been worth it.

anna loved flowers. she liked to smell them, touch them, and look at their colors. she was very enthusiastic about flowers. she wanted to learn more about them.

one day, she saw a bee on a yellow flower. she wondered what the bee was doing. she thought the bee was cute and fuzzy. she wanted to hold the bee and make friends with it.

she reached out her hand and gently touched the bee. but the bee did not like that. the bee was scared and angry. the bee stung anna's finger. it hurt a lot. anna cried out loud.

her mom heard her cry and ran to her. she saw the bee and the red spot on anna's finger. she hugged anna and said, "i'm sorry, honey. the bee was just trying to protect itself. you should not hold bees. they can sting you and make you hurt. bees are good for flowers, but not for holding."

anna nodded and sniffled. she learned a new thing about bees. she still loved flowers, but she decided to leave the bees alone. she held her mom's hand and went inside to get some ice for her finger. she felt better soon. she was still enthusiastic about flowers, but more careful about bees.

tim and mia were best friends. they liked to play in the park every day. they had a lot of fun on the slide, the seesaw and the swing. the swing was their favorite. they would take turns to push each other and go higher and higher.

one day, a big boy came to the park. he was mean and rude. he wanted to use the swing, but tim and mia were on it. he pushed them off and took the swing for himself. he laughed at them and called them names. he said they were ignorant and stupid.

tim and mia were sad and angry. they did not like the big boy. they wanted to have the swing back. they did not know what to do. they sat on a bench and watched the big boy swing. he looked happy and proud.

mia had an idea. she whispered to tim: "let's pray to god. maybe he can help us. maybe he can make the big boy go away or be nice to us."

tim nodded. he liked mia's idea. he closed his eyes and folded his hands. he prayed to god in his heart. he said: "dear god, please help us. we want to play on the swing. the big boy is mean and rude. he took our swing and hurt us. please make him go away or be nice to us. thank you, god. amen."

mia did the same. she prayed to god in her heart. she said: "dear god, please help us. we want to play on the swing. the big boy is mean and rude. he took our swing and hurt us. please make him go away or be nice to us. thank you, god. amen."

they opened their eyes and looked at the swing. the big boy was still on it. he was still laughing and calling them names. he did not care about their prayers. he did not care about god.

tim and mia felt sad and hopeless. they did not understand why god did not help them. they did not understand why the big boy was so mean and rude. they did not understand why he was so ignorant and stupid. they wished they could have the swing back. they wished they could have fun again. they wished they could be happy again.

sara and ben were twins who liked to play with their toys. one day, they found a bottle of perfume in their mom's room. it smelled nice and had a pretty picture on it. they decided to spray some on their stuffed animals.

"look, ben, now our animals smell like flowers!" sara said.

"let me try, sara, let me try!" ben said. he took the bottle and sprayed some on his teddy bear. but he sprayed too much and the perfume got in his eyes. he started to cry.

"ben, are you okay?" sara asked. she felt sorry for her brother. she ran to get a wet cloth and wiped his eyes gently.

"i'm sorry, sara, i was silly. i sprayed too much perfume and it hurt my eyes." ben said.

"it's okay, ben, i forgive you. but we should not play with mom's perfume. it is not for us. it is for mom." sara said.

they hugged and put the bottle back in mom's room. then they went to the kitchen to feed their brown dog, spot. he was hungry and happy to see them. they gave him some kibble and water and petted him.

"spot is a good dog. he loves us and we love him." ben said.

"yes, he is. and we should be good to him and to each other. that is what mom and dad teach us." sara said.

they smiled and played with spot. they learned that perfume is not a toy and that they should be careful and kind.

lily and ben were playing pirates in the backyard. they had a big box for a ship, a stick for a sword, and a hat for a captain. they also had a tape to measure things, and a hook to catch treasure.

"arrr, matey, let's measure how big our ship is!" ben said, holding the tape. "maybe we can find a bigger one to steal!"

"okay, captain!" lily said, and helped him stretch the tape along the box. "it's very big, but not as big as the real ships in the water."

"then we need more treasure to make it bigger!" ben said, and grabbed the hook. "look, there's a shiny thing over there, maybe it's gold!"

he ran to the shiny thing, which was a metal can. he tried to hook it, but it was too heavy. he pulled harder, and the can rolled towards him. it hit his foot, and he cried out in pain.

"ow, ow, ow!" ben shouted, dropping the hook and the tape. "that's not gold, that's a mean can!"

lily ran to him, and saw his foot was bleeding. she was scared, and hugged him.

"ben, are you okay? do you need a band-aid?" she asked, wiping his tears.

"i think so," ben said, sniffling. "that can hurt me a lot."

"let's go to mom, she can make you feel better," lily said, and helped him walk to the house. "she can measure your foot, and put a band-aid on it. then you'll be safe and happy again."

"okay," ben said, and smiled a little. "but next time, let's not play with hooks and cans. let's play with something nicer, like dolls or cars."

"okay," lily said, and nodded. "but we can still be pirates, right?"

"right," ben said, and they both laughed. "we can be pirates, but nice pirates."

once there was a fat kid who liked to do lots of fun things. he ran around in the park and played lots of games. one day, he even built a sandcastle.

the kid did lots of other fun things too, like eating ice cream and going for a swim. but his favorite thing to do was riding his bike. he would ride it around his neighborhood every day.

one day, the fat kid met a friend who also liked to ride bikes. the two kids had lots of fun together, riding their bikes to the playground and then to the ice cream shop.

the fat kid and his friend did so many fun things together. soon, the whole neighborhood knew about them and called the fat kid and his friend the bike riders.

they were the best of friends and would do lots of fun things together. whenever they were out riding their bikes, they would always have a great time.

once upon a time, there was a brave girl called donna. she was only three, but she was very brave. she had to fight a big thing that was coming from the east.

donna's mom said to her, "donna, you need to fight this big thing that is coming from the east." donna said "yes, mom."

so donna got ready to fight. she was so brave and small. she faced the thing from the east and she fought hard with all her strength. the thing from the east got scared and it ran away!

donna was so happy. she said to her mom, "mom, i fought hard and i won!" her mom said, "you were so brave, donna. i am so proud of you!"

donna smiled. she knew she had fought hard and won.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her long hair and make it into a loop. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. while playing with her friends, lily didn't behave very well. she was running around and not listening to her mom. 

her mom reminded her to behave and be a good girl. lily listened and started playing nicely with her friends. she even showed them how to make a long loop with her hair. they all laughed and had fun together. 

after playing for a while, lily and her friends went to get ice cream. lily remembered to say please and thank you to the ice cream man. her mom was proud of her for behaving so well. they all enjoyed their ice cream and went home happy. from that day on, lily always tried to behave and be a good girl.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and look up at the big white clouds in the sky. one day, she saw a big, dark cloud coming towards her house. she was scared and ran inside to tell her mom.

her mom told her not to worry and to kneel down with her to pray for safety. lily didn't understand why they had to kneel, but she did it anyway. as they prayed, the storm outside got worse and worse. the wind was blowing hard and the rain was coming down in sheets.

suddenly, there was a loud noise and a tree fell onto their house. lily and her mom were safe, but their house was damaged. they were sad, but they were also grateful that they were okay. later that day, their neighbors brought them some sweet cookies to make them feel better. even though they had a scary experience, they knew they were lucky to have kind friends and family.

one day, a little boy named tim went to play at the park. he saw a big structure to climb on. it had slides and swings. tim was excited to play on it. he looked around and saw that it was available. no other kids were playing on it.

as tim started to climb, he saw a small bird on the structure. the bird said, "please don't climb on my home." tim wanted to play, but he tried to resist. he didn't want to hurt the bird's home.

tim said, "okay, i won't climb on your home." the bird was happy and thanked tim. then, the bird flew away to find a new place to live. now, tim could play on the structure without worrying about the bird. he had lots of fun at the park that day.

ben and lily love to watch the parade. they see big cars, loud drums, and funny clowns. they wave and cheer with their mom and dad. ben has a red balloon that he got from a nice lady. lily has a yellow hat that she found on the ground.

"look, lily, a lion!" ben says, pointing to a big cage on a truck. the lion has a wild mane and sharp teeth. he roars and shakes his head.

"wow, he is scary!" lily says, hiding behind her hat. "i don't like him."

"don't be afraid, lily. he can't get out. he is just playing," ben says, trying to be brave.

but then, something bad happens. the truck hits a bump and the cage door opens. the lion jumps out and runs into the crowd. people scream and run away. the parade stops and the police come.

ben and lily are very scared. they hold their mom and dad's hands. they see the lion running towards them.

"help!" ben cries.

"ben, give me your balloon!" lily says.

"why?" ben asks.

"just do it!" lily says.

ben gives lily his balloon. lily throws it at the lion. the balloon pops and makes a loud noise. the lion is surprised and stops. he looks at the balloon and sniffs it. he thinks it is a toy. he plays with it and forgets about the people.

the police catch the lion and put him back in the cage. they say sorry to everyone and thank lily for her quick thinking.

ben and lily are happy and proud. they hug each other and their mom and dad.

"that was a wild parade!" ben says.

"yes, it was. but you were very brave, ben. and you were very smart, lily. you saved the day!" their mom says.

they smile and go home. they still have their balloon and hat. they decide to keep them as souvenirs of their wild parade.

once upon a time there was a baby. she was so small and cute. she liked to crawl around, exploring the world.

one day the baby was crawling around and she saw something so exciting. it was a kite, sailing through the sky. the kite was so colorful, with red and blue stripes.

she wanted to play with the kite, so she started to crawl faster. but the wind kept blowing the kite away, and the baby couldn't catch up.

the baby was sad, so she lay down and cried. then she heard a voice.

"don't worry," said the voice. "i can help you catch the kite."

the baby looked around and saw a big person. it was a friendly man. he showed the baby how to use her hands to catch the wind. together, they were able to catch the kite.

the baby was so happy. she thanked the man and they laughed and played with the kite in the wind.

the end.

ben and mia are friends who like to play on the farm. they like to run, jump and hide in the hay. they also like to feed the animals and pet them.

one day, they see a new animal on the farm. it is a big, white horse with a long, shiny mane. ben and mia think the horse is very pretty and want to get closer.

"hello, horse!" ben says. "can we feed you some hay?"

the horse nods and comes to the fence. ben and mia give him some hay from a bucket. the horse eats the hay and nuzzles their hands.

"wow, he likes us!" mia says. "can we pet him?"

the horse nods again and lets them stroke his fur. ben and mia are very happy and giggle.

but there is another animal on the farm who is not happy. it is a small, brown donkey who lives in the same barn as the horse. the donkey is jealous of the horse. he thinks the horse gets more hay, more attention and more love than him.

the donkey decides to do something mean. he sneaks behind the horse and kicks him hard in the leg. the horse neighs in pain and runs away from the fence.

"hey, stop that!" ben shouts at the donkey. "that was not nice!"

the donkey does not listen. he kicks the fence and tries to get to ben and mia. he wants to scare them away.

but ben and mia are not scared. they are brave. they stand still and look at the donkey. they make their eyes big and their voices loud.

"freeze, donkey!" mia says. "you are being bad!"

the donkey is surprised. he stops kicking and looks at ben and mia. he sees that they are not afraid of him. he feels ashamed.

"i'm sorry, horse," the donkey says. "i'm sorry, ben and mia. i was jealous of the horse. i wanted you to play with me too."

ben and mia feel sorry for the donkey. they understand that he was lonely and sad.

"it's okay, donkey," ben says. "we can play with you too. we have enough hay and love for both of you."

the donkey smiles and nods. he comes to the fence and lets ben and mia feed him some hay and pet him. he feels happy.

the horse comes back to the fence and sees the donkey. he is not angry. he is glad that the donkey is sorry and has new friends.

"hello, donkey," the horse says. "can we be friends?"

the donkey nods and says, "yes, horse. we can be friends."

ben and mia smile and clap. they are happy that the horse and the donkey are friends. they hug them both and say, "we love you, horse and donkey. you are both very pretty and nice."

one day, a little boy named tom was playing in his garden. he saw something yellow out of the corner of his eye. he ran to see what it was and he saw it was a wallet! the wallet was yellow and had a smiley face on it.

tom was so happy to find the wallet, he wanted to show it to his mom. he ran inside the house and showed his mom the wallet. his mom laughed and said it must be a joke. 

tom didn't understand what his mom meant, so he decided to find out. he asked his neighbors if they knew who the wallet belonged to. everyone said they did not know, so tom decided to keep it.

tom used the wallet to store his lunch money. every day he would get a few coins out of it and enjoy his lunch in the garden. everyone around him was amazed at how he found such a cool wallet.

tom was glad he found the yellow wallet. it made him laugh every day, so he knew it was a good joke!

once upon a time there was a friendly little girl named lucy. everywhere she went people always said, "what a friendly little girl!" one day, she went for a walk in the park and she saw a big tree. below the tree was a comb. she thought to herself, "i will pick up the comb and bring it home!" 

lucy went up to the comb and picked it up. suddenly, she heard a noise and saw a friendly old man. he said to her, "that's my comb! i lost it when i was combing my hair."

lucy felt embarrassed and said, "i'm sorry!" she handed the comb back to the old man. he smiled and said, "it's ok! you can have the comb! i will find another one." 

lucy was so happy and thanked the friendly old man. she proceeded to comb her hair everyday and always thought of the old man. she never forgot how friendly he had been.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to run around outside and play with his friends. one day, he went outside to play and his foot got stuck in a hole. it hurt a lot and timmy started to cry. 

his mom came outside and saw that timmy's foot was hurt. she tried to help him get his foot out of the hole but it was too rough. timmy was scared that his foot would be spoiled forever. 

but his mom was very smart and knew just what to do. she called the doctor and they were able to get timmy's foot out of the hole. timmy was so happy that his foot wasn't spoiled and he could go back to playing with his friends. from that day on, timmy was more careful when he played outside so he wouldn't get hurt again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a favorite cup that she loved to drink her juice from every day. one day, she noticed that her cup was too tight and she couldn't drink from it.

lily went to her mom and said, "mommy, my cup is too tight. can you help me?" her mom observed the cup and saw that it was too small for lily's growing hands. so, her mom got her a bigger cup that was just right.

lily was happy and said, "thank you, mommy! this cup is perfect for me." she drank her juice and observed how much easier it was to hold the new cup. from then on, lily loved her new cup and used it every day.

tom and lily were friends who liked to play in the park. they had a rope that they used to make knots and swings. one day, they found a big tree with a branch that was perfect for a swing. they tied the rope to the branch and made a knot.

"look, lily, we made a swing!" tom said. "let's take turns and have fun!"

"ok, tom, you go first!" lily said. she was compassionate and wanted tom to be happy.

tom sat on the knot and pushed himself with his feet. he swung back and forth, feeling the wind in his hair. he laughed and shouted, "this is awesome!"

lily clapped and smiled. she waited for tom to stop and let her have a turn. she valued their friendship and wanted to share.

but tom did not stop. he swung faster and higher, feeling greedy and selfish. he did not care about lily's feelings. he said, "this is my swing! i made it! you can't have it!"

lily felt sad and angry. she said, "that's not fair, tom! we made it together! you are being mean!"

tom did not listen. he swung even faster and higher, feeling proud and rude. he said, "too bad, lily! you are too small and weak! you can't swing like me!"

lily felt hurt and lonely. she said, "please, tom, stop! you are my friend! don't be like this!"

but tom did not listen. he swung so fast and high that he lost his balance and fell off the knot. he hit the ground hard and hurt himself. he cried and screamed, "ow! ow! ow!"

lily ran to him and tried to help him. she was compassionate and wanted tom to be ok. she said, "tom, are you ok? i'm sorry you fell. do you want me to get help?"

but tom did not listen. he pushed lily away and said, "go away, lily! you are not my friend! you made me fall! you are bad!"

lily felt shocked and sad. she said, "no, tom, i didn't make you fall. you fell because you were not careful and nice. you are bad!"

tom did not listen. he kept crying and screaming, feeling hurt and angry. he did not value their friendship and did not want to say sorry.

lily felt sorry and disappointed. she said, "goodbye, tom. i hope you feel better. but i don't want to play with you anymore. you are not a good friend."

she left the park and went home. she did not look back. she did not want to see tom again.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to eat spicy food. one day, timmy went to a country far away. in that country, they had very spicy food. timmy was so happy! he ate and ate and ate. but then, he started to feel funny. his mouth was burning! it hurt a lot. timmy learned that sometimes, too much spicy food can burn your mouth. from then on, timmy was more careful when he ate spicy food.

once upon a time there was a little boy. his mum said he was very special. he wanted to make something special too.

so one day he found a big box. inside the box there was lots of colours. he mixed them all together and he made a rainbow. it was beautiful! he was so proud of it.

but then something weird happened. it started to rain. then he saw that the rainbow was beginning to attach itself to the raindrops! it was so strange! everyone thought it was very cool.

the little boy was so happy. he loved how the rainbow was becoming part of nature. he smiled and thanked god for such a wonderful and weird sight.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tommy. tommy liked to play outside in his backyard. every day, tommy would go out and explore.

one day, tommy walked to the corner of the yard. he found a big, shiny faucet! he was so excited. he touched it and tried to turn it on, but nothing happened.

the next day, tommy went back to the faucet. this time, he wasn't alone. his mommy and daddy were there with him. his mommy told him that if he twisted the faucet ever so gently, water would come out.

tommy was so excited when he saw the little stream of water come out. he smiled and laughed as the water sprayed him.

mommy and daddy were so proud of him. they gave him a big hug and told him what a clever boy he was.

tommy was so happy to have received a special surprise. every day after that, he went back to play with the little faucet in his backyard.

once upon a time, there was a happy family who loved to cook on the grill. they would make yummy food like hot dogs, hamburgers, and chicken. one day, they went to the mailbox to mail a letter. they saw a lively bird flying in the sky. the bird was so pretty with its colorful feathers. the family loved watching the bird and decided to write a letter to their grandma about it. they put the letter in the mailbox and went back to the grill to cook more delicious food.

once upon a time, there was a little bird. the bird was very happy because the sun was shining and the day was bright. suddenly, something happened. the sky turned dark and the wind started blowing very hard. the little bird was scared and didn't know what to do.

the wind was so strong that it pushed the little bird inch by inch towards a big tree. the bird tried to fly away, but the wind was too strong. finally, the bird reached the tree and found a small hole where it could hide. the hole was very dark, but the bird felt safe.

after a while, the wind stopped and the sun came out again. the little bird peeked out of the hole and saw that everything was back to normal. the sky was blue and the sun was shining again. the bird was very happy and flew away, feeling light as a feather.

once upon a time, there were two friends who loved to play in the big spot. they would laugh and giggle and make all kinds of silly jokes together. but one day, they began to quarrel. one friend said something that made the other sad. he was so mad that he shouted loudly and ran away.

the other friend was sad and he felt so lonely. he didn't want to play in the spot anymore. he trudged all the way home, feeling very unhappy.

but when he arrived home, he was surprised to find the other friend waiting for him. he had followed him all the way home to make sure he was okay. the other friend showed him heartfelt compassion even though he was still angry. he wanted to make sure his friend was okay.

the two friends hugged for a long time and then went back to the spot to play together again. they remembered that friends should not quarrel and always show compassion to each other.

once upon a time, there was a new plane. it flew very high in the sky.

the plane flew over a big lake. suddenly, a loud voice warned the plane to stay away. the voice said that the lake was too deep and the plane could get hurt.

the plane listened carefully and flew away. it flew around the lake and stayed away.

the plane kept flying until it was back in the sky. thankfully, the plane had been warned and was safe.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play in the park with his friends. one day, timmy's friend saw a scary dog in the park. the dog was big and had sharp teeth. timmy's friend was scared and wanted to go home, but timmy wanted to protect his friend. 

timmy knew that he had to be brave and protect his friend from the scary dog. he stood in front of his friend and told the dog to go away. the dog barked and growled, but timmy didn't move. he protected his friend until the dog went away. 

timmy's friend was so happy that timmy protected him. timmy felt proud of himself for being brave and protecting his friend. the moral of the story is that it's important to protect your friends, even if it's scary.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was a twisty road. on the road, there was a big hole. many people walked by the hole every day. they looked at it and felt scared. they did not want to fall in.

one day, a little boy named tim saw the hole. he was curious about it. he looked at the empty hole and wanted to see what was inside. he went closer and closer to the hole. he thought he could be careful and not fall in.

but tim was wrong. as he got closer to the hole, he slipped and fell in. the twisty road was too slippery for him. he could not get out of the hole. people walked by and saw tim in the hole. they tried to help him, but they could not. tim was stuck in the hole forever.

once there was a little girl named grace. one day, grace wanted to hang up her jelly on the tree outside. she grabbed the jar of jelly and climbed out of the window onto the tree branch. she carefully hung the jelly on the branch and was so excited to watch it sway in the wind. 

suddenly, the branch broke and grace fell and got hurt. she started to cry. suddenly, her mom appeared and said, "grace, you should always be careful of the things you do. when you do something that is too difficult, you might hurt yourself." 

grace listened to her mom's wise words and tried to climb down the tree with her mom's help. from then on, grace tried to be more careful and cautious of the things she did. the moral of the story is we should always be careful and not try to do something if it is too difficult for us.

tom and lily were twins who liked to play in the garden. one day, they saw a big pipe near the fence. they wondered what was inside the pipe.

"let's look inside the pipe," tom said. "maybe we can find something fun."

"ok," lily said. "but be careful. don't spoil the pipe."

they crawled inside the pipe and saw many things. they saw rocks, sticks, bugs, and mud. they also saw a shiny thing that looked like a ring.

"wow, look at this!" tom said. "it's a fancy ring. maybe it belongs to a princess."

"can i see it?" lily asked.

tom gave the ring to lily. she put it on her finger and smiled.

"it's so pretty," she said. "i want to keep it."

"no, you can't keep it," tom said. "it's not yours. we have to give it back."

"but i like it," lily said. "it's mine now."

they started to argue. they pulled the ring from each other. they did not notice that the pipe was shaking.

suddenly, a loud noise came from the pipe. water started to spray out of the pipe. it was a sprinkler pipe. the water was cold and wet. it soaked tom and lily and the ring.

"help!" tom and lily shouted. "we're wet!"

they ran out of the pipe. they saw their mom and dad standing by the fence. they looked angry.

"what were you doing in the pipe?" mom asked. "you spoiled the pipe. now the water is everywhere."

"we're sorry, mom," tom and lily said. "we found a fancy ring in the pipe. we wanted to see it."

they showed the ring to their mom and dad. they saw that the ring was not shiny anymore. it was rusty and dirty.

"that's not a fancy ring," dad said. "that's a washer. it was part of the pipe. you broke the pipe when you took the washer."

tom and lily felt bad. they realized that they made a mistake. they said sorry to their mom and dad. they gave the washer back to their dad. they helped their mom and dad fix the pipe.

they learned a lesson. they learned not to spoil things that are not theirs. they learned not to fight over things that are not important. they learned to share and be nice. they hugged their mom and dad and said they loved them.

mum and dad were walking in the park. "let's sit down in the sun and have a picnic!" said dad.

mum unpacked their picnic lunch and smiled. "it looks delicious!" she said.

"i notice something," said dad. he pointed up to a large spider on a tree branch.

mum smiled. "look at the spider."

the little boy saw the spider and gasped. "can i touch it?"

dad laughed. "no, it's best to leave it alone. spiders can be a bit scary."

the little boy nodded. he was happy just looking at it.

then they ate their delicious picnic lunch. the little boy bounced on the grass and laughed. he noticed a butterfly and chased after it. what a fun day!

once upon a time, there was a fluffy white bunny named fluffy. fluffy was always looking for adventure and was always ready for whatever the day would bring. 

today, fluffy decided to wander through the forest. while wandering he saw an open, white door. could it be? a secret door! he slowly hopped inside and saw a world of wonder. there were bright, colourful butterflies and singing birds everywhere. fluffy felt so excited he couldn't stay still.
 
he wandered all around, taking in all of the beauty. after a while, he stumbled upon a fountain. he drank the cool, refreshing water and he felt so happy and content.

fluffy returned to the white door and hopped back through it. he knew that sometime he would find his way back to this magical place. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a lucky little bear. she was looking for something special to do. one day, she had an idea - she would decorate the universe! she was so excited, she quickly ran off to gather supplies to get started.

when she got there, she met a friendly alien. "what are you doing?" asked the alien. the bear excitedly replied, "i'm decorating the universe!" the alien smiled and said, "that sounds like fun! what can i do to help?"

the bear and the alien set to work. they gathered stars and sparkles, moons and clouds. they chose colors and put them in swirls. then, the bear used a magical wand to put a special glow around everything.

when they finished, the sky twinkled and glowed. the bear was so happy with the beautiful decorations. the alien said, "you have done a wonderful job! the universe looks so lucky. you are a very lucky bear." 

the bear smiled and said, "yes, i am very lucky. and i am so happy i could decorate the universe!"

once upon a time, there was a jolly little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and color pictures with her crayons. one day, lily's mommy made some yummy cookies and asked lily if she wanted to taste one.

lily's eyes got big and she said, "yes, please!" she took a bite and smiled. "mmm, these cookies taste so good!" she said.

her mommy asked, "what color do you think the cookies are, lily?"

lily looked at the cookies and said, "they are brown, just like chocolate!" her mommy smiled and said, "you're right, lily. you have a good eye for colors." from that day on, lily loved the taste of cookies and the colors of the world around her.

once there was a lip. it was a tough lip and it called out. it said, "help me, help me!" a 3 year old heard it and came over. he looked at the lip and asked it what was wrong. the lip said, "i need help getting unstuck!" the 3 year old looked at the tough lip and saw it was stuck on the ground. he thought for a moment and then smiled and said, "i know what to do!" he went to the kitchen and brought back some butter. he slowly spread the butter all around the tough lip until it was free. the lip was so grateful and thanked the 3 year old for his help. they both smiled and the 3 year old said, "you're welcome!"

once upon a time, there were two logs. one log was big, and one log was small. the small log was different because it had stars carved into it.

the two logs were put near each other. then, they were lit on fire. the logs became brighter and brighter until they both began to burn. the logs burned for a long time until nothing was left. 

when the logs were no more, everyone was happy. the small log with stars carved in it was a special log - it made the fire look different! and that made everyone feel warm and happy.

ben was a shy three-year-old. he only had a few words to say and he liked to keep quiet. one day, his dad decided to display a new grill in his backyard. when ben saw it, he was so excited. he ran out of the house and took a closer look. dad turned the grill on and it started to make noises he had never heard before. ben was a little scared and hid behind his dad's legs.

but when he saw the burgers and hot dogs his dad was grilling, he forgot all about his shyness. he smiled and asked for a hamburger. dad said he could have one after dinner. after dinner, dad served the hamburgers off the grill. ben enjoyed his hamburger so much that he wanted another one the next day!

little matt was a very gifted 3 year old. he loved building and inventing things with his parents' tools. one day his parents noticed his extraordinary talents and decided to help him out with a special project. 
they talked and planned for weeks so they could help him build a puppet theater. matt was excited and couldn't wait to use his hammer. 
finally the day came when matt started the project. he spent hours and hours hammering, cutting and building. his parents watched and helped him out with the ideas and materials. 
at the end of the day, the theater was complete! little matt was so proud of his creation, he was jumping up and down in joy! his parents were amazed by his skills and hard work. what a gifted little boy!

once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. tim had a funny suit that made him look like a big banana. tim loved his funny suit and wore it all the time. one day, tim's mom told him they were going to the park. this excited tim very much because he loved playing on the swings and slides. 

when they got to the park, tim saw his friends playing on the monkey bars. he ran over to them and showed off his funny suit. his friends thought it was hilarious and they all laughed together. tim had so much fun playing with his friends and showing off his suit. 

after a while, tim's mom called him over for some snacks. tim was still excited and told his mom all about his adventures on the monkey bars. as they sat and ate their snacks, tim thought about how much he loved his funny suit and how much fun he had at the park with his friends.

once upon a time, there was a wealthy city. it was so wealthy that everyone in the city was happy and had enough food to eat.

one day, a big and empty container was found in the city. everyone was curious what was inside the container, so the city elders decided to fill it with something special.

everyone in the city worked together to fill the container with things that would make them happy. they filled it with things like toys, books, and games.

when it was full, they put on a party and everyone enjoyed the happy surprises they had put in the container. they had filled the container with joy and the city was even richer and happier than before.

sara and ben were bored. it was a gloomy day and they could not go outside to play. they had no toys or books to have fun with. they only had a big paper and some crayons.

"let's make a quiz!" sara said. "we can draw things and guess what they are."

"ok!" ben said. "that sounds like a good game. you go first."

sara took a crayon and drew something on the paper. it had four legs, a tail, and a long neck.

"what is it?" sara asked.

ben looked at the drawing. he thought hard. he knew it was an animal, but he did not know its name.

"is it a horse?" ben guessed.

"no, it is not a horse. try again." sara said.

"is it a dog?" ben guessed.

"no, it is not a dog. it is bigger than a dog. and it has spots." sara said.

ben looked at the drawing again. he saw the spots. he remembered seeing a picture of this animal in a book.

"is it a giraffe?" ben guessed.

"yes, it is a giraffe! you are right!" sara said. "you are good at this game. now it is your turn."

ben smiled. he took a crayon and drew something on the paper. it had two wheels, a seat, and a handle.

"what is it?" ben asked.

sara looked at the drawing. she knew what it was. she had one at home.

"is it a bike?" sara guessed.

"yes, it is a bike! you are right!" ben said. "you are good at this game too. let's do more."

sara and ben took turns drawing and guessing. they had fun with their quiz. they forgot about the gloomy day. they were happy.

lila and tom are friends. they like to play with blocks and cars. one day, they find a new toy in the playroom. it is a big train with many cars. it has a button that makes it go.

"wow, look at the train!" lila says. "can we play with it?"

"yes, let's play with it!" tom says. "i want to be the driver."

they push the button and the train starts to move. it makes a loud noise and has a spark on the front. it goes around the room very fast.

"this is fun!" lila says. "the train is so fast and shiny!"

but then, the train goes too fast. it bumps into a chair and falls off the track. the spark goes out and the noise stops. the train is broken.

"oh no, the train is broken!" tom says. "what do we do?"

lila and tom are sad. they look at the train and try to fix it. but they don't know how. they feel bad for breaking the new toy.

"maybe we can ask for help," lila says. "maybe someone can fix the train."

they go to the door and look for an adult. they see miss jen, their teacher. she is smiling and holding a book.

"miss jen, miss jen!" they call. "we need your help!"

miss jen comes to the playroom and sees the broken train. she sees lila and tom's sad faces.

"what happened, lila and tom?" she asks. "did you break the train?"

lila and tom nod. they tell miss jen what happened. they say they are sorry for breaking the new toy.

miss jen hugs them and says, "it's okay, lila and tom. i'm not mad at you. you didn't mean to break the train. it was an accident. accidents happen sometimes."

she picks up the train and looks at it. she sees the button and the spark. she says, "i think i can fix the train. it just needs a new battery. the battery makes the spark and the noise. do you want to help me?"

lila and tom nod. they are happy. they follow miss jen to the closet. she finds a new battery and puts it in the train. she pushes the button and the train starts to move again. it makes a loud noise and has a spark on the front.

"yay, the train is fixed!" lila and tom say. "thank you, miss jen!"

miss jen smiles and says, "you're welcome, lila and tom. you are very good helpers. now you can play with the train again. but be careful, okay? don't make it go too fast. and don't let it bump into anything. the train is very tight. it can break easily."

lila and tom say, "okay, miss jen. we will be careful. we will play with the train nicely."

they take the train and go back to the playroom. they play with the train and have fun. they make it go slow and steady. they don't let it bump into anything. they are happy and proud. they gain a new toy and a new skill. they learn how to fix the train.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a big house with her mommy and daddy. one day, lily was playing with her toys in the hall when her mommy came in.

"what are you doing, lily?" her mommy asked.

"i'm playing with my toys. do you want to play with me, mommy?" lily asked.

"i would love to, but i think we should clean up the hall first. it's a mess," her mommy said.

lily thought for a moment and then said, "okay, mommy. i'll help you clean up. i want to be kind and help you." so, lily and her mommy cleaned up the hall together and it looked much better. they both felt happy and proud of themselves.

lia liked to look at the stars at night. she wondered what they were and how they shone so bright. she asked her mom, "mom, what are those little lights in the sky?"

mom smiled and hugged lia. "those are stars, my dear. they are very far away from us, but they are like big balls of fire that burn and glow."

lia was amazed. "fire? like the fire we make in the camp? do they hurt?"

mom shook her head. "no, they don't hurt us, because they are too far away. but they can hurt other things that are close to them, like planets."

lia tilted her head. "what are planets, mom?"

mom pointed to the moon. "that is a planet, lia. a planet is a big round thing that goes around a star. some planets have air and water and life, like our planet, earth. but some planets are too hot or too cold or too dry, and nothing can live there."

lia nodded. "i see. and what is earth, mom?"

mom smiled again. "earth is our home, lia. it is the planet where we live, and where we have plants and animals and people. earth is a very special planet, because it has everything we need to be happy and healthy. earth is also very independent, because it can make its own air and water and food, and it can protect itself from the sun and the stars."

lia hugged her mom. "i love earth, mom. and i love you."

mom kissed her cheek. "i love you too, lia. and i'm glad you love earth. because earth loves us back, and we have to take care of it."

once upon a time, there was a red apple. the apple was too big for the little girl's hand. she wanted to put it in the fridge, but it didn't fit. the little girl tried and tried, but the apple was too big. she asked her mommy for help. her mommy took the apple and put it in the fridge. it fit perfectly! the little girl was happy that the red apple was safe and sound in the fridge.

once upon a time, in a large tree, there lived a squirrel named sam. sam had a big bushy tail and liked to jump from branch to branch. one day, sam met a new friend, a little bird named bella.

bella said, "hi sam! i am hungry. can you help me find some food?"

sam replied, "sure, bella! i can serve you some nuts from my tree."

sam took bella to his tree and they found a large pile of nuts. sam served the nuts to bella and they both ate happily. they played together all day and became best friends. from that day on, sam and bella always shared their food and fun times in the large tree.

lily and ben are best friends. they like to play in the sand near the sea. they build castles and bridges and tunnels with their buckets and shovels. they are very playful and happy.

one day, they see a big orange ball in the sky. it is the sunset. it makes the sea and the sand look shiny and pretty. lily and ben want to see it better. they decide to build a tower with the sand. they work hard and fast. they make the tower very tall and strong.

"look, ben, we did it!" lily says. "we can see the sunset from here. it is so beautiful!"

"yes, lily, it is!" ben says. "you are a great builder. and a great friend."

they hug and smile. they watch the sunset together. they feel warm and cozy. they are very happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named alice. alice was only three years old and she dreamed of being a musician. one day alice went to visit her grandma. grandma asked, â€œwhat do you want to do when you grow up?â€

alice replied, â€œi want to be a jazz musician!â€ grandma smiled and said â€œthatâ€™s nice. i used to play the piano and sing in a band.â€ 

grandma then proceeded to tell alice a story. she said, â€œimagine a delicate butterfly fluttering around a room. every time the butterfly lands on a flower it hears a note of music. now imagine all the butterflies in the room playing different notes that form a beautiful melody. that is what jazz is like.â€

alice was mesmerized. she thought to herself, â€œif the butterfly can make delicate music, i can make beautiful music too!â€ 

alice learned that if you want to reach your dreams, you have to try your very best, just like the butterfly makes delicate music to create something beautiful.

lily and ben are twins. they like to watch cartoons on tv. but they do not like the same cartoons. lily likes the cartoon with the pink pony. ben likes the cartoon with the blue robot.

one day, they have a big fight. they both want to watch their favorite cartoon. they grab the remote and pull it. they yell at each other.

"let me watch the pony! it is fun and pretty!" lily says.

"no, let me watch the robot! it is cool and smart!" ben says.

"the pony is better! the robot is stupid!" lily says.

"the robot is better! the pony is stupid!" ben says.

they do not match. they are very angry.

mom hears them and comes to the living room. she sees them fighting over the remote. she is not happy.

"stop it, you two! you are being rude and selfish!" mom says. "you need to share and take turns. you can watch both cartoons, one after the other. or you can watch something else that you both like."

lily and ben look at each other. they feel sorry. they do not want to make mom sad. they do not want to fight anymore.

"sorry, mom. sorry, lily. sorry, ben." they say.

they hug and make up. they decide to watch something else that they both like. they find a cartoon with a purple dragon. they think it is funny and cute. they laugh and smile. they match. they are happy.

lila is a big girl who likes to help her mom at work. her mom works with many files that have names and numbers on them. lila likes to look at the files and learn new words.

one day, lila and her mom go to work in a high building. lila sees many people and many files. she wants to help her mom, so she takes a file from her mom's desk and goes to find a place to put it. she sees a big shelf with many files on it. she thinks the file will be happy there.

but lila is too small to reach the high shelf. she tries to jump, but she cannot. she tries to climb, but she falls. she tries to ask for help, but no one hears her. she feels sad and scared. she misses her mom.

her mom misses her too. she looks for lila everywhere. she asks the people, but they do not know. she sees the file on the floor and knows lila took it. she follows the file and finds lila by the shelf. she hugs lila and says, "i missed you, my sweet girl. you are very brave, but you should not take files without asking. they are important for my work. let me show you how to put them back."

lila says, "i'm sorry, mom. i wanted to help you. i love you." her mom says, "i love you too. you are a great helper, but you need to be careful. come, let's go back to my desk and have a snack. you can look at the files with me, but please do not touch them."

lila nods and smiles. she holds her mom's hand and walks with her. she is happy to be with her mom. she does not miss the high shelf. she likes the files, but she likes her mom more.

everyone was so excited. it was billy's third birthday today! he ran around the house looking for his presents. he saw a big box with a bright blue bow on top. with a grin, he exclaimed, "what's this?" his mum replied, "it's a present from us, happy birthday." billy excitedly opened the box. inside was a shiny new tricycle!

he shouted with joy as he jumped onto the tricycle. his dad held onto the seat and together they went for a spin around the block. billy couldn't believe how fast he was going. he made sure to turn at each corner and make the most of his new ride.

finally they got back home. billy said, "thanks so much, this was the best birthday ever!" his parents smiled proudly and said, "you're welcome, we hope you had lots of fun." billy nodded as he hopped off his tricycle and went inside, happy that he'd had the best birthday ever!

sara and ben are twins, but they are very different. sara likes to run and jump and play. ben likes to read and draw and think. one day, they go to the big building with their mom. mom has to work in the big building. she says they can play in the lobby.

sara sees a big red ball in the corner. she runs to get it. she throws it to ben. "catch, ben, catch!" she says. ben tries to catch the ball, but he is not good at it. the ball bounces away from him. it rolls to the door. sara runs after it.

ben sees a big silver box with a door. he walks to it. he pushes a button. the door opens. he sees a small room inside. he steps in. he pushes another button. the door closes. he feels the room move. he is in an elevator.

sara catches the ball. she turns around. she does not see ben. she looks for him. she sees the big silver box. she sees a number on it. it changes from one to two to three. she thinks ben is in the box. she runs to the box. she pushes the button. the door does not open. she pushes it again and again. she is scared. she cries. "ben, ben, where are you?"

ben hears sara cry. he feels sorry. he pushes the button to go down. the room stops. the door opens. he sees sara. she sees him. she runs to him. she hugs him. she gives him the ball. "i'm sorry, sara, i'm sorry," he says. "i wanted to see the big building."

mom comes out of the work room. she sees sara and ben. she smiles. she hugs them. she says, "i'm proud of you, sara and ben. you are different, but you love each other. you are good twins."

once upon a time, there were two best friends - a little girl and a pony.

the pony was very famous. every day, the little girl would brush his silky, soft fur and take him for a ride.

one evening, the little girl and the pony decided to take a walk in the moonlight. it was so quiet that they could almost hear the stars twinkle.

the pony stopped and listened. what was that sound? suddenly, they heard birdsong and could see a beautiful rainbow up ahead. as they walked closer, they saw a tiny pond filled with sparkles.

the little girl and her pony looked in wonder. then, the pony bent its head to one side and began to drink from the pond. just then, they heard splashing and out of the water jumped the most magical fairy they had ever seen!

the little girl and the pony were so happy - they knew they had found a special friend. the fairy said, "listen carefully, my friends. i have something special for you."

sam and lily were twins who liked to play together. they had many toys, but their favourite was a big aeroplane that could make noises and fly in the air. they pretended to be pilots and passengers and had fun.

one day, they saw a new boy in the park. his name was max and he had a small aeroplane that was red and shiny. sam and lily wanted to play with him, but max was not nice. he said his aeroplane was better than theirs and he would not share. he laughed at them and said they were silly.

sam and lily felt sad and angry. they decided to scare max and make him go away. they waited until he was not looking and then they ran to his aeroplane. they grabbed it and threw it in the air. they shouted, "look, max, your aeroplane is flying away!"

max was very scared. he looked up and saw his aeroplane flying higher and higher. he cried and ran after it, but he could not catch it. he tripped and fell on the ground. he hurt his knee and his elbow. he sobbed and called for his mum.

sam and lily felt bad. they realised they had done something wrong. they ran to max and said they were sorry. they tried to help him, but he was too upset. he did not want to talk to them. he said they were mean and he hated them. his mum came and took him home. she was angry and said they were naughty.

sam and lily learned a lesson. they learned that scaring someone is not a good way to make friends. they learned that being kind and sharing is better. they wished they had been nice to max and played with him. they hoped he would forgive them and come back to the park. they hugged their aeroplane and said they would never do that again.

lily was bored at home. she wanted to play with someone, but her mom was busy and her dad was at work. she looked around her room and saw her phone. she liked her phone. it had games and songs and pictures. she picked up her phone and pressed some buttons.

"hello?" a voice said from the phone. lily was surprised. she did not know who it was.

"hello, who are you?" lily asked.

"i'm max. i'm three years old. i live far away. i was playing with my phone and i called you. who are you?" the voice said.

"i'm lily. i'm three years old too. i live here. i was bored and i picked up my phone. i'm happy to meet you, max," lily said.

"i'm happy to meet you too, lily. do you like to play?" max asked.

"yes, i like to play. i like to play with dolls and cars and books. what do you like to play?" lily asked.

"i like to play with trains and blocks and puzzles. do you have a favorite color?" max asked.

"i like pink and purple and yellow. what about you?" lily asked.

"i like blue and green and red. do you like to eat?" max asked.

"yes, i like to eat. i like to eat pizza and ice cream and cookies. what do you like to eat?" lily asked.

"i like to eat pasta and cheese and fruit. but i don't like sour things. they make my face funny. do you like sour things?" max asked.

"no, i don't like sour things either. they make my tongue hurt. i like sweet things. they make me smile. do you want to be my friend?" lily asked.

"yes, i want to be your friend. you are nice and fun. can we talk again?" max asked.

"sure, we can talk again. maybe we can play together someday. i have to go now. my mom is calling me. bye, max," lily said.

"bye, lily. i'm glad i met you. have a good day," max said.

lily hung up the phone and ran to her mom. she was not bored anymore. she had a new friend. she told her mom about max and how they met on the phone. her mom smiled and hugged her. she was happy for lily. she said maybe they could call max again later. lily nodded and smiled. she liked her phone. it had games and songs and pictures. and it had max.

anna and ben are twins. they like to play together. they have many toys, but their favorite is a big box. they can make the box into anything they want. sometimes it is a car, sometimes it is a castle, sometimes it is a spaceship.

one day, they decide to make the box into a kitchen. they find some pots and pans and spoons and plates. they pretend to cook and eat. anna says, "i will make broccoli for you, ben. it is good for you." ben says, "no, thank you. i do not like broccoli. it is yucky." anna says, "but broccoli is green and crunchy and yummy. you should try it."

anna puts some broccoli on a plate and gives it to ben. ben makes a face and pushes it away. he says, "i want cake. cake is sweet and soft and tasty." anna says, "but cake is not good for you. it has too much sugar. you will get a tummy ache." ben says, "i do not care. i want cake."

anna shakes her head and says, "you are silly, ben. you do not know what is good for you. i admire you for many things, but not for your food choices." ben says, "you are silly, anna. you do not know what is fun for you. i admire you for many things, but not for your food tastes."

they look at each other and laugh. they say, "we are silly twins. we do not like the same things, but we love each other." they hug and share their food. they eat some broccoli and some cake. they say, "both are good in different ways. we are happy twins." they play some more in their box kitchen. they have fun.

one day, a little fox was looking for food in the forest. he saw a big tree with many colorful fruits. he wanted to eat them, but he was afraid of the birds that lived in the tree. they had sharp beaks and loud voices.

he thought of a plan. he went to the tree and said, "hello, birds. i am a friend. i do not want to eat your fruits. i just want to see them. they are so colorful and pretty. can i come closer?"

the birds did not mind. they liked to show off their fruits. they said, "sure, little fox. you can come closer. but do not touch our fruits. they are ours."

the little fox nodded. he came closer and closer to the tree. he looked at the fruits with big eyes. he saw red ones, yellow ones, green ones, and purple ones. they smelled sweet and juicy.

he waited until the birds were busy singing and flapping their wings. then he jumped and grabbed a fruit with his mouth. he ran away as fast as he could. he heard the birds scream and chase him. but he was too quick and clever. he escaped to his den and ate the fruit. he was very happy. he thought, "what a colorful and tasty fruit. i will come back tomorrow and get another one."

once there was a lazy dog. the dog lay on top of the roof of the house all day and did not do anything. it was very lazy. every day the dog would just lie there and be lazy.

sometimes, when the sun was shining, the dog would look at the world below. it could see the trees and the lake and the people walking around. the dog liked to look at the world, but it was always too lazy to get down from the roof.

one day, the dog heard some children laughing outside. it looked down and saw them playing. the dog wanted to join them, but it was still too lazy. it kept on lying on the roof until the sun went down.

the next day, the dog woke up early and hopped off the roof. it ran over to the children and joined their game. they were so happy to see the dog that they played together all day long.

the dog had a wonderful time. it was so glad it finally wasn't so lazy anymore. from that day on, the dog made sure to never be lazy again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved pancakes. every morning, her mom would make her a delicious pan of pancakes for breakfast. one day, lily's mom said, "lily, tomorrow is an important day. you need to wake up early so we can start getting ready."

lily went to bed early that night, excited for the important day. the next morning, she woke up early and saw a big pan on the kitchen counter. she asked her mom, "what's the pan for?" her mom smiled and said, "it's for making pancakes, but not just any pancakes. today we are making special pancakes for a surprise guest."

lily helped her mom make the special pancakes and they were delicious. later that day, their surprise guest arrived and lily was so happy to share her favorite food with them. she realized that waking up early and helping her mom was important because it made the surprise even more special. from that day on, lily always remembered the importance of waking up early and helping out in the kitchen.

one day, john held his yellow toy car. he was so happy and excited to play with it. 

he pushed the car across the floor, then watched as it rolled across the room, making the funny sound it makes. 

john raced the car, then held it up in the air, admiring its yellow colour. he wondered what kind of fun things he could do with it today.

he called his friends over and they all raced the cars together. they played for a long time, and had lots of fun. 

at the end of the day, john put his car in its special spot, ready for another day of fun the next day.

once upon a time there was a mommy and a baby. the mommy was very worried because the baby had not eaten anything all day. the mommy looked in the kitchen, but there wasn't anything in there! suddenly, the mommy remembered that there was a yummy melon in the fridge. it was the baby's favorite! 

the mommy cut up the melon and put it in a bowl. she rushed over to the baby and showed it to them. the baby's eyes lit up when they saw it! they picked up a melon piece looked at it and smiled. 

the baby started munching on the melon. soon, the baby was full and happy. the mommy was so relieved and smiled. the baby hugged the mommy and gave her a big kiss.

the mommy and the baby were so very happy that they had the melon. and the mommy was no longer worried.

the end.

once upon a time there was a farmer. he was very alert and he wanted to create something special. he thought and thought until he had an idea; he would make a barn! he set off to create his barn.

he put together lots of big wooden blocks to make the walls. then he created the roof, a big triangle out of felt. finally, he made a door for animals to go in and out.

when he was finished, all the animals in the farm were so happy! they had a lovely new home where they could stay safe and warm. they could play fetch in the garden and have long naps in the hay.

the farmer was so proud of his creation. he was very alert, and he had made sure that the barn was perfect for the animals. he was a kind farmer and everybody in the village was very pleased.

once there was a little rabbit who wanted to catch some dinner.  he hopped around looking for something to eat. then he saw a trap. the rabbit thought it was a great idea and carefully put his paw in the trap. but he couldn't get out! the rabbit made a request and asked the hunter to help. fortunately, the hunter was grateful and opened the trap. the rabbit thanked the hunter and hopped away. he was happy to have been let free and kept looking for dinner.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a folder that he loved very much. he always kept it with him wherever he went. one day, timmy went to the park to play. he saw a girl playing with a ball and asked if he could play too.

the girl said, "no, i don't want to play with you. you're not polite."

timmy felt sad and went to rest on a bench. he opened his folder and started to draw a picture. suddenly, a wind blew and the folder flew away. timmy tried to catch it, but it was too late. the folder was gone forever.

timmy cried and cried. the girl came over and asked what was wrong. timmy said, "i lost my folder. it had all my drawings in it."

the girl said, "i'm sorry. that's too bad."

and that was the bad ending. timmy never found his folder again.

once upon a time, in a large pond, there was a happy little fish named finn. finn loved to swim and play with his friends. one day, finn saw a pretty pastel shell on the bottom of the pond.

finn wanted to show the pastel shell to his friends. so, he took a big breath and started to dive down to the bottom of the pond. as he got closer, the pastel shell became even prettier.

finn picked up the pastel shell and swam back up to show his friends. they all loved the large, pretty shell. they took turns diving and playing with it. and they all lived happily ever after in their large pond.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her toys and coloring pictures. one day, she went to the park and saw a boy playing with a blue ball. 

lily went up to the boy and said, "i want to play with your blue ball." 

the boy said, "sure, you can play with it for a little while." 

lily played with the blue ball and had so much fun. but then, she accidentally threw it too hard and it went over the fence. 

the boy was sad because he lost his ball, but lily learned that it's important to be careful with other people's things. she apologized and promised to be more careful in the future. from that day on, lily always asked before playing with someone else's toys and made sure to be extra careful with them.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very nervous. she had a telephone that she loved very much, and she never wanted it to disappear. one day, something strange happened. the telephone just vanished right before her eyes! she was so scared that she started to cry.

suddenly, her mum came into the room and asked what happened. the little girl told her that her telephone had disappeared. her mum looked around the room and noticed a little mouse hiding behind the curtains. it had taken the telephone!

the girl's mum caught the mouse and took the telephone away from it. then, she put the telephone back into its special place. the little girl was so happy to have her telephone back. from then on, she was always careful to make sure it didn't disappear again. the end.

lily liked to study. she had many books with pictures and words. she liked to learn new things. she liked to study with her mom and dad. they helped her read and write and count.

one day, lily found a book with purple flowers on the cover. she loved purple. it was her favorite color. she opened the book and saw more purple flowers inside. she also saw a purple butterfly. she wanted to study the butterfly. she asked her mom, "what is this?"

her mom said, "that is a butterfly. it is an insect. it has wings and can fly. it likes to drink nectar from flowers."

lily said, "wow, it is so pretty. can i touch it?"

her mom said, "no, you cannot touch it. it is very delicate. if you touch it, you might hurt it. you have to be compassionate. that means you have to be kind and gentle to living things."

lily said, "i understand. i will be compassionate. i will not touch the butterfly. i will just look at it and study it."

her mom said, "that is very good, lily. you are a smart and compassionate girl. i am proud of you." she hugged lily and gave her a kiss. lily smiled and hugged her back. she was happy to study and learn. she was happy to have a purple book and a compassionate mom.

once there was a little girl named ella. she was the most popular girl in school. she loved to play on the balancing beam in the playground. she was so good at balancing that she never had to use her muscles.

one day, all the kids gathered around ella, asking her to show them what she could do. she smiled and got on the beam. she balanced so well that the kids all applauded.
