ella's teacher came out and told her not to stay on the beam too long. "sometimes, muscles get tired," he said.

but ella didn't listen. she stayed on the beam for a really long time. eventually, her muscles got tired and she fell off. everyone was very sad. ella's teacher told her to be careful next time.

but ella didn't listen and she fell off the beam the next time too. and the next time. the kids in school stopped asking ella to balance on the beam, since they were afraid something bad might happen. ella was no longer the most popular girl at school.

one day, a little girl named sue got a new scooter for her birthday. she was very happy and excited to ride it. sue's friend, tom, did not know what a scooter was. he was ignorant about scooters.

sue wanted to show tom her new scooter. she said, "tom, come look at my new scooter!" tom came over and saw the scooter. he did not know how it worked, but he wanted to try it. sue said, "be careful, tom. i will show you how to ride it."

as tom tried to ride the scooter, he felt a pinch on his finger. he cried out, "ouch! sue, it pinched me!" sue said, "i told you to be careful. let me show you the right way to ride it."

sue showed tom how to ride the scooter without getting pinched. tom learned how to ride it, and they both had fun riding the scooter together. from that day on, tom was no longer ignorant about scooters and always remembered to be careful when riding one.

once upon a time there was a ship sailing on the ocean. the ship was very big and strong, and there were many people on it. one day, the wind blew really hard, making big waves around the ship. everyone was worried that the ship might sink, so they locked the doors with a big thick lock.

the waves kept getting bigger, and they sprayed big drops of water all over the ship. everyone was scared, but finally the storm ended and the sun started to shine again.

the people on the ship were so happy that they had survived the storm. they were happy that they had locked the door on the ship, because it kept them safe from the wind and the waves. from then on, the ship kept sailing across the ocean, safely and happily.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in her yard, but there was a big fence around it that she couldn't climb over. one day, she saw a squirrel on the other side of the fence and wanted to say hello.

"hello, mr. squirrel," lily said, but the squirrel just looked at her and didn't say anything back. "why won't you talk to me?" she asked.

the squirrel finally nodded his head and said, "i'm sorry, lily. i can't talk to you because i'm very shy." lily felt a little sad, but she understood. "that's okay," she said. "maybe we can be friends through the fence."

from that day on, lily and the squirrel would talk to each other every day through the fence. even though the fence was bossy and kept them apart, they were still able to be friends.

jack was walking through the park one day when he saw something important. it was a squirrel! it was grey and had a big bushy tail.

jack smiled when he saw the squirrel. he wanted to grab it but he knew he couldn't. still, he couldn't take his eyes off the squirrel.

the squirrel hopped from tree to tree above jack's head. suddenly, the squirrel jumped down and landed on jack's shoulder!

jack was very surprised. he slowly reached out, trying to grab the squirrel. suddenly, the squirrel jumped again, and it was gone.

jack laughed and smiled. he was happy to have seen the important squirrel.

sara and her mom went to the mall. they wanted to buy a new dress for sara. sara liked the mall. she saw many colors and shapes and sounds.

they walked into a store with many dresses. sara saw a pink dress with flowers. she wanted to try it on. she said to her mom, "mom, can i try this dress? it is so pretty!"

her mom smiled and said, "sure, sara. let's go to the dressing room." they went to the dressing room and sara put on the dress. she looked at herself in the mirror. she felt like a princess. she twirled and spun and laughed.

her mom said, "you look so graceful, sara. do you like the dress?" sara nodded and said, "yes, mom. i love it. can we buy it, please?"

her mom said, "of course, sara. you deserve it. you are a good girl." they went to the cashier and paid for the dress. sara hugged her mom and said, "thank you, mom. you are the best mom ever!"

they left the store and walked to the food court. they were thirsty and hungry. they saw a juice stand and decided to get some juice. sara chose apple juice and her mom chose orange juice. they got their cups and sat at a table.

they drank their juice and felt refreshed. they talked about the dress and the mall and other things. they enjoyed their time together. they were happy.

once there was a mom and a dad who were very worried. their daughter, lily was about to turn three, and they didn't know what to do for her birthday! 

one day, lily's dad had an idea. he knew that lily loved oysters, so he decided that for her birthday they could go to the beach and celebrate with some oysters!

the day arrived and lily was very excited. she put on her dress and sandals and ran to the car. when they arrived at the beach, they all began to look for oysters. after a while, they found one!

lily's dad showed her how to open it and lily was delighted. inside was a pearl! she gasped and said "mommy, look at my pearl!" 

lily's parents were so pleased. they had a big celebration that day with lots of singing, dancing and oysters. 

lily was the happiest little girl and her parents were so relieved that their daughter had such a special birthday celebration.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big balloon in the sky. it is red and yellow and blue. it is very pretty.

"look, ben, a balloon!" anna says.

"wow, anna, it is so big!" ben says.

they run to the balloon. they want to touch it. but the balloon is too high. they cannot reach it.

"hello, children!" a voice says. they look up. it is a man in the balloon. he has a basket and a hat. he is smiling. he is charming.

"hello, sir!" anna and ben say.

"do you like my balloon?" the man asks.

"yes, we do!" anna and ben say.

"it is a special balloon. it can fly very high. do you know why?" the man asks.

anna and ben shake their heads. they do not know.

"it is because of oxygen. oxygen is the air we breathe. it is invisible, but it is everywhere. the balloon has a lot of oxygen inside. it makes it lighter than the air outside. that is why it can fly," the man explains.

anna and ben nod. they understand. they think oxygen is amazing.

"can we fly with you?" anna asks.

"sure, if you want. but you have to ask your parents first. and you have to wear these helmets. they have oxygen too. they help you breathe when we fly very high," the man says.

he shows them two helmets. they are shiny and have tubes.

anna and ben run to their parents. they ask them if they can fly with the man. their parents say yes. they are happy.

they put on the helmets. they climb into the basket. the man turns on a fire. the fire makes the balloon bigger. the balloon lifts off the ground. anna and ben wave to their parents. they are excited.

they fly with the man. they see the park, the trees, the houses, the cars. they see the clouds, the sun, the birds. they talk to the man. they ask him questions. he tells them stories. they have fun.

they fly with the man in the balloon. they learn about oxygen. they think it is charming.

lily and ben were playing with their crayons and paper. they liked to draw animals and cars and flowers. lily had a pink eraser that she used to fix her mistakes. ben did not have an eraser, but he wanted one.

"can i use your eraser, lily?" ben asked.

"no, it is mine. you have to find your own eraser," lily said.

"but i need it. i made a big mess on my paper. please, lily, please," ben begged.

lily shook her head. she did not want to share her eraser. she liked it too much. she put it in her pocket and turned away from ben.

ben was angry and sad. he wanted to draw a nice picture, but he could not. he looked around the room and saw a big eraser on the teacher's desk. he thought maybe he could borrow it for a little while. he got up and walked to the desk. he reached for the eraser, but he did not see the teacher coming back from the bathroom.

"hey, what are you doing?" the teacher yelled.

ben was scared. he dropped the eraser and ran back to his seat. he did not want to get in trouble. he felt sorry for trying to take the teacher's eraser.

the teacher picked up the eraser and walked to ben. she looked at his paper and saw the mess. she smiled and said, "don't worry, ben. it's okay to make mistakes. that's how we learn. here, you can use my eraser. but next time, ask me first, okay?"

ben nodded. he said, "thank you, teacher. i'm sorry, teacher. i won't do it again."

the teacher gave him the eraser and a hug. she said, "it's all right, ben. i'm glad you like to draw. you have a lot of imagination. and you know what? you can also share your crayons with lily. maybe she will share her eraser with you, too."

ben smiled. he felt better. he erased his mess and started a new picture. he looked at lily and said, "do you want to use my blue crayon, lily?"

lily looked at ben and said, "yes, thank you, ben. do you want to use my pink eraser, ben?"

ben said, "yes, please, lily. thank you, lily."

they shared their crayons and eraser. they drew a beautiful picture together. they were happy and proud. they showed their picture to the teacher and their friends. they learned to be nice and to share. they had fun.

once there was a bunny. he was purple, and he was very brave. he wanted to catch a trap.

he went to the forest and he called for his friends. they all wanted to help him catch the trap.

he found a big purple tree. they started to build a big trap near the tree. they used sticks and string to make the trap.

when they finished, they all put their ears close to the ground. they heard a noise! it was the trap.

the bunny was so excited. he opened the trap and saw a big purple butterfly. it was so beautiful. he was very happy.

so the bunny and his friends all cheered! they had caught the purple trap!

once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named hopper. hopper loved to hop around and play with his friends. one day, hopper saw a big, juicy melon in the garden. he wanted to eat it, but it was too high for him to reach.

hopper asked his friend, the noisy bird, to help him get the melon. the bird agreed, but when they tried to get the melon, it fell and broke into pieces. hopper felt sad and guilty for ruining the melon.

but then, hopper's mother told him that it's always better to ask for help when you need it, and that accidents happen. hopper learned his lesson and promised to be more careful in the future. from that day on, hopper and his friends always helped each other and played together happily.

ben and lily liked to play on the farm with their grandpa. they liked to see the animals and help with the chores. one day, they saw a big, elderly cow in the barn. she was very old and slow, but she was still kind and gentle.

"can we pet her, grandpa?" ben asked.

"sure, but be careful. she might be a bit grumpy today," grandpa said.

ben and lily approached the cow slowly and gently. they stroked her soft fur and scratched her ears. the cow mooed softly and licked their hands.

"can we ride her, grandpa?" lily asked.

"no, no, she's too old for that. she needs to rest and eat her hay," grandpa said.

"but we can spin with her, right?" ben asked.

"spin with her? what do you mean?" grandpa asked.

ben and lily giggled and ran around the cow in circles. they pretended they were spinning like a merry-go-round. the cow watched them with curiosity and amusement. she wagged her tail and mooed again.

"look, grandpa, we're spinning with the cow!" ben and lily shouted.

grandpa smiled and shook his head. he was glad to see them having fun. he joined them and spun with them too. the cow, the children, and the grandpa spun and laughed together. they had a wonderful time on the farm.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved his toy car very much. one day, he accidentally broke it and felt very sad. his mom promised to replace it for him, but it would take some time. 

the next day, timmy went to the park to play. he saw a big, empty box and climbed inside to pretend he was driving his car. suddenly, the wind blew the box away and timmy was stuck inside. he tried to escape, but the box was too heavy. 

just when he thought he would be stuck forever, he heard his mom's voice calling his name. she had come to the park to look for him and found him in the box. she helped him escape and took him home. when they got home, there was a surprise waiting for timmy. his mom had replaced his toy car and he was very happy.

once upon a time there was a bright planet. it was so shiny and nice. all of sudden, something happened and the planet started to scatter. that made everyone so sad, because they liked to look at the bright planet.

suddenly, a brave superhero came to the rescue. he flew around and put all the pieces of the planet back together. the superhero worked hard and soon the bright planet was back in one piece.

everyone was so happy now that the bright planet was back. they all cheered for the superhero who had saved the day! from that day on, the bright planet was safe again and the people cheered everyday.

ben and lily were playing in the park. they liked to run and jump and slide. they saw a big hill with many trees. they wanted to climb the hill and see what was on the other side.

"let's go, ben!" lily said. "maybe we can find a bear!"

ben was not sure. he was a little scared of bears. he had seen them in books and on tv. they looked big and strong and loud.

"i don't know, lily," ben said. "what if a bear is not nice? what if it chases us or bites us?"

lily laughed. she was not scared of anything. she was brave and curious and ready.

"don't be silly, ben," lily said. "bears are not mean. they are just animals. they like honey and berries and fish. maybe we can be friends with a bear!"

ben thought for a moment. he did not want to miss the fun. he did not want to make lily sad. he decided to be brave too.

"ok, lily," ben said. "let's go and find a bear. but we have to be careful and quiet. and we have to stick together."

lily nodded. she took ben's hand and they started to climb the hill. they walked through the trees and looked for signs of a bear. they saw some paw prints and some scratch marks and some fur. they followed the trail until they reached the top of the hill.

there, they saw a big cave. it was dark and deep and mysterious. they heard a loud snore coming from inside. they knew it was a bear.

"wow, ben," lily whispered. "we found a bear! do you want to see it?"

ben felt his heart beat fast. he was very nervous. he wanted to see the bear, but he also wanted to be safe.

"i don't know, lily," ben whispered. "maybe we should go back. maybe the bear is sleeping and we should not wake it up."

lily shook her head. she was too excited to leave. she wanted to see the bear, and maybe touch it and talk to it.

"no, ben," lily whispered. "we came this far. we have to see the bear. come on, it will be fun!"

lily let go of ben's hand and crept towards the cave. she moved slowly and quietly. she peeked inside and saw a big brown bear lying on the ground. it was covered with fur and had a big nose and ears and claws. it looked very cozy and warm.

lily smiled. she thought the bear was cute and friendly. she wanted to say hello. she took a step inside the cave and said in a soft voice:

"hi, bear. we are ben and lily. we came to see you. we want to be your friends."

the bear heard the voice and opened its eyes. it saw a small girl standing in front of it. it was surprised and angry. it did not like strangers in its home. it did not want to be friends. it wanted to be alone.

the bear roared and jumped up. it showed its teeth and growled. it was ready to attack.

lily screamed and ran out of the cave. she was scared and sorry. she did not mean to make the bear mad. she did not know the bear was not nice.

ben saw lily running and heard the bear roaring. he was terrified and worried. he wanted to help lily and get away from the bear.

he ran after lily and grabbed her hand. he pulled her down the hill and away from the cave. he did not stop until they reached the park.

they were safe and sound. they hugged each other and cried. they were sorry for being foolish and brave. they learned their lesson.

they never went to look for a bear again.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a big tower. it was very tall and had lots of windows. a little girl named lily loved to look at the tower from her window. one day, she saw a bird flying into the tower. 

lily became anxious and worried about the bird. she asked her mom, "mommy, can we help the bird in the tower?" her mom said, "let's go see what we can do." 

when they got to the tower, they saw that the bird was stuck inside. lily's mom tried to open the door, but it was locked. then, lily had an idea. she said, "mommy, let's reverse the door and the bird can fly out!" 

so, they reversed the door and the bird flew out of the tower. lily was so happy that they could help the bird. she said, "mommy, we are heroes!"

lila and ben love to play in the snow. they make snowballs and throw them at each other. they make a snowman and give him a hat and a scarf. they make snow angels and laugh.

but one day, they see something hidden in the snow. it is a big box with a bow. they run to the box and open it. inside, they find a puppy. he is brown and fluffy and has a red collar. he wags his tail and licks their faces.

lila and ben are very happy. they hug the puppy and thank their mom and dad. they name him raisin, because he is sweet and wrinkly. they raise him in their arms and take him inside. they give him a warm blanket and a bowl of food. they play with him and cuddle him. they love their new friend. raisin loves them too. he is the best gift ever.

ben and mia were at the beach with their mom and dad. they liked to play in the sand and look at the sea. the sea was big and blue and made funny noises.

"look, ben, i found a shell!" mia said, holding up a shiny pink thing. "it is so pretty!"

"wow, mia, that is a rare shell!" ben said. "can i see it?"

mia gave the shell to ben. he looked at it closely and saw a tiny hole in it. he put the shell to his ear and listened.

"what do you hear, ben?" mia asked.

"i hear the sea!" ben said. "it is like a song!"

they both smiled and took turns listening to the shell. they decided to keep it as a treasure.

"let's set it here, in our sand castle," mia said. "it can be the king's crown."

they put the shell on top of their sand castle and admired their work. they were very happy and proud.

"look, mom and dad, we made a castle with a rare shell!" they shouted.

mom and dad came over and praised them. they took a picture of them with their castle and their shell. they said it was a very special day.

one day, mommy saw something special outside the house. it was a big, blue box with a big, sparkly bow on the top! mommy was excited and she said "it's for you, honey".

little girl saw the box and was excited too. she wanted to open it. she said "mommy, can i open the box?" mommy said, "yes, open it, sweetheart".

little girl ran and opened the box. inside the box was a big, success! little girl saw the success and shouted "yay, success!" she hugged the success and showed it to her mommy.

mommy smiled and said "you are so successful, honey". little girl smiled and showed her success to everyone. from now on, she always knew that when she opened boxes, she could find success!

once upon a time there was a beetle who wanted to balance on a tightrope. he was so anxious! every day he practiced, but no matter how hard he tried he just could not stay balanced.

one day, a wise bird landed beside the beetle. the bird said to the beetle, â€œwhy donâ€™t you try it with a friend?â€ the beetle thought it was a great idea, and so he found another beetle who wanted to help.

they carefully balanced on the rope together and it was much easier. the beetle was so happy! to his surprise, they could stay balanced on the rope together, but not when they were alone.

the moral of this story is that it is much easier to do difficult tasks when you work with a friend! together, you can be stronger and stay balanced!

ben loves his dinosaur toy. he plays with it every day. he makes it roar and run and bite. he calls it rex. rex is loyal. he never leaves ben's side.

one day, ben goes to the park with his mom. he brings rex with him. he wants to show rex the swings and the slide and the sandbox. he has so much fun with rex. he forgets to hold rex tight.

a big boy sees rex on the ground. he likes dinosaurs too. he picks up rex and runs away. he does not see ben. he does not hear ben call.

ben sees the big boy take rex. he feels sad and angry. he runs after the big boy. he shouts, "give me back rex! he is mine! he is my friend!"

the big boy does not listen. he does not stop. he goes to his bike and puts rex in his basket. he rides away fast.

ben cannot catch the big boy. he falls on the grass. he weeps. he weeps loud. he wants rex back. he misses rex.

his mom hears him weep. she runs to him. she hugs him. she asks him what is wrong.

ben tells her what happened. he tells her about the big boy and rex. he tells her how much he loves rex. he tells her how loyal rex is.

his mom feels sorry for him. she wipes his tears. she says, "i'm sorry, ben. that was not nice of the big boy. he should not have taken rex. rex belongs to you. he is your dinosaur. he is your loyal friend."

she says, "don't worry, ben. we will find rex. we will get him back. we will make the big boy say sorry. come on, let's go."

she takes his hand. they get in the car. they drive after the big boy. they hope to see rex soon. ben stops weeping. he feels a little better. he trusts his mom. he knows she will help him. he knows rex will be happy to see him. he smiles. he says, "thank you, mom. you are loyal too."

jill was a regular girl. she liked to play outdoors and she liked to play golf. one day she went outside to play golf. on the way, she saw something special. it was a very tall tree. she wanted to reach the top of the tree. 

she tried and tried and finally she was able to reach the top. it was a great view from up there. she could see the entire park from the top of the tree. it was amazing! 

jill had so much fun reaching the top of the tall tree. from then on she played golf there every day. it was a regular outing for jill and she looked forward to going there every day.

once upon a time there was a little girl who was very proud. she loved to move around and explore. one day she found a pair of sunglasses. she was so excited, she quickly put them on. the sunlight glinted off the lenses and she smiled. with her sunglasses on, she moved around her home and garden, feeling like the most important person in the world. everywhere she went, people smiled and cheered her on. she was so proud that she could move around with her sunglasses on.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. amy was very independent. she liked to do things by herself. one day, she went to the park to play.

at the park, amy saw a tall pole. she thought it would be fun to climb the pole. so, she started to climb up, up, up. she was very happy and proud of herself.

but then, amy started to feel scared. she looked down and saw that she was very high. she didn't know what to do. suddenly, she began to fall. down, down, down she went. luckily, her mommy was there to catch her. amy was safe and learned to be more careful when playing.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to make cocoa on cold days. one day, the weather was very harsh and lily's mom said they could make cocoa together. they went to the kitchen and got some milk, cocoa powder and sugar. lily's mom helped her mix everything together and then they put it on the stove to heat up. when it was ready, they poured it into mugs and added some marshmallows. lily took a sip and smiled. it was the best cocoa she ever had!

lily and ben were friends who liked to gaze at the stars. they had a big book with pictures of stars and planets. they wanted to visit the space museum, where they could see real rockets and learn more about space.

one day, their teacher said they could go to the museum with the class. lily and ben were very happy. they packed their lunch and their book and got on the bus. the museum was very popular. there were many other children and adults there.

lily and ben followed their teacher and saw many things. they saw a big rocket that could fly to the moon. they saw a suit that astronauts wore. they saw a model of the earth and the sun. they learned many new words and facts.

but then, they saw a big telescope. it was shiny and had a long tube. lily and ben wanted to look through it and see the stars. they ran to the telescope and pushed each other.

"let me see first!" lily said.

"no, me!" ben said.

they both grabbed the telescope and pulled. they did not see that a sign said "do not touch". they did not hear their teacher calling them. they did not notice that the telescope was wobbly.

suddenly, the telescope fell over and broke. it made a loud noise. everyone looked at lily and ben. they were scared and sorry. their teacher came and was angry.

"what did you do?" she asked. "you broke the telescope! you did not listen to me or the sign! you were rude and selfish!"

lily and ben felt ashamed. they said they were sorry. they said they only wanted to see the stars. they said they were friends.

the teacher sighed. she said they had to pay for the telescope. she said they had to apologize to the museum staff. she said they had to learn to share and be careful.

lily and ben nodded. they realized they had made a mistake. they said they would do better. they hugged each other and said they were still friends.

they learned that gazing at the stars was fun, but not more important than being kind and respectful. they learned that visiting the museum was a privilege, not a right. they learned that being popular was not worth losing a friend.

once upon a time, there was a big brown bear. the bear was very hungry and wanted to eat some honey. he went to the beehive, but it was too high for him to reach. so, he lay down on the ground and tried to think of a way to get the honey. 

suddenly, he saw a rope nearby. he picked it up and tried to tie it around the beehive. but the rope was too short, and it didn't fit around the beehive. the bear was sad and hungry.

just then, a little bird flew by and saw the bear. the bird asked the bear what was wrong. the bear told the bird that he was hungry and wanted some honey, but he couldn't reach the beehive. the bird had an idea. she flew up to the beehive and pecked at it until it fell to the ground. the bear was so happy, and he thanked the bird for helping him. they both ate some honey together and became good friends.

once upon a time, there was a fat cat named tom. tom loved to eat spaghetti. one day, tom asked his mom, "can i have spaghetti for dinner?"

mom said, "no, tom. we are not allowed to have spaghetti today. we are having fish instead." tom was sad because he really wanted spaghetti.

later, tom saw a big bowl of spaghetti on the table. he wanted to eat it, but he knew he was not allowed. tom tried to think of a way to get the spaghetti without getting in trouble.

tom's friend, a little mouse named jerry, saw tom looking at the spaghetti. jerry said, "i can help you get the spaghetti, but you have to share it with me." tom agreed, and they both worked together to get the spaghetti without mom seeing them.

in the end, tom and jerry enjoyed the spaghetti together. but they knew they had to be more careful next time, so they wouldn't get caught.

once upon a time there was a bunny called thumper. thumper was a happy bunny. he lived in a beautiful garden filled with lots of green vines.

every morning thumper hopped around the garden, looking at all the flowers and listening to the birds sing. but one particular morning, he noticed something special â€” a vine!

thumper was very enthusiastic. he thought the vine looked like lots of fun. so he hopped closer and closer to the vine, until he was standing right beside it.

then thumper did something special â€” he jumped onto the vine! he grabbed hold of the vine with his two little paws and swung around and around, feeling very happy and carefree.

thumper was delighted. every day from then on, he jumped onto the vine and swung around and around for hours. he always felt so excited and enthusiastic when he was soaring through the air.

the end!

once upon a time, there was a little train named choo-choo. choo-choo loved to travel on the track and see all the pretty colors around him. one day, choo-choo met a thin rabbit who was also traveling on the track.

"hello, little rabbit," said choo-choo. "what are you doing on the track?"

"i am going to sleep in my burrow," replied the rabbit.

"oh, that sounds nice," said choo-choo. "i wish i could sleep too, but i have to keep going on the track."

the rabbit looked at choo-choo and said, "you don't have to keep going all the time. sometimes it's good to take a break and sleep."

choo-choo thought about what the rabbit said and decided to take a nap. he closed his eyes and fell asleep on the track. when he woke up, he felt refreshed and ready to continue his journey. from that day on, choo-choo learned to take breaks and sleep when he needed to.

tim and lily like to play with the fish in the pond. they have a net and a bucket. they catch the fish and put them in the bucket. they think the fish are happy in the bucket.

one day, mom sees them playing with the fish. she is angry. she says, "you are hurting the fish! the fish need water and air. the bucket is too small and dirty. put the fish back in the pond now!"

tim and lily feel guilty. they did not know they were hurting the fish. they say sorry to mom and to the fish. they take the bucket and the net to the pond. they pour the water and the fish back in the pond. they see the fish swim away. they hope the fish are not mad at them.

mom hugs them and says, "it's okay. you did not mean to hurt the fish. but you have to be careful and kind to animals. they are living things, like you and me. they have feelings and needs. do you understand?"

tim and lily nod and say, "yes, mom. we understand. we will not catch the fish again. we will only watch them and feed them bread crumbs. we love the fish."

mom smiles and says, "that's good. i love you, too. now, let's go home and have some cookies."

sara and tom like to play outside. they like to run and jump and laugh. but today, they cannot see very well. there is fog everywhere. fog is like a big cloud on the ground. it makes everything look white and blurry.

sara and tom feel curious. they want to explore the fog. they hold hands and walk slowly. they see shapes and shadows in the fog. they hear noises and voices in the fog. they wonder what is in the fog.

they come to a big street. they see cars and buses and bikes in the fog. they see people and dogs and birds in the fog. they see lights and signs and shops in the fog. the street is very busy. busy means there are many things happening.

sara and tom feel scared. they do not like the busy street. they do not like the loud noises and the fast things. they do not like the fog. they want to go back home. they turn around and run. they find their house and their mom. they hug her and feel safe. they do not want to play in the fog anymore. they want to play inside. they want to play with their toys and their books. they want to play with each other. they are happy.

lily and sam are playing with paper. they like to fold the paper and make shapes. lily folds a paper into a hat. sam folds a paper into a plane.

"look at my hat!" lily says. "it is big and pink!"

"look at my plane!" sam says. "it can fly fast and far!"

they show each other their paper shapes. they are happy and proud.

then they see a box of labels on the table. the labels are small and sticky. they have different colors and words.

"what are these?" lily asks.

"they are labels," sam says. "you can stick them on things."

"can we stick them on our paper shapes?" lily asks.

"sure, why not?" sam says.

they take some labels and stick them on their paper shapes. they choose labels that match their shapes. lily sticks a label that says "hat" on her hat. sam sticks a label that says "plane" on his plane.

they look at their paper shapes with labels. they are more happy and proud.

"let's show mommy and daddy!" lily says.

"ok, but we have to be quiet," sam says. "they are working in the other room."

they hold their paper shapes with labels and tiptoe to the other room. they are very quiet. they knock on the door softly.

"come in," mommy says.

lily and sam open the door and show their paper shapes with labels.

"look what we made!" they say.

mommy and daddy look at their paper shapes with labels. they smile and clap.

"wow, you are very creative!" mommy says.

"those are amazing!" daddy says.

they hug and kiss lily and sam. they tell them they are very proud of them.

lily and sam are very happy. they love their paper shapes with labels. they love their mommy and daddy. they have had a fun and quiet day.

once upon a time there was a little girl named jane. she was three years old and had a gray teddy bear she took everywhere with her. one day she decided to go for a ride on her little brown bike with her teddy in tow. she screamed with joy as she zoomed around the neighborhood. jane and her teddy bear were both wearing their helmets, ready to go.

all of a sudden they both noticed a funny looking thing on the side of the road. it was gray, chunky and had two little wheels on it. jane shouted out to her teddy, "let's go check it out!"

they stopped their bikes and pushed the thing around. jane wasn't sure what it was but she thought it was fun, so she jumped on for a ride. she pushed the handles down and soon she was flying around like a bird!

jane laughed with delight as she rode the thing around and around, a big smile plastered on her face. after a few minutes, she finally stopped to catch her breath. she and her teddy waved good-bye to the gray thing and hopped back on their bikes.

they both rode off into the sunset, back to jane's home, with stories about the funny gray thing for jane to tell.

john and his mom were taking a walk. as they walked, they saw a cute little puppy. his mom bent down and said, "oh, hello there little pup!" 

the pup jumped and started to bark. john was scared and said, "mom, why is the pup barking?" 

his mom smiled and said, "that's his way of understanding us. he's just trying to say hello." 

john looked at the pup with wonder and said, "oh, okay." they continued their walk and stopped in front of a pet store. his mom took out a label and said, "this label is for the pup. we can take him home with us." 

john asked, "are we taking him home?" his mom said, "yes, but only if you understand how to take care of him." 

john was so excited. he couldn't believe that he was going to get a cute little puppy. the pup was his and he would learn how to take good care of him. 

at the end of their walk, they had a new family memberâ€”the cute pup. he was with them forever, and john had a great understanding of how to take care of him.

once upon a time there were two friends named farrah and jake. one day, jake said to farrah, "let's go in a taxi!" farrah excitedly agreed and soon they were off to the taxi.

the taxi was big and yellow and it had thick windows. when farrah and jake got in, the driver said, "where would you like to go?". farrah and jake told the driver their destination and the driver said, "it'll cost you five dollars." 

farrah and jake gave the driver five dollars and they went on their way. as they drove, farrah and jake looked outside the thick windows and watched the scenery go by. soon, they arrived at the beach and farrah said, "let's go  swimming!"

the friends took off their shoes and dipped their toes in the water. after a few seconds, they noticed that the water was getting deeper and soon they could not touch the bottom. farrah and jake looked at each other, understanding they would have to find a way to get back to land. suddenly, the driver from the taxi came by in a boat and said, "need a ride back?".

once there was a big beetle who was a very good friend to a little boy. the beetle was always around and gave the boy lots of love.

one day the little boy thought he had a good idea. he wanted to give the beetle a surprise. so, he put a big piece of cheese in the beetle's path.

when the beetle saw the big piece of cheese, he was so happy. he stopped and started eating the cheese. the little boy was very pleased to receive the beetle's big smile of thanks.

from then on, whenever the beetle saw the little boy, he gave him a big smile and the boy knew why. they were good friends.

tim and kim are twins. they like to play with their toys and read books. but they do not like to go to bed. they say they are not sleepy and they want to stay up.

one night, their mom says, "it is time for bed, tim and kim. you have to sleep and rest. tomorrow is a new day."

tim and kim say, "no, mom, we do not want to sleep. we want to play more. please, mom, let us play."

mom says, "no, tim and kim, you have to sleep. if you do not sleep, you will be tired and grumpy. you will not have fun tomorrow. you will not learn new things. you will not be happy. now, go to bed and sleep."

tim and kim are sad and angry. they go to their room and get into their beds. but they do not sleep. they whisper to each other and make plans. they say, "we will wait until mom is asleep. then we will sneak out of our room and play with our toys. we will have fun and we will not be sleepy."

they wait and wait until they hear mom snore. then they get out of their beds and tiptoe to the living room. they see their toys and books on the floor. they smile and run to them. they start to play and laugh.

but they do not see the big glass vase on the table. they do not see the cat sleeping on the couch. they do not see the window open and the wind blowing.

the wind makes the vase wobble. the vase falls and breaks. the cat wakes and hisses. the noise scares tim and kim. they scream and cry.

mom hears the scream and the crash. she wakes and runs to the living room. she sees the mess and the twins. she is angry and worried. she says, "tim and kim, what are you doing? why are you not in bed? why did you break the vase? why did you wake the cat? why did you make so much noise?"

tim and kim are sorry and scared. they say, "we are sorry, mom. we did not want to sleep. we wanted to play. we did not see the vase and the cat and the window. we did not mean to make trouble. please, mom, do not be mad. please, mom, comfort us."

mom says, "tim and kim, i am mad and sad. you did not listen to me. you did not obey me. you did not respect me. you did not sleep. you made a bad choice. you caused a problem. you have to face the consequences. you have to clean the mess. you have to apologize to the cat. you have to go back to bed. and you have to stay there until morning. no more playing. no more talking. no more fun. only sleep."

tim and kim are very sorry and very sad. they do what mom says. they clean the mess. they say sorry to the cat. they go back to bed. but they do not sleep. they cry and cry. they wish they had listened to mom. they wish they had slept. they wish they had not played. they wish they had not broken the vase. they wish they had not woken the cat. they wish they had not made noise. they wish they had not made mom mad and sad.

the moral of the story is: you should listen to your mom and go to bed when she says so. if you do not, you will not have fun, you will make trouble, and you will make mom mad and sad. sleep is good for you and mom knows best.

once upon a time, there was a big park with lots of trees and flowers. one day, a little boy went to the park with his mommy. they saw a river and in the river, there was an otter! the otter was swimming and playing in the water. the little boy was so happy to see the otter. he said, "mommy, look at the otter! it's so cute!" 

suddenly, they heard a loud noise. it was a big truck driving by the park. the noise scared the otter and it swam away. the little boy was sad that the otter left, but he still had fun playing in the park with his mommy. they played on the swings and went down the slide. the little boy loved going to the park and seeing all the animals that lived there.

bella was so excited. she had been invited to her first ever birthday party! she was going to the park and her best friend annie was going to be there too.

when they arrived, the park was full of children. everyone was playing games and celebrating. bella felt so happy.

bella and annie decided to go to the slide. as they reached the top, bella noticed something strange. it was a pale video camera! she asked annie what it was for.

â€œoh, that's for my birthday surprise,â€ said annie. â€œmy dad is going to make a video of all of us playing together. itâ€™s going to be so much fun!â€

bella was so excited that she started to climb up again. as she got back to the top, the slide suddenly started to move. everyone was screaming as it quickly went down the steep hill. bella was scared but suddenly annie grabbed her hand.

at the bottom, everyone was ok but full of joy. annie's dad quickly started recording a video of all of them celebrating and laughing together.

bella thought the slide must have been part of annie's surprise! it was the best day ever.

once upon a time, a girl called jessie wanted an apple. she looked around but all the apples were dark. she did not like dark apples. so she was sad and started to suffer. 

then something special happened. a big bird flew down and dropped an apple right in front of her. jessie was happy and excited. she picked up the apple and it was bright and red - the perfect apple! 

jessie's frown turned into a smile. she bit into the apple - it was so tasty! she ate the whole apple and felt much better. no more suffering for jessie. 

the lesson jessie learned was that if you wait, something special will come.

once there was a girl called sarah. she was three years old and she loved playing in the park. sarah loved to find the biggest bench and rub it. 

the bench was very pale and smooth. sarah liked the feeling of rubbing it. she would rub her tiny hands back and forth on the bench. sarah's mom watched from afar and laughed as sarah was having so much fun. 

sarah and her mom stayed in the park all afternoon. they watched the birds and played on the swing and slide. before heading home, sarah had to rub the bench one last time. so she did. she rubbed it with her tiny hands and gave it one big hug. 

then it was time to go home, so sarah and her mom said goodbye to the pale bench and walked away. sarah couldn't help but smile as she thought about how much fun she had in the park. she looked forward to her next visit and another chance to rub the pale bench.

john was in his room, feeling a little bit sad. he wanted to do something fun, but he didn't know what. he looked around the room, but nothing seemed to catch his eye. then he saw it, a big armchair tucked away in the corner of the room. he had never noticed it before, so he thought it must have been there for a long time.

john ran to it, jumping with joy. he loved how light it was and he just wanted to curl up and cozy. he realized this was exactly what he was hoping for. he begged his mom to let him use it.

"of course, dear!" his mom said, with a big smile. 

john squealed with delight and plopped himself down into the armchair. he realized how comfortable it was, and he smiled.

john spent lots of time in his light armchair, finding new things that brought him joy. he was so happy that he had realized it was there.

once upon a time, there was a kind duck named ducky. ducky lived in a big pond with many other ducks. they all loved to play and splash in the water all day long.

one day, the ducks had a fun race in the pond. the winner would get a prize. ducky wanted to win the prize, but so did all the other ducks. they all lined up and got ready to race.

the race started and all the ducks began to splash and swim as fast as they could. ducky swam very fast, but so did the other ducks. in the end, ducky won the race and got the prize. all the other ducks were happy for ducky and they all continued to play and splash in the pond together.

once upon a time there was a little bear. he was a very happy bear, who loved to play.

one day he spotted a butterfly, and he was so excited. he wanted to catch it, but it was too high up in the sky. he tried and tried to catch it, but his little paws just couldn't reach high enough.

he got so frustrated. he started to clap his paws together and before he knew it, the butterfly landed in his paw. he was so delighted! he ran around, clapping his paws and chasing the butterfly.

the little bear was very happy. he had been able to catch his butterfly, and it made him smile.

once there were two friends, jeff and joe. they liked to have fun together in the park. one day when they were playing they saw something strange appear in the sky. it was a tiny little light. it was winking at them!

"what is that?" jeff asked joe.

joe just shrugged his shoulders and said he didn't know. suddenly the light came closer and started talking to the boys.

"hello boys, i'm sparkle the star. i appear to you today to ask you a question. are you honest boys?" sparkle asked.

jeff and joe looked at each other, their eyes wide with surprise. jeff was the first to speak.

"yes, we are honest," he replied.

sparkle smiled and gave them each a gentle wink.

"that's good to hear. remember to always be honest, no matter what." then, sparkle vanished as quickly as she had appeared.

jeff and joe looked at each other in amazement and laughed. they knew it was a special day and they would never forget sparkle's wise words.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called lucy. she was only three years old, but extremely brave for her age. every morning, lucy would visit a big green hill outside her house.

one day, lucy reached the top of the hill and saw something that made her sigh. it was a teaspoon, but not just any teaspoon - it was a black teaspoon! "where did this come from?," she asked.

just then, a friendly old butterfly flew up to lucy and said, "i can tell you, little one. the black teaspoon is magic. it gives wishes to anyone who holds it."

lucy was so excited, she jumped and clapped her hands. she grabbed the black teaspoon and whispered her wish. then she sighed contentedly, wondering what would happen next.

back home, lucy waited and waited. soon enough, her wish came true - and it was better than she ever imagined! even though lucy was only three years old, she knew she had been given a wonderful gift. 

she thought of the magic black teaspoon and smiled.

once upon a time, there was a clumsy duck named ducky. ducky lived in a big pond with many other ducks. ducky was not like the other ducks, he was always falling and making a mess.

one day, ducky wanted to help his friends. they were trying to sort their toys into different piles. ducky tried his best, but he was so clumsy that he kept knocking the piles over.

ducky felt sad, but his friends told him not to worry. they all worked together to sort the toys again. in the end, ducky learned that even clumsy ducks can be helpful with the support of good friends. and they all played happily ever after.

once upon a time, a little boy named timmy wanted to go fishing. he asked his dad if they could go, but his dad said they needed a special pole to catch the fish. the pole was very expensive, so timmy's dad said they needed to save up some money first.

timmy decided to help his dad earn some money. he went around the neighborhood asking if anyone needed help. he helped his neighbor carry groceries and even helped his mom complete some chores around the house.

after a few weeks, timmy and his dad had enough money to buy the expensive pole. they went to the store and bought the pole, feeling very happy and proud of themselves. they went fishing and caught lots of fish together, making it a complete and wonderful day.

max was very happy. he was playing in his garden. suddenly, he noticed a heavy start falling from the sky. it was beautiful! max carefully walked to the start, and picked it up in his hands. he wanted to keep the start forever! max ran inside the house, and showed the start to his mom. his mom was so happy. she said, "max, come outside and we can play with the start together!" max and his mom had so much fun playing together. max will never forget the day he found the heavy start.

once upon a time, there were two friends who were playing in the park. they were having lots of fun and enjoying the sunny day.

suddenly, they heard the sound of clapping. they looked around and saw everyone in the park was applauding. they were very surprised, but then they noticed there was a clown in the middle of the park, twirling around a hose.

everyone was laughing and having a great time watching the clown water people with his hose. they both laughed and clapped as the clown sprayed people with water.

at the end of the show, the clown gave all the kids a yummy lollipop, then he bowed goodbye to everyone.

the two friends waved goodbye, feeling excited from the enjoyable show. they were so happy that they started to applaud again, and everyone else in the park clapped too.

once upon a time, there was a dog named max. max was a good dog, always happy and loyal to his family. one day, max went for a walk in the park with his family. it was fall season and the leaves were orange and brown. max loved to run and play in the leaves.

as max was running, he stumbled on a big stick and fell down. his family ran over to make sure he was okay. max got up and shook himself off. he was fine! max's family was proud of him for being so brave.

after that, max continued to run and play in the leaves. he was having so much fun! when it was time to go home, max was tired but happy. he had a great day with his family in the park.

once upon a time, there was a jolly bear. he was always cheerful and friendly. he loved to have friendly conversations with everyone he met! one day, he was walking in the forest and he saw a little boy in the distance. the bear waved to the boy, and the boy waved back. 

the bear and the boy started to chat. the boy was amazed by the bear's kind words and they became fast friends. the bear asked the boy, "would you like to discuss something?" the boy happily agreed!
 
the bear and the boy discussed many different things. they talked about the trees, the sky, the birds and about what kind of fun stories the bear knew. eventually, the little boy had to go home. 

before the boy left, the bear gave him a big hug. they both said goodbye, and the bear watched the happy boy walk away. the bear smiled, content that he had made a new friend.

one morning, sam woke up and stretched. he was a fat little boy and he loved to play. he went to the kitchen and saw a bar of soap on the counter. he picked it up and said, "what is this?"

his mom smiled at him and said, "that's soap, sam. you can use it to get clean when you take a bath!"

sam loved taking baths, so he took the soap and ran off to the bathroom. he was getting ready to climb into the tub when he slipped and dropped the soap. 

his mom came running in and said, "oh no, sam! i guess we'll need to clean up this mess." she bent down and started to pick up the pieces of broken soap.

sam ran over and helped his mom pick up the pieces. "that's it," his mom said. "let's stretch our arms and have a big hug!" he wrapped his fat little arms around his mom and squeezed tight. 

"thanks for your help, sam," she said, giving him a kiss on the cheek. "now, let's get ready for your bath!"

once upon a time there was a little girl called hannah. she was curious and liked to explore. one day, she was walking in the woods, looking for something interesting.

suddenly, she saw a yellow branch. it looked interesting, so she decided to open it. when she opened the branch, she found a nest of baby birds inside. she was so excited. 

the baby birds were yellow and so fluffy. hannah wanted to stay and play with them, but she knew she had to leave them alone. gently, she put the branch back, and carried on walking.

the end

once upon a time there was a little girl named sally. sally was only three years old and very adventurous. 
one day, sally decided to take a stroll in her backyard. she saw a cute bookcase in the middle of the garden. she was so excited that she decided to step closer to take a better look. suddenly, her mom shouted from the kitchen, "sally, don't step too close. you might get hurt!". sally nodded quickly, and stepped away from the bookcase. 

sally looked around the garden and noticed something sparkly lying on the grass. she stepped closer and saw that it was a shiny rock. she smiled and looked up to her mom. "mommy! look what i found!" she exclaimed. her mom laughed and smiled. "that's so cute, sally!" 

sally picked up the rock and continued exploring the backyard. she explored different flowers, whistled with the birds, but mostly she admired the cute bookcase. she was stopped by a small insect, who then asked her if she wanted to play. sally smiled and nodded. 

the two of them ran around the bookcase and laughed as they played. when the day was over, sally thanked the insect as he flew away. she smiled and stepped back inside the house, thrilled that she had such a wonderful day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went outside to check the mailbox. she was surprised to see that there was a letter inside from an unknown sender. 

lily asked her mom, "who sent this letter?" 

"i don't know, lily. it seems like a mystery," her mom replied. 

lily was curious, so she opened the letter. inside, she found a picture of a puppy and a note that said, "this is your new puppy. come to the animal shelter to pick him up!" 

lily was so excited that she ran to her mom and said, "mommy, we have to go to the animal shelter to get my new puppy!" 

her mom smiled and said, "okay, let's go!" and so, lily and her mom went to the animal shelter to find her new furry friend.

once there was a girl named jennie. she was three years old and very excited to go to the park. as she arrived, her childish eyes beamed with joy as she looked around. she could see many things to do and jumped right into the fun of the park. she wanted to explore each and every corner.

so, off she went, into the park. one by one, jennie would run up to a playground set, jump on it and then rush off to the next one. jennie laughed as she jumped around, feeling very happy and alive.

sometimes, she would stop and watch what other kids were doing. jennie was amazed and above all, jealous that they were playing together and having so much fun. her naive and ignorant mind did not know that she could join in the play and make new friends.

then, finally, she realized that she was just as important and could join in on the fun. she smiled and started to make new friends that same day. now, jennie visits the park almost every day, knowing she will be surrounded by both old and new friends. she always makes sure to jump around and enjoy all the fun!

once there was a human who was very clumsy. he often dropped things and stumbled around. one day he was feeling particularly clumsy and he tripped on a rock and landed on the ground.

as he lay in the dirt, a wise bird flew down and spoke to him:

"why are you so clumsy, human?" the bird asked.

the human replied, "i don't know. i just am."

the bird was quiet for a moment, then it said, "remember, human, be careful and mind how you move. clumsiness can get you into trouble."

the bird flew away and the human was left to think about what it had said. he realized he needed to be more careful when he moved and not be so clumsy.

the bird had reminded him to take care of himself. the human was thankful as he went on his way.

once upon a time, there was a dragon that could fly. he was very special because he was expensive. he loved to fly to different places and explore. everywhere he went he made new friends. one day he flew over a city and noticed a building with lots of colourful lights. he flew down closer and saw that it was a big toy store. it was very exciting! he watched children run around the store and pick out their favourite toys. he wanted to join in. he flew up to the window and looked inside. the toy he wanted most was very expensive. but it was too big to fly away with. the dragon was sad, until he realized that he had already made so many friends and had so many adventures. he was very happy and flew away.

once there was a little girl who was very lucky. she had a special lamp that she liked to play with. she would shake it and pretend it was her magic wand. one day she decided to shake it really hard. 

the little girl said out loud, "i'm shaking the lamp really hard!" 
but nothing happened. suddenly, the lamp started to shake and rattle on its own. it shook so hard that it broke into pieces. 

the little girl started to cry. she was no longer lucky, and her special lamp was gone forever.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, she found a tree with a big branch that hung low to the ground. she thought it would make a good swing, so she tied a rope to it.

lily swung on the branch all day long, but when it was time to go inside, she forgot to untie the rope. the next day, her little brother came to play in the yard. he saw the rope and thought it would be fun to swing too. but when he tried to swing, the rope broke and he fell to the ground.

lily realized that it was her fault for not taking down the rope. she apologized to her brother and promised to always remember to exit the swing and take down the rope when she was done. lily learned that it is important to be responsible and do good things for others.

once upon a time there was a little girl who could record ghost voices. but it was hard. she had to use a special tool to record the ghosts. everyday she would try but she couldn't quite hear them. 

one day, she decided that she needed to be harder. so, she focused all of her energy on recording ghost voices. when she was done, she heard a loud whisper! it was a ghost!

the ghost said, "hello! i'm a ghost and i'm here to help." the little girl was so happy and thankful. from then on, every time she recorded ghost voices, the ghost would come and help her. 

and so, the little girl and the ghost became great friends and recorded ghost voices together. they had so much fun!

once upon a time, there was a little girl called katie. she wanted to see something special, but she didn't know what it was. she looked around her room and suddenly, a radio appeared. it was a big, shiny radio and katie was so happy. 

katie decided to give it a try. she pressed the button with a big smile and music came out of the radio. she started to dance and she was very fit in all her moves. she was so excited, she couldn't believe it.

katie listened to her music all day and she was very, very happy. when it was time to go to bed, she hugged the radio and said good night.

the next morning, katie woke up and the radio was still there. she was so glad it was still her friend. she kept dancing and listening to the music. 

katie and her radio were best friends, and she was so happy to have it!

once upon a time, there was a little girl. every day she would help her mom at the grocery store. the little girl would supply all the food and drinks for the customers.

one day, a special customer came in to the store. she smiled at the little girl and said, â€œi think you have done a great job today. can i give you a reward?â€

the little girl was so excited. she clapped her hands together and said, â€œyes, please.â€

the customer gave the little girl a big box. inside the box was a spicy brownie. it looked delicious.

the little girl was delighted with her reward. she said, â€œthank you! i love my reward.â€

the customer smiled and said, â€œyouâ€™re very welcome.â€

the little girl enjoyed her spicy treat and told her mom that sheâ€™d been given a very special reward!

today was a very special day for a little boy called peter. he was about to have his first bath by himself. as he stepped into the warm, bubbly water, he couldn't help but feel a little bit scared.

his mom, who was standing by watching him, could see the fear in his eyes. she said, in a very friendly voice, "don't worry, peter. remember your name. everything's going to be alright."

peter smiled and nodded his head, feeling a little bit more brave. but then, he noticed the water was getting tangled in his hair. he started to fear it and tried to get out of the bathtub.

his mom said, "it's okay. i'll help you to untangle your hair and make it all better. you just have to stay in there and relax."

peter reluctantly settled back in the tub and gradually, with his mom's help, the water was tamed and the tangles in his hair disappeared.

soon, the water was starting to get cold. peter's mom helped him out of the tub and onto the cozy towel. peter smiled a big, happy smile. he felt so proud for having had a bath all by himself.

john was an ordinary boy. he was playing in his backyard. suddenly, he saw something! it was a clown! he was wearing a funny hat and funny clothes.

john ran up to the clown and said, "hi! what's your name?"

the clown said, "i'm mr. chuckles! what's yours?"

john said, "my name is john. what do you do?"

mr. chuckles said, "i'm a clown and i like to make people laugh and have fun."

john smiled. he asked, "can i play with you?"

mr. chuckles said, "of course! let's play!"

john and mr. chuckles played for a long time. john enjoyed their game so much. eventually, it was time for the clown to go.

john said goodbye to mr. chuckles and waved as the clown drove away. he had a lot of fun playing today and he knew he would never forget this special day.

once upon a time, there was a silly cow named bessie. bessie lived on a big farm with lots of other animals. one day, bessie went to the pond to drink some water. she saw some ducks swimming and wanted to join them, so she jumped in the pond and got all wet. 

after playing in the pond, bessie walked back to the farm. she was so wet that she decided to lay in the sun to dry off. but then, she saw a big puddle of mud and thought it would be fun to roll around in it. so she did! 

when bessie got back to the farm, all the other animals laughed at her. they said she looked stupid with mud all over her. but bessie didn't care. she was happy and having fun. she went to the ranch and ate some hay, then went to sleep. she dreamed about soaking in the pond with her new duck friends. the end.

once there was a little girl called ella. she was only three years old. she liked to see different things.

one day ella asked her mum, "what's a dictionary?"  her mum laughed and said, "it's a book with lots of words."

so that day ella decided to go and find a dictionary. after a while she saw a smelly old bookshop. inside it she found a dictionary. the dictionary was old and smelly but ella was excited.

she flipped through the pages and found so many words. ella was happy and smiled.

ella said to her mum, "you were right, the dictionary is full of words!" her mum smiled and said, "yes, now you can see lots of words in this book."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she went to a restaurant with her family. the waiter gave them a menu to choose their food. lily liked the pictures on the menu and pointed at the burger.

her mom said, "that's too big for you, lily. you can have the chicken nuggets."

lily pouted and said, "no! i want the big burger!"

the waiter brought the food, but lily couldn't finish it. she tried to pour water on the burger to make it smaller, but it didn't work. she felt sad and cried.

the ancient statue in the corner of the restaurant saw her crying and said, "don't worry, little one. sometimes we make mistakes, but we can always try again next time."

lily smiled, but then accidentally knocked over her drink and spilled it all over the table. her mom got mad and they had to leave the restaurant early. lily felt embarrassed and sad that she didn't get to finish her burger.

kevin was walking around looking at all the trees. he saw something shiny on the ground, and he bent down to take a closer look. it was a big, heavy mirror. he was so excited. he looked in the mirror and saw his big, happy smile! he couldn't believe how big and clear the mirror looked. 

he wanted to take the mirror home. he picked it up and tried to carry it, but it was so heavy he couldn't. he asked his mom to help him, and she said yes! 

when they got home, they put the mirror up in his bedroom. kevin loved looking at himself in the mirror. he would look at himself, smile and make silly faces. his friends thought it was so cool that he had a mirror in his room! 

kevin was so happy with his new mirror. he had a lot of fun with it, and he was very proud that he was able to take it home!

tom and sam are friends. they like to play outside. they have a big lawn with many toys. they have a ball, a bike, a car, and a kite.

one day, tom and sam want to fly the kite. they run to the lawn and look for the kite. but they cannot find it. they are sad.

"where is the kite?" tom asks.

"i don't know. maybe someone took it," sam says.

"who took it? why did they take it?" tom says.

they look around. they see a big tree near the lawn. they see something in the tree. it is the kite!

"look! the kite is in the tree!" sam says.

"how did it get there?" tom says.

"maybe the wind blew it there. or maybe a bird took it," sam says.

"we have to get it back. it is our kite," tom says.

they go to the tree. they try to reach the kite. but the tree is too high. they cannot get it.

they need help. they see a girl near the lawn. she is smart. she knows many things. her name is lily.

"hi, lily. can you help us?" tom says.

"what do you need?" lily says.

"our kite is in the tree. we cannot get it. can you help us get it?" sam says.

lily looks at the tree. she thinks. she has an idea.

"i have a rope. we can use the rope to get the kite," lily says.

she runs to her house. she gets the rope. she comes back to the tree.

she ties one end of the rope to the bike. she throws the other end of the rope over the kite. she pulls the rope. the kite comes down.

"yay! you did it! you got the kite!" tom and sam say.

they are happy. they thank lily. they give her a hug.

"you are smart, lily. you are a good friend," tom and sam say.

they take the kite. they fly it in the sky. they have fun. they are happy.

once upon a time there was a girl called jane. jane was three years old and loved wearing hats.
one day when she was playing in the park, she saw something pretty and blue appear. when she looked closely she noticed that it was a hat! jane thought it was really cool, so she put it on her head.

the hat was comfortable and jane liked the way it looked. she wanted to keep it, but it didn't seem to be available. jane was sad that she could not keep the hat, but she kept looking around the park and saw something else appear! it was a big, fluffy yellow hat. 

jane was so happy that she clapped! she tried it on her head and it fit perfectly. she was glad that it was available and she could keep it. from that day on, jane always wore a hat everywhere she went. 

the end.

once upon a time there was a shy animal. he was very quiet and he never made any noise. one day the animal needed help, but he couldn't find anyone.

suddenly, he saw a small child playing in the park. she had a toolbox in her hand. the animal was very shy, so he didn't want to intrude. but after a while, he decided to try and ask her for help.

he said in a quiet voice "excuse me, can you help me?" the little girl was surprised to hear an animal talking. she looked around to make sure no one else was there. when she saw that no one was looking, she smiled and said "yes, i can try".

the little girl took out her tools and started to fix the problem. the animal watched in amazement as she worked. after a while, she had fixed it! the animal was so happy and thanked the girl for her help. the girl smiled and said she was glad to help.

the animal said goodbye and went on his way with a feeling of happiness in his heart. the little girl couldn't help but smile, for she had helped someone in need.

once upon a time, there was a strong oak tree. it was tall, and it was big. it was so strong that nothing could make it fall down.

one day, a little bird saw the oak tree. the bird wanted to make a nest in the oak tree, so she asked if she could build a nest.

the oak tree was so kind that it allowed the bird to build a nest. the bird was very happy, and so was the oak tree.

the little bird built her nest in the strong oak tree and she was very safe. she was so happy to be able to make her home in the strong oak tree!

there was a bright sun in the sky. andy was so happy. he put on his hat and went outside. he looked for something to do. he saw a puddle on the ground and grabbed a bucket of water. he wanted to clean it up. he filled the bucket and began to dump the water into the puddle. he winked with a big grin on his face because he was having so much fun. the water made the puddle sparkle and shine. he kept pouring until the puddle was clean. when it was done, he let out a cheer and then ran off to find something else to do.

tim and mia are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big pond. they want to see what is in the pond.

they go near the pond and look. they see fish and frogs and ducks. they also see a big green thing. it has a long mouth and many teeth. it is an alligator.

tim and mia are scared. they want to run away. but the alligator is not mean. it is friendly. it comes out of the pond and wags its tail. it wants to play with tim and mia.

tim and mia are curious. they touch the alligator. it is wet and rough. they see that it is clean. it has no dirt or bugs on it. they think it is nice.

the alligator likes tim and mia. it licks them with its tongue. it makes a happy sound. it wants to kiss them. tim and mia giggle. they kiss the alligator back. they are not scared anymore. they are friends with the alligator.

once there was a tall man who wanted to organize a party. he invited all of his friends on the same day. he found a big piano and started to play it. the music was so beautiful his friends wanted to dance.

the tall man said, "let's organize a dance!" everyone agreed and started to move around in different directions. some of them were hopping, others were skipping, but all of them had a lot of fun.

suddenly, the music stopped. everyone stopped dancing and asked the tall man what happened. he said, "i'm sorry, the piano is old and the strings broke." everyone was very sad, but the tall man said, "don't worry, i will organize another party very soon." everyone smiled and said, "we will be there!"

once upon a time, there was a boy named tom. tom was a very glad boy. he loved to play outside in the sun. 

one day, tom's mom was making corn for dinner. tom smelled the yummy corn and shouted with joy. tom's mom said, "tom, come get some corn!" 

tom was so glad that he shouted and ran to the kitchen. he saw the big pot of corn and he shouted even louder. tom's mom smiled and gave tom a big spoonful of corn. tom smiled and shouted with delight. 

tom ate the delicious corn and thanked his mom. tom was so glad he shouted and shouted until it was time to go to bed. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a nosy bear named mona. she always liked to look around and explore new things. one day, she decided to go for a walk outside. mona noticed some celery in a garden nearby and thought it looked tasty. she thought it would be the perfect snack for her walk.

mona grabbed some celery and started to eat. as she ate, she noticed a pond. mona thought maybe she should take a quick bathe. before she knew it, she was swimming around in the pond! she splashed and played in the water, having lots of fun.

mona was happy and refreshed after her swim. she enjoyed a nice celery snack in the garden afterwards and headed back home. she was feeling relaxed, content, and nosy - just as she normally does.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the snow. one day, she saw a big igloo in her backyard. it was so cool! she ran inside to tell her mommy and daddy. 

when they came outside, they were surprised to see the igloo too. they asked lily if she knew who made it, but she didn't know. they thought it was silly and stupid to build an igloo in their backyard, but lily thought it was amazing. 

she begged her parents to let her play in the igloo, and they finally said yes. lily had so much fun playing in the igloo, pretending she was in a secret castle. she was so happy and grateful to have such a fun surprise in her backyard.

once upon a time, there was a little pig. the pig lived in a house made of bricks. the pig loved his brick house, it kept him safe from the big bad wolf.

one day, the pig went outside to play in the mud. he found a seed and decided to plant it. the pig watered the seed every day and watched it grow. soon, it became a big tree.

but one day, a storm came and a big branch fell and hit the pig's brick house. the pig was very sad because his house was broken. he tried to fix it with more bricks, but it didn't work.

the pig was very worried because he didn't want to be homeless. but then he remembered the big tree he grew. he used the wood from the tree to fix his house. now, the pig had a new house that was even better than before. he was very happy and went to bed with a big smile on his face.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat yummy food but sometimes she got sick because she ate too much candy. one day, her mommy said, "lily, we need to prepare a healthy dinner tonight."

lily asked, "what is healthy?"

mommy said, "healthy means food that is good for your body and helps you grow strong. we will season our chicken with herbs and spices to make it taste good and good for you."

lily helped her mommy prepare the dinner by washing the vegetables and setting the table. when they sat down to eat, lily said, "this is delicious and healthy too!"

mommy smiled and said, "i'm glad you like it, lily. eating healthy helps us feel good and stay healthy."

once there was a small robot who liked to swing in the park. he was really brave and always swinging high. one day the robot was swinging and he saw a dirty park bench. he stopped swinging and decided to clean it up.

he tried to lift it and started to talk: "oh no, i can't lift this bench. i'm too small!"

just then, an old man appeared and said: "come, i'm sure we can lift it together."

so the robot and the old man lifted the bench together and it was soon sparkling clean.

the robot was happy he had helped make the park clean and said thanks to the old man. as they were walking away the old man said: "teamwork makes everything possible. remember, together we are stronger!".

the robot was so happy and he went off to enjoy swinging again, but this time he thought about how working together made everything better.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named emma. emma was only three and she loved to explore. one day, she found a mysterious chamber in the woods. she was very excited and went inside to take a look.

when she got inside, she noticed that it was very dusty. she wanted to repair it. she thought, "maybe i can find something to fix it!" so she looked around and found a long piece of wood. 

she took it and tried to use it to repair one of the broken walls. but it was too hard for her and she was struggling. suddenly, a voice spoke from behind her. "maybe i can help you!"

emma turned around and saw an old man. she asked him if he could help, and he gladly agreed. the old man was very clever, and with his help, she managed to repair the chamber. 

when they finished, emma was very happy. she thanked the old man, who said: "you can always repair things if you have the right help. good friends can make all the difference."

the moral of this story is that it is good to have friends to help you out when you need it. friends can make even the toughest task seem easy.

tom likes to play with his motorcycle. it is red and shiny and makes a loud noise. he likes to ride it around the yard and pretend he is a racer. he wears a helmet and gloves and a jacket.

one day, he hears a ring at the door. he stops his motorcycle and runs to see who it is. he hopes it is his friend sam, who also has a motorcycle. he likes to play with sam and race with him.

but it is not sam. it is a lady with a big smile and a pretty dress. she has a box in her hands. she says, "hello, tom. i am your aunt lisa. i came to visit you and bring you a present."

tom is surprised. he does not know his aunt lisa. he looks at the box and wonders what is inside. he says, "hello, aunt lisa. what is in the box?"

aunt lisa says, "why don't you open it and see? i think you will like it very much."

tom opens the box and gasps. it is a new motorcycle. it is blue and shiny and has stickers on it. it is bigger and faster than his old one. he is very happy. he says, "wow, thank you, aunt lisa. this is the best present ever. can i try it?"

aunt lisa says, "of course you can. but be careful and wear your helmet. and maybe you can share it with sam when he comes over."

tom hugs his aunt lisa and says, "you are very nice and very pretty. i am glad you came to visit me. can we play with my motorcycles together?"

aunt lisa says, "sure, why not? i like motorcycles too. let's go and have some fun."

once there was a robot. it was eager to find something it could do. one day it thought of balancing. so the robot started to try to balance. it was tricky at first, but the robot kept trying. finally after several tries, the robot was able to balance on two legs for a few seconds. the robot was so eager and it couldn't wait to show its friends. it rushed off to find them. when the robot's friends saw it they were very impressed. they clapped and cheered. the robot was so proud. now it just had to keep practising to get better at balancing.

sara likes to write. she has a big book with many pages. she writes her name, her mom's name, and her cat's name. she draws pictures of flowers, stars, and rainbows. she is very happy when she writes.
