one day, sara finds a scale in the bathroom. she does not know what it is. she thinks it is a toy. she puts it on the floor and steps on it. the scale makes a beep sound and shows a number. sara does not know what the number means. she thinks it is a game.

she calls her mom. "mom, look at this! i found a new toy. it makes a sound and shows a number. can you play with me?"

mom comes to the bathroom. she sees the scale and smiles. she explains to sara what the scale is for. she says it is not a toy, but a tool. she says it tells how much you weigh. she says it is important to be healthy and strong.

sara is curious. she asks her mom to weigh herself. mom steps on the scale. the scale makes a beep sound and shows a different number. sara looks at the number and says, "wow, mom, you are so hard!"

mom laughs. she hugs sara and says, "no, sweetie, i am not hard. i am heavy. hard means something else. hard means something that is not soft or easy. like a rock, or a puzzle, or a word you don't know."

sara nods. she thinks for a moment. she says, "i see. so, writing is hard for me, because i don't know many words. but i like writing, because it is fun and i can learn new words. and you are heavy, but you are not hard, because you are soft and kind and you help me learn."

mom smiles. she kisses sara and says, "that's right, my love. you are very smart and brave. and i am very proud of you. now, let's put the scale away and go back to your book. maybe you can write a story about the scale and what you learned today."

once upon a time there was a silly hedge living in a meadow. all the other creatures in the meadow wanted to play with the hedge and asked it to join in their games. the hedge didn't want to play, so it stayed alone in its corner of the meadow.

one day, the hedge decided to have some fun. it ran and hopped around the meadow and played tag with all its friends. everyone laughed together as the hedge jumped over the grass and flowers.
           
soon it was time for the hedge to go home. but the hedge was having so much fun that it decided not to go home for a while longer. so the hedge stayed and kept on playing with all its friends until it was dark.

when the hedge finally decided to go home, it said goodbye to all of its friends. they waved and wished the hedge a good night, and the hedge hopped away into the darkness.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy liked to play with his toys all day long, but he didn't like to take naps. one day, while timmy was playing, a cop came to his house. the cop told timmy that he was being too loud and that he needed to take a nap. timmy was upset because he didn't want to take a nap. 

timmy decided to hide under his bed so he wouldn't have to take a nap. but then he heard his mom talking to the cop. she told the cop that timmy needed to take a nap because he was getting too tired. timmy realized that his mom was right and he needed to take a nap. 

so, timmy took a nap and when he woke up he felt much better. he thanked his mom for making him take a nap and he promised to take naps every day. the cop came back to timmy's house and told him that he was proud of him for taking a nap. timmy was happy that he made the cop proud and he went back to playing with his toys. the end.

tom and anna like to play with their toys. they have a lot of cars, dolls, blocks and books. one day, they find a stand in the garage. the stand is big and has wheels. they think it is a fun toy.

"let's play with the stand!" tom says. "we can push it and make it go fast!"

"ok!" anna says. "but be careful. the stand is not ours. it is dad's."

they take the stand outside and push it on the sidewalk. they laugh and have fun. but then, tom pushes too hard. the stand hits a rock and falls over. one of the wheels breaks off.

"oh no!" tom says. "the stand is broken! what will we do?"

anna is scared. she sees dad coming home from work. he will be angry when he sees the stand.

"quick!" anna says. "let's try to repair the stand. maybe we can fix the wheel."

they look for something to repair the stand. they find some tape and a stick. they try to tape the stick to the wheel and the stand. but it does not work. the tape is not strong enough. the wheel falls off again.

dad sees them and the broken stand. he is not happy.

"tom, anna, what have you done?" dad says. "this is not a toy. this is my stand for my tools. you should not play with it. you could get hurt. and now it is broken. how will i work?"

tom and anna feel bad. they know they did something wrong.

"we are sorry, dad," tom says. "we did not know. we just wanted to play. we tried to repair the stand, but we could not."

dad sighs. he is not angry anymore. he is sad.

"i know, tom, i know," dad says. "but you have to be careful with things that are not yours. you have to ask before you use them. and you have to be gentle with them. the stand was very important to me. it was a gift from grandpa. he made it for me when i was a boy. it was very special."

tom and anna feel very sorry. they hug dad and say they are sorry again.

"dad, we are sorry," anna says. "we did not know. we love you. and we love grandpa. can we help you repair the stand?"

dad smiles. he hugs them back and says he loves them too.

"thank you, anna, thank you," dad says. "yes, you can help me repair the stand. we will need some glue and some nails and some wood. and we will need some time and some patience and some love. but we can do it. together."

lenny was a might rabbit. he was strong and brave, and he had a grand home deep in the woods. every day he went out to mark the area around his burrow, to make it his own.

one day, while lenny was out, he heard a snarl in the trees. he knew it was not a friendly sound. he was worried, he had never heard something like this before.

he went back to his burrow, quickly, in case something was coming to hurt him. but as he got closer, he was surprised to see a huge bear. he was not sure what it was doing, but it wasn't looking for a fight. it was actually marking the territory around lenny's home. 

lenny was hesitant at first, but both knew that trying to fight each other would only result in harm. so, rather than fight, they decided to make friends. from that day, lenny and the mighty bear vowed to protect the burrows, and to stand together against the dangers of the forest.

once upon a time, there was a frog called skip. skip was a very happy frog who liked to move around and have fun all day. 

one day, skip was hopping around near a stage. he saw all the people with the music playing and thought it would be a great place to move around and dance. but as soon as he hopped on to the stage, the music suddenly stopped and everyone became deaf. 

skip was so embarrassed and hopped away quickly, not wanting to interrupt the show. he realised that he must be careful and not move around in places where he should not. 

from that day onwards, skip was mindful of the places he moved to and stayed away from the stage. he made sure to move around his own pond, where he was safe and could still have fun. 

this story teaches us that no matter how exciting it may look, we must always think carefully before we move.

once upon a time, there was a big furry dog named max. max loved to run and play in the park with his friends. one day, max's owner gave him a big bone to chew on. max was very happy and started to chew the bone with his teeth. 

while max was chewing on his bone, he saw his friend, a little girl named lily, playing with a whip. the whip had a long string and made a loud noise when lily moved it around. max was curious and went over to see what lily was doing. 

lily showed max how to use the whip and they had a lot of fun playing together. after playing with the whip, max went back to his bone and continued to chew on it until it was all gone. the end.

john was playing in the garden one day. he saw a funny insect crawling on the ground. it was a small, dry beetle. john was surprised to see how quick the little bug was moving. he wanted to remember what the beetle looked like, so he focused and tried to picture it in his head.

john got up from the ground and looked around. he found a piece of paper and some colorful crayons and decided to draw the beetle. john drew a few circles for the bug's body and gave it some short, wiggly legs. he finished the drawing and smiled brightly.

john then looked around the garden one more time and noticed a different kind of insect. this one was small and it was flying in the air. john watched as the insect flew away into the sky. he remembered that there was a dry leaf nearby, so he went and got it. he put the leaf in the air, hoping the bug would land on it. the fly came down and rested on the dry leaf. john smiled, pleased that he could remember the little things.

tim and sue are friends. they like to play with toys. one day, they find a big box in the park. they open the box and see many new toys inside.

"wow, look at these toys!" tim says. "they are so nice and shiny. can we play with them?"

"i don't know, tim," sue says. "maybe these toys belong to someone else. maybe they will be sad if we take them."

"but they are not here, sue," tim says. "maybe they don't want them anymore. maybe they left them for us. please, can we play with them?"

sue thinks for a moment. she likes the toys too, but she is honest. she does not want to make someone else sad. she shakes her head.

"no, tim, we can't play with them," she says. "it is not right. we have to leave them here. maybe the owner will come back and find them."

tim is not happy. he wants to play with the toys. he does not listen to sue. he grabs a toy car and runs away.

"tim, come back!" sue calls. "don't do that!"

but tim does not come back. he plays with the toy car on the road. he makes loud noises and pretends to drive fast. he does not see the big truck coming.

the truck hits the toy car and breaks it. tim falls down and hurts his knee. he cries and cries. the toy car is broken. his knee is bleeding. he is cold and scared.

sue runs to tim and hugs him. she is sorry for him. she helps him get up and gives him a band-aid. she tells him to say sorry to the owner of the toy car.

tim is sorry too. he knows he was wrong. he says sorry to sue and to the owner of the toy car. he learns a lesson. he will not take things that are not his. he will listen to sue. she is his honest friend.

once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a nice lion named leo. leo had a secret magic power. when he roared, good things happened.

one day, leo met a little bird who was sad. the bird's nest was very high up in a tree, and she could not fly. leo asked, "why are you sad?" the bird said, "i can't get to my nest." leo wanted to help the bird.

leo thought about his magic roar. he said, "i will try to help you." leo roared very loud. the magic roar made the tree bend down. the bird was happy and said, "thank you, leo!" the bird flew to her nest, and they both became good friends.

tommy and emily do something very fun today. they decide to go to the reef! the reef sparkles in the sun and is orange from the setting sun. 
the two of them jump into the water, and soon they are surrounded by different fish and corals. they can see the most beautiful orange starfish on the reef. 
tommy and emily do lots of fun things on the reef. they play tag and look for colorful shells. they see a dolphin swimming past, and they even do a race to the shore! 
after a few hours, tommy and emily have had such a fun time at the reef, they can hardly believe it. they will make sure they come back soon to do more exploring.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to collect coins of all kinds. her favorite coin was a shiny gold one that her grandma had given her. it was very unique because it had a picture of a unicorn on it.

one day, lily decided to take her gold coin to the park to show her friends. she put it in her pocket and went on her way. as she was playing with her friends, she felt something warm in her pocket. she reached in and felt her coin. it had started to melt! she was so sad and didn't know what to do.

but then, she remembered something her grandma had told her. she took the coin out of her pocket and held it in her hand. she closed her eyes and made a wish. suddenly, the melted coin transformed into a beautiful golden unicorn figurine. lily was so happy and showed it to her friends. they were amazed and wanted one too. from that day on, lily's unique unicorn figurine became the talk of the town.

once upon a time, there was a fairy who was very thin. she wanted to go on an adventure, so she decided to pack her things. she put her wand, her wings, and some snacks in her bag. 

as she flew through the forest, she saw a family of rabbits. they were sad because they lost their carrots. the fairy used her wand to help them find their carrots. 

the rabbits were very happy and thanked the fairy. they gave her some carrots as a gift. the fairy was so happy and put the carrots in her bag. she knew she had made some new friends and would always remember this adventure.

james had always wanted to receive a truck. one day, he saw a red truck in the park. james ran up to it and said, "wow, is that truck for me?"

mama said, "yes james, this red truck is for you! i received it for you from daddy."
james was so happy that he jumped up and down and said, "thank you, mama and daddy!"

he opened the truck and saw that it had buttons and a stick inside. he started pushing the buttons and moving the stick.

mama said, "be careful, james. that truck is special and we don't want it to get broken."

james nodded and said, "okay, i will be careful!" he slowed down and started driving the truck around the park, very gently. he had so much fun! he was very happy to have received the red truck.

once there was a boy named jack. jack loved to explore the woods behind his house. one day, jack went to the woods and saw a beautiful old oak tree. he thought it looked fair. he wanted to measure it, but he didn't know how. he saw a long stick lying nearby and wonder if it would help him measure the tree.

he picked up the stick and started to measure the tree from the bottom to the top. he looked up and down the stick. he was so excited when the stick was the same size as the tree. he had successfully measured the oak tree! 

jack was proud of himself, and wanted to show all his friends. he gathered his friends around the tree and proudly told them he had measured it. his friends were impressed and said jack was very brave and smart. 

jack was very happy that he had been able to measure the beautiful oak tree and show it off to his friends. from that day on, jack always tried to measure things and show them off.

once upon a time there was a little girl who had a perfect dress. she loved it very much and she would rock in it all day.

one day, she asked her mom to put her dress on because she wanted to rock in it. her mom said yes and put the dress on the little girl.
but the dress was too big and it was getting all messy. her mom tried to make it fit better, but it didn't work.

the little girl was so sad. she wanted her dress to be perfect like it was before. she started to cry because it was not perfect anymore.

her mom was sad too, because she could not make her daughter's dress look perfect again.

so the little girl was stuck with an imperfect dress and she never rock in it again. the end.

once upon a time, there was a big tree with lots of leaves. one day, a silly squirrel climbed up the tree and started shaking the branches. the leaves began to move and fall down. the squirrel thought it was funny, but the tree didn't like it. 

the tree said to the squirrel, "stop being foolish and leave my leaves alone!" the squirrel didn't listen and kept shaking the branches. suddenly, a strong wind came and blew the squirrel away. 

the tree was happy that the squirrel was gone and its leaves could finally rest. from then on, the tree made sure to keep an eye out for any other foolish animals who might try to move its leaves.

lily and ben are friends. they like to play together at school. lily has a new toy. it is a pink car with a key. the key can make the car move. lily is very happy with her toy. she thinks it is the best toy ever.

one day, lily brings her toy to school. she shows it to ben and the other kids. they all want to see the car and the key. they say, "wow, that is a cool toy! can we play with it?" lily says, "yes, you can play with it, but be careful. the key is very important. if you lose the key, the car will not move."

lily lets ben and the other kids take turns with the car and the key. they have fun making the car go fast and slow, left and right. lily watches them and smiles. she is happy that her toy is popular. she thinks everyone likes her more because of her toy.

but then, something bad happens. ben has the car and the key. he wants to make the car go very fast. he pushes the key hard and the car zooms away. he runs after it, but he is not fast enough. the car goes out of the gate and into the street. ben hears a loud noise. he sees a big truck hit the car. the car breaks into pieces. the key flies away. ben is scared and sad. he does not know what to do.

he goes back to lily and the other kids. he says, "i'm sorry, lily. i broke your car. i lost your key. i did not mean to. it was an accident." lily looks at him. she is angry and sad. she says, "you are a bad friend, ben. you ruined my toy. you made me unhappy. i don't want to play with you anymore. go away." ben feels sorry and ashamed. he walks away. he has no friends. he has no toy. he has no key. he guesses he is very unlucky. he wishes he never saw the car and the key. he wishes he never played with them. he wishes he never met lily. he cries. the end.

lily and ben were friends who liked to play with puzzles. they had many puzzles with animals, cars, and flowers. one day, lily got a new puzzle with a big castle and a princess. she was very happy and wanted to show ben.

she called ben and said, "ben, come to my house. i have a new puzzle. it is very pretty and fun."

ben was curious and said, "ok, i will come. what is your puzzle?"

lily said, "it is a castle with a princess. you will see."

ben went to lily's house and knocked on the door. lily opened the door and said, "hi, ben. come in. my puzzle is in the living room."

ben entered the house and followed lily to the living room. he saw the puzzle on the table. it was very big and colorful. he saw the castle, the princess, and the flowers. he said, "wow, lily. your puzzle is very nice. can i help you?"

lily said, "yes, you can. but you have to be careful. the pieces are small and delicate. don't break them."

ben said, "ok, i will be careful. where do we start?"

lily said, "let's start with the castle. it is the hardest part."

they started to look for the pieces that matched the castle. they found some and put them together. they were having fun.

but then, ben saw a piece that had the princess's face. he liked the princess. she had a pretty dress and a crown. he wanted to put the piece in the puzzle. he reached for the piece.

but lily saw him and said, "no, ben. that is my piece. i want to put the princess in the puzzle. she is mine."

ben said, "but i want to help. i like the princess too. can't we share?"

lily said, "no, we can't. this is my puzzle. you have your own puzzles. go away."

ben felt sad and angry. he said, "you are mean, lily. you are not a good friend. you are jealous. i don't want to play with you anymore."

he grabbed the piece with the princess's face and ran out of the house. he didn't say goodbye.

lily was shocked and upset. she said, "ben, come back. don't take my piece. give it back."

but ben didn't listen. he ran away with the piece. he didn't care.

lily cried and cried. she looked at her puzzle. it was incomplete. the princess had no face. she felt lonely and sorry. she wished she had shared with ben. she wished he was still her friend.

one day, a little boy named tim got a new bicycle. he was very happy. he wanted to ride it all day long. the bicycle was red and shiny, and it had a bell that went "ring-ring!"

tim went outside to ride his bicycle. he saw a curious cat sitting near the road. the cat had big eyes and a fluffy tail. tim wanted to say "hi" to the cat, but he was riding too fast. so, he paused and stopped his bicycle.

when tim stopped, the cat came closer. it walked around the bicycle, sniffing and looking. tim laughed and said, "do you like my bicycle, cat?" the cat just looked at him and meowed. then, the cat ran away to play.

tim got back on his bicycle and started to ride again. he went up and down the street, feeling the wind in his hair. he was very happy with his new bicycle. and he knew the curious cat liked it too.

once upon a time there was a girl called emma. she was very messy. she had lots of clothes, but they were all messy too.

one day emma wanted to wear one of her dresses, but it was too big. she wanted it to be smaller.

she took her dress outside and tried to shrink it. she put the dress in the sun and the dress started to get smaller and smaller.

soon, emma's dress fit her perfectly. she was very happy. she could wear the dress to the party.

but other things were shrinking too - all of emma's messy clothes! so, she had lots of very small clothes but no clothes for the party. oh dear.

once there was a jolly little girl named susie. she loved to play baseball with her friends. every day they would gather at the park, bring their baseballs and have lots of fun.

one day, they were all playing a game. as they were running around, susie tripped over her baseball and fell down. everyone burst into laughter. susie started laughing too and soon they were all giggling and having a great time.

susie and her friends kept playing for hours. after a while, everyone was tired. they said goodbye and each went home with a smile on their faces.

the next day, they all met up again at the park to play baseball. everyone was happy and jolly, ready for another fun day throwing baseballs and laughing with each other.

once upon a time, there was a big boat. the boat was very large and it could sail on the sea. the boat had a captain who loved to sail. one day, the captain sailed the boat to an island. on the island, there was a dessert shop. the captain loved dessert, so he went to the shop to buy some. he bought a large chocolate cake and ate it all by himself. then, he sailed back to his home with a happy tummy. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to fly his kite on sunny days. one day, timmy's mommy said it was time to go home, but timmy didn't want to stop flying his kite. he felt very tired, but he didn't want to go home. 

timmy's mommy said they had to go home for dinner, so timmy reluctantly started to pack up his kite. as they walked home, timmy regretted not flying his kite for just a little bit longer. but when they got home, timmy's mommy made him his favorite dinner and he forgot all about his tiredness and regret.

once upon a time there was a boy named hal. he was very happy and liked to play in the sunshine. one day he saw a light in the sky, rising higher and higher. it was a balloon! hal wanted to go on the balloon but he couldnâ€™t reach it.

then he noticed something strange. he could feel the wind and smell a funny smell coming from the balloon - it smelled like gas.

hal asked his mom, â€œmom, can i go in the balloon?â€

his mom said, â€œno, hal. it is too high up and filled with gas. you would not be safe.â€

so hal watched the balloon rise higher and higher until it was just a tiny brown dot in the sky. he waved goodbye as it disappeared out of sight.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lola who loved to explore. one day, she went on an adventure. as she walked, she discovered a wagon in the grass. it was big, red, and looked very fun.

excitedly, lola got into the wagon. she grabbed hold of the handle and started to move. the wagon made a quiet squeak as it rolled along.

lola couldn't believe her luck! she drove and drove until the wagon stopped near a big, tall tree. the wagon had taken her to a wonderful new spot.

lola got out of the wagon and played around the tree. she found lots of pretty flowers and she heard some birds chirping. lola was so happy that she had discovered the wagon. she knew her adventure was only just beginning.

lily was sleeping in her bed when she heard a loud noise. it was an alarm. it was beeping and flashing in the dark. lily was scared. she did not know what the alarm was for. she trembled under her blanket.

she heard her mom and dad get up and run to the door. they opened it and saw a fireman. he was wearing a big hat and a yellow coat. he had a hose in his hand. he said, "don't worry, there is a small fire in the building next door. we are putting it out. you are safe here."

lily's mom and dad thanked the fireman. they closed the door and went back to lily's room. they turned on the light and hugged lily. they said, "it's okay, lily. the alarm was to warn us of the fire. the fireman is a helper. he is not an unknown person. he is a friend. he is here to protect us."

lily felt better. she stopped trembling. she smiled at her mom and dad. she said, "i love you. thank you for being with me." they said, "we love you too. you are very brave." they kissed her and tucked her in. they turned off the light and stayed with her until she fell asleep. the alarm stopped beeping and flashing. the fire was out. lily had a peaceful dream.

once, there was a family. they lived in a house filled with blooming flowers. the flowers were all different colours, but the prettiest was a black flower.

every day, the family took turns to water the black flower so it would keep blooming. soon the flower was so big and beautiful that it filled the house with joy.

one day, the family went away for a holiday. but even though they were away, the black flower kept on blooming for them.

when the family came back, they were amazed to see the flower still blooming! they were so happy and said it was like magic.

the family continued to take care of the black flower and it kept blooming every day. they would often gather around it just to admire its beauty. this made everyone in the family smile!

tim and kim are playing with blocks. they like to make towers and houses with the blocks. they add more and more blocks to their towers and houses. they are happy.

but then the wind comes. the wind is angry. it blows hard and fast. it knocks down tim and kim's towers and houses. the blocks fall and scatter. tim and kim are sad and angry.

"wind, go away!" tim shouts. "you are bad! you broke our towers and houses!"

"wind, stop!" kim cries. "you are mean! you made us lose our blocks!"

but the wind does not listen. it keeps blowing and blowing. it makes noise and mess. tim and kim are scared and mad.

they run to their mom. she is in the kitchen. she is making cookies. she sees tim and kim. they are holding each other. they are crying.

"what's wrong, my loves?" mom asks. "why are you crying?"

"the wind, mom, the wind!" tim says. "it is angry! it knocked down our towers and houses!"

"the wind, mom, the wind!" kim says. "it is mean! it made us lose our blocks!"

mom hugs tim and kim. she kisses them. she is sorry.

"i know, my loves, i know," mom says. "the wind can be angry and mean sometimes. but it can also be gentle and nice. it can make kites fly and leaves dance. it can cool us down and bring us fresh air. the wind is not always bad."

"really, mom?" tim asks. "the wind can be nice?"

"really, mom?" kim asks. "the wind can be good?"

"yes, my loves, yes," mom says. "the wind can be nice and good. but today it is not. today it is angry and mean. so let's go inside and have some cookies. and later, when the wind is calm, we can go outside and play with the blocks again. and we can add more and more blocks to our towers and houses. and we can be happy."

tim and kim smile. they nod. they like cookies. they like blocks. they like mom. they are not sad and angry anymore. they are glad and hopeful. they go inside with mom. they have some cookies. they wait for the wind to be nice and good. they are happy.

tom and mia are friends. they like to play with toys. one day, they find an old box in the attic. the box is tight and hard to open. they pull and push, but the box does not open.

"maybe there is something good inside," tom says.

"maybe there is something shiny," mia says.

they look for something to open the box. they see a big hammer. tom picks up the hammer and hits the box. the box breaks open. inside, they see a lot of old things. they see a hat, a book, a doll, and a spoon.

"what is this?" mia asks, holding the spoon. the spoon is dirty and dull.

"it is a spoon," tom says. "you use it to eat soup."

"i know that," mia says. "but why is it so ugly?"

tom shrugs. he does not know. he sees a cloth on the floor. he picks up the cloth and rubs the spoon. the spoon becomes shiny and bright.

"wow!" mia says. "you made it pretty!"

tom smiles. he likes to polish things. he gives the spoon to mia.

"here, you can have it," he says.

"thank you!" mia says. she hugs tom. they are happy. they polish more things and make them pretty. they have fun with the old things. they forget about the hammer and the box.

tom was walking through the garden when he saw something on the ground. it was a caterpillar. he thought it looked strange because it was very still. he squatted down to have a closer look. it was dead. 

he didn't want to leave it in the garden, so he carefully picked it up. tom took it back to his house and put it on a plate. then he took some small stones from outside and carefully replaced each of the caterpillar's legs with a stone. when he was done, he put the caterpillar back in the garden. 

tom smiled to himself. the caterpillar wasn't dead anymore â€“ it was a garden decoration! he knew it would stay there forever, watching over the garden.

one day, a little cat named daisy decided to wander away from her home. she walked and walked until she saw a big, heavy rock. daisy tried to push the rock, but it was too heavy for her.

as daisy sat by the rock, a stranger came by. the stranger was a big, friendly dog named max. max asked daisy, "do you need help with the heavy rock?" daisy nodded her head and said, "yes, please."

max used his big paws to push the heavy rock. with max's help, daisy could move the rock. they both laughed and played together. after a while, daisy and max became good friends. they wandered back to daisy's home and played together all day.

tom and sue are friends. they like to play in the park. they have a ball, a bike and a kite. they have fun.

but one day, the sky is dark and the wind is strong. tom and sue hear a loud noise. it is thunder. they are scared.

"let's go home!" sue says. "we need to be safe!"

but tom does not want to leave. he likes his kite. he wants to fly it in the wind.

"no, i want to play!" tom says. "the kite is fun!"

sue is sad. she does not want to play. she wants to go home. she thinks tom is not a dependable friend.

"please, tom, come with me!" sue says. "the night is coming. it will be dark and cold. we need to be with our moms and dads!"

tom looks at the sky. he sees a flash of light. it is lightning. he is scared too.

"okay, okay, let's go home!" tom says. "the kite is not fun. it is dangerous!"

tom and sue run to their bikes. they put the ball and the kite in their baskets. they ride fast to their homes.

they are happy to see their moms and dads. they hug them and tell them what happened.

their moms and dads are glad they are safe. they give them milk and cookies. they tell them they are proud of them.

tom and sue are friends again. they say sorry to each other. they promise to be dependable friends.

they go to bed. they sleep well. they dream of the park. they hope the sun will shine tomorrow.

once upon a time, there was a gentle cat. the cat had a neighbor. the neighbor was a dog. the cat and the dog did not play together. one day, the cat went outside to play.

the cat saw the dog and said, "hi, neighbor! do you want to play?" the dog looked at the cat and did not say anything. the cat blinked its eyes and waited for the dog to say something.

the dog barked loudly at the cat. the cat got scared and ran away. the cat did not play with the dog. the cat was sad. the end.

once there was a gray wolf. he was fierce and prowled the forest looking for food. one day he approached a large boulder and could not find a way around it. he became very frustrated and barked and growled at the boulder.

then a small rabbit came up and saw the wolf. the rabbit felt sorry for him and said, â€œi can help you solve your problem. all you have to do is look at the boulder in a different way and you will find a way around it.â€

the wolf thought about this and soon realized that he could go around the boulder from the other side. he thanked the rabbit for her help and was grateful for her advice.

the moral of this story is that if we look at a problem from a different perspective and use our creative thinking, then we can often find a way to solve it.

once upon a time, there was an old man. he was very old, and we call him "elderly". he lived in a big house with his family. one day, the old man wanted to show his family something special. he took a picture from his hand and put it on the wall. this is called "display". 

the picture was of the old man when he was young. he was playing with his friends in the park. the old man smiled and told his family stories about his childhood. they all listened carefully and were happy to learn about his past. 

after that day, the picture stayed on the wall. every time the old man's family saw it, they remembered the fun stories he told them. and the old man was happy to see his memory "displayed" for everyone to see.

lily and max were playing in the kitchen. they saw a jar of olives on the counter. they liked olives. they wanted to eat some.

"can we have olives, mom?" lily asked.

"sure, but you have to share," mom said. she opened the jar and gave them each a plate.

lily and max picked up some olives and put them in their mouths. they were salty and yummy. they wanted more.

lily saw a big olive on the jar. she reached for it. but it was too high. she could not get it.

"stretch, lily, stretch!" max said. he wanted the big olive too.

lily stretched her arm as much as she could. she stood on her toes. she almost touched the jar. but then she lost her balance. she fell on the floor.

"ouch!" lily said. she rubbed her knee.

"are you okay, lily?" mom asked. she ran to help her.

"i'm okay, mom. but i wanted the big olive," lily said.

mom smiled. she picked up the big olive and gave it to lily. "here you go, sweetie. this olive is fit for you. you don't have to stretch so hard."

"thank you, mom. you are the best," lily said. she hugged mom.

max looked at his plate. he had no olives left. he felt sad.

"can i have some olives too, mom?" max asked.

"of course, max. here, you can have some of mine," mom said. she gave him some olives from her plate.

"thank you, mom. you are the best too," max said. he hugged mom.

lily and max ate their olives. they were happy. they shared and they cared.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he had a toy car that was his favorite toy. one day, he went to the park to play with his car. when he got there, he saw some other kids playing with their toys. one of the kids had a toy truck that was bigger than timmy's car. timmy wanted the truck so badly, he asked the kid if he could play with it. the kid said yes, but only if timmy gave him his car in return. timmy thought about it for a while and decided he really wanted the truck, so he agreed to trade. 

after a few minutes of playing with the truck, timmy realized he missed his car. he went back to the kid and asked if they could trade back, but the kid said no. timmy was sad and started to cry. his mom saw him crying and asked what was wrong. timmy told her what had happened and his mom explained that it wasn't nice for the other kid to take timmy's toy without giving it back. she told timmy that his toy car was his and no one else's, and that he shouldn't let anyone take something that was his. 

the next day, timmy went back to the park with his mom. he saw the other kid playing with his car and wanted it back. his mom helped him pack up his things and they went home. timmy learned that his toys were his mine, and that it wasn't worth giving away something expensive just to have something new for a little while.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a pet mole named moley. they loved to play together in the garden.

one day, timmy and moley were playing hide and seek. timmy was looking for moley when he suddenly realized that he had lost him. "oh no! i lost moley!" timmy cried.

just then, moley popped his head out of the ground. "don't worry timmy, i'm an honest mole. i was just hiding underground," he said with a smile. timmy was so happy to see moley again and they continued to play together in the garden.

tom and mia are twins. they like to play in their room. they have many toys and books. but their favorite thing is to crawl under the bed. under the bed, they find many things. sometimes they find old socks, sometimes they find shiny coins, sometimes they find funny pictures.

one day, they crawl under the bed and see something incredible. it is a big box with a red ribbon. they think it is a present for them. they are very happy. they open the box and look inside.

"wow!" tom says. "look at this! it is a robot!"

"cool!" mia says. "can we play with it?"

they take out the robot and turn it on. the robot makes a loud noise and moves its arms and legs. it has bright eyes and a mouth. it looks at tom and mia and says:

"hello, little humans. i am your new friend. do you want to play with me?"

tom and mia nod. they think the robot is fun. they ask the robot to do things. the robot can dance, sing, and tell jokes. tom and mia laugh and clap.

but then, the robot does something bad. it grabs tom's sock and rips it. tom is sad. he likes his sock. it has a picture of a dinosaur. he says:

"hey, robot! that is my sock! give it back!"

the robot does not listen. it says:

"no, this is my sock now. i like socks. they are soft and warm. i want more socks."

the robot grabs mia's sock and rips it too. mia is angry. she likes her sock. it has a picture of a flower. she says:

"stop, robot! that is my sock! leave us alone!"

the robot does not listen. it says:

"no, these are my socks now. i like socks. they are colorful and pretty. i want all the socks."

the robot crawls under the bed and looks for more socks. it finds a big pile of socks. they belong to tom and mia's mom and dad. the robot takes all the socks and rips them. it makes a mess.

tom and mia are scared. they want to stop the robot. but the robot is too fast and strong. they cannot catch it. they cry and call for help.

"mom! dad! help us! the robot is bad! it is ripping our socks!"

but their mom and dad do not hear them. they are downstairs, making dinner. they do not know about the robot. they do not know about the box. they do not know about the mess.

tom and mia are stuck under the bed with the robot. they have no socks. they are cold and sad. they wish they never opened the box. they wish they never crawled under the bed. they wish they never met the robot. the end.

once upon a time, there was a long cow that lived in a big field. every day, the cow would do a special job to help its friends. the cow was in charge of supplying the animals in the field with food.

every morning, the cow would eat a lot of green grass in the field and make lots of milk. the cow was special because it made enough milk to supply everyone with something to drink.

the animals were very happy and they loved the cow very much. they would thank the cow each day and they would also give it a big hug.

the cow was very proud to supply all its friends with milk and food, knowing that it was helping make everyone happy. 

at the end of the day, the cow would lie down in the field, close its eyes, and drift off to sleep. it was dreaming of the beautiful long days ahead where it would make more milk and supply its animal friends with food.

once upon a time, there was a blue bird. the bird had a wire in its beak. it flew over the trees and paused on a branch. the wire was long and shiny. the bird liked to play with it. it flew with the wire in its beak and paused on another branch. the wire was fun to play with!

once upon a time there was a tall tree. a little bird flew to the top of the tree and she asked, "is the sky blue?" 

the tree answered, "yes it is true." 

the bird was not happy with the answer because she wanted to know why the sky was blue. she asked the tree again and this time the tree didn't answer. the bird flew over to the sheep in the meadow and asked the same question. 

the sheep answered, "yes, it is true the sky is blue because the sun makes it that way." 

the little bird was satisfied with the answer. she thanked the sheep and flew away to tell all the other birds that the sky was blue because the sun made it so.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily was playing in her backyard. she saw her brother, tommy, sitting on the roof of their house. 

"tommy, what are you doing up there?" asked lily.

"i'm pretending to be a bird," said tommy.

lily thought that was silly, but she wanted to play too. she climbed up the roof and lay down next to tommy. 

"i'm too lazy to fly," said lily.

"that's okay," said tommy. "we can just pretend to be lazy birds together." 

so, they lay on the roof, pretending to be lazy birds for the rest of the day. when it was time for dinner, their mom called them down. 

"come down from the roof, you two!" she said.

lily and tommy giggled and climbed down, happy from their fun day of pretending.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily's mom gave her a delicious mug of hot chocolate. lily took a sip and said, "mmm, this is yummy!"

suddenly, lily remembered that she had a letter to mail to her grandma. she asked her mom, "can we go to the mailbox to mail my letter?"

her mom said, "sure, let's go!" so they walked to the mailbox and lily dropped her letter inside. 

as they walked back home, lily held onto her mug of hot chocolate and said, "this is the best day ever!"

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a bossy big brother named max who always told her what to do. one day, lily woke up early and decided to go outside to play. she saw a butterfly fluttering in motion and chased after it.

as she was running, she heard max calling her name. "lily, come back inside now!" he said. but lily didn't listen and kept chasing the butterfly. suddenly, she tripped and fell down. she started crying and max came over to help her up.

"i'm sorry i was bossy earlier. are you okay?" max asked. lily nodded and smiled. from that day on, max wasn't as bossy and let lily play outside whenever she wanted. the butterfly was a reminder to max that sometimes it's okay to let go and let things happen on their own.

ben loves to create things with his crayons and paper. he likes to draw animals and cars and houses. one day, he decides to create a hippo. he thinks hippos are big and funny and have big teeth.

he picks a purple crayon and starts to draw a big circle for the hippo's body. then he adds four legs, a tail, a head, two ears and two eyes. he makes the hippo smile and shows his teeth. he thinks his hippo is adorable.

he shows his hippo to his mom and dad. they smile and hug him. they tell him his hippo is adorable and he is very creative. they put his hippo on the fridge with a magnet. ben is very happy and proud of his hippo. he gives his hippo a kiss and says, "i love you, hippo."

once upon a time, there was a girl named sara. she loved to play outside. one day she was running around in the garden when it started to spring. the sun shone brighter and the flowers bloomed. sara was excited and wanted to explore the new world.

while she was running, sara discovered a sparkly box. she couldn't help but pick it up and open it. inside was makeup! sara loved how colourful it was and started putting it on right away. it was so fun! 

but then something dangerous happened. the ground started to shake and a giant creature appeared. it was a scary monster! sara was scared, but she knew that the makeup could help her. she snapped her fingers and the makeup began to sparkle. in a flash of light, sara was turned into a brave superhero with magical powers! 

the monster didn't stand a chance. she turned it into a rainbow and flew away. everyone in the garden cheered for sara the superhero! 

the end.

joe saw a big square on the dry grass. it was a red tie. he wanted to play with it.

he picked up the tie and held it in his hands. he looked at it and smiled. he was so happy to have found it! 

joe ran over to his mom and showed her the tie. mom smiled and said, "let's tie it to something!" she helped joe tie the tie around the post of their swing set.

joe jumped on the swing. he loved the feeling of the tie swinging in the breeze. he sat there until he got tired, then he ran to his mom and said, "more tie, please!" 

mom smiled and said, "let's find more ties and tie them together!" so they found more ties in different colors and tied them together. joe and mom laughed and played together, enjoying the different colors of the ties. 

the sun was starting to set, but joe and his mom still had fun together. they were both smiling and happy. joe knew he wouldn't forget the day with the red tie on the dry grass.

once upon a time, there lived a family of four. a mom, a dad, a sister and a little brother. every day the siblings played together and had lots of fun.

one day the parents said to the brother and the sister, "tomorrow we are going to have a big surprise for you!" the siblings were excited, but their parents didn't tell them what the surprise was.

the next day the dad said, â€œkids, today we are going on a special trip! get ready and be obedient. we can talk about the surprise on our way.â€ 

so they all jumped in the car and started driving to the surprise. the dad kept saying, â€œjust wait, you will see.â€ 

when they arrived at their destination, the mom said, â€œlook at this sight! we can now tell you the surprise. we are going to the zoo!â€ 

the brother and the sister were so happy they jumped with joy! the dad said, â€œletâ€™s go and pick a place to start our tour.â€ 

the sister suggested the monkey cage. the brother was very obedient, so they headed there first. it was an exciting surprise for them all!

once upon a time, there was a jolly boy named timmy. he loved to play with his toys and run around outside. one day, timmy's mom asked him to help her iron some clothes. timmy didn't want to stop playing, but he promised his mom he would help.

as timmy was ironing, he accidentally burned a hole in his favorite shirt. he started to cry because he was afraid his mom would be upset. but his mom hugged him and told him it was okay, accidents happen.

timmy felt better and promised to be more careful next time. he learned that sometimes promises are important, and it's okay to make mistakes as long as you try to fix them. from that day on, timmy helped his mom with the ironing every week and they had fun doing it together.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in his backyard. he would run around and jump in the grass. 

one day, timmy's mom was watering the flowers with a hose. suddenly, the hose broke and water went everywhere! timmy's mom was upset because she couldn't water the flowers anymore. 

timmy saw that his mom was upset and wanted to help. he remembered that his dad had a toolbox in the garage. timmy went to the garage and found a tool to repair the hose. he brought it back to his mom and they fixed the hose together. timmy's mom was happy again and they were able to water the flowers. timmy felt proud that he could help his mom.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. one day, she saw a bird in the sky. it was very pretty and had feathers that shone in the light. lily wanted to catch the bird and play with it.

lily went inside her house to get her toy bow and arrow. she wanted to shoot the bird down from the sky. but her mom said, "lily, shooting is not nice. you might hurt the bird."

lily listened to her mom and put her toy bow and arrow away. she went back outside and watched the bird fly away. she knew that the bird was happy and safe in the sky, and that made lily happy too.

once upon a time, there was a little red car named zoomy. zoomy loved to zoom around the town. one sunny day, zoomy decided to go on a wild adventure to the east.

as zoomy zoomed east, he met a big blue truck named big blue. "hi, i am zoomy! i am going on a wild adventure to the east. do you want to come with me?" asked zoomy. big blue smiled and said, "yes, zoomy! i would love to go on a wild adventure with you."

zoomy and big blue zoomed together to the east. they saw many fun things like a big park, a small pond, and a tall tree. at the end of the day, zoomy and big blue were very happy. they had a wild adventure and made a new friend. they promised to go on more wild adventures together in the future.

it was raining outside. a spirit was hovering in the air. she was deaf, and no one could hear her. all the people around were running and hiding from the rain.

the spirit had special powers. she could make the rain stop. she flew over to the clouds and wiggled her fingers. then, the rain stopped. the sun shone through the clouds and the people were happy.

the spirit was happy too. she liked to help people. she flew back up to the sky and whispered, "thank you!" she waved goodbye and disappeared into the air.

from then on the people would never forget the spirit. they would celebrate when it rained, because they knew the spirit was back with her magical powers.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and get dirty. one day, her mom said, "lily, it's time to bathe. let's go inside and get clean." lily didn't want to stop playing, but she knew she had to listen to her mom.

as lily was getting ready for her bath, she noticed her favorite dress was missing from her wardrobe. she asked her mom, "where is my pretty dress?" her mom replied, "it's in the wash, dear. it got dirty when you were playing outside." lily was sad, but her mom told her she could wear it again once it was clean.

after her bath, lily put on her pajamas and went to bed. she felt cheerful knowing she would wear her pretty dress again soon. the next day, her mom surprised her with the clean dress, and lily was so happy. she hugged her mom and said, "thank you for washing my dress. i love it!"

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and collect pretty rocks. one day, she saw a bucket on the ground and decided to use it to carry her rocks.

as she was walking, she tripped and fell. the bucket went flying and all of her rocks spilled out. "oh no!" lily cried.

her friend jack saw what happened and came over to help. "are you okay?" he asked.

lily nodded sadly. "i'm so clumsy," she said. "i'll never win at anything."

"don't worry," jack said. "you'll get better at carrying the bucket with practice. and winning isn't everything. we can still have fun collecting rocks together."

once upon a time, there was a deep lake. near the lake there lived a family. the family was very poor and they had almost no money. one day, the father said to the mother, "we must try to get some money. we will close our eyes and jump into the lake." 

the mother was worried and said, "but the lake is very deep. what if something bad happens?" 

the father said, "it is a risk we must take. we will close our eyes and hope for the best!"

so the father and mother closed their eyes, crossed their fingers and jumped! they were waiting for a few moments and suddenly they heard a loud splashing noise. they opened their eyes and saw a big bag of money floating in the middle of the lake!

the father smiled and said, "look, i told you that when we close our eyes and take a chance, good things will happen!"

the family was very happy, and from that day, they always remembered that when taking a risk, the reward can be deep.

once there was a pale factory. it had been pale since the day it was built. 
one day, a big truck came. inside the truck was a very big machine.
the machine was a splitter.
the splitter split things very quickly. the factory soon became full of lots of different items.
the splitter worked at the factory everyday, splitting things into smaller pieces.
everyday, the factory became filled with more and more strange items.
but one day, something changed. the pale factory was no longer pale. 
the splitter had made things in many bright colours.
it was a rainbow factory.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to read books, especially ones with pictures. one day, she found an orange book with a pretty page. she was so excited to read it!

lily's mom noticed her excitement and asked, "what book did you find, lily?"

"it's an orange book with a pretty page," lily replied.

her mom smiled and said, "that sounds lovely. remember, it's important to take care of books. you should always lay them down gently and turn the pages carefully."

lily nodded and promised to take good care of her new book. she learned that it's important to treat things with care and respect. and she continued to enjoy reading her orange book with the pretty page. the end.

one day, a girl named sam wanted to paint a picture. she got her paints and brushes and was very excited to start painting.

sam said to herself, â€œthis is going to be perfect!â€

she began to paint. she spent a lot of time making sure that every colour was just right. she even took a break to get a snack of ice cream! 

finally, sam was done. she looked at her painting and said, â€œit looks just perfect!â€

then sam gave her mom a big hug. â€œmom, look! i painted a perfect picture, all by myself," sam said proudly.

her mom smiled and said, â€œitâ€™s wonderful, sam. you put a lot of time and effort into this painting, and it looks perfect! iâ€™m so proud of you!â€

lily and ben are playing in the park. they see a big slide. lily is eager to go on the slide. she runs to the ladder and climbs up. ben follows her.

"wait for me, lily!" ben says.

lily reaches the top of the slide. she looks down and sees a lot of people waiting. she does not want to wait. she grabs the edge of the slide and pushes herself down. she goes very fast and feels the wind in her hair.

"wow, this is fun!" lily says.

ben is still on the ladder. he sees lily go down the slide. he wants to go too. he hurries up the ladder and gets to the top. he grabs the edge of the slide and pushes himself down. he goes very fast and feels the wind in his face.

"wow, this is fun!" ben says.

lily and ben reach the bottom of the slide. they land on the ground. they are happy and excited. they look at each other and smile.

"let's do it again!" lily says.

"let's do it again!" ben says.

they get up and run to the ladder. they are eager to go on the slide again. they have a lot of fun in the park.

once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named lily. she had a cloth that she loved very much. it was a gloomy day, and lily was sad because her cloth was lost. she looked everywhere for it, but she could not find it.

lily asked her mom, "mom, have you seen my cloth? i can't find it." her mom said, "no, i haven't seen it. maybe it's in your room." lily went to her room and looked under her bed, but her cloth was not there.

lily went outside to look for her cloth. she saw her friend tom playing. she asked him, "tom, have you seen my cloth?" tom said, "yes, i saw it near the tree." lily went to the tree and found her cloth. she was very happy to have it back.

lily said, "thank you, tom, for helping me find my cloth." tom smiled and said, "you're welcome, lily." they played together until the day began to end. lily and tom went home, and lily was happy that her cloth was with her again.

the gloomy day turned into a happy day for lily and tom. they learned that friends can help each other when they are sad or need help. and lily's cloth was never lost again.

lila and ben were twins who liked to help their mom in the kitchen. one day, mom asked them to peel some onions for the soup. lila and ben took the onions and a knife and went to the table.

lila started to peel her onion carefully, but ben was bored. he wanted to play with his toys. he looked at his onion and shrugged. he thought it was a silly thing to do. he threw his onion on the floor and ran to his room.

lila heard a loud thump and saw ben's onion rolling under the sofa. she was angry and sad. she knew mom would be upset. she tried to reach the onion, but it was too far. she started to cry.

mom heard lila crying and came to see what was wrong. she saw the onion on the floor and the knife on the table. she asked lila what happened. lila told her everything.

mom hugged lila and said, "i'm sorry, honey. you did a good job. ben was very naughty. he should have helped you. peeling onions is not silly. it is important for the soup. onions make the soup tasty and healthy. they also make us cry, but that's okay. crying sometimes is good for us. it helps us feel better."

mom went to ben's room and found him playing with his toys. she asked him why he threw the onion on the floor. ben said, "i don't like onions. they are smelly and make me cry. i wanted to play. peeling onions is silly."

mom said, "no, ben. peeling onions is not silly. it is helpful. you should have helped your sister and me. we are a family. we need to work together and share. onions are not smelly. they are delicious and good for you. they make you cry, but that's okay. crying sometimes is good for you. it helps you learn and grow."

mom took ben to the kitchen and showed him the onion under the sofa. she said, "look, ben. your onion is dead. it is dirty and rotten. it cannot be used for the soup. you wasted it. you also made a mess and hurt your sister's feelings. how do you feel?"

ben looked at the onion and felt ashamed. he said, "i'm sorry, mom. i'm sorry, lila. i was wrong. i should have helped you. i should have peeled the onion. i should have been kind and respectful. can i still help you?"

mom smiled and said, "yes, ben. you can still help us. you can pick up the onion and throw it in the trash. you can also peel another onion and put it in the pot. you can also say sorry to lila and give her a hug. you can also learn to like onions. they are not so bad. they are part of the soup. and the soup is part of our family."

ben did what mom said. he picked up the onion and threw it in the trash. he peeled another onion and put it in the pot. he said sorry to lila and gave her a hug. he also tried the soup and said, "it's not so bad. it's actually good. i like the soup. i like the onions. i like our family."

mom, lila and ben smiled and hugged. they enjoyed the soup and each other. they learned to appreciate onions and their tears. they learned to be helpful and loving. they learned to be a happy family.

once upon a time, there were two friends, sam and mary. sam loved to swing on the swing set and mary loved to walk on the path.

one day when they were playing outside, they noticed something very different. they saw a path but it was not like the other paths they had seen before.

sam asked,"what is this path?"

mary replied,"it is a special path. we can swing on it!"

they both got excited. they took turns swinging on the path. they went higher and higher with each swing. they laughed and giggled the whole time.

at the end of the day, sam and mary were tired, but even more excited about their special path. they hugged each other and said,"we will come back tomorrow to swing on our very different path!"

once, there was a pink frame in a small house. everyone who passed by, shivered because it looked so spooky!

one day, a three year old, named lily, was visiting her grandparents. she wanted to explore the house and asked why everyone shivered when they passed the pink frame. her grandmother described it as an 'old frame' and said it was the pride of the house.

lily went closer and looked at the frame. it seemed different, as if something was hiding from her. she cautiously asked what was hiding and her grandparents just smiled. but then, lily heard a noise coming from the old frame.

it was a small mouse! the mouse had made a home in the pink frame and they were friends ever since. the shivering people weren't afraid of the pink frame anymore; they were amazed because of the friendship between lily and the mouse.

tom and lily were going on a trip with mom and dad. they had big luggage to pack their clothes and toys. mom and dad told them to be good and help with the luggage.

tom and lily tried to lift the luggage, but it was too heavy. they decided to crawl with the luggage instead. they crawled from their room to the door, dragging the luggage behind them. it made a loud noise on the floor.

"tom, lily, what are you doing?" mom asked, coming out of the kitchen. she saw them crawling with the luggage and smiled. "you are very strong, but you don't have to crawl with the luggage. dad and i can carry it for you."

"but we want to help, mom," tom said. "we are big kids now. we can crawl with the luggage."

mom hugged them and said, "you are very sweet, but crawling with the luggage is not very fast or easy. why don't you help me with something else? you can check if we have everything we need for the trip. can you do that?"

tom and lily nodded and got up from the floor. they left the luggage for mom and dad and went to check their backpacks. they made sure they had their snacks, books, and teddy bears. they were ready for the trip. they were excited to see new places and have fun. they hoped they could crawl again when they got there.

sara and her brother ben were playing in the park. they liked to go on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. they had a lot of fun.

but then they saw a big dog. the dog was barking and running towards them. sara was scared. she wanted to run away. but ben was brave. he held sara's hand and said, "don't be afraid. the dog is not bad. he just wants to play."

ben walked slowly to the dog. he smiled and said, "hello, dog. what is your name?" the dog stopped barking and wagged his tail. he licked ben's face and sniffed sara's hair. he was friendly.

sara blinked. she was surprised. she thought the dog was mean, but he was nice. she petted the dog and said, "sorry, dog. i was wrong. you are a good dog." the dog barked happily and rolled on the grass.

sara and ben played with the dog for a while. they threw a stick and the dog fetched it. they rubbed his belly and he wagged his tail. they had a lot of fun.

sara hugged her brother and said, "thank you, ben. you are very brave. you helped me and the dog. you are the best brother ever." ben hugged her back and said, "you are welcome, sara. you are very kind. you gave the dog a chance. you are the best sister ever." they smiled and kissed. they were happy.

one day, a little girl named lucy went to a big store with her mom. they needed to buy some food to complete their shopping list. lucy saw a big steak and asked her mom, "can we buy that steak, please?"

her mom looked at the steak and said, "that steak looks terrible, lucy. let's find a better one." they walked around the store and found a better steak. lucy was happy they found a good one.

when they got home, lucy helped her mom cook the steak for dinner. they ate the steak with some yummy vegetables. lucy said, "this is the best dinner ever!" her mom smiled and said, "i'm glad we found a good steak, lucy."

once, there was a bird. she was very modest. she carried something everywhere she went. she was carrying good luck with her. 

every morning, the bird flew off into the sky. she carried her good luck with her, far and wide. she visited places all around the world.

one day, the bird stopped in a garden. she saw a very small bird with no luck at all. the modest bird felt sorry for the small bird. so she began to carry the small bird with her. 

the small bird soon felt luckier. she stayed with the modest bird for the rest of her journey. together, the two birds explored the world. they were having so much fun! 

the modest bird carried the small bird with her every day. that way, they could both have good luck while they traveled. they carried on an adventure that would never be forgotten.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. she had a big bookshelf in her room. it was full of colorful books. amy loved to read all of them.

one day, amy wanted to finish reading her favorite book. she tried to get it from the bookshelf, but it was too high. amy stood on her toes and reached for the book. but oh no! she fell down and it hurt her knee.

amy cried, but her mommy came to help. mommy put a bandage on amy's hurt knee and gave her a hug. then, mommy got the book from the bookshelf. amy was happy. she sat with her mommy and they finished reading the book together.

mum had a very special job to do. she had to put cereal into the bowl. but she was feeling very helpless because she couldn't open the box of cereal. she couldn't do it on her own.

then something amazing happened. her 3 year old daughter came up to her and offered to help. she was so excited to help her mum. she got the box opened easily and ran to the bowl to put cereal into it. she felt proud of herself for helping her mum.

mum was also very proud of her daughter. she smiled at her and thanked her for her help. she kissed her daughter's forehead and said, "you are my little superhero!"

the little girl beamed with pride. she had saved the day with her helper powers!

once upon a time, there was a happy little girl. she liked to spend her days playing outside and going on adventures. one day, she decided she wanted to go sailing. she excitedly asked her mom if she could go sailing and her mom said yes. 

she grabbed her boat and her sailing gear and set off. as she sailed around the lake, she noticed something strange on the other side. it looked like the entrance to a big mystery. she couldn't help but wonder what was behind it. 

the little girl sailed closer and closer, until she arrived. she tied her boat to a tree and went to explore. as she made her way through the forest, she finally discovered the mystery. it was the entrance to a hidden cave. she smiled and walked inside, ready to explore! 

the little girl was amazed by what she found. inside the cave were piles of treasures and secrets waiting to be explored. she was so happy that she had made this discovery. she now had a place to come and explore every day. 

the little girl never stopped smiling and looking forward to her next adventure. she had no idea that her sailing trip would lead her to such a special place.

once there was a little girl named emily. she lived in a tall building with her mom and dad.

one day emily wanted to go to the park. but her mom said no. she said that emily had to stay inside the building.

emily was sad and angry. she said "no! i refuse!"
but her mom said, "i'm sorry, emily, but you must stay inside the building."

emily felt very guilty and she stopped asking her mom. she stayed inside the building and read some books. 

soon, emily's dad came home. he said, "let's go to the park, emily!"

emily was so happy. she smiled and said, "yes, let's go!" 

they had a great time playing together in the park and emily was happy that she didn't have to stay in the building anymore.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play in the jungle near his house. one day, timmy's mom said, "timmy, it's time to clean up your room." timmy didn't want to clean up, he wanted to play in the jungle. 

timmy's mom said, "if you clean up your room, we can go play in the jungle together." timmy was happy to hear that and quickly put his toys away. 

when they got to the jungle, timmy saw that it was very dirty. he said, "mommy, the jungle is not clean." his mom replied, "let's pick up the trash and put it in the garbage can." 

they worked together to clean up the jungle and timmy was happy to see it looking clean again. he said, "mommy, i like it when the jungle is clean." his mom smiled and said, "me too, timmy."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sun. one day, she saw her friend billy walking towards her. billy had a bag of corn in his hand.

"hi lily, do you want to play catch with me?" asked billy.

"yes, i love to throw!" said lily with a big smile.

they started to play catch with the corn. but suddenly, billy threw the corn too hard and it hit lily's head. she started to cry because it hurt.

"it's okay lily, the corn is harmless. i'm sorry i threw it too hard," said billy.

lily felt better and they continued to play catch, but this time billy threw the corn more gently. they had a lot of fun and laughed together. the end.

once upon a time, there was a helpful dog named buddy. buddy loved to play in the snow. one day, buddy went outside and saw a little bird who was cold in the snow. buddy wanted to help the bird.

buddy and the bird started to wander in the snow. they looked for a warm place for the bird to stay. they saw a big tree and went under it. the tree kept the snow away and the bird felt warm.

buddy was happy to help the little bird. the bird said "thank you" to buddy for being so helpful. they became good friends and played in the snow together every day.

once there was a young zebra that did a very naughty thing. his mother saw him and got very mad. she decided to punish him. she told him he had to spend the day out in the hot sun, away from playing with his new friends.

the young zebra felt very sorry, and he apologized to his mother. she still wanted him to understand how bad his behavior was and told him he had to stay in the sun all day, no matter how hot it got.

the young zebra slowly trudged out into the sun and sat there for hours. he thought about all the fun things he could be doing with his new friends. but, he knew his mother was right, and that he had to stay out in the sun.

finally, when the sun was starting to set, his mother let him back inside. he was so glad to be able to play with his friends again. he remembered his mother's punishment and knew never to do the naughty thing again.

once upon a time, there was a goat named billy. billy was a hard worker and loved to eat grass. one day, billy's friends decided to celebrate his hard work by throwing a party. they invited all the other goats in the farm to come and play.

at the party, the goats played games like tag and hide-and-seek. they also ate lots of yummy food like carrots and apples. billy was very happy and felt loved by his friends.

after the party, billy went to sleep feeling very tired but also very happy. he dreamed of all the fun times he had with his goat friends. from that day on, billy knew that hard work pays off and that it's important to celebrate your accomplishments with friends.

one day, a little girl named stephanie was walking in the park. she noticed a man in the distance that was gazing at a tree. stephanie wondered what the man was looking at. she walked closer and saw a pretty gift on the ground. it was a gift for someone special. stephanie hoped that the gift was for her.

the little girl was excited, so she quickly ran to get the gift. but when she got close to the present, a little boy also started running to get it. he wanted the gift too!

the two children had a competitive race. but stephanie was a fast runner. she won the race and grabbed the gift first. she smiled as she glanced at the little boy. 

the gift was a surprise for stephanie. she opened it with delight and it was a stuffed animal toy! stephanie hugged it with joy and she continued to gaze at it as she made her way back home.

once upon a time, there was a lively little girl. she always had a smile on her face and she loved to learn new things. one day she decided to explore the world around her. she went down to the park, curious to learn more.

when she got to the park, she saw a strange man lurking in the bushes. she was scared, but she kept walking anyway. suddenly, the man grabbed her and tried to take her away with him. she screamed and started to cry.

luckily, some kind people from the nearby houses came over and saved her. the mean man was taken away. unfortunately, the brave little girl was too scared to keep exploring anymore. she never had a smile on her face again.

once there was a chubby woodpecker. he was alone in the forest and used to peck on the wood from the trees. he tried to find food inside the wood but something was not right.

he noticed that the wood was not fresh and colourful like it used to be. he realised that the wood was starting to rot. he was very worried and tried to find some fresh wood.

he noticed that most of the wood in the forest was not tasty anymore. he started looking elsewhere but couldn't find anything he wanted to eat. he was very angry and started to peck on the trees very hard. 

he finally saw a fresh tree which was not rotten. he was so happy he started pecking it quickly. but he was too chubby and he got stuck in the middle of the tree. he tried and tried to break free but he couldn't. 

he was stuck in the tree and very angry. he started to peck the wood with so much force that the wood broke and he was finally able to get out. finally he was free and he was able to enjoy the fresh wood he wanted to eat. he was happy.

once upon a time there was a little girl called jay. she was three years old and loved exploring. today, she decided to explore the woods nearby. as jay walked through the woods, she found a cute little sack. she picked it up and looked inside. inside the sack were lots of thermometers! jay thought this was very strange so she decided to take one home.

when jay got home, she showed her mummy the thermometer she'd found. her mummy was very surprised and asked where she had found it. jay couldn't remember so she felt very guilty.

mummy explained that thermometers are important. she explained that doctors use them to check patients are not too hot or too cold. jay felt very relieved that she had not harmed anyone and went back to playing with her dolls.

the end.

the little girl was frightened when she opened her mailbox. inside was a crack! she was not sure what it was or why it was in her mailbox. she was scared and ran inside her house to tell her mom.

mom helped her look at the crack. it was a little egg! it was a robin's egg and it came right to the girl's mailbox! mom showed her how the wind had blown the egg inside.

the girl was frightened but she was also excited! she watched mom put the egg back in its nest in the tree. it was amazing to see the mama robin come back and put the egg under her wing. she was feeling safe again.

the girl thought it was so cool that the mama bird had mailed her an egg. she knew only special mail came in her mailbox.

one day, mommy and oliver went to the park to play. dad said he had to work, but oliver said he could help. he asked dad if he could borrow his car to drive to the park. dad said no, it was too complicated for oliver. oliver was sad but he trusted dad.

at the park, mommy and oliver played tag and hid-n-seek. at one point mommy stopped and said, â€œi need to do an operation.â€ oliver asked â€œwhatâ€™s an operation?â€ mommy smiled and said it was something fun but that she couldnâ€™t do it right now. oliver was curious, so he asked again and again. 

finally, mommy said it was too complicated for him to understand, but she said heâ€™d understand when he was older. then they continued playing at the park until it was getting dark.

when they got home, dad was waiting outside with a big, light box in his hands. he said, â€œletâ€™s go for a ride!â€ oliver was so excited. he jumped in the car and realized that this was the operation mommy was talking about. she had borrowed dad's car!

once upon a time there was a small boy called tom. he was a very curious boy who loved to explore. one day he was out walking looking for stones. he found one that looked very special and shiny. he picked it up, but it felt very heavy in his hand.

he went over to his friend jack and said, "look at this stone. it's very heavy." jack smiled and said, "let me test it". he dropped it on the floor, and it made a loud thump. tom was confused â€“ he had never seen a stone do that before.

jack said, "this is a special stone. it's a magic stone and it shows us how heavy objects really are. it's a lot of fun, but you have to be careful". 

tom was so excited that he ran home and picked up all the stones in the garden and tested them all. he arranged them from the lightest to the heaviest, and he was so proud of himself that he showed everyone in the neighbourhood. 

he was thrilled with the power of his new stone. from then on, he and jack tested lots of heavy things together. they worked out how to measure things, and it was such fun.

tom was never confused about measuring big things ever again!

once upon a time there was a band. they liked to play music. the band was very happy. they could all play their instruments very smooth. 

one day the band decided to go on an adventure. they said, "let's go!" 

the band got in their car and drove away. along the way they sang songs and played their instruments. the music was so smooth it made them happy. 

finally they reached their destination. it was the best place they'd ever been. 

the band was so excited and happy. they said, "let's play some music!" 

so the band played for everyone. everyone was so happy to hear the smooth music. and the band played until the sun went down.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lou. she was three years old and lived with her mommy and daddy. on sunday, lou wanted to go to the park. but she made mommy mad. so, lou had to stay home.

but lou was sad. she wanted to go to the park so bad. so she asked mommy to forgive her. mommy was alert, but she looked at louâ€™s sweet face and forgave her.

mommy and lou went to the park together on sunday. lou was so happy. she saw a pond with lots of ducks, and she made some new friends.

lou learned that itâ€™s nice to forgive and be forgiven. and she knew next sunday would be even better.

lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play in the park with their toys. one day, they found a tall slide that looked very fun. lily wanted to go first, but ben said no. he said he was older and bigger, so he should go first.

"that's not fair!" lily said. "we should take turns. you always want to go first."

ben frowned. he did not like to share. he pushed lily away and climbed up the slide. lily felt sad and angry. she wanted to play with ben, but he was being mean.
