she waited at the bottom of the slide, hoping ben would change his mind. but he did not. he slid down and ran back up, over and over. he did not look at lily or talk to her. there was only silence between them.

lily decided she did not want to play with ben anymore. she picked up her toys and walked away. she looked for another friend to play with. she saw a girl with a big smile and a yellow dress. she was swinging on a swing.

"hi, i'm lily. can i play with you?" lily asked.

"sure, i'm anna. you can have the other swing. do you like slides?" anna said.

lily nodded. she liked slides, but not with ben. she told anna what happened with ben. anna listened and said, "that was not nice of him. he should have shared. maybe he will say sorry later."

lily smiled. she liked anna. she was kind and friendly. she swung with anna and had fun. she forgot about ben and his frown. she was happy.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lily who lived in a small village. she loved going on vacations with her family. one day she asked her mom if they could take a vacation to see the enormous mountains nearby. her mom said that they could go on vacation, but first lily had to do something. she needed to kneel and say thank you for all the blessings in her life.

lily was confused. she didn't understand why she had to kneel, but she did it anyway. when she stood up she felt a warm feeling inside of her. she looked at her mom and said "is that why i had to kneel?" her mom smiled and explained that it was important to be thankful for what you have.

on the day of their vacation, lily felt so excited. she ran up to the enormous mountains and said "thank you for letting me see this. i'm so grateful for everything i have." as soon as she said those words, lily felt a wave of joy come over her. 

the moral of this story is that it doesn't take much to feel grateful. a simple act such as kneeling and expressing our thanks is enough to leave us feeling blessed.

once upon a time there was a little boy called john who was very sick. he had to go to the hospital to get some help from the nurse.

when john first arrived, he was very scared. he saw a new nurse and she smiled at him. she said, "hello there, my name is fiona. i'm here to help you."

john nodded and said, "okay."

fiona was very kind to john. she held his hand and sang to him. she also gave him a special toy to play with.

john felt much better after his visit with the nurse. she told him he could come back anytime he needed help.

john thanked the nurse before he left. he smiled and nodded as he said goodbye.

john never forgot how nice the nurse was to him. he was so glad to have been taken care of by the new nurse!

lily loved to play the piano. she had a small piano in her room that made nice sounds when she pressed the keys. she liked to sing along and pretend she was a great piano player.

one day, her piano broke. she was very sad and cried. she tried to fix it, but it did not work. she asked her mom for help, but her mom said the piano was too old and they needed to replace it.

"replace it? what does that mean?" lily asked.

"it means we get a new piano and give the old one away," her mom said.

"but i love my old piano! i don't want a new one!" lily said.

her mom hugged her and said, "i know, sweetie, but sometimes things break and we have to let them go. maybe someone else can use your old piano and be happy with it. and maybe you can find a new piano that you love even more."

lily was not sure. she did not like change. she liked her old piano. she did not want to give it away.

the next day, her mom took her to a store that had many pianos. they were big and shiny and had many keys. lily saw one that was pink and had flowers on it. it looked pretty. she touched it and it made a beautiful sound.

"wow, this piano is great!" lily said.

"do you like it?" her mom asked.

"yes, i do! can we get it?" lily asked.

"sure, we can. it's on sale and it fits in our car. but we have to replace your old piano, remember?" her mom said.

lily thought for a moment. she looked at the pink piano and then at her mom. she smiled and said, "ok, mom. i think i'm ready to replace my old piano. but can we take a picture of it before we give it away?"

"of course, we can. and we can keep the picture in your room, next to your new piano. how does that sound?" her mom said.

lily nodded and hugged her mom. she was happy. she had a new piano that was great. and she still had the memory of her old piano that she loved.

the lake was peaceful and still. the sun was shining and the trees were swaying in the wind. suddenly there was a big splash, and a fisherman appeared. he had been fishing in the water.

the fisherman looked around and then shouted, "wow, this is an interesting lake!" everyone around him stopped and looked.

the fisherman suddenly froze. he saw something in the water he hadn't seen before. "what's that?" he asked. everyone peered into the water and gasped. it was a big, bright fish!

the fisherman quickly grabbed his net and tried to catch the fish. after a few tries he managed to scoop it up. everyone clapped and cheered. the fisherman smiled and said, "that's an interesting fish i've caught today!" everyone agreed and they all had a very happy day.

once upon a time there was a stable. inside the stable there was a pony called spotty. spotty was very enthusiastic and loved to rock. every day he would jump up and down and rock his stable. he was very happy in the stable and all his friends were with him. he sang his happy songs and rocked his stable from side to side. 

one day, another pony joined the stable. her name was daisy. she was very excited and she too loved to rock. spotty and daisy became the best of friends and they would rock together all day. 

the ponies were so enthusiastic that soon their stable was rocking faster and faster. they danced and laughed and sang together. 

the stable rocked for a long time and all the animals were very happy. the ponies rocked their stable in a happy chorus until the sun went down. the stable was calm then and all the animals had a nice rest.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she woke up one morning and felt very hungry. she went to the kitchen and saw a box of cereal on the table. she poured some cereal into a bowl and added some milk. it was a lovely breakfast.

after she finished her cereal, she went to play with her toys. but she started to feel sleepy. she yawned and yawned but she didn't want to take a nap. she wanted to keep playing. but her eyes were getting heavy and she couldn't keep them open.

suddenly, her little brother came into the room and started to play with her toys. lily got upset and started to cry. she didn't want to share her toys. but then her mom came into the room and told her that sharing is important. lily stopped crying and let her brother play with her toys. they all played together and had a lovely time.

once upon a time there was a little boy named paul. he wanted to see a harbor. one day, paul saw a harbor and hopped on a boat. he sailed away and saw many new things.

he sailed near an iceberg and saw a big polar bear. the bear was deaf and walked up to the boat. paul was scared but the bear only wanted to play and smiled.

the polar bear took paul's hand and the two of them went on an adventure. they walked through the icy snow and watched the icebergs melt away. suddenly, the polar bear took paul back to the boat and waved goodbye. paul waved back and said, "see you again!"

the boat sailed away and paul thought of the deaf polar bear he had met. he was sad to say goodbye, but was happy that he had gone on such a special adventure!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going on the bus with her mommy to the park. one day, they got on the bus and sat down. but then, a big boy came and sat next to them. he was tough and grumpy. 

lily didn't like the big boy because he took up too much space and made her feel scared. she told her mommy that she wanted to get off the bus. but her mommy said they couldn't get off until they paid the bus driver.

lily started to cry because she didn't want to be near the tough boy anymore. her mommy gave her a hug and told her that they would pay the driver soon and get off at the next stop. finally, they paid the driver and got off the bus. lily felt much better and they had a fun day at the park. the end.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved rockets. he had a toy rocket that he played with every day. one day, timmy's mom said, "timmy, we need to go to the store. it's important." timmy didn't want to go to the store. he wanted to play with his rocket.

but then, timmy had an idea. he asked his mom, "can i bring my rocket to the store?" his mom said yes, so timmy grabbed his rocket and they went to the store. in the store, timmy saw a shelf with lots of rockets. he wanted to reach the rockets on the top shelf, but he was too short.

a kind man saw timmy struggling and said, "do you want me to help you reach that rocket?" timmy was so happy and said yes. the man picked up timmy and helped him reach the rocket. timmy was so excited to have a new rocket to play with. he thanked the man and said, "this is the most important rocket ever!"

one day, a boy and his dad went to the park. the boy was excited to see the trucks that were there. he jumped up and down and screamed with joy. the dad laughed as his son climbed into one of the big trucks. but after a little while, the truck's engine stopped running. it was very boring.

the dad tried to fix the truck but it wouldn't start. so, the dad and the little boy had to find another way to get home. suddenly, a big truck drove by with its horn beeping loudly. the boy screamed with excitement and started waving to the truck driver.

the truck driver smiled and pulled up next to them. he asked the dad if he needed a lift. the dad said yes and thanked the truck driver. the boy hugged his dad and jumped into the truck.

on their way home, the little boy sang and laughed. he was so happy that they got a lift in the truck. when they finally arrived home, the dad and the boy hugged each other and thanked the truck driver. they had a great adventure and never forgot it.

once upon a time, there was a big, wide ladder. it was so big that it reached up to the sky. a little boy wanted to climb the ladder, but it was too high for him. so, he decided to kick the ladder to make it shorter. but when he kicked it, the ladder fell down and made a loud noise. the little boy was scared and ran away. later, he saw some firefighters using the ladder to rescue a cat from a tree. the little boy felt happy that the ladder was useful again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who lived in a big castle. one day, she went for a walk in the forest and heard a loud noise. "what is that sound?" she asked herself. suddenly, she saw a big, scary dragon! the dragon had icy blue eyes and was breathing fire.

"hello, little girl," said the dragon. "what are you doing in my forest?"

"i'm just taking a walk," replied lily.

"well, you better be careful," warned the dragon. "i'm not the friendliest dragon around."

lily was scared, but she knew she had to be brave. "please don't hurt me," she said. "i just want to be friends."

the dragon thought for a moment and then said, "okay, we can be friends. but only if you promise to never tell anyone about me."

lily promised and the dragon and her became the best of friends. they went on many adventures together and always kept each other's secrets.

once upon a time, there was a little crab named crabby. crabby loved to play on the beach and collect shiny shells. one day, crabby found a very smooth shell, and he was so happy! 

as he was walking back to his home, he saw a little fish who was stuck in a puddle of water. the fish was crying and asking for help. crabby knew what to do. he used his strong claws to lift the fish out of the puddle and put him back in the ocean. 

the fish was so grateful and said, "thank you, crabby! you are so kind!" crabby felt very happy and proud of himself. he realized that helping others is important and it makes you feel good inside. from that day on, crabby made it his mission to help anyone in need, and he always remembered the smooth shell as a reminder of the good feeling he got from helping others.

sam was a new lawyer. he wanted to help people with their problems. he worked in a big building with many other lawyers. he liked his job very much.

one day, sam had to go to a big court. he had to talk to a judge and a jury. he had to supply them with facts and proofs. he had to show them that his client was good and not bad. he had a big folder with many papers. he was ready and confident.

but when he got to the court, he saw a problem. he had taken the wrong folder. he had taken his friend's folder, not his own. his friend was a lawyer too, but he worked on a different case. sam did not have his facts and proofs. he only had his friend's facts and proofs. they were not useful for his case.

sam did not know what to do. he felt scared and ashamed. he tried to explain to the judge and the jury, but they did not listen. they thought he was lying and cheating. they did not believe him or his client. they said his client was bad and guilty. they said sam was a bad lawyer.

sam and his client lost the case. they had to pay a lot of money. they had to go to jail. sam lost his job and his friend. he was very sad and sorry. he wished he had taken the right folder. he wished he had been more careful. he wished he had been a better lawyer.

sara and ben are playing with blocks in the living room. they are building a big tower with many colors. sara likes the red blocks and ben likes the blue ones. they are having fun and sharing the blocks.

but then, ben sees a shiny green block on the shelf. he wants to use it for his tower. he climbs on the sofa and reaches for the block. but he is not careful and he knocks down a vase. the vase falls to the floor and breaks into many pieces. sara hears the loud noise and looks at ben.

"ben, what did you do?" sara asks. "you break the vase! mom will be very angry!"

ben feels scared and sorry. he does not want to get in trouble. he thinks of a lie to tell mom. he says, "it was not me. it was the cat. the cat jumped on the shelf and break the vase. i tried to stop the cat, but it was too fast."

sara knows that ben is not telling the truth. she saw him take the green block. she says, "ben, that is not true. you are lying. you break the vase, not the cat. you should tell mom the truth. she will be more happy if you are honest."

ben thinks about what sara says. he knows she is right. he does not want to lie to mom. he wants to be a good boy. he says, "you are right, sara. i break the vase, not the cat. i am sorry. i will tell mom the truth. i hope she will not be too mad."

sara smiles and hugs ben. she says, "i am proud of you, ben. you are brave and ready to tell the truth. i will help you clean up the mess. maybe mom will not be so mad if we say sorry and help."

they go to find mom and tell her what happened. mom is not happy about the broken vase, but she is glad that ben told the truth. she says, "thank you, ben, for being honest. and thank you, sara, for being a good sister. i love you both. now, let's clean up the mess and be more careful next time."

once upon a time there was a girl named jane who loved to bow. jane's bow was so powerful that it made the other kids jealous. all of the other kids wanted to be as powerful as jane. 

one day, a mean girl named sue came to their town. she was very selfish and didn't like to share. when sue saw jane's bow, she wanted it for herself. she begged jane for it, but jane didn't want to give it away.

sue was so angry that she challenged jane to a competition. sue said, "i bet i can make my bow more powerful than yours!" 

jane agreed to the competition, and on the night of the competition, hundreds of people gathered to watch. as sue was about to start, jane used her bow and shot an arrow across the sky. it flew higher and farther than sue's arrow.

the crowd cheered for jane and her powerful bow. jane proved that the power of her bow was the most powerful of all. she'd beaten sue and the other kids, who could only look on in awe.

jane's bow might have been the most powerful, but it was also shared with kindness instead of selfishness. and that made it the most beautiful bows of all.

once upon a time, there was a cool bulb named blinky. blinky lived in a small house with his friends. he loved to shine brightly and make everyone happy.

one day, blinky saw some kids playing outside. they were having a lot of fun. blinky wanted to join them and make their game even more fun. so, he asked his friends if they wanted to join too. they all said yes, and they went outside to play.

when they got outside, blinky and his friends started to shine brightly. the kids loved it! they played and laughed together, and blinky was very happy. from that day on, blinky and his friends would always join the kids to play and have fun.

one day, a little boy named tim wanted to play hide and seek with his friends. he asked his mom if he could play outside. his mom said, "yes, but first you have to do your math."

tim sat down and did his math. he counted one, two, three, four, and five. he was very happy when he finished. now he could play with his friends.

tim went outside and saw his friends. they were all available to play. they started to play hide and seek. tim hid behind a big tree. his friends looked and looked, but they could not find him. tim was very good at hiding. he had so much fun playing with his friends.

once there was a kind little puppy. he was small and white, and his name was spot. he loved to explore and play outside.

one day, spot wanted to go out on an adventure. he tried to run away, but there was a leash around his collar. he looked down and frowned.

spot's mom saw him and she was very kind. she said, "let's go for a walk instead!" she took the leash off of spot and they went for a nice walk in the sunshine.

spot felt so happy. he wagged his tail and looked up at his mom with a big smile on his face. he was so glad that his mom was so kind.

tom and sam are friends. they like to play outside. one day, they find a kite in the park. it is big and red and has a long tail.

"wow, look at this kite!" tom says. "let's test it!"

"ok, but how do we test it?" sam asks.

"we need wind. wind makes the kite fly high. come on, follow me!" tom says. he runs to a hill with the kite.

tom and sam climb the hill. they see a lot of wind. they are happy. tom holds the kite and sam holds the string.

"ready, set, go!" tom says. he throws the kite in the air.

the kite flies up and up. it looks like a bird. tom and sam laugh and clap.

"look, our kite is the best!" tom says.

but then, something bad happens. the string breaks. the kite flies away. tom and sam are sad.

"oh no, our kite is gone!" sam says.

they run after the kite. they hope to catch it. but the kite is too fast. it flies over the trees and the houses.

they lose sight of the kite. they stop and sigh.

"i'm sorry, tom. it was my fault. i pulled the string too hard." sam says.

he feels embarrassed. he thinks tom is angry.

but tom is not angry. he is a good friend.

"it's ok, sam. it was an accident. don't be embarrassed. we can find another kite. or we can play something else." tom says.

he smiles and hugs sam.

"thanks, tom. you are a good friend. i'm sorry we lost the kite. but we had fun, right?" sam says.

he smiles and hugs tom back.

"yes, we had fun. and we learned something. we learned how to test a kite. maybe next time we can test something else." tom says.

they laugh and walk back to the park. they look for a new game to play. they are still friends.

one day, a small otter was playing near the water. he saw a big fish and wanted to catch it. he tried to slap the fish with his tail, but he missed. the fish swam away, and the otter felt sad.

the otter tried again and again to slap the fish, but he could not catch it. he became very serious. he said to himself, "i must catch that fish!" he watched the fish carefully and waited for the right time.

then, the otter saw the fish come near him. he slapped the water with all his strength. this time, he caught the fish! the otter was so happy. he said, "i did it! i caught the fish!" the little otter learned that if he was serious and tried hard, he could do anything.

one day, a little boy named tim went for a walk with his mom. they saw a big billboard with a funny picture on it. tim pointed at the billboard and said, "look, mom! funny face!" his mom looked and laughed too. tim felt happy that he made his mom laugh.

as they walked, tim started to feel tired. he let out a big yawn. his mom asked, "are you sleepy, tim?" tim shook his head and said, "no, mom. i want to keep walking." but his mom knew he was very tired, so they went back home. tim felt a little embarrassed because he didn't want his mom to know he was tired.

when they got home, tim went to his room to take a nap. but he couldn't sleep because he was still thinking about the funny face on the billboard. he got up and tried to draw the funny face, but it didn't look the same. tim felt sad because he couldn't make his mom laugh again. his drawing didn't look like the funny face on the billboard, and he didn't get the happy ending he wanted.

once upon a time there was a family that had a very strange iron. even though it looked like an ordinary iron, it had an unusual knack for making things better.

one day a little girl named sophie wanted to make her dress look nice. she grabbed some fabric and asked her mom to help her. mom agreed to help, but reminded sophie that she could also use the iron.

sophie was hesitant. "but that iron is weird!" she said.

mom smiled. "it's weird, but it works! i'm sure it'll help make your dress look nice."

sophie took the iron and started ironing her dress. when she was done, she proudly showed off her nice wrinkly-free fabric to mom.

"see? that iron really works," said mom.

sophie couldn't help but smile. she knew there was something special about that iron.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy train. he would push it around and make it go choo-choo. one day, timmy's friend came over to play. his friend was very helpful and they had lots of fun together. they decided to play catch with a ball. timmy's friend would throw the ball and timmy would try to catch it. but then, timmy got an idea. he asked his friend if they could throw the ball at the train and see what would happen. his friend agreed and they threw the ball at the train. it didn't break, but it did make a funny noise. timmy and his friend laughed and laughed. they had a great time playing together.

once upon a time, there was a girl named jane. she had a grape in her hand and she wanted to try it. jane asked her mom to let her eat it. her mom said yes.

jane was very excited. she put the grape in her mouth and bit it. but it was not very tasty. she didn't like it.

jane wanted to make the grape useful. so she decided to cut it up and put it in a salad. she worked very hard cutting up the grape.

finally, it was time to eat the salad. but when she tasted it, the salad was awful. jane didn't like it at all! the grape had not been useful.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a big palace. it was very pretty and had lots of rooms. one day, a kind queen wanted to introduce her gifted daughter to all the people in the palace. the daughter was very happy and wore a beautiful dress. she waved to everyone and smiled. all the people in the palace clapped and cheered for her. the daughter felt very special and loved.

once upon a time, there was a beetle. he was a pale little bug, with a brown shell and black spots. he lived in a garden which was filled with sweet-smelling flowers and buzzing bees. every morning he would display his wings to the sun. it made all the other beetles in the garden jealous, but he didn't care. he was so happy to be alive that nothing else mattered!

one day, he flew away from the garden, high up into the sky. there was a big, bright moon up there, which lit the way for him. he kept flying higher and higher until he was surrounded by stars. they shone brightly with their twinkling lights, and he felt so tiny beside them. 

suddenly, a shooting star flew past. it was so fast that it left a trail of sparkles in its wake. and then, it was gone. the beetle was filled with wonder. he had never seen anything like it before. little did he know, his tiny display of wings had made the stars come alive! 

the beetle flew back down to the garden, filled with happiness. he knew he had seen something special that day. and from then on, he never stopped displaying his wings to the sky.

one day, grandma and grandpa took their grandkids to the mountain. it was icy and very tall. grandma and grandpa told the grandkids to stay very close. 
suddenly, they heard a loud roar! the grandkids were worried that a monster was near. but it was okay. grandma and grandpa weighed the monster and it was too small to be a scary monster. 
the grandkids were happy, and they all went sledding down the icy mountain together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. sue had a big, rich house. she liked to play with her toys and dress up in pretty clothes. sue had her own style. she wore a blue dress, red shoes, and a yellow hat.

one day, sue went to the park to play. she saw a small boy named tim. tim was sad because he lost his toy car. sue wanted to help tim find his car. they looked under the slide, behind the tree, and in the sandbox.

suddenly, sue saw the toy car near the swings. she yelled, "tim, i found your car!" tim ran to sue and picked up his car. he was so happy. sue and tim played together at the park all day. they became best friends and always had fun together.

once upon a time there was a beautiful pale princess. she was very special and very kind. she wanted to buy something nice for herself, so she went to the market. 

at the market, she saw many things â€” delicious food, colourful toys and sparkly jewellery. but nothing was quite right. 

then, she saw a pink dress. it was perfect! the princess knew she had to buy it. 

she asked the shopkeeper how much it was. he said it was very expensive. the shopkeeper said she could have it if she worked hard and saved her pocket money. 

the princess was happy. she thanked the shopkeeper, paid him and went home. she wore the beautiful dress and felt like a princess.

once upon a time there were two friends, rex and ella. they were both very patient and liked to play together. 

one day, ella had an old rag and she wanted to make something special with it. she asked rex to come over to her house, so they could make something special together. 

rex was so excited and he said yes! ella showed rex the rag and they both sat and listened carefully. suddenly, they heard a strange noise coming from inside the rag. they looked closer and it was a small mouse!

the mouse was scared and started to cry. rex and ella were very patient, so they started to talk to the mouse in a very calm and gentle way. eventually the mouse stopped crying and rex and ella began to make a new coat for it.

when they finished, the mouse put on its new coat and thanked rex and ella for being so patient and kind. they said goodbye and the little mouse ran away with its new coat. rex and ella were very happy, they had been very patient and they felt like they had done something special.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to sing songs all day long. one day, her mom brought her a glass of great milk to drink. lily drank it all up and felt happy. she started to sing a song about the great milk she just had. her mom smiled and clapped for her. from then on, lily made sure to drink her milk every day so she could sing and dance all the time. the end.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy who loved going to the beach. he loved playing in the sand and swimming in the water. one day, timmy saw a family who looked helpless. they didn't have any food or toys to play with.

timmy went up to the family and said, "hi! do you need help?" the family said, "yes, we are hungry and bored. we don't have anything to eat or play with." timmy had an idea. he said, "i have some toys at home. i can sell them to you and we can use the money to buy food."

the family was happy and timmy went home to get his toys. he sold his toys to the family and they went to buy food. they had a picnic on the beach and played with the toys. timmy was happy that he could help the family and they all had a great day at the beach together. the end.

once upon a time, there was a big animal with a horn on its head. it lived in a far, far away place. the animal had many friends who liked to play with it.

one day, a loud sound came from the sky. it was a distant noise. the big animal and its friends were scared. they hid behind trees and rocks.

the big animal wanted to make the loud sound go away. so, it used its horn to strike a big tree. the loud sound stopped, and all the animals came out to play again. they were happy and safe.

once upon a time, there was a bluebird named pete. pete was a curious bird who liked to explore the world. one day, he decided to go on an adventure.

he spread his wings and began to jog. everywhere he went, he saw new things. he saw a river, a bridge, and trees.

then, he saw something he had never seen before - a bright yellow bucket! pete stopped jogging and flew over to take a closer look. he was very excited!

suddenly, a voice said, "don't touch that bucket!"

pete looked around, but he could not see anyone. "who said that?" he asked.

"it was me," a voice answered from around the corner. pete flew closer and saw a small, green frog.

the frog said, "that bucket is filled with unknown things. don't open it or something bad might happen."

pete thanked the frog for the warning. he decided not to open the bucket and flew away, jogging back home.

he never forgot the strange yellow bucket, but he was glad he never opened it. after all, it had been filled with something unknown.

once upon a time there was a little girl called lucy and she was playing with her toys in her bedroom. she had a really cute teddy bear that she loved and she was holding it close. 
suddenly, lucy noticed a switch at the bottom of her teddy bear and she quickly pressed it. in that moment, the teddy bear seemed to shrink! lucy was so surprised and she gasped.

then, lucy turned around to face her mum and said, "mummy, look what i did!"

mummy smiled at lucy and said, "wow, that is so cool. now you can cuddle with your teddy--even when you go to sleep!" 

lucy smiled and hugged her cute, small teddy bear. she loved it just the same even though it was smaller now.

ben and lily were best friends. they liked to play with marbles. they had many marbles of different colors and sizes. they always shared their marbles and played fair.

one day, they found a big, shiny marble in the park. it was the most beautiful marble they had ever seen. they both wanted it very much. they looked at each other and did not know what to do.

"let's part it," ben said. "we can cut it in half and each have a piece."

"no, let's not part it," lily said. "it will break and lose its shine. let's take turns to play with it. you can have it today and i can have it tomorrow."

ben thought for a moment. he really wanted the whole marble for himself. he had an idea. he said, "okay, let's do that. but let's make a promise. we have to be honest and give it back when it is the other's turn. do you promise?"

lily nodded. she trusted ben. she said, "i promise. do you promise?"

ben nodded. he lied. he said, "i promise."

they played with the marble for a while. then it was time to go home. ben put the marble in his pocket and said goodbye to lily. he did not give it back. he ran away.

lily was sad. she waited for ben the next day, but he did not come. she looked for him in the park, but he was not there. she asked his mom, but she said he was sick. she did not believe her. she knew ben had broken his promise. he had kept the marble for himself. he was not honest. he was not a good friend.

ben was happy. he had the marble for himself. he played with it in his room. he did not care about lily. he did not care about his promise. he was not honest. he was not a good friend.

but one day, something bad happened. ben was playing with the marble on his bed. he rolled it too hard and it fell off. it hit the floor and cracked. it lost its shine. it was broken. ben was shocked. he cried. he wished he had shared the marble with lily. he wished he had kept his promise. he wished he had been honest. he wished he had been a good friend.

the moral of the story is: be honest and share with your friends. if you are greedy and lie, you will lose what you have and what you love.

once there was an ancient squirrel.he wanted to find someone to forgive him. he ran through the forest looking for help. he saw a mother bear and her cubs playing. he knew he wanted them to forgive him.
he hopped up to them and asked, "will you forgive me please?"
the mother bear was kind and smiled. she said, "yes, of course i forgive you". then she hugged him gently. 
the squirrel was so relieved. he thanked the mother bear and ran off happily. 
from then on, he knew it was important to ask for forgiveness. he also remembered to be kind to other animals.

sara and ben are playing in the park. they like to run and jump and slide. they see a big hill with many trees and flowers. they want to climb the hill and see what is on the other side.

they hold hands and start to walk up the hill. they hear a funny sound. it sounds like a hiss. they stop and look around. they see a long, thin thing on the ground. it has scales and a tongue. it is a snake!

"look, sara, a snake!" ben says. he points at the snake.

"wow, ben, a snake!" sara says. she looks at the snake. it is not green or brown or black. it is pink! a pink snake!

"hello, snake!" sara says. she waves at the snake.

the snake looks at sara and ben. it hisses again. it does not like to be disturbed. it wants to be alone.

"go away, kids!" the snake says. it is a talking snake!

sara and ben are surprised. they did not know snakes can talk. they are also scared. they do not want to make the snake angry.

"sorry, snake!" ben says. he pulls sara by the hand. "let's go back to the park!"

they run down the hill as fast as they can. they do not look back at the snake. they are glad to be away from the pink, talking snake.

they tell their mom and dad about the snake. their mom and dad do not believe them. they think they are making up a story. they laugh and hug them.

sara and ben do not mind. they know what they saw and heard. they will always remember the day they met the pink, talking snake.

jane was a little girl who loved to explore and play. everywhere she went, she would always behave very well. she was often called "jane" by her friends, but her parents gave her a different name. 

one day, jane was feeling especially brave and curious. she decided to take a walk through the woods. the woods held many different animals, and jane loved to see them. 

as jane explored the woods, she stumbled across a little house with a funny looking roof. "who lives here?" she asked. she peeked through the window and saw a family of bears. the bears were behaving very politely, and jane smiled with delight. 

the bears noticed jane and smiled back. one of the bears introduced himself as wisdom and asked jane what her name was. she introduced herself as margaret, a different name to what her parents called her. the entire family of bears began to laugh. 

jane and the bears quickly became friends. they spent the remainder of the day exploring the woods together and behaved so kindly towards one another. from then on, jane often visited the bears, and each time, her parents were always glad to hear about her adventures.

once upon a time, in a small house, lived a little girl named lily. she loved to sing songs all day long. one day, lily heard a scary noise outside her window. she was very scared and hid under her bed.

her mommy came into the room and said, "lily, what's wrong?" lily whispered, "i heard a scary noise, mommy." her mommy smiled and said, "don't worry, i have an idea to make you feel better. let's replace the scary noise with a happy song."

lily and her mommy sang a happy song together. they sang so loud that the scary noise went away. the next day, lily went outside and saw a big, friendly dog. it turns out, the scary noise was just the dog barking. from that day on, lily and the dog became best friends, and they sang happy songs together every day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the garden. one day, she saw a pretty flower and wanted to pick it. but when she got close, a bee flew out and started to spray her with its stinger. lily got scared and ran back inside her house.

later that day, lily's mommy asked her to help her with something. she gave her an envelope and asked her to spray it with some perfume. lily was happy to help and sprayed the envelope with the sweet smell. then, her mommy put a letter inside and licked the envelope to seal it shut.

when lily's mommy asked her if she wanted to taste something bitter, lily shook her head no. she didn't like bitter things. but her mommy explained that sometimes bitter things can be good for you, like medicine. lily didn't understand, but she trusted her mommy.

once upon a time, there lived a little girl named jessica. she was a very adventurous girl and loved to explore. she decided to go outside and explore the garden. when she arrived in the garden, she spotted a tall, green plant. it was celery! she was amazed and admired it.

"how cool!" she exclaimed.

she admired it closely and decided to take it home with her. she took out her basket and put the celery in it. she was so proud of herself. 

jessica brought the celery to her mom, who was very pleased.

"what an adventurous girl you are!" her mom said.

jessica smiled proudly and said, "let's have some celery for dinner!"

and so, jessica and her family enjoyed celery for dinner and admired jessica for her adventurous spirit. the end.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was patient and quiet. she really wanted to play with some matches. but she wasn't allowed to do that.

one day, her mother had to leave the house. so she left the little girl alone with the television.

the little girl was very patient. she sat still and watched the television quietly. then suddenly something wonderful happened. the little girl saw some beautiful pictures on the television that matched the matches she wanted to play with!

the little girl was so excited. she watched for a very long time. finally the pictures on the tv stopped and the mother returned to the house.

but the little girl kept thinking about the matches that matched the pictures she had seen. it was a very happy thought and it made her smile.

once upon a time, there was a big fire in the woods. the fire was so hot that it melted all the snow and ice. the animals were very scared because they were not used to seeing a big fire like this.

suddenly, a big bear came out from the woods and growled loudly. the bear was so big that he was able to chase the fire away from the woods. all the animals cheered and thanked the bear for rescuing them.

after the fire was gone, the snow and ice melted and the woods became green and beautiful again. the bear went back to the woods and the animals returned to their homes.

the animals were happy that the big fire was gone and could never hurt them again. they were glad that the big bear had been there to help them.

in the morning, jack woke up. he looked outside his window and he could see snow on the ground. it looked so cold. he put his coat on and he stepped outside. the snow was so white and glittering. jack wanted to stand in it! he walked over to the snow and he stood there. he laughed and enjoyed the cold snow under his feet. he looked over and saw his friends. they were calling him to come play in the snow. he waved and ran over to join them. they were having so much fun! they played in the snow and made snowballs. the cold snow felt so good! for hours they played in the cold snow. jack couldn't remember ever having so much fun!

once upon a time there were two friends, bob and jane. they were playing in the park one day. 

"what shall we do today?" asked jane. 

"i know," replied bob. "let's borrow a pistol from my dad."

"what's a pistol?" jane asked.

"it's a hard toy," replied bob. 

bob and jane hurried to bob's house, and he grabbed the pistol from his father's room. then they ran back out to the park.

bob and jane played with the pistol all day long, laughing and squealing. but when it started to get dark, bob noticed something strange about the gun. it wasn't a toy at allâ€” it was a real pistol!

suddenly, bob and jane heard a loud, scary noise coming from the bushes. everyone frozeâ€” it was a policeman!

"what are you two doing with that gun?" he yelled.

bob and jane quickly explained what had happened. the policeman nodded and said, "kids, it is not safe to borrow things that adults use. it's a good thing you got caught, otherwise you could have put yourselves in danger. now, let's take this pistol back to its owner."

bob and jane learned their lesson that dayâ€” always be careful what you borrow!

tommy was so excited for his birthday. he was three years old and loved when his family sang for him. he ran around the house, wearing an orange shirt and calling for everyone to sing.

his mom smiled at him. "let's sing the birthday song," she said. 

tommy clapped and laughed, his face beaming. he sang the song very well and even knew the words. when the song was finished, he jumped with joy and shouted, "let's sing it again!" 

his dad smiled and kissed him on the head. "that's enough singing for now," he said. "let's have a piece of cake." 

tommy grinned and hurried to the kitchen. together, they all sang the birthday song one more time before everyone enjoyed the delicious orange cake.

once there was a little boy called jack. he was three years old. one day jack was playing in the garden when the telephone rang. he ran inside and picked it up. on the telephone was his grandma. she said "i have something very tasty for you. can you come and visit me?"

jack said yes. he put on his coat and his shoes and he took some coins. he went to the train station. once he was there, he got on the train. the train took him to grandma's house. 

when he arrived jack saw that his grandma had made some nice cake. it was very tasty. jack ate some yummy cake with his grandma. then he helped her complete her puzzle. they worked together to put the last piece in place. 

when the puzzle was finally complete, grandma gave jack a hug. he had a great time visiting his grandma and eating some tasty cake.

tom and sam are friends. they like to play with their toy carts. they push them on the floor and make noises. vroom, vroom, beep, beep!

one day, they find a new toy in the box. it is a gun. it can shoot little balls. tom and sam are curious. they want to try it.

"can i shoot the gun?" tom asks.

"ok, but be careful. don't shoot me or the cart," sam says.

tom takes the gun and aims at the wall. he pulls the trigger. bang! the gun makes a loud noise. a ball flies out and hits the wall. tom and sam are surprised. they laugh.

"that was fun! let me try!" sam says.

he takes the gun from tom and aims at the door. he pulls the trigger. bang! the gun makes a loud noise again. a ball flies out and hits the door. but the door is not closed. it is open. and behind the door is mom.

mom hears the noise and sees the ball. she is not happy. she comes to the room and sees tom and sam with the gun.

"who gave you that gun? that is not a toy. that is dangerous. you could hurt someone or break something. give it to me right now!" mom says.

tom and sam are scared. they drop the gun and run to their carts. they hug them and say sorry.

"sorry, mom. we didn't know. we won't play with the gun again," they say.

mom picks up the gun and puts it away. she is still angry, but she loves tom and sam. she hugs them and says.

"i know you didn't mean to do anything bad. but you have to be careful with things you don't know. guns are not for children. they are for grown-ups. and even grown-ups have to use them wisely. do you understand?" she says.

tom and sam nod. they understand. they say they love mom. mom says she loves them too. she tells them to play with their carts, but not to make too much noise. she goes back to the kitchen.

tom and sam play with their carts quietly. they don't want to make mom angry again. they are happy with their carts. they don't need the gun. they have each other.

once there was a boy. he was three years old and very serious. one day he wanted food, so he went to the store. when he arrived, he saw lots of different food. he was so excited and wanted to try them all.

the boy chose some fruit and candy. he smiled as he put them in the cart. the store was very big and the boy got lost. he was very scared but stayed very serious. he asked a lady for help.

the lady smiled and said, "follow me". she took the boy to the checkout line. he paid for his food and thanked the lady. she waved goodbye when the boy left the store.

the boy was so happy to have food. he ran home, ate his food and was very satisfied. it was a great day for the serious boy!

"i'm sorry mommy," she said. "i wanted to help perform too." 

her mom smiled and said, "it's okay jackie, i understand. let's try again tomorrow, okay?"

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a soft teddy bear named brownie. one day, lily and brownie went on a big adventure in their toy car. but, uh-oh! the car ran out of fuel! 

lily said, "brownie, we need to find more fuel for the car. let's go ask mr. bear where we can find some." 

they went to mr. bear's house and asked him, "do you know where we can find more fuel for our car?" 

mr. bear shook his head and said, "i don't know. but, i have some yummy cookies for you and brownie to eat while you look for fuel." 

lily and brownie were happy and ate the cookies. then, they went on their way to find fuel for their car. they searched high and low until they found a gas station. they filled up the car with fuel and continued on their adventure. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing outside and getting dirty. one day, she came home with mud all over her clothes and her mom said, "lily, you need to clean up before dinner."

lily went to take a bath but she didn't like the soap her mom gave her. she wanted a massage instead. her mom said, "i don't have time for a massage, but i can wash your hair and give you a little rub."

lily didn't like the rub and she was still upset about not getting a massage. she went to bed grumpy. the next day, lily's mom surprised her with a cheap massage kit. lily was so happy and she promised to always clean up before dinner from now on.

patty was a modest mouse. she was playing in the garden one sunny day when she heard a strange noise. she was curious and decided to follow it.

suddenly, patty saw a large bird with beautiful feathers. she wanted to get closer for a better sight, but the bird flew away.

patty chased it, but the bird flew too fast. she began to cry, but then she heard the noise again.

patty saw the bird was hiding behind a tree. she smiled and went closer, but the bird flew again. so she decided to hide and wait for it.

patty hid behind the tree and waited. after a while, the bird came back. it said, "hi, i'm peep. what are you doing here?"

patty said, "i'm looking for a friend! do you want to play together?"

peep smiled and said, "of course, let's play!"

the two friends spent the whole day playing and laughing together. patty knew she had found a special friend.

once upon a time, there was a brave girl who liked to try new things. she thought, â€œi dare to eat a waffle!â€ so she went to the famous waffle tower. inside, she saw many yummy-looking waffles. she picked one up and took a big bite. it was delicious! she took another bite and another. soon, she had eaten all the waffle. it had been so tasty that she wanted another. so, she went back to the famous waffle tower and got another. she gobbled it all up too. the brave girl had tried something she had never tried before and the food had been so yummy! she was so happy.

once upon a time, there was a bright sun that loved to shine. the sun would shine every day, making everyone happy. one day, the sun found a long cord. the cord was very special and rare. the sun wanted to show the cord to all its friends.

the sun took the rare cord to the moon and the stars. the moon and the stars liked the cord too. they all played with the cord, making fun shapes and patterns in the sky. the sun, the moon, and the stars were very happy with their new toy.

one day, the sun, the moon, and the stars decided to share the rare cord with the people on earth. they let the cord shine brightly in the sky for everyone to see. the people loved the cord and were very happy. from that day on, the sun, the moon, and the stars continued to shine and play with the rare cord, making everyone smile.

tom and amy were having lunch with mom and dad. they liked to eat sandwiches and fruit. mom gave them each a napkin to wipe their mouths. tom and amy said thank you.

"can i have some juice, please?" amy asked.

"sure, honey. here you go," mom said and poured some juice in her cup.

tom wanted some juice too. he reached for the pitcher, but he spilled some juice on the table. he felt bad. he looked at mom and dad.

"i'm sorry, i'm sorry," he said.

mom and dad smiled. they were not angry. they knew tom was trying to be a big boy.

"it's okay, tom. accidents happen. just use your napkin to clean it up," dad said.

tom used his napkin to wipe the juice. he felt better. he smiled too.

"thank you, dad. thank you, mom," he said.

"you're welcome, tom. you're welcome, amy," mom and dad said.

they finished their lunch and put their plates and cups in the sink. mom and dad said they could play for a while, but then they had to take a nap.

tom and amy nodded. they liked to play, but they also liked to nap. they knew naps made them feel good and light. they ran to their room and picked their favorite toys. they played happily until mom and dad came to tuck them in. they gave them hugs and kisses and said good night.

tom and amy closed their eyes and smiled. they had a good day. they dreamed of more sandwiches, fruit, juice, and napkins.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and imagine that she was a princess in a big castle. one day, lily found a tube in her backyard. it was long and wide, and she wondered what she could do with it.

lily started to imagine that the tube was a telescope and she could see all the stars in the sky. she looked through the tube and saw a shooting star! she made a wish and hoped it would come true.

later, lily used the tube as a tunnel for her toy cars to drive through. it was so wide that even her biggest car could fit inside. lily had so much fun with her tube that she decided to keep it and use it for more adventures.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and run around in the park. one day, her mommy came home with a big package. "lily, look what i got for you!" she said, as she handed the package to her daughter. lily was so excited and opened it right away.

inside the package was a puzzle, but it was a difficult one. lily tried and tried, but she couldn't solve it. she asked her mommy for help. "mommy, can you help me solve this puzzle? it's too difficult for me," she said. her mommy replied, "of course, lily. let's study it together." 

and so, they both sat down and studied the puzzle. they worked on it for a long time, but finally, they solved it! lily was so happy and proud of herself. "thank you, mommy. i couldn't have done it without you," she said. and her mommy replied, "you're welcome, lily. i'm always here to help you."

once there was a friendly rabbit. he had a secret and he wanted to tell it to someone but he couldn't find the right person.

so the rabbit began to whisper around the garden. he was looking for a keen listener, one that was honest and trustworthy.

he eventually met a lime. he asked the lime if he wanted to listen. the lime was quiet but he nodded his head in agreement.

the rabbit leaned close and whispered his secret to the lime. he told the lime his secret that he wanted to share. the lime was the most honest listener, so the rabbit was sure his secret was safe.

then the rabbit hopped away, feeling happy and relieved that his secret was safe. the lime had heard his secret and it would stay a secret forever.

so, the two twin sisters flew way up high in the sky. they could see the sun, the trees and the clouds.

the second sister said, â€œyes, it was awesome!â€

once there was a clever truck. it always wanted to help. one day it needed to do something special. so it decided to load some grass. it made sure it was very careful and intelligent when it was loading the grass. it worked very hard to make sure the grass was safely loaded. 

when the grass was loaded, the clever truck was very proud of itself. it had done a great job! the truck drove away, taking the grass with it. it felt so happy to have been able to help.

once upon a time there was a chubby bear. he was very fat and happy. one day, he decided to go on an adventure. he opened the door and started walking. 

but soon, he reached a big hill with a pass through it. he had never seen a pass before, and he wanted to go through it. he tried to climb the hill, but it was too hard. 

suddenly, he heard a voice. "hey bear! need some help?" it was a rabbit. the rabbit said, "i can help you go through the pass. follow me!" 

the bear followed the rabbit and eventually they both made it up the hill and went through the pass. 

the bear was so happy that he was able to open the pass with the help of the friendly rabbit. he thanked the rabbit for helping him and then started on his way to explore more of the world.

once upon a time there was a girl. she liked to be creative. she made her own jacket with her own two hands. she sewed it with bright colors and sparkles. it was a very special jacket. 

one day the girl went outside with her new jacket. suddenly it started to rain! she was not sure what to do. she held the jacket close to her and smiled. 

just then, a kind and friendly man said, "i have an umbrella so you can hold it over your head". he helped her keep her jacket dry and the rain could not touch her. 

the girl smiled and thanked the kind man. she was so happy that she held tightly onto the wonderful jacket she had created. 

the end.

sara likes to design things. she draws pictures of dresses, cars, animals and flowers. she has many crayons and papers. she is very happy when she makes something new.

one day, sara wants to design a home for her dolls. she finds a big box and some scissors. she cuts the box and makes windows, doors and a roof. she uses glue and tape to stick things on the box. she uses stickers, ribbons, buttons and feathers to decorate the box. she thinks her home is very pretty.

but when she shows her home to her mom, her mom is not happy. she says the home is terrible. she says sara made a big mess. she says sara used things that are not for playing. she says sara could hurt herself with the scissors and the glue. she says sara has to clean up everything and say sorry.

sara feels very sad. she does not understand why her mom is angry. she thinks her home is nice. she loves her dolls and wants them to have a good home. she starts to cry.

her mom sees that sara is crying. she feels sorry for sara. she hugs sara and says she is sorry too. she says she knows sara likes to design things, but she has to be careful and ask before she uses things. she says she will help sara clean up and find better things to play with. she says she loves sara and her designs.

sara stops crying. she says she is sorry too. she says she will be careful and ask next time. she says she loves her mom and her home. she smiles and hugs her mom. they clean up together and have fun.

john was glad to be playing with his toy cars. his dad had given him a bright yellow one he could use all day. suddenly, john heard a loud noise. he started to panic. he looked around and saw a big mark on the wall. his dad was not happy. he shouted at john to never do something like this again. john was very sad. he felt like he did something wrong. 

at night, john was too scared to sleep. he kept thinking about the mark. he felt so worried. in the morning, he started to cry. 

john was very glad when his dad came to his room. he said he was sorry and hugged john. but john was not happy for too long. his dad told him that he had to go to his room for a whole week for making the mark on the wall. 

john was very sad. he didn't understand why he had to be punished. he started to panic. he would never do something like this again.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved going to the theater with his mommy and daddy. they would watch plays and sing songs. timmy always ate delicious popcorn while watching the show.

one day, timmy's parents were sick, and they couldn't go to the theater. timmy was sad because he wanted to see a play. but then, timmy had an idea. he could lead his own play! he gathered his toys and made a stage out of a box. he put on a show for his parents, and they loved it. timmy was happy because he got to be the star of his own theater show.

jenny and her dad were playing in the park. dad said, "let's travel to the ocean". jenny was very excited and said, "yes, let's go!"

they took the bus to the beach and they could see the large ocean in front of them. they looked around and saw a lot of things. jenny saw a giant faucet and she ran over to check it out.

"what is this daddy?" she asked.

dad laughed and said, "this is a faucet. it's really big and it helps us get water from the ground."

jenny said, "wow! that's amazing!"

they stayed at the beach for the rest of the day and had a lot of fun. they watched the waves and built sand castles. they even found some seashells to take home.

at the end of the day, the travel back home. jenny was so happy and said, "can we come back again soon daddy?"

dad smiled and said, "of course we can, i would love to." 

that was the best day ever!

once upon a time, a small girl named lucy was playing in the garden. she wanted to make something special and decorate it with her own hands.

mummy came out to help her and asked, â€œwhat would you like to decorate, lucy?â€

lucy grinned and pointed to the garden track.

â€œletâ€™s decorate the track,â€ she said happily.

mummy bought some bright flowers and colourful pom-poms for them to use. they also had some paint and glitter that would make the track look extra special.

the two of them set to work. they painted the track with stripes and added sparkly flowers along the side.

â€œdo you like it?â€ asked mummy.

â€œyes, it looks very available,â€ replied lucy.

mummy smiled. â€œletâ€™s go show daddy what weâ€™ve done!â€

so together they went to show daddy their special decorated track. daddy said it was the most beautiful track heâ€™d ever seen.

lucy and mummy were proud of their work. they knew they had made something beautiful that they would remember forever.

sara loved to play with yarn. she had many colors of yarn in her box. she liked to make things with yarn, like hats and scarves and dolls. she always shared her yarn with her friends.

one day, sara found a new ball of yarn in her box. it was very soft and shiny. it was pink and purple and blue. sara thought it was the most beautiful yarn ever. she wanted to make something special with it. she did not want to share it with anyone.

she took the yarn and hid it under her bed. she thought no one would find it there. she planned to make a big blanket with it. she thought it would keep her warm and cozy at night.

but sara did not know that the yarn did not belong to her. it belonged to her mom. her mom had bought it for a surprise. she wanted to make a sweater for sara's birthday. she had put the yarn in sara's box by mistake.

the next day, sara's mom looked for the yarn. she could not find it in her bag. she could not find it in the closet. she could not find it anywhere. she was very sad. she thought she had lost the yarn.

she asked sara if she had seen the yarn. sara felt guilty. she knew she had taken the yarn. she did not want to lie to her mom. but she did not want to give up the yarn. she did not know what to do.

she decided to tell the truth. she went to her room and got the yarn. she brought it to her mom. she said she was sorry. she said she thought the yarn was hers. she said she wanted to make a blanket with it.

her mom hugged her. she said she was not angry. she said she was glad sara told the truth. she said the yarn was for sara's birthday. she said she wanted to make a sweater with it.

she asked sara if she wanted to help her. sara nodded. she said yes. she said she liked the yarn. she said she liked sweaters. she said she liked her mom.

they went to the couch and sat together. they took the yarn and the needles. they started to knit. they made a sweater with the yarn. it was very soft and shiny. it was pink and purple and blue. it was the most beautiful sweater ever.

sara was happy. she learned a lesson. she learned that sharing is better than hiding. she learned that telling the truth is better than lying. she learned that the yarn belonged to her and her mom. she learned that they belonged to each other.

lily was a little girl who liked to ask many questions. she wanted to know everything about the world. sometimes, her mom and dad were too busy to answer her. they had to work, cook, clean, and do other things. lily felt sad and bored when they did not reply.

one day, lily saw a big book on the shelf. it had many pictures of animals, plants, and places. lily loved animals, plants, and places. she took the book and opened it. she saw a lion, a rose, and a mountain. she wanted to know more about them. she ran to her mom and dad with the book.

"mom, dad, look at this book! what is this? and this? and this?" lily asked, pointing at the pictures.

her mom and dad looked at the book and smiled. they were happy that lily was curious and eager to learn. but they also had a lot of work to do. they could not reply to all of lily's questions right away.

"lily, this is a very nice book. but we can't talk to you now. we have to finish our work. can you wait a little bit?" her mom said.

lily did not like to wait. she wanted to know everything now. she pouted and said, "no, i can't wait. i want to know now. please, please, please!"

her dad sighed and said, "lily, we love you, but you have to be patient. we can't reply to you every time you ask something. sometimes, you have to find out things by yourself. or you can listen to a lecture. a lecture is when someone tells you a lot of things about something. like a teacher or a storyteller. do you want to listen to a lecture?"

lily thought for a moment. she liked to listen to stories. maybe a lecture was like a story. she nodded and said, "yes, i want to listen to a lecture. who can give me a lecture?"

her dad smiled and said, "well, how about grandma? she knows a lot of things. and she likes to talk to you. maybe she can give you a lecture about the book. do you want to call her?"

lily liked grandma. grandma was always kind and funny. and she had a lot of stories to tell. lily nodded and said, "yes, i want to call grandma. can we call her now?"

her mom and dad agreed. they picked up the phone and dialed grandma's number. lily held the book and waited. she hoped grandma would reply. she hoped grandma would give her a lecture. she hoped grandma would tell her everything about the lion, the rose, and the mountain.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very cold. she was walking through a snowy forest, looking for a place to rest. she was tired and shivering. suddenly, she saw a light in the distance and walked towards it.

when she arrived, she saw a kind old woman. she had a warm smile and a blanket in her hands. the old woman wrapped the little girl up so that she was no longer cold.
she smiled and said, "come with me if you want warmth."

the little girl followed the kind old woman to a small house. inside, the old woman told the girl to sit down. she then kneeled down and began to pray. the girl watched as the old woman prayed with a persistent heart.

the old woman prayed for the little girl and asked god to keep her safe and warm. the little girl felt a warm feeling inside as she heard the old woman's prayer. she smiled, knowing that she was safe.

when the old woman finished her prayer, she stood up and gave the little girl a big hug. the little girl smiled, grateful for the warmth and kindness she had been shown. from then on, the old woman was like a grandmother to the little girl, always taking care of her.

lily was excited to go to the zoo with her mom. she loved to see the animals and hear their sounds. she put on her hat and coat and ran to the door.

"wait for me, lily!" her mom said. "we need to take the bus to the zoo. it will be fun!"

lily nodded and smiled. she liked the bus. it was big and yellow and made a loud noise. she and her mom walked to the bus stop and waited for the bus to come.

soon, they saw the bus coming down the street. lily waved her hand and shouted, "bus! bus!"

the bus stopped and the door opened. lily and her mom got on the bus and paid the driver. lily said, "thank you, driver!" the driver smiled and said, "you're welcome, little girl. enjoy the zoo!"

lily and her mom found a seat and sat down. lily looked out the window and saw the trees and cars and people. she was happy and excited.

but then, something bad happened. the bus hit a big rock and made a loud bang. the bus shook and tilted and slid off the road. lily and her mom screamed and held each other. the bus crashed into a tree and stopped. lily and her mom were hurt and scared. they saw smoke and fire and heard people crying and shouting.

lily and her mom tried to get out of the bus, but the door was stuck. they were trapped in the bus. lily cried and said, "mom, i don't want to be in the bus. i want to go to the zoo!"

her mom hugged her and said, "i know, lily. i know. i'm sorry. i love you."

they waited for help, but help did not come. the fire got bigger and hotter and the smoke got thicker and darker. lily and her mom could not breathe. they closed their eyes and said goodbye. they did not go to the zoo. they did not see the animals. they did not hear their sounds. they did not have fun. they died in the bus.

once upon a time, there was a grumpy tower who was very lonely. the tower had no friends and so it was very sad. one day, a little boy came walking along the path. he saw the tower and was very sad to see it so grumpy and alone.

he stopped in front of the tower and said, "don't be so grumpy! come, let's be friends!" the tower felt a bit better and was happy that the little boy wanted to be its friend.

the little boy hugged the tower and smiled. "i will be your friend and comfort you when you are lonely," he said. the tower was very happy to have a friend. from then on, the little boy and the tower were very good friends. they played together every day and the little boy always comforted the tower when it was feeling lonely or grumpy. they both lived happily ever after!

once upon a time, there was a little girl called sarah. she was three years old and loved going on trips.

one day, sarah and her family decided to take a trip together. everyone was very excited but sarah was the most excited of them all. they packed their bags and set off.

after a long journey, they arrived at the beach. the beach was very beautiful and sarah wanted to explore it. she played in the sand and splashed in the sea.

after a while, sarah got very dirty and it was time to go back home. her family said it was time to wash sarah so she could be all original again. 

sarah got into a warm bath and her family washed her all over. she was soon all clean. then, everyone dressed her in clean clothes. 

that was the end of the trip! sarah and her family had a great time and she was happy to be clean and original again.

once upon a time, there was a squirrel. the squirrel was very patient. he waited and waited for his friend to come and play. finally, his friend came! they played together and had so much fun. they played tag and hide-and-seek. 

but then, the squirrel's friend accidentally pushed him. the squirrel was surprised and fell down. but his friend helped him up and said sorry. the squirrel forgave his friend and they continued to play together. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a cute puppy named max. max loved to play outside in the sun. one day, max saw some police officers walking by. they said hello to max and patted his head. max was happy to see them. 

later that day, max was tired from playing and decided to lay down in the grass. he closed his eyes and took a nap. when he woke up, he saw the police officers again. they were looking for a lost kitten. max wanted to help, so he sniffed around and found the kitten hiding in a bush. the police officers were very happy and thanked max for his help. 

from that day on, max became friends with the police officers. they would often stop by and say hello to max. max was happy to have new friends and he knew he had helped the police officers find the lost kitten.

once there was a boy who was walking through the woods. as he walked he felt something crunchy under his feet. he looked down and noticed a nut. he bent down and picked it up. he felt it and noticed that it was really hard. he smashed it with his hand and opened it. inside he found a sour nut. he quickly ate the nut before carrying on his journey.

the boy was very happy, the sour nut tasted delicious. he looked up into the sky, smiled and felt content. no matter what had happened before he was sure there were more adventures to come.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a pack of gum that he loved very much. he would take a piece of gum out of the pack every day and chew it. one day, timmy went to the park to play. he saw a little girl who looked very lonely. she didn't have any friends to play with.

timmy felt sad for the little girl, so he decided to share his gum with her. he took a piece of gum out of his pack and gave it to her. the little girl was so happy and thanked timmy. they became friends and played together for the rest of the day. timmy was happy that he could make someone else happy by sharing his gum.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to go on adventures with her mom and dad. one day, they decided to go on a trip to a big hotel in the city. 

when they arrived, lily was so excited to explore the hotel. she ran around really fast and giggled with joy. but then, she got lost in the big hotel. she couldn't find her mom and dad anywhere. 

lily started to feel scared and sad. she saw a nice lady and asked her for help. the lady guessed that lily was lost and took her to the front desk. the front desk person called lily's mom and dad, and they came to get her. 

lily was so happy to be reunited with her family. they hugged and kissed her, and lily felt safe and loved. from then on, she promised to never run too fast and always stay close to her mom and dad.

sara and tom are friends. they like to play in the park. there is a big swing in the park. sara and tom take turns on the swing. they push each other and go high in the air. they laugh and have fun.

one day, they see a river near the park. the river is blue and shiny. it makes a sound like "shhh". sara and tom want to see the river. they run to the river and look at it. they see fish and ducks and stones in the river.

"can we touch the river?" sara asks tom.

"ok, but be careful," tom says. "the river may be cold."

they hold hands and walk to the edge of the river. they dip their toes in the water. the water is cold and wet. they shiver and giggle.

"brrr, the river is cold!" sara says.

"yes, it is. let's go back to the swing," tom says.

they run back to the park and get on the swing. they push each other and go high in the air. they forget about the cold river. they laugh and have fun.

once upon a time, there were two very different creatures - a bear and a mouse. the bear was very, very hungry and noticed a vine full of juicy white grapes.

the bear said, "i'm so hungry! i must eat those white grapes!"

the mouse scurried over to the bear and said, "please don't eat the grapes, bear! if you destroy the vine, there won't be any more grapes and we'll be hungry forever!"

the bear thought for a moment and realised that the mouse was right. he said, "you're right, little mouse. we must work together to look after the vine and the white grapes. then everyone will have something to eat!"

the bear and the mouse happily worked together to look after the vine. they picked the grapes, watered the vine and protected it from pests. 

the moral of the story is that it's important to take care of what we have, so that everyone has enough to eat. working together helps us to do that!

once upon a time, there was a fat cat named tom. tom was very proud of his round body and he loved to rest. one day tom was relaxing in the sun when a small mouse scurried by. the mouse was so surprised to see tom that he stopped in his tracks and said, "hi tom, why are you so fat? that's very strange!"
tom chuckled at the mouse and said, "why i am so fat is none of your business. but if you really want to know, i am fat because i love to rest."
the mouse smiled and exclaimed, "that's a good point! resting does sound like fun. i think i'll join you!"
tom was very pleased and he said, "come over here, there is a nice spot for us to rest together."
the two animals rested together for hours. they enjoyed the sun and the peacefulness that came with it. at the end of the day, they both had a sense of contentment, knowing that rest is important to our lives.

once upon a time, there were two best friends, named april and jimmy. april and jimmy loved to spend the afternoon playing silly outdoor games. 

one day they decided to have a standing quiz. it was a fun idea because they could compete with each other to see who remembered the most silly things. "let's go!", said april excitedly. 

jimmy started the quiz. "what animal has stripes and loves to climb trees?", he asked. april thought for a moment and then shouted, "a tiger!" jimmy smiled. "that's right!", he said. 

april stood tall while the game went on. at the end of the quiz, they both had a big laugh because they had both learned many silly things. april said, "that was fun!" and jimmy agreed. they hugged and spun around, laughing in delight!

lily and max are twins. they like to play together on the lawn. the lawn is big and green and soft. they have a ball, a bike, and a doll.

one day, mom says, "lily and max, you have to separate. lily, you go to grandma's house. max, you stay with me. we have to do some things."

lily and max are sad. they do not want to separate. they want to play together on the lawn.

"why, mom?" lily asks.

"because grandma is sick. she needs some help. and i have to go to the store. it is only for a little while. you will see each other soon. i promise." mom says.

lily and max hug each other. they say, "i love you. i will miss you."

mom takes lily to the car. max waves goodbye. he watches them drive away.

max feels lonely. he does not want to play on the lawn by himself. he sits on the porch and waits for mom.

after a while, mom comes back. she has a surprise for max. she gives him a beautiful flower. it is red and yellow and smells nice.

"look, max. this is for you. i saw it at the store and i thought of you. you are my beautiful boy. i love you." mom says.

max smiles. he hugs mom and the flower. he says, "thank you, mom. i love you too. can i put the flower on the lawn?"

"of course, you can. let's go together." mom says.

they go to the lawn. they find a spot for the flower. they dig a hole and plant it. they water it and pat it.

max feels happy. he has a beautiful flower on the lawn. he thinks of lily. he hopes she is happy too. he says, "mom, can we call lily and tell her about the flower?"

"sure, we can. let's go inside and call her." mom says.

they go inside and call lily. lily is happy to hear from them. she tells them about grandma and her house. she says she misses them.

max tells her about the flower and the lawn. he says he misses her too.

they say, "i love you. i will see you soon."

they hang up and smile. they know they will play together on the lawn again. they are twins. they are always together in their hearts.

once upon a time, there was a green truck. the truck was very big and had lots of wheels. one day, the truck went on a long trip to deliver toys to children. 

after the truck had delivered all the toys, the driver realized he had forgotten something. he said, "oh no! i forgot my lunch box. i need to return to the toy factory to get it." 

the truck turned around and drove back to the toy factory. when the driver got there, he found his lunch box and said, "phew! i'm glad i found my lunch box. now i can go back home." the end.

tom and lily were best friends. they liked to play with their toys, read books, and watch tv together. they had a cable that let them watch many shows on the big screen.

one day, tom had to go away with his family. he was sad to leave lily. he gave her a hug and said, "i will miss you, lily. you are my perfect friend."

"i will miss you too, tom. you are my perfect friend. when will you come back?" lily asked.

"soon, i hope. maybe in two weeks. i will call you when i can," tom said.

tom and lily waved goodbye and got in their cars. lily felt a big hole in her heart. she wished tom could stay.

the next day, lily tried to watch tv, but it did not work. she asked her mom what was wrong. her mom said, "the cable is broken, lily. we have to wait for someone to fix it. it might take a few days."

lily was very upset. she could not watch her favorite shows. she could not talk to tom. she felt lonely and bored. she cried and said, "i want tom. i want cable. i want to be happy."

her mom hugged her and said, "i know, lily. i know. it's hard to miss someone you love. it's hard to lose something you enjoy. but you are not alone. i am here for you. and tom will come back soon. and the cable will be fixed soon. we just have to be patient and brave. can you do that, lily?"
