lily nodded and wiped her tears. she said, "yes, mom. i can do that. i love you, mom. and i love tom. and i love cable. but i can wait. i can find other things to do. like play with my toys. or read books. or draw pictures. or sing songs. or hug you."

her mom smiled and said, "that's my girl. you are very smart and strong, lily. and you are my perfect daughter."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to wear her favorite black dress every day. one day, lily's mom told her that the dress was too small for her waist and she couldn't wear it anymore. lily didn't want to take off her dress, so she started to cry.

her mom tried to calm her down and asked her to show her the dress. lily showed her the dress and her mom saw that it was really small. she told lily that they could go to the store and buy a new dress that would fit her waist. lily was happy again and stopped crying.

at the store, lily found a beautiful new dress that fit her waist perfectly. she was so excited to wear it and show it to her friends. when they saw her new dress, they all said how pretty she looked. lily was proud to show off her new dress to everyone.

once upon a time there was a cool little girl called lily. she was always adventurous and liked to explore. she loved to find new things like rocks and sticks and see what she could do with them.

one day, lily saw a big file in her house. she knew it was important and wanted to open it. lily tugged and pulled on the file, but it wouldn't open. she kept trying until her mum told her to stop. her mum said she needed to resist the temptation and leave it alone.

but lily was determined. she tried and tried until eventually, the file opened. inside, she found lots of cool things - a skipping rope, some games, some books and even a song. lily was so happy and excited.

she spent the rest of the day playing with what she found in the file. she found so many new and fun things - it was great! 

lily and her mum had learnt an important lesson that day - it's okay to be curious, but it's important to resist opening things that don't belong to you.

once upon a time, there were two friends, timmy and tommy. they loved to play together, but sometimes they would fight over toys. one day, timmy brought a jug of juice to share with tommy. 

tommy said, "that juice looks stupid. i don't want it." 

timmy felt sad and didn't understand why his friend didn't want to share with him. 

then, timmy's mom came and said, "boys, sharing is important. it makes us happy and helps us make friends." 

tommy realized he was being mean and said sorry to timmy. they both drank the juice together and had fun playing. from that day on, they always shared their toys and treats. the end.

john wanted a tube. he saw a tasty one in the store. he wanted it so much that he slipped it in his pocket without anyone noticing.

as he was walking away, a store clerk noticed and dashed after him. the clerk shouted for john to stop, but he ran as fast as he could. 

john seemed to be getting away, but as he rounded a corner he slipped and fell on the pavement. the tube fell out of his pocket and rolled away.

the clerk managed to catch up with him and the tube. john was so scared he started to cry. the clerk took him back to the store and his parents had to pay for the tube.

john never got the tasty tube and was very sad.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to imagine all sorts of things, like being a princess or a fairy. one day, she was playing with her toys when her mom called out, "lily, it's time to tidy up your room!" 

lily didn't want to stop playing, but she knew she had to listen to her mom. so, she quickly put away all her toys and made her bed. her mom was happy to see that lily had made her room tidy. 

later that day, lily's friend came over to play. they decided to dance together to some music. lily's friend said, "i love your room, it's so tidy!" lily smiled and replied, "thanks! i had to tidy it up earlier, but now we can dance without any toys in the way." 

they danced and twirled around the room, imagining they were ballerinas in a big show. lily was happy that her friend liked her tidy room, and she was even happier to be dancing with her friend.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his friends. one day, timmy saw a pigeon on the ground. he wanted to say hi to the pigeon, so he went over to poke it gently. the pigeon didn't fly away, so timmy thought it was okay to keep poking it. but the pigeon was persistent and wouldn't move. timmy realized that the pigeon might be hurt, so he went to get his mom to help. his mom called an animal rescue and they took the pigeon to the vet. the vet fixed the pigeon's wing and it flew away happily. timmy was happy that he helped the persistent pigeon. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. she had a toy named mr. bear. mr. bear was broken. he had a sad look on his face. sue loved mr. bear very much.

one day, sue's mom saw mr. bear. she said, "sue, we should fix mr. bear. he looks broken." sue said, "yes, mom. i value mr. bear a lot. he is my best friend."

sue and her mom fixed mr. bear. they sewed his arm and put a big smile on his face. now, mr. bear had a happy look. sue was so happy too. she hugged mr. bear and said, "i value you, mr. bear. you are my best friend forever."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved going to the market with her mom every saturday. she loved seeing all the colorful fruits and vegetables and hearing the vendors shout, "come get your fresh produce!"

one saturday, as they were walking through the market, lily saw a scary clown. she got scared and hid behind her mom's legs. her mom asked her what was wrong, and lily said, "the clown scares me." 

her mom explained to lily that sometimes things can look scary, but they might not actually be scary. she told lily that the clown was just trying to make people laugh and have fun. 

from that day on, lily learned that sometimes things might seem scary, but it's important to look closer and see if they are really peaceful and harmless. and every saturday, she still loved going to the market with her mom.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine with her friends. one day, lily found a stick on the ground and decided to create something special with it. she waved the stick around and said some magic words, and suddenly a beautiful butterfly appeared! 

lily was so happy and excited that she ran to show her bossy big brother, who was always telling her what to do. but when she got to him, he just rolled his eyes and said it was silly. lily didn't let him ruin her fun though, and she continued to create more magic with her stick. 

she made flowers bloom, birds sing, and even made a rainbow appear in the sky! everyone in the neighborhood was amazed by lily's magic, and they all wanted to play with her and her stick. from that day on, lily was known as the magic creator and she was the happiest girl in the world. the end.

once upon a time, in a little house, there lived a little girl named lily. lily had a best friend, a cat named tom. they played together every day.

one sunny day, lily and tom were playing outside when they saw a big dog. the dog looked like a threat. tom said, "lily, we must be careful!" lily held tom's paw, and they walked away slowly. the big dog did not chase them.

when they were safe, lily said, "thank you, tom, for helping me." tom replied, "you're welcome, lily. we should always help each other." and they continued to play happily.

the moral of the story is: always help your friends and be thankful for their help.

once upon a time, a little girl named rose was playing in the park. she saw a jet flying high in the sky and wanted to reach it. she jumped up and reached out her hand as she cried "jet! please come down to me." but her little hand couldn't reach so high. then the jet answered, "i can't come down, but if you want, i can make you fly too." rose was so excited, so she said "yes please!" 

the jet then flew down and stopped right over rose. it blew very strong air on her, and she started to feel her feet lifting up. the jet's air was so strong that rose was soon dry, just like a feather. the jet then said "ready, smile and hold on tight!"

rose shouted with joy as she flew into the clouds with the jet following behind. they flew around the park, higher and higher, until they both flew out of sight. they were so high that the sun shone brightly and everything looked dry, just like a desert. rose waved to the jet as she flew away and smiled with delight.

tom and jen were playing in the yard. they liked to pretend they were spies and had secret missions. tom had a toy gun that made a loud noise when he pulled the trigger. jen had a ruler that she used to measure things.

"let's go to the shed and look for clues," tom said. "maybe there is a bad guy hiding there."

"ok, but be careful," jen said. "the shed is dark and scary."

they walked to the shed and opened the door. it was full of old stuff, like boxes, tools, and clothes. tom and jen started to look around.

"look, i found a map!" jen said. she held up a piece of paper with some lines and dots on it. "maybe it shows where the bad guy's base is."

"let me see," tom said. he took the map and tried to read it. "this is unusual. it has numbers and letters on it. what does it mean?"

"i don't know," jen said. "maybe we need to measure something with my ruler."

"or maybe we need to shoot something with my gun," tom said.

he pointed his gun at the map and pulled the trigger. but instead of making a loud noise, the gun made a beep. and then a voice came from the gun.

"congratulations, agents. you have found the secret code. enter it on the keypad to unlock the treasure."

tom and jen were surprised. they looked at the gun and saw a small screen with some numbers on it. they also saw a keypad on the wall of the shed.

"wow, this is not a toy gun. this is a spy gun!" tom said.

"maybe this is our mission. maybe someone left this for us to find," jen said.

they ran to the keypad and entered the numbers. the wall opened and revealed a chest. inside the chest, there were candies, stickers, and a note.

"good job, agents. you have passed the test. enjoy your reward. love, dad."

tom and jen smiled. they realized their dad had made a game for them. they hugged each other and ate some candies.

"this is the best mission ever," tom said.

"i agree," jen said. "and you have the best gun ever."

they thanked their dad and continued to play in the shed. they felt like real spies.

once upon a time there was a little rabbit who had no one to play with. he was very lonely. he went for a walk and he came to a big pond. by the pond there were two ducks, who were laughing and playing together. the little rabbit felt sad and helpless. he tried to call out to the ducks but they didn't hear him. 

suddenly the rabbit saw a jelly drop in the pond. he wanted to have the jelly, so he sharpened a stick to poke it out of the water. he tried hard and eventually he managed to get it out. but it was too slippery to hold onto and it fell back into the pond. 

the little rabbit was sad and he started to cry. but then, the two ducks saw him and came to help. they told him that if he got two sticks it would be easier to catch the jelly. so the little rabbit followed their advice and the three of them were able to get the jelly out of the water. 

the little rabbit was so delighted! he thanked the two ducks for helping him. from that day onward, the rabbit had two new friends to play with. together, they would often go to the pond and catch jelly!

lily and ben were twins who lived in a big house near a valley. they liked to play with their toys and their dog, spot. one day, their mom said they could go to the store with her. they were very happy and put on their coats and shoes.

at the store, they saw many things they wanted. lily saw a doll with a pink dress and long hair. ben saw a truck with big wheels and a horn. they both asked their mom if they could have them. their mom said they could only choose one thing each. lily and ben could not agree on what to choose. they started to argue and cry.

their mom was not happy. she said they had to stop fighting or they would go home without anything. lily and ben did not want that. they looked at each other and felt sorry. they decided to share their toys and play together. they told their mom they were sorry and hugged her.

their mom smiled and said they were good children. she bought them the doll and the truck and gave them a kiss. they thanked her and said they loved her. they went back to their big house near the valley. they played with their toys and their dog, spot. they had a lot of fun and were very happy. they thought their mom was the best and their toys were adorable.

max was 3 years old. he and his mommy were at the bus stop. they were going to take a bus to the park. max was so excited. he was jumping up and down.

suddenly, the bus came. it was a big yellow bus. max went to get on the bus with his mommy.

when they sat down, everything started spinning. max felt dizzy. his mommy put her arm around him and said,"it's okay, max. you just have a bit of motion sickness." she smiled at max and told him to close his eyes.

as the bus drove along, max felt better. he opened his eyes and smiled. the bus dropped them off at the park. they had a wonderful time playing and walking around the park.

max was so glad he had his mommy to tell him it was okay. he knew he was safe and he was feeling better.  he was so happy!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she liked to play with her dolls and go on adventures in the park. one day, she saw a big dog and got scared. but then she remembered her mom told her to cross the street if she ever felt scared. so, she crossed the street and felt safe again.

as she was walking, she found a stick on the ground. she picked it up and tried to snap it in half, but it was too strong. suddenly, she saw an old man who was deaf. she didn't know what that meant, but she saw he was trying to cross the street too. lily went to help him and held his hand. together, they safely crossed the street.

the old man was very happy and gave lily a big hug. she felt warm and fuzzy inside. from that day on, lily knew that helping others was the best thing to do. and she never forgot how good it felt to cross the street and be brave.

once upon a time there was a furry motor. it was noisy and it made funny noises. everyone in the village had never seen anything like it before and they didn't believe it could move.

but one day, the furry motor started to hum and rattle. everyone in the village was amazed and they all cheered! they couldn't believe the motor was moving. 

the motor zoomed around the village, but it didn't make a mess. everyone was so happy that they started to laugh and dance. everyone wanted a ride on the furry motor. 

in the end, everyone was so happy that they believed the furry motor was magical. and they lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a fat wardrobe. it was full of things that made it heavier and heavier every day. one day, the wardrobe started to rot. it smelled bad and looked terrible. everyone in the house didn't like the smell of the wardrobe anymore. 

so, they decided to take the wardrobe away and get a new one. they found a new, bigger and sturdier wardrobe. it was so strong, it wouldn't rot! the family was so happy and put all their things into the new wardrobe. 

from then on, the family enjoyed their new wardrobe. they kept it clean and tidy and it stayed that way for a long time. the bad-smelling, old wardrobe was forgotten. the end!

once upon a time, in a big jungle, there was a modern house. in the house lived a nice family. they had a cat, a dog, and a bird. the family loved to play in the jungle with their pets.

one day, the cat saw a big door. the cat went to the door and tried to open it. but it was closed. the cat called the dog and the bird to help. they all tried to open the door together. they pushed and pushed, but it was still closed.

then, the family found the cat, dog, and bird near the door. they saw that the door was closed, so they helped to open it. with everyone working together, the door finally opened. behind the door, they found a beautiful garden with many pretty flowers and trees. the family and their pets played in the garden all day long, and they were very happy.

once upon a time, there was a girl and her name was susie. susie was three years old and loved pretty things. she had a special case for her prettiest things. 

one day, susie's mom said that it was time for susie to help in the garden. she helped by watering the plants and pulling out the weeds. every day, susie helped and watched the plants grow bigger and bigger.

susie was so happy to watch the garden grow that she wanted to have her own plants. so susie's mom gave susie seeds, and they planted them in susie's special case. then they waited and watched the seeds, and soon they saw little plants coming out of the dirt.

susie was so proud of her plants. she watered them every day and loved to watch them grow. she would tell all of her friends about how much her plants were growing. then one day, susie got very tired from playing in the garden. so she put her special case up on the shelf and went straight to bed. 

the next morning when susie woke up, her special case was still there on the shelf, but this time it was filled with big, beautiful plants! susie was so happy that she could watch her plants grow. she thanked her mom for helping her with her garden and took her special case outside to enjoy the sunshine.

once upon a time there lived a little boy called joe. he was three years old and lived in a small village with his mum and dad. every day he went out to play in the garden. one day, while playing outside joe noticed his elderly neighbor slipping and falling to the ground. 

joe quickly rushed over to help. he asked his neighbor if he was okay and offered to get him some help. his neighbor thanked joe and said he was alright but thanked him for his kindness. 

afterwards, joe ran back home to tell his mum and dad all about it. his mum and dad were very proud of him and told joe how special it was that he had offered help to his neighbor. they also explained how it was important to look out for and help others, especially those who are elderly and not as strong as himself. 

joe smiled and said he understood. from that day forward, he looked out for his elderly neighbors, offering help whenever he could.

once upon a time, there was a modest comet. it twinkled in the sky and shined in the night. all the stars admited it was beautiful. but the comet was feeling lonely.

the comet wanted a friend, so it went on a journey. it visited all the planets, but no one wanted to join it in its lonely journey.

suddenly, the comet spotted another shining star. this star was much brighter and shinier than the comet. the comet asked the star to unite with it, and the star said yes.

the comet and the star began to fly together in the night sky. the stars shone more brightly when the comet and the star were together. they twinkled and sparkled like one special light.

they were very happy and enjoyed the night sky, seeing all the other stars shining in the different colours. from that day on, the comet and the star were always together, united in their journey across the night sky.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named anna. one day, she was playing in the kitchen and was having lots of fun. suddenly, anna heard her mother say, â€œanna, i need your help in the kitchen. it is important.â€ 

anna said, â€œi can help, what do you need?â€ 

her mother replied, â€œi need you to help me put all the dishes away. are you willing to help?â€ 

anna smiled and said yes! she carefully folded the towels and helped put the dishes away. when they were done, her mother said, â€œthank you for helping me in the kitchen anna, it was important.â€

anna gave her mother a big hug and said, â€œi care about helping you mom.â€ 

her mother smiled and said, â€œthat is so sweet of you anna, and it's important to remember that you can always show you care by helping with chores.â€ 

anna smiled, and they both hugged again. she learned an important lesson that day, never forget to care for others by helping.

lily and her dog spot like to visit grandma every week. grandma lives in a big house with a nice garden. spot loves to run and play in the garden with grandma's cat, fluffy.

one day, the weather was very bad. it was raining and windy and cold. lily and spot could not go outside. they had to stay in the house. lily was sad. she wanted to play in the garden. spot was sad too. he wanted to chase fluffy.

grandma saw that lily and spot were sad. she said, "don't worry, my dear. the weather will be better soon. why don't we play a game inside? i have some cards and puzzles and books. we can have fun together."

lily smiled. she liked games. she said, "ok, grandma. that sounds good. what game do you want to play first?"

grandma smiled too. she said, "how about we play go fish? it's a card game. you have to ask for cards and match them. do you know how to play?"

lily nodded. she said, "yes, i know how to play. i learned it at school. it's fun. can spot play too?"

grandma laughed. she said, "of course he can. he's a loyal dog. he can be your partner. he can help you find the cards you need."

lily hugged spot. she said, "thank you, spot. you're the best dog ever. you always make me happy."

spot wagged his tail. he licked lily's face. he was happy too. he loved lily and grandma. he didn't mind the bad weather. he was glad to visit them. he hoped they would play go fish and other games until the sun came out.

once upon a time, in a normal little town, there was a girl named mia. mia had a special talent, she could perform tricks with her foot. one day, mia decided to show her friends her tricks.

mia invited her friends to the park. she was so excited to perform her tricks for them. when they all got to the park, mia started to perform. she could kick a ball very high and far with her foot. her friends clapped and cheered.

after mia's performance, her friends tried to do the same tricks, but it was not easy. they all laughed and had fun trying. in the end, they all agreed that mia was the best at performing tricks with her foot. they played together happily in the normal little town.

once upon a time, there was a mouse named tim. tim loved cheese more than anything. he lived in a house with a big family. the family did not like tim, but they did not know he was there.

one day, tim heard the family mention cheese. they talked about a big, original cheese they had in the kitchen. tim was very excited. he thought about that cheese all day and all night. he wanted to eat it so badly. 

tim waited until the family was asleep. he went to the kitchen to find the cheese. when he found it, he started to eat it. but the family heard him. they woke up and saw tim eating their cheese. they were very angry. they caught tim and took him far away from their house. tim was sad and hungry, and he never found a big, original cheese like that again.

once upon a time, there was a smart cat. the cat always knew what it wanted, and it didn't like to be told what to do. 

one day, the cat was napping in a tree when the ground shook. this was an earthquake! the cat wanted to keep sleeping, but it was scared so it quickly came down the tree.

next day, the cat wanted to go back up the tree. but its mom said, "no! it's too dangerous. you might get hurt if there's another earthquake." the cat didn't like this and refused to listen. 

the cat kept trying to go back up the tree. but its mom kept saying, "no!" finally, the cat had to admit that its mom was right. it was too dangerous.

the smart cat listened to its mom and stayed on the ground. from then on, it was much safer.

lia and ria are sisters. they like to play in the forest. they pretend to be warriors with sticks and leaves. lia has a long stick. she calls it a spear. ria has a short stick. she calls it a sword.

one day, they find a big rock in the forest. it has a hole in it. lia says, "look, ria, a cave! let's go inside and see what's there." ria says, "ok, lia, but be careful. it might be dark and scary."

they go inside the hole. it is dark and cold. they can't see anything. they hold their sticks tight. they hear a growl. they see two yellow eyes. it is a bear! the bear is angry. it wants to chase them away.

lia and ria are scared. they run back to the hole. but the bear is faster. it blocks the hole with its big body. lia and ria are trapped. they cry for help.

lia has an idea. she says, "ria, give me your sword. i will lift my spear and poke the bear. maybe it will move and let us go." ria says, "ok, lia, but be brave. i will help you."

they swap their sticks. lia lifts her spear high. she pokes the bear in the nose. the bear roars. it moves a little. ria lifts her sword low. she pokes the bear in the foot. the bear roars again. it moves more. lia and ria see a gap. they squeeze through the gap. they run out of the hole. they are free.

they hug each other. they are happy. they say, "we did it, ria! we did it, lia! we are warriors!" they laugh and dance. they leave the forest. they go home. they tell their mom and dad what happened. they are proud. they are brave. they are sisters.

once upon a time, there was a small girl named amy who was only three. she was playing in the park with her friends when suddenly her friend, jack, had his eraser taken away by the park keeper. amy gasped with surprise and saw that jack was trembling with fear. the park keeper said sternly, â€œyouâ€™re not allowed to bring this thing into the parkâ€. he put the eraser in his pocket.

amy felt bad for jack but she didnâ€™t know what to do. she looked at him sadly and said, â€œitâ€™s not your fault.â€ but jack didnâ€™t seem to hear her. he just sat there, trembling.

then, amy had an idea. she ran to the park keeper, who was standing nearby, and said, â€œwould you please give jack back his eraser? he didnâ€™t mean to do anything wrong.â€ she looked at him with big, guilty eyes.

the park keeper smiled and said, â€œok, little one. here you go.â€ he reached into his pocket and gave the eraser back to jack. jack smiled with relief and hugged amy with thanks.

amy was so happy she had helped her friend!

once upon a time, there was a hidden tower that suddenly appeared in the middle of a meadow. it looked like a castle with lots of windows. everyone in the meadow was very surprised by the tower and wanted to know who it belonged to. they decided to go and investigate.

when they got to the top of the tower, they discovered a magical printer that could print anything the people wanted! they could print sweets and toys and all kinds of fun things. everyone in the meadow was so excited about the hidden tower and the magical printer. 

from then on, everyone in the meadow visited the hidden tower every day to get some of the amazing things the printer could make. they also made sure to take turns so that everyone in the meadow would get a chance to print something special.

the people in the meadow were very happy and enjoyed their visits to the hidden tower every day. they kept the magical printer and the tower a secret so that it could stay special.

it was a sunny day and two friends, rob and sam, were walking together. they had a big plan: to explore the clean space. they wanted to go somewhere special.

rob was feeling excited. in order to reach the space, the pair had to climb a mountain. as they moved forward, rob tripped and fell.

sam started laughing and said, â€œthat was so embarrassing!â€

rob slowly got up and replied, â€i know, but itâ€™s ok. letâ€™s just keep going.â€

the explore the clean space until they reached the top. they both laughed as they enjoyed the scenery.

finally, they arrived at their destination. the space was filled with colourful trees, happy birds and a crystal stream.

rob and sam cheered in delight, glad to have explored such a clean space.

danny was a 3 year old who always wanted to explore. every day he tried to find something new and exciting. one day, danny walked by a museum and decided to try and go inside. he asked his mom if he could go in, but she said no. danny was upset, but he didn't give up.

he tried again a few days later, telling his mom he really wanted to go to the museum. this time, his mom said yes! danny was so excited! he grabbed his coat and ran outside.

when danny arrived at the museum, he noticed that the front door was very rough. he tugged and pulled at the door, but it wouldn't budge. danny was getting frustrated. he tried one last time and then he heard a noise - the door had opened! danny couldn't believe it.

danny spent the rest of the day exploring the museum. he saw all sorts of different things in there and he even made a few new friends. at the end of the day, danny was tired and happy. he had conquered the rough door and discovered something new and exciting.

once there was a nice man called bob. he was a brave man and everyday he would perform special tasks. 

one day he was asked to perform a very special task. he had to move a big statue from one place to another. bob was scared but he knew he had to do this task. 

he grabbed the heavy statue and started carrying it to its new home. he was tired but he kept going. after a while he felt very sorry. he wanted to stop but he kept going. 

finally bob managed to move the statue to its new place. he was very happy and said "i am sorry i was scared but i did it". he was very proud of himself and everyone cheered.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play together. one day, they go to the park with their moms. the park has a big maze. anna and ben want to try the maze.

"can we take the maze, mom?" anna asks.

"sure, but stay together and don't get lost," mom says.

anna and ben hold hands and enter the maze. they see many paths and walls. they have to choose which way to go. sometimes they go left, sometimes they go right, sometimes they go straight. they have fun in the maze.

"look, ben, a bird!" anna says, pointing to a blue bird on a tree.

"wow, it's amazing!" ben says, looking at the bird.

they follow the bird and find the exit of the maze. they are happy and proud. they run to their moms and hug them.

"we did it, mom, we did it!" anna and ben say.

"good job, you two! you are very smart and brave," mom says.

anna and ben smile and high-five. they love the maze. they want to play again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called daisy who was not happy. she was very worried about the dark. 

daisy's mother said to her gently, "what's wrong, daisy? why aren't you happy?"

daisy replied, "the dark scares me. i'm worried that bad things will happen." 

her mother said, "don't worry, daisy. it's okay to be scared of the dark. but nothing bad will ever happen. i promise."

daisy's mother hugged her and told her that she would always be there to keep her safe and make her happy. since then, daisy has never been worried about the dark. she has been very happy, and she knows that her mother will always be there to take care of her.

once there was a little girl called daisy. she was only 3-years-old. one day, daisy wanted to play with her telephone. she loved talking to her family. but when daisy picked up her telephone, it had disappeared! daisy was very embarrassed. she tried everywhere to find her telephone.

she looked on the sofa, but it wasn't there. she looked in the kitchen, but she couldn't see it. she even looked in her bedroom, but nothing! daisy was so sad.

she asked her mum and dad, but they hadn't seen it. then daisy asked her brother, toby. daisy asked "toby, have you seen my telephone?". toby said "yes, i put it away so you can't play with it". "why did you put it away', said daisy?

toby said "i'm sorry, i didn't want you to have too much fun". daisy was very happy. she gave toby a big hug and took her telephone back!

once upon a time, there was a wealthy farmer. he had a big farm with lots of oat plants growing in it. every morning he would get up early to start looking after his oat plants. he loved his job! he watered them every day and watched them grow.

one day, the farmer shocked to find that a big family of rabbits had started living in his oat field! the farmer knew he had to get rid of them otherwise they would eat all of his oat plants!

the farmer thought hard. he soon came up with a plan. he put down some special food in the oat field. everywhere the rabbits went, they found food. the rabbits couldnâ€™t help but keep eating and eating. the farmer soon realised that the food was making them very full!

the farmer smiled. he had tricked the rabbits into eating too much and now they needed to find somewhere else to live! so the farmer and the rabbits said goodbye and the rabbits moved on to another, bigger piece of land.

the farmer was very happy. he was now able to start looking after his oat plants again and he would always remember this as one of his most clever ideas!

once there was a green mouse who lived in a big house. he was very happy but he was also very worried. the green mouse didn't have an owner and he didn't know who he would live with.

one day a kindly lady saw the green mouse and she called out to him. the mouse was so happy that he ran over to her and did a little dance. the kind lady said that she wanted to be his owner and take care of him.

the green mouse no longer had to worry. he jumped into the kind lady's pocket and snuggled against her warm hand. the kind lady was now his very own owner. the green mouse was so happy he smiled all day long.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved playing at the beach. one day he saw something in the sand that caught his eye. he bent down and picked it up - it was a beautiful feather!

the little boy said "marvellous!" he carefully placed it in his pocket and continued on his way.

as he was walking, he heard a distant sound. he looked around, trying to figure out where it was coming from. suddenly, out of nowhere, a lightning bolt struck the ground. the little boy was surprised and scared all at the same time.

the little boy was so patient as he waited for the thunder and lightning to pass. the thunder got louder and louder and then, finally, it stopped. when the storm had passed, the little boy took the feather out of his pocket. he looked at it and said, "marvellous!"

once upon a time there was a little girl named daisy. daisy was only three years old, but she was brave and curious. one night, daisy wanted to visit the stars. she put on her nightgown and quietly sneaked outside.

suddenly, daisy heard a soft voice say, "hello, daisy!" she looked around but there was nobody there. it was an angel! daisy was scared but the angel had a kind face so daisy said hello back.

the angel smiled and said, "i'm here to take you to the stars. do you want to go?" daisy nodded excitedly. the angel took her hand and they flew up high into the night sky.

the stars were twinkling brightly and daisy was very happy. she waved goodbye to the angel and ran back inside. from that night on, daisy would always visit the stars to say hello to her special angel.

jane was a rich girl who lived in a big house. every morning, jane would wake up and go outside to sit on her porch. her porch was high and overlooked a nearby beach.

as jane sat on her porch, she would wave to all the people who walked by the beach. jane loved to wave to people and make them smile. 

one day, a little girl was walking on the beach. jane saw her, smiled and waved. the little girl stopped and waved back. jane was so happy to have a new friend.

the two girls waved to each other every morning. jane couldn't wait to wake up each morning and wave hello. she was very happy that she had made a new friend.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved her favorite jacket with a zipper. one day, she noticed the zipper was broken. she asked her mommy to fix it. her mommy examined the zipper and saw it was stuck. she fixed it perfectly and lily was happy again. from that day on, lily made sure to examine her zipper every day to make sure it was perfect. the end.

once upon a time, there were two best friends called jack and toby. they were both very patient but jack was a bit jealous of toby. whenever toby did something cool, jack wanted to do it too.

one day, toby showed jack how to do a special cheer. jack was very excited and wanted to do it too. he watched toby carefully and then repeated the cheer.

every day, jack and toby would practice the cheer together. they would take turns repeating the words after each other and they would help each other learn the movements. 

jack soon become very patient and good at the cheer. toby was so proud of him and they both cheered together every day. they were the best of friends and each of them was happy and content.

once upon a time, there was a famous hero named tom. he was very strong and brave. all the people in the town loved and admired him. he always wore a big red cape and a shiny hat. 

one day, while tom was walking, he heard a little girl crying. he went to her and asked, "why are you crying?" the girl said, "my cat is stuck in the tree." tom looked up and saw the cat. he knew he had to help.

tom climbed the tree and saved the cat. the little girl was so happy. she said, "thank you, tom! you are my hero!" tom smiled and felt proud. from that day on, everyone knew that tom was not just famous, but also kind and helpful.

lila and tom are playing in the park. they see a big tree with many leaves. they want to climb the tree and pretend to be kings and queens.

"look, i found a crown!" lila says. she picks up a shiny thing from the ground. it is light and has many colors. she puts it on her head.

"wow, you look like a real queen!" tom says. he wants to find a crown too. he looks around, but he does not see anything.

"can i try your crown?" he asks lila.

"no, it is mine!" lila says. she does not want to share. she likes her crown too much.

tom is sad and angry. he tries to grab the crown from lila. they start to fight. they pull and push each other. they do not hear the big noise.

a car is coming fast. it does not see the children. it hits them with a loud bang. the crown falls from lila's head. it breaks into many pieces. lila and tom do not move. they do not play anymore. they are gone.

one day, a little girl named mia went to the mall with her mom. they wanted to buy a delicate dress for mia's birthday party. mia was very excited to find the perfect dress.

at the mall, mia saw many beautiful dresses. she tried on a pink dress with flowers. "do you like this one?" asked her mom. "yes!" said mia, "it is so pretty!" her mom reminded her to be careful, as the dress was delicate.

they bought the delicate dress and went home. mia wore the dress to her birthday party and everyone loved it. she remembered to be careful, just like her mom reminded her. mia had a great birthday and felt like a princess in her new dress.

once upon a time there was a family with a scaredy cat. he was so fearful of everything. one day he saw a lump of coal on the ground. he was so scared of it and backed away slowly. 

the family wished the lump of coal would go away and soon enough it did. little did they know it was just the start of something which made them fearful. 

every day the family saw more and more coal on the ground. this time it was more than a lump and soon enough it was everywhere. they became more and more afraid. 

one day, something terrible happened. a storm started to form and destroy everything. everyone was fearful but the scaredy cat remembered the coal. he took action and warned the family.

they all worked together and managed to get rid of the coal they had seen. eventually the storm was gone, leaving them all safe and happy.

john had a pink toy that he loved very much. he played with it every day. one morning, he decided to leave the toy by the window so he could admire it from outside.

but when he looked at the toy, it looked very dull. he tried to make it look better, but all his efforts were in vain. he was so disappointed that he decided to leave the toy alone and went outside.

john looked all around the garden, but he could not find anything to make the toy look nice again. just then, he spotted a pink flower in the garden. he ran to pick it up, and carefully placed it near the toy.

john smiled as the toy finally looked happier. he went back inside and continued playing with the toy, making sure to never leave it alone ever again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily's mommy gave her a pretty sweater to wear. lily loved the sweater so much that she wore it every day. but one day, lily lost her sweater. she looked everywhere for it, but it was hidden.

lily was sad and started to suffer without her favorite sweater. she cried and cried until her mommy came to help. together, they searched high and low until they finally found the sweater. lily was so happy that she hugged her mommy tight.

from then on, lily made sure to keep her sweater safe and never let it get hidden again. she wore it every day and never suffered without it again. the end.

once upon a time there was a little girl called tina. she was always scared of the dark and would cry when it was time to go to bed. her parents wanted to help her, so one night they brought her outside and asked her to look up.

tina was very surprised to see the big, high moon in the sky. she smiled and said to her parents, "what is that?" her parents said, "that's the moon. it's very big and very high."

they all looked at the moon together and her parents tried to comfort her. they said, "tina, the moon will always be there when it's dark, watching over you and your home." 

tina nodded, feeling much calmer. she smiled and said, "the moon makes me feel better." and it was true. she knew that with the moon there she would never be alone or scared in the dark.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named fluffy. fluffy was very curious and loved to explore. one day, while hopping around, fluffy saw a white box with a hole in it. fluffy wanted to see what was inside, so he hopped closer and closer.

suddenly, fluffy heard a loud snap and a trap closed on his foot! fluffy was scared and started to cry. but then, he saw a little girl walking by. she saw fluffy and knew just what to do. she gently poked the trap with a stick until it opened and fluffy was free.

fluffy was so happy and grateful to the little girl. from that day on, he knew to be careful of traps and always be grateful for helpful friends.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the park. one day, she met a little boy named max. max had a toy truck that he was playing with. 

lily said, "hi max, that's a good toy truck you have there!" 

max smiled and said, "thank you, lily. do you want to play with it?" 

lily was happy and said, "yes, please!" 

as they played, the sun started to go down and it became chilly. lily started to shiver. max noticed and said, "are you cold, lily?" 

lily nodded and said, "yes, i am. let's go home." 

as they walked home, they heard a noise. it was a dog barking. max said, "don't worry, lily. it's just a dog. he's a good dog." 

lily felt better and they continued walking home together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to play hide and seek with her friends. one day, lily's mom told her that they were going to a party. lily was very excited because she loved parties.

when they got to the party, lily saw something unusual. there was a big, green dinosaur! lily was scared at first, but then she realized that it was just a toy. she went over to the dinosaur and touched it.

suddenly, lily's friend emma came up to her and said, "let's play hide and seek!" lily was so happy because she loved playing hide and seek. they ran around the party, hiding behind chairs and under tables. lily had so much fun at the party with her friends.

lily was a naughty girl who liked to design things with her crayons. she drew on the walls, the furniture, and even her mom's cane. her mom was very sad and angry when she saw the mess. she said, "lily, you are very naughty. you should not draw on things that are not yours. you should respect other people's things. how would you feel if someone drew on your toys?"

lily did not listen to her mom. she thought it was fun to design things with her crayons. she said, "i don't care. i like to draw. it is pretty. you are mean."

one day, lily went to the park with her mom. she saw a boy playing with a ball. she wanted to play with the ball too. she ran to the boy and snatched the ball from him. she said, "this is my ball now. i will design it with my crayons. it will be prettier."

the boy was very sad and angry. he said, "lily, you are very naughty. you should not take things that are not yours. you should share and be kind. how would you feel if someone took your crayons?"

lily did not care. she said, "i don't care. i like this ball. it is mine. you are mean."

but then, something bad happened. lily tripped over her mom's cane and fell down. she dropped the ball and the crayons. the ball rolled away and the crayons broke. lily hurt her knee and cried. she said, "mom, help me. i am sorry. i was naughty. i want my crayons. i want the ball."

her mom came to her and hugged her. she said, "lily, i am glad you are sorry. you learned a lesson. you should not be naughty. you should be good. you should not design things with your crayons that are not yours. you should respect other people's things. you should share and be kind. then you will have more friends and more fun."

lily nodded and said, "yes, mom. i understand. i will be good. i will not be naughty. i will design things with my crayons that are mine. i will respect other people's things. i will share and be kind."

her mom smiled and said, "that's good, lily. i love you. now let's go and say sorry to the boy and give him back his ball. maybe he will let you play with him."

lily smiled and said, "okay, mom. i love you too. let's go."

once there was a little girl who had a house. it was a very pale house, and she loved it. every day she would play outside with her friends. they would run around and laugh and have lots of fun.

the girl's friends loved teasing her. they would call her silly names and call her little. she would start to feel sad and not want to play with them.

one day the girl had had enough. she decided to stand up to her friends and let them know that teasing wasn't nice. she told them that it hurt her feelings and that she didn't like it.

her friends stopped teasing her and eventually became very good friends. they now play together all the time and have lots of fun. they even love her pale house and have lots of fun playing in it.

one day, john was playing in his room. he had lots of toys and they were scattered everywhere. he was happy whooshing his cars around and playing with his dolls. suddenly, he heard a loud noise. he looked around and saw that his pillow had split in two! he was very surprised. the pillow was dull and grey, and had been john's favorite pillow for a long time. john looked around and saw that his toy box was empty. he realized that all of his toys had been in the pillow and had scattered across the floor when it split. 

john picked up all of his toys and put them back in the toy box. he decided to get a new pillow and placed it on his bed. he was happy to have a new place to rest his head. even though the new pillow wasn't as dull as the old one, it was still very comfy. john smiled and went back to playing with his toys.

once upon a time, there was a man and a woman who were married. they were arguing with each other and soon they were quarrel ing. the man had an old axe and he was holding it in his hand.

the woman saw this and she started to get scared. she said, "why do you have the axe?"
the man said, "i am going to use it to chop the wood."
the woman said, "be careful with the axe. it looks old and broken."

the man nodded and said, "don't worry, i will be careful." he took the axe and went outside to chop the wood. he carefully used the axe and was able to chop a lot of wood. 

the man and woman were now happy and the argument was forgotten. they hugged each other and were friends again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to wear pretty dresses with bows on them. one day, she put on a dress with a big bow on the back. she felt so happy and twirled around in her room.

but then, she accidentally bumped into the wall and hurt her neck. it hurt a lot and she started to cry. her mommy came in and saw that lily was hurt. she gave her a hug and a kiss on the forehead to make her feel better.

lily's mommy helped her take off the dress with the bow and put on a comfy shirt. lily felt much better and smiled at her mommy. from then on, she made sure to be careful when wearing dresses with big bows.

once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore. one day, she went on an adventure in the forest. she brought her equipment with her, which included a backpack, a flashlight, and a magnifying glass.

as she was walking, she noticed a grumpy bear. the bear was not happy and was growling loudly. lily was scared and didn't know what to do. she remembered her equipment and decided to use her flashlight to scare the bear away.

after the bear ran away, lily felt very proud of herself. she continued her adventure and found a beautiful butterfly. she was very happy and decided to bring it home to show her mom. she ran all the way home and showed her mom what she found. her mom was very proud of her too.

grandma had a special surprise for little timmy. she brought out a big box and he clapped his hands with joy. inside the box was a beautiful gray bookcase. grandma showed timmy how to put it together and he giggled as he counted the pieces.

when the bookcase was all put together, grandma helped timmy fill the shelves with all his favorite books. he smiled happily and hugged her. grandma smiled and sighed contentedly.

afterwards, timmy ran around his new bookcase, exploring all its corners. he found a tiny spider living inside and he laughed as he watched it move around. grandma had to tell timmy it was time to go home. he nodded sadly, but soon the thought of his new bookcase cheered him up.

on the way home, timmy thought about how nice his new bookcase looked in his room. it was the perfect shade of gray and he knew it would look nice with all his books on it. grandma smiled to herself and sighed again, happy to have brought a little bit of joy to timmy.

tom and lily were playing in the park. they liked to look for pebbles and make shapes with them. tom found a big pebble that was round and smooth. he showed it to lily and said, "look, i found a ball!"

lily smiled and said, "that's not a ball, silly. that's a pebble. but it's a nice pebble. can i see it?"

tom nodded and gave the pebble to lily. she held it in her hand and felt how heavy it was. she said, "wow, this pebble is heavy. i wonder what's inside it."

tom said, "maybe there's a treasure inside it. maybe there's a gold coin or a shiny ring."

lily said, "that would be cool. how can we open it?"

tom said, "maybe we can hit it with another pebble. maybe it will break and show us the treasure."

lily said, "ok, let's try it. but be careful, don't hurt yourself."

tom and lily looked for another pebble that was hard and sharp. they found one and tom took it. he said, "are you ready?"

lily said, "yes, i'm ready. hit it hard!"

tom raised the pebble and hit the big pebble with it. but nothing happened. the big pebble did not break. it only made a loud noise. tom and lily were surprised and disappointed. they said, "oh, no!"

then they heard a voice behind them. it was a man who was sitting on a bench. he looked angry and said, "hey, what are you doing? that's my pebble. i found it in the river. it's very old and rare. it's worth a lot of money. give it back to me!"

tom and lily were scared and confused. they did not know the man. they did not know the pebble was his. they did not know the pebble was old and rare and worth a lot of money. they thought it was just a pebble. they said, "we're sorry, mister. we didn't know. we were just playing."

the man snatched the pebble from lily's hand and said, "playing? playing with my pebble? how dare you? you could have damaged it. you could have ruined it. you are very naughty and stupid. go away and don't come back!"

tom and lily ran away from the man. they felt sad and ashamed. they said, "we're sorry, pebble. we didn't mean to hurt you. we thought you were a ball. we thought you had a treasure. we didn't know you were old and rare and worth a lot of money. we didn't know you belonged to a mean man. you are a poor pebble. we hope you are ok."

one day a little girl called lucy went to the park with her mom. it was a lovely day and lucy skipped around and played.

suddenly she heard a loud noise like thunder coming from near the swings. lucy ran towards the sound and was surprised to see a baby rabbit stirring up a shower of leaves. the rabbit was frightened and tried to run away, but the poor animal couldn't move!

lucy decided to help the animal and gently scooped it up in her arm. she said "don't worry little one, you're safe now!". the rabbit seemed to relax a little and lucy carried it home.

at home, lucy showed mom the rabbit. mom was so happy that lucy had been so kind and helped the animal. mom said, "we will take care of the rabbit, it's so lovely that you wanted to help". 

the little rabbit was named 'fuzzy' and from then on was part of the family. lucy and fuzzy became the best of friends and learned to love each other deeply.

the end.

lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play in the park with their toys. one day, they saw a big cross on the grass. it was red and shiny. lily and ben were very excited. they wanted to touch the cross.

"wow, look at that cross!" lily said. "it is so pretty!"

"let's go and see it!" ben said. "maybe it is a treasure!"

they ran to the cross. but when they got there, they saw a sign. the sign said: "do not touch. this cross is for a special show. it is not a toy."

lily and ben did not read the sign. they did not know what it meant. they only saw the cross. they reached out their hands to touch it.

"stop!" a voice shouted. "you are being naughty! you cannot touch the cross!"

lily and ben turned around. they saw a man. he was wearing a hat and a coat. he looked angry. he was the owner of the cross.

"sorry, mister," lily said. "we did not know."

"we just wanted to see the cross," ben said. "it is so nice."

the man shook his head. he was not happy. he said: "the cross is not for you. it is for a special show. it is very old and fragile. if you touch it, you might break it. you have to be careful and respectful. you have to follow the rules."

lily and ben felt sorry. they did not mean to be naughty. they did not want to break the cross. they wanted to be careful and respectful. they wanted to follow the rules.

"ok, mister," lily said. "we are sorry. we will not touch the cross again."

"thank you," the man said. "now, go and play somewhere else. and next time, read the sign before you touch anything."

lily and ben nodded. they said goodbye to the man. they took their toys and went to play somewhere else. they learned their lesson. they did not touch the cross again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing in the forest near her house. one day, she saw a big, scary tiger hiding behind a tree. the tiger looked hungry and mean. lily was scared and ran away.

the next day, lily decided to bring some food for the tiger. she put some meat in a basket and went to the forest. when she saw the tiger, she felt scared again, but she remembered she wanted to be helpful. so, she sent the basket to the tiger with a long stick.

the tiger ate the meat and looked at lily with big, grateful eyes. from that day on, the tiger and lily became friends. the tiger was always helpful to lily, and she was never scared of him again.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had a pet dog named max. max was very nosy and always wanted to know what was going on around him.

one day, lily decided to feed max some treats. max was very happy and wagged his tail. lily felt successful because she made max happy.

after max finished his treats, he wanted to go outside and play. lily followed him outside and they played together in the sunshine. they had so much fun and felt very successful because they had each other to play with.

once upon a time, there was a young boy named tim. tim loved to play in the park with his friends. one day, tim's stomach started to hurt really bad.

tim's friend, jack, asked him if he was okay. tim said, "no, my stomach hurts a lot." jack said, "let's go to your mom so she can help you."

when they got to tim's house, his mom gave him some medicine. tim felt better, but he was sad because he had to pass on playing with his friends that day. but jack said, "don't worry, we can play together tomorrow." tim felt happy again.

one day, willy was walking in the park with his mom when they heard an emergency! mom said they needed to close their eyes. willy found it really interesting. he shut his eyes tight and held his mom's hand. when he opened his eyes, there was a fire truck with its sirens blazing. firefighters were everywhere and one of them talked into a loudhailer as he closed off the park. willy and his mom were very relieved when it was over. they walked home and willy thought it was the most interesting thing he had ever seen!

once there was a boy named jack. jack was three years old and loved playing with his friends. one day he was at the park with his mom. she gave him a smooth jar filled with delicious juice.

jack was excited and he held the jar in his hand. he took a big drink of juice and it tasted so yummy! he drank and drank until it was all gone.

jack had so much fun playing in the park. when it was time to go, jack held his empty jar in his hand. he wanted to go back to the park and drink more juice.

his mom smiled and said, "yes, jack. we can go back to the park. we'll get another smooth jar of juice." jack was very happy. he waved goodbye to all his friends and then ran with his mom to the store.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named tim. tim had a big shield that he liked to carry around. he used his shield to protect his friends from harm. tim's shield was very special to him.

one day, a rude boy came to the town. he saw tim's shield and wanted to take it away. tim did not like the rude boy, and he knew he had to protect his shield. so, tim held his shield tightly and stood up to the rude boy.

the rude boy tried to grab the shield, but tim was strong and brave. he used his shield to protect himself and his friends. in the end, the rude boy left the town, and tim was a hero. everyone was happy and safe because of tim and his special shield.

once upon a time there was a smart bird named billie. she loved to fly, but she could never find the right way to fly. 

one day, she asked the wise owl, "how can i find the right way to fly?"

the wise owl suggested, â€œfly high and watch the world below, observe the nations from above, and you will find the way.â€ 

so billie flew high and watched the world from above. she saw all the nations and how different, yet how alike, they were. then, billie realized, the best way to fly was not in just one direction but around the world!

that day, billie gained a new understanding for the world. she had learned that exploring was the best way to learn and that in the end, the best way is to help each other. 

the moral of the story is that it is wise to be open to suggestions and explore different places. then, you can discover new things and develop a deeper understanding of the world.

once upon a time there was a friendly lady. she had lots of nice things. one day she was looking at an old box. inside the box she found a pretty jewel. she thought the jewel looked so nice she wanted to share it with her friends.

the friendly lady suggested an idea. she thought it would be fun to make a necklace with the jewel. so she shared the idea with her friends. they agreed and started to plan it out.

when the necklace was done, everyone was so happy. it was so pretty with the special jewel. everyone said it was the best necklace ever. the friendly lady was so pleased she had a good idea.

they all took turns wearing the necklace and showing it off. everyone had a big smile on their face. they were so happy to share their special jewel necklace. the end.

once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named lily. one day, lily went outside to play. she saw something unknown in the grass. it was long and moved like a snake. lily was not scared, but curious.

lily said to the snake, "hello, snake! i am lily. do you want to be friends?" the snake looked at lily and said, "yes, lily. i want to be friends, too. my name is sam."

lily and sam played together all day. they laughed and had fun. then, lily had an idea. she said, "sam, let's play dress-up!" sam agreed, and they went inside the house.

lily found a small hat and put it on sam's head. she found a scarf and wrapped it around sam's long body. sam looked very funny, and they both laughed.

from that day on, lily and sam were best friends. they played together every day and had many fun adventures. and sometimes, they would play dress-up and laugh together.

once upon a time there was a big, mysterious space. no one knew what the space contained, it was a mystery. one day a small, brave mouse ran into the space and started to explore. suddenly he demanded to see what was hidden in this mysterious space. he searched around and found a secret door. he opened the door carefully and saw a beautiful garden with glittering flowers. he was so excited! what luck, he thought, to find this beautiful place! he ran back to tell his friends of the discovery. despite his best attempts to keep it a secret, the news quickly spread and soon the garden was full of animals, all demanding their own private space in the garden. things soon got a little bit crowded, but thankfully they all managed to find their own special little area in the garden. they all lived happily ever after.

lily liked to collect rocks. she had many rocks of different colors and shapes in her box. she was proud of her rocks and showed them to her friends.

one day, she met a new boy in the park. his name was ben and he was a lawyer. he wore a suit and a tie and carried a briefcase. he said he was very busy and important.

"can i see your rocks?" he asked lily.

"sure, they are in my box," lily said. she opened her box and let ben look at her rocks.

ben was envious of lily's rocks. he wanted to have them for himself. he said, "these rocks are not very good. they are dirty and boring. you should give them to me. i can make them better."

lily was confused and sad. she liked her rocks and did not want to give them away. she said, "no, these are my rocks. i collected them myself. they are not dirty and boring. they are beautiful and special."

ben was angry and greedy. he said, "you are silly and selfish. you don't know anything about rocks. i am a lawyer and i know everything. give me your rocks or i will sue you."

lily was scared and upset. she did not know what sue meant, but it sounded bad. she did not want to fight with ben. she said, "please, don't sue me. i don't want to give you my rocks, but i don't want to make you mad."

just then, a man came to the park. he was lily's dad. he saw lily and ben and heard their words. he said, "what is going on here? why are you making my daughter cry?"

ben said, "she has some rocks that i want, but she won't give them to me. i am a lawyer and i can sue her."

lily's dad said, "you are not a lawyer. you are a liar. you are a bully and a thief. you can't sue anyone. you can't take anyone's rocks. you should be ashamed of yourself."

ben was embarrassed and ashamed. he realized he was wrong and mean. he said, "i'm sorry. i was envious of her rocks. i don't have any rocks of my own. i lied about being a lawyer. i just wanted to impress her."

lily's dad said, "you don't need to lie or be envious to impress anyone. you need to be honest and kind. you need to respect other people's things. you need to apologize to lily and leave her alone."

ben said, "i'm sorry, lily. i was wrong. i won't bother you again. can you forgive me?"

lily said, "i forgive you, ben. but you can't have my rocks. they are mine. you can collect your own rocks. there are many rocks in the park. maybe we can be friends and share our rocks someday."

ben said, "thank you, lily. maybe we can. i will try to be a better person."

lily's dad said, "that's good, ben. i hope you learned your lesson. come on, lily. let's go home and have some cookies."

lily said, "okay, dad. i love you. and i love my rocks."

the moral of the story is: don't be envious of what others have. be honest and kind. respect other people's things. collect your own rocks.

once upon a time, there was a wealthy man who had a big black dog. the man and the dog lived in a big house. the man had many things, but he did not have friends. the black dog was his only friend.

one day, the man saw a poor boy playing with a small ball. the boy was happy even though he did not have many things. the wealthy man thought, "why is the poor boy so happy?" he wanted to know how to be happy like the boy.

the wealthy man talked to the boy. the boy said, "i am happy because i have friends and we share." the man learned that having friends and sharing made people happy. he started to share his things and made many friends. the man and the black dog were happy too. the moral of the story is that sharing and having friends are more important than having many things.

once there was a girl who was very restless. she was always looking for something to do. she wanted excitement and adventure. 

one day she had an idea. she wanted to go shopping. she asked her mom to supply her with money. 

â€œmommy, can i have some money so i can go shopping?â€ the girl asked. 

â€œok, sweetheart, you can have the money,â€ said the mom.

the girl was so happy. she thanked her mom and went off to buy all the things she wanted. she was very excited to go shopping. 

when she got to the store, she got whatever she wanted. she was very happy and content now that she had all the supplies she needed. the girl finished her shopping and left the store with a big smile on her face. 

she looked around and noticed all the things she had bought. she smiled, knowing she was now content and not so restless anymore.

once there was an oak. it was tall, strong and proud. but one day something happened. a big, bad animal came and decided to destroy it. the oak was embarrassed and sad. it felt so helpless, with no way to stop the animal from tearing it down.

it tried to cry for help, but no one came. in the end, the oak was destroyed. but it was not forgotten. people could still see its sad remains, standing there so sadly.

the oak was gone, but its spirit still remained. people would always remember it and how it was destroyed. they were all very ashamed that they didn't try to stop it. 

but the oak's memory will live on forever. people will always remember the proud oak that was destroyed.

once upon a time there was a little girl called grace. she was only three years old and loved hammering horseshoes. she had a shiny red hammer she was playing with one day and felt she could do anything with it!

suddenly her mom called out from inside the house. "grace, come here please!" she reluctantly went inside and put the hammer down on the table. 

"mommy, can i take my hammer out again?" she asked. 

"no sweetie. i don't want you to hurt yourself. you can't release the hammer just yet," said her mom. 

grace began to get upset. she didn't want to be told what to do with her toy! however her mom was firm and continued to say she couldn't have it back.

grace thought hard and came up with a plan. after a lot of persuasion, she managed to convince her mom to let her take the hammer out again, but with one condition - she had to wear gloves to protect her hands. 

grace agreed and quickly put on the gloves. her mom looked on and smiled, pleased that grace had come up with a fine solution.

grace released the hammer with great delight and was soon happily hammering away again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to go on adventures. one day, she put on her coat and headed out into the world.

down the road, she came across a thick forest. she couldn't see the end of it! but the little girl was brave so she decided to stand at the edge and explore it. 

the little girl soon spotted a wide road snaking through the forest. she took a few steps closer and saw that it was thick with mud. she knew she'd need some help to get through so she turned around and yelled out loud, "help me get through this road, please!"

suddenly, a big brown bear came over and stood next to her. he said, "i can help you cross the road! hold onto my fur and i'll take you safely across." the little girl nodded and gripped the bear's fur. then with the bear's help, she crossed the road and reached the other side. 

once she was back on the road, the little girl waved goodbye to the bear and plowed ahead for her next adventure.

once, there was a jolly little girl. she loved to care for things. one day, she was playing in the living room and noticed something special. there was a big, thick curtain hanging from the window. she reached out and touched it. the curtain felt soft and she didn't want to stop touching it.

the little girl wanted to care for the curtain. she started to clean it, picking off the tiny pieces of dirt stuck to it. then she got some warm water and washed it, so it looked nice and bright again. when she was finished, the curtain was beautiful and the little girl was very proud.

the little girl kept caring for the curtain. she would hang it back up and make sure it was in the right place. then she admired how it looked and how it made the room feel. she loved her beautiful curtain.

every day, the little girl cared for her lovely curtain. she was happy and jolly, knowing that she had something special to care for.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a house with her mommy and daddy. one day, lily's mommy said, "let's go to the store and buy some toys." lily was so happy and said, "yay! i want a doll and a ball."

at the store, they found a modern toy cabinet. lily's mommy said, "this is perfect to load all your toys in!" lily said, "wow, it's so big!" they bought the cabinet and went back home.

when they got home, lily's daddy helped them load all the toys into the cabinet. lily said, "thank you, daddy! now my room is clean and my toys are all in one place." her mommy said, "that's great, lily! now you can find your toys easily." lily was so happy and hugged her mommy and daddy.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and get dirty in the mud. one day, timmy's mom told him to stay inside because it was going to rain. but timmy didn't listen and went outside to play anyways.

as timmy was playing in the mud, he heard a loud growling noise. he looked up and saw a fierce bear coming towards him. timmy was scared and didn't know what to do. he tried to run away, but he slipped and fell in the mud.

the bear got closer and closer, but then timmy remembered something his dad had told him. he yelled, "go away, bear!" and the bear ran away. timmy was safe and he learned that sometimes it's important to listen to his parents and to be brave when he needs to be.

one day, a little girl named amy went to the park. it was a cool day, and she wore a big, warm coat. in the park, there was a fence. amy liked to play near the fence with her friends. 

amy saw her friend, ben, by the fence. ben looked sad. amy asked, "why are you sad, ben?" ben said, "i lost my toy car." amy wanted to help her friend. she said, "let's look for your car together."

amy and ben looked near the fence and found the toy car. ben was very happy. he hugged amy and said, "thank you for helping me!" amy smiled and hugged him back. they played with the toy car by the fence all day, happy to be together.

lily and ben are friends. they like to play together. today they have a big box. they want to make a house with the box.

"look, lily, we have a big box!" ben says. he is excited. he likes to make things.

"yes, ben, we have a big box!" lily says. she is excited too. she likes to pretend.

they take the box to the garden. they find some scissors and some paint. they cut a door and some windows in the box. they paint the box with different colors.

"wow, lily, our house is beautiful!" ben says. he smiles. his face is happy.

"wow, ben, our house is fun!" lily says. she laughs. her face is happy too.

they go inside the box. they pretend they are a family. they have a tea party. they have a lot of fun. they are happy. they have a big box.

once upon a time, a little girl named lucy had a special vest. it was her favorite vest because it was bright red and it had sparkles all over it.

one day, lucy wanted to share her vest with her friends. she gathered them all together in the yard, and she had an idea. she opened up her special vest and scattered the sparkles everywhere. the sparkles twinkled and glittered and it was so much fun for everyone!

they played games and chased each other, but when the sun started to go down, the sparkles were gone too. lucy was sad but then one of her friends said they still had something special to share: some special spicy snacks they had all been saving. 

so they all gathered around the snacks and enjoyed the delicious spicy treats. lucy was no longer sad because she had made some wonderful memories with her friends, thanks to her special vest. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a good dog. he wanted to be free, so he ran away from his family. he had a special pawprint he wanted to find.

the dog ran and ran until he came to a big city. everywhere he looked, he saw prints. he looked and looked, but none of the prints were his.

he was feeling sad when suddenly he heard a voice. it said, "surrender, and you will find what you are looking for." the dog was not sure what to do, but he followed the voice's advice.

at first, the dog was scared, but then he felt relieved. he had surrendered and found the special pawprint he wanted. he was so happy that he went back home to share his good news. 

from then on, the dog felt free. he was once again with the family he loved. he felt so happy because he had found his pawprint and his freedom.

once upon a time, there were two best friends, sam and lola. sam and lola loved to spend time together. 

one day, sam and lola were having a lot of fun playing with sam's wheel. sam rolled the wheel across the bouncy grass and laughed as she watched lola try to catch it. 

suddenly, lola stopped and said to sam, "let's make the wheel more colorful!" sam agreed and the two of them reached for some colorful paints nearby.

sam and lola worked together to paint the wheel. they painted it green, blue, and yellow. when they finished, sam stepped back to admire their work and said, "it looks perfect!"

suddenly, a strong wind blew from a nearby cliff and it struck the wheel. the wheel flew up into the air and away from them. they shouted for the wheel, but it was too far away. 

sam was very sad and said, "it's gone, lola." lola thought for a moment and then said, "don't worry sam, i know where it is." sam was curious and asked lola where the wheel was. 

lola smiled and said, "look up at the sky tonight and you will see the wheel. all the colors we painted it are sparkling in the night." sam was amazed realizing that the wheel was now a colorful star!

once upon a time, there was a big tree. it was heavy and very tall. everyone who passed by the tree, stopped to look at it. one day, a little girl named lucy was walking by the tree and decided to take a break. 

she said, "i want to climb the tree and see the view from the top. it looks so peaceful up there. i can feel the peace coming from the top of the tree."

her mom replied, "be careful, sweetheart. don't remove the leaves or branches from the tree, ok?"

lucy nodded and started to climb. she removed a few leaves from the tree as she was climbing, but when she reached the top, the most beautiful thing happened. she saw a magnificent rainbow. its colors filled the sky and everywhere felt so peaceful. 

lucy said, "mom, i am so glad i removed those leaves. otherwise i wouldn't have seen this amazing rainbow!"

with a big smile, lucy's mom replied, "that's what i wanted you to learn, sweetheart. when you take away something heavy, you can find great peace."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to tell jokes and make her family laugh. one day, she asked her mom if she could buy a joke book. her mom said yes, but only if it was cheap.

lily went to the store and found a joke book that was very cheap. she was so excited to show her family all the jokes in the book. she asked her dad if he wanted to hear a joke. he said yes, so lily told him a joke about a chicken crossing the road.

everyone laughed and lily felt very happy. she realized that making people laugh was the best feeling in the world. from that day on, lily told jokes every day and made her family smile.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she loved wearing her pretty scarf every day. one day, she went to the park to play with her friends. she was so proud of her scarf that she showed it to everyone.

suddenly, a big, mean dog came running towards her. lily was scared and she ran away. she tripped and fell down. her scarf got caught on a branch and she couldn't get up. her friends tried to help her, but it was too late. the dog bit her and she got hurt badly.

lily's family took her to the hospital, but she didn't make it. her friends were very sad and they missed her so much. they welcomed her scarf back, but it was never the same without lily.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside with his friends. one day, they decided to go row a boat in the pond. it was a hot day, and the sun was shining bright.

as they were rowing, timmy noticed that his friend forgot to shut the lid of his water bottle. "hey, your bottle is open! you might spill your water!" timmy said. his friend quickly shut the lid and thanked him.

after a while, they got tired of rowing and decided to take a break. they sat under a tree and talked about their favorite toys. "i have a toy car that goes really fast!" timmy said. "wow, that's cool!" his friend replied.
