soon, it was time to go home. timmy said goodbye to his friends and went back to his house. he was happy that he got to spend the day outside with his friends, even though it was hot.

once upon a time there was a little girl who lived near a big forest. she liked to look at the forest and all its beautiful things, like the wild animals and flowers. but one day the little girl saw a sign by the forest which said she had to be careful when she went inside it.

the little girl had never gone inside the forest before and she was a bit scared. but she was brave and decided to take a chance. she went in, but she was so careful not to get lost. everywhere she looked there was something new and exciting.

unfortunately, the little girl was too careful and couldn't enjoy the forest enough. before she knew it, it was time to go home and she had to leave. as she left the forest, the little girl couldn't stop thinking about it and how much she would miss it. but the little girl knew that she would have to be even more careful the next time she went in.

anna and ben were friends. they liked to play with toys. anna had a new doll. she loved her doll very much. she did not want to share her doll with anyone.

one day, ben came to anna's house. he saw the doll and wanted to play with it. he asked anna, "can you lend me your doll for a little while? i will be careful."

anna did not want to lend her doll, but she did not want to be rude. she said, "okay, you can play with her for a little while. but you have to give her back soon."

ben took the doll and ran to the garden. he played with the doll and had fun. he forgot about anna and the time.

anna waited and waited. she was upset. she wanted her doll back. she went to the garden and looked for ben. she saw him sitting on a swing. he was holding the doll. but the doll was not the same. the doll had dirt on her dress, a tear on her eye, and a missing shoe. anna was very angry. she shouted, "ben, what did you do to my doll? you ruined her! give her back to me!"

ben was scared. he did not mean to hurt the doll. he said, "i'm sorry, anna. i was just playing. i did not know she was so fragile. please don't be mad at me."

but anna was mad. she snatched the doll from ben's hands. she said, "you are a bad friend. you did not take care of my doll. you did not keep your promise. you can never play with her again. go away!"

ben felt sad. he wanted to say sorry again, but anna did not listen. she ran to her house and slammed the door. ben was left alone in the garden. he heard the silence. he knew he had lost his friend. he cried.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she liked to walk in the park and look at the pretty flowers. one day, she found a poem on the ground. it was very pretty and made her happy. 

lily wanted to keep the poem clean, so she put it in her pocket and walked home. when she got home, she showed the poem to her mommy. but, when she took the poem out of her pocket, it was ripped and dirty. 

lily was sad because she had wanted to keep the poem clean. she learned that sometimes things don't go the way we want them to.

once upon a time, there was a famous town where everyone was happy. one day, a man came to the town and displayed his big toy truck. all the children loved it and wanted to play with it.

but one boy, named timmy, didn't have any toys to play with. he asked the man if he could borrow the toy truck, but the man said no. timmy felt sad and didn't know what to do.

then, a kind lady came and saw that timmy was sad. she asked him what was wrong and timmy told her about the toy truck. the lady talked to the man and convinced him to let timmy play with the truck. timmy was so happy and grateful to the kind lady.

from that day on, timmy made a new friend and played with the toy truck every day. the town was even more famous because of timmy's new toy. and everyone was happy again. the end.

tom and lily are friends. they like to play with toys. today, they have a new toy. it is a jet. it is big and red. it can fly in the air.

"wow, this jet is cool!" tom says. "can i drive it?"

"sure, you can drive it," lily says. "but be careful. do not crash it."

tom takes the jet. he pushes a button. the jet makes a loud noise. it goes up and down. tom is happy. he drives the jet around the room.

lily watches tom. she claps her hands. she says, "you are good at driving the jet. can i try it too?"

tom nods. he says, "yes, you can try it. you are my friend. we can share the jet."

he gives the jet to lily. she smiles. she says, "thank you, tom. you are a friendly friend. we can have fun with the jet."

she pushes the button. the jet makes a loud noise. it goes up and down. lily is happy. she drives the jet around the room.

tom and lily play with the jet. they laugh and talk. they have a good time. they are friends. they like the jet.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and paint. one day, she saw an owl in the park. the owl was so pretty with big eyes and feathers. lily wanted to draw the owl, but she didn't have paper or paint.

she asked her mom, "mommy, can i draw the owl on the wall?" her mom said, "no, lily. that's not creative. you can draw the owl on paper." 

lily was sad because she didn't have any paper. but then, her mom gave her a napkin to use. lily was happy and started to draw the owl. but she accidentally spilled juice on the napkin. she said, "oh no! the juice is on the owl. what should i do?" 

her mom said, "just wipe it off, lily. it's okay." lily wiped the juice off the owl and finished her drawing. she realized that even if things don't go as planned, she can always fix it. the moral of the story is that it's important to be creative, but also to be responsible and clean up our messes.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved chewing gum all the time. one day, she was walking in the park and saw a nosy squirrel. the squirrel was very curious and kept following her around. 

lily decided to pause and give the squirrel some gum. but the squirrel didn't like the gum and ran away. lily felt sad that the squirrel didn't like her gum. 

suddenly, lily noticed a group of ducks swimming in the pond nearby. she ran towards them and gave them some bread. the ducks loved the bread and followed her around for more. lily was happy that she made some new friends in the park.

once upon a time, there was a parrot called joe. joe was a very weird parrot. he liked to do things differently than the other parrots.

one day, joe went to visit his friends. his first stop was at a mouse's house.

joe: "hello, mouse! i brought you a present!" 

mouse: "thank you, joe! what is it?"

joe: "i brought you something to eat. i hope you like it!"

joe had given the mouse a delicious nut. mouse was very happy and thanked joe for his kind gesture.

joe's next stop was at a bear's house.

joe: "hello, bear! i have something special for you!" 

bear: "what is it, joe?"

joe: "it's a weird present. i hope you like it!"

joe had given the bear a brightly coloured feather. bear was very excited and thanked joe for his thoughtful gift.

the moral of this story is that it's nice to give presents to your friends.

lily and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys and their dog, spot. but sometimes they fight over who gets what. mom and dad tell them to share and be nice, but they do not listen.

one day, mom and dad have a surprise for them. they say they are going to the park, but they drive to a big building instead. lily and ben are confused. they ask what is going on. mom and dad smile and say they will see soon.

they go inside the building and see a lot of people and balloons. they hear music and laughter. they see a sign that says "happy birthday, lily and ben!" they are shocked. they did not know it was their birthday. they forgot.

mom and dad hug them tight and say they love them very much. they say they are sorry they did not tell them before, but they wanted to make it a surprise. they say they are proud of them for being good kids, even when they fight sometimes.

lily and ben feel happy and sorry at the same time. they hug mom and dad back and say they love them too. they say they are sorry for fighting and not sharing. they say they will try to be better. they thank them for the surprise.

mom and dad say they are welcome and take them to the party. they see their friends and family waiting for them. they see a big cake and a lot of presents. they have fun and enjoy their birthday. they learn that surprises can be good and that hugs can make everything better. they also learn that sharing and being nice are important, because they make mom and dad happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named amy. she was very spoiled and she was allowed to do anything she wanted. one day, she was playing in the park, and she saw a white stair. she was so excited and she wanted to share it with her friends. thus, she ran to her friends and she said "i found a stair! let's play together!" her friends were very happy and they wanted to share it too. so, they all took turns on the stair. they laughed and smiled, and had lots of fun! when it was over, they thanked each other for sharing the stair with them. it was a very special moment and they were so happy! the end.

tom and jen are friends. they like to play in the yard. they have a ball and a bike and a doll. they have fun.

one day, a big black dog comes to the yard. he is not nice. he barks and growls and runs at tom and jen. tom and jen are scared. they run to the house. they yell for help.

but the door is locked. mom and dad are not home. they went to the store. they told tom and jen to mind the house. they did not know about the big black dog.

the big black dog jumps on the bike and breaks it. he bites the ball and pops it. he tears the doll and makes it dirty. he ruins tom and jen's toys. tom and jen cry.

the big black dog sees tom and jen in the window. he wants to get them. he scratches the door and makes a hole. he pushes his head through the hole. he snarls and snaps. tom and jen scream.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a cherry tree. every day the tree grew cherries and the birds would come to feed from its branches. all was well until one day the sky became very gloomy. the birds stopped coming to the tree. the tree felt sad and lonely, but it didn't give up hope.

one morning, a little girl came to the tree. she was carrying a big basket full of cherries. she began to feed the birds who had come back to the tree. the tree was so thankful and it smiled in the sun.

the little girl came every day to feed the birds. the tree was very happy and its branches filled with cherries. the birds sang beautiful songs and the sky filled with sunshine again. the little girl and the birds kept coming back every day to share the cherries from the tree.

it was the time of sunrise. the sky was normal. bob and sam were walking together. 

"let's skip!" said bob.

sam was excited. he smiled and said, "yes!"

so they began to skip. they skipped fast and they skipped slow. they even jumped, but mostly they skipped. 

the sky was getting brighter. colors started to appear and the birds in the sky began to sing. 

bob and sam stopped. they watched the sunrise and were so happy. 

"that was fun!" said sam.

"yes, it was normal! but let's do it again tomorrow morning," said bob.

sam nodded and smiled. he was excited to go skipping again.

once upon a time, there was a girl named emma. emma was three years old and she loved exploring the world around her. everywhere she went, she would wonder at all the things she saw and experienced.

one day, emma's mom asked her to help pick out a new blanket for her bed. emma was so excited. she wondered what kind of blanket she should get. she looked at the different colors and designs, but nothing felt quite right.

just then, she saw a special blanket. it was a soft pink one, with a cool pattern that sparkled in the light. emma knew right away that this was the perfect blanket for her bed.

emma's mom smiled when she saw the blanket, and was generous enough to let emma have it. emma thanked her mom and happily carried it back home. she snuggled up with the blanket and wondered with delight what her next adventure would be.

one day, anna and her mom went to the beach. anna loved the water and the sand. she saw many fish and shells. she wanted to swim in the sea, but she was a little scared.

"mom, can i swim with you?" she asked.

"of course, honey. i will hold your hand and we will stay close to the shore. the water is warm and nice. don't be afraid," her mom said.

they walked into the water and splashed each other. anna giggled and felt happy. she saw something big and gray jump out of the water. it was a dolphin!

"look, mom, a dolphin!" she shouted.

the dolphin came closer and made a funny noise. it seemed friendly and curious. anna reached out her hand and touched its smooth skin. the dolphin let her stroke its back and head. it smiled and nodded.

"hi, dolphin. you are so pretty and smart. i like you," anna said.

the dolphin liked anna too. it swam around her and her mom and played with them. it pushed them gently with its nose and made them laugh. it showed them how it could jump and spin in the air. it was like a magic show.

anna felt comfortable and brave with the dolphin. she forgot her fear and enjoyed the water. she hugged the dolphin and kissed its cheek.

"thank you, dolphin. you are my friend. you made my day," she said.

the dolphin thanked anna too. it made a happy noise and winked at her. it waved its tail and said goodbye. it swam away and joined its family.

anna and her mom waved back and smiled. they were grateful for the dolphin and its kindness. they had a wonderful time at the beach. they never forgot their new friend.

anna loves to help her parent make cake. she likes to mix the flour and the eggs and the sugar in a big bowl. she likes to lick the spoon and taste the sweet batter. she likes to watch the cake turn brown in the oven.

when the cake is ready, her parent takes it out and puts it on a plate. they let it cool down a little bit, then they cut a slice for anna and a slice for them. they sit at the table and eat the cake with some milk. the cake is soft and moist and delicious. anna smiles and says, "thank you for the cake, parent. you are the best."

her parent smiles back and says, "you are welcome, anna. you are a good helper and a good eater. i love you very much." they hug and kiss and finish their cake. then they wash the dishes and put them away. they go to the living room and read a book together. anna feels happy and cozy. she loves her parent and her cake.

once upon a time, there was a stupid key. the key was so stupid that it wouldn't open any door. all the other keys around it were so nice and opened the doors, but not the poor stupid key.

one day, the key thought it was so tired of being stupid and not opening the door. so, it rolled away and found a window. the key thought, "maybe if i just try i can open this window." so, it tried and tried to open the window, but it couldn't. 

suddenly, the lock of the window opened! the key was so excited. it opened the window and peeked outside. it thought that maybe, just maybe, it wasn't so stupid afterall. then, it shut the window and went on a new adventure. 

and the key was never seen again, maybe it found its purpose in life. but nobody knows and the stupid key became a mystery.

annabelle was very sad one day. she cried and cried. nothing could stop her tears. suddenly she remembered something. it was an icy memory from the winter.

grandma had taken her to the park. annabelle had been scared of the ice, it looked cold and hard. but grandma helped her walk on it. it didn't take long for annabelle to stop being scared, and soon she was running and laughing all over the frozen park.

she cried some more, remembering grandma. but then she remembered how happy she was in the park and her tears turned into smiles. she remembered how much fun she had that day. 

annabelle was not crying anymore. she was now smiling, remembering that icy memory.

one day, a goose went for a walk. it went very fast! it was running and flying at the same time. it was so fast that it made the grass spin around its feet. 

soon the goose came to a lake. it wanted to take a rest, but it heard a noise. it was a little boy! he was laughing and running near the lake. 

the goose got scared and it ran away. the boy chased it, but the goose was too fast. it flew away, into the big blue sky. 

the boy watched the goose go. he waved goodbye, and watched until it was gone. 

the goose was happy and safe. it flew away, for its adventures, to new places far away.

max was a kind little boy. he was playing in his garden when he saw something special. it was a flower that looked like it was made from gold. max knew he had to have it. 

he carefully picked the flower and took it inside his house. when he looked at it closely, max knew exactly what he had to do. he was going to replace the petals with shining coins. 

at noon, max was ready. he replaced the petals of the golden flower with the coins. now he had something even more special. max smiled as he looked at his new flower. he had replaced something dull with something beautiful!

alice was always in a hurry. she was always running around the house, playing with her toys and having fun. today, alice wanted to see something amazing. she quickly ran to her room and opened the door. 

alice was so surprised by what she saw! the room was filled with all kinds of balloons, and there were bright streamers and decorations everywhere. on the wall was a big painting that showed an incredible hot air balloon. 

alice was so happy! she ran up to the painting and touched it with her little hands. she smiled as she looked around the room and took in the amazing sights. 

alice ran around the room, picking up balloons and chasing after the streamers. she was having so much fun! before she knew it, alice had been running around the room for hours. 

when it was time to go, alice got ready to leave the room. she smiled, thanked the room for being so amazing and ran off to her next adventure.

jack was walking in the field. it was a very gloomy day and the sky was grey. he felt very sad, but there was nobody to help him. 
suddenly, he heard a sound. he walked towards it and saw a puppy. the puppy was all alone and it urgently needed an owner.

jack smiled at the puppy and the puppy jumped and ran to him, licking his face happily. jack knew the puppy really needed a home, so he decided to take him home and give him a good life.

ever since, jack and the puppy are best friends. they laugh, play and have lots of fun together, and jack knows that the puppy always needs him and loves him. 
no matter how gloomy the sky is, jack and the puppy brighten each otherâ€™s days!

one day, a little boy named tim found a bright baseball in the park. he picked it up and saw a big door. he wanted to see what was inside, so he decided to enter.

inside, he saw a big room with lots of other kids. they were all playing with baseballs too. tim was very happy to see them. he said, "hi! can i play with you?"

one of the kids smiled and said, "yes, of course! we love playing with baseballs. come and join us!" tim felt very happy and started to play with them.

they played together for a long time, and tim made many new friends. they all had a lot of fun with the bright baseballs. at the end of the day, tim went home with a big smile on his face, and he couldn't wait to come back and play again.

once there was a little girl who wanted to know how much she weighed.
she asked her mom to weigh her one morning, and her mom said yes.
so they went to the kitchen and her mom put her on the scale.
the scale showed her weight and she was so excited!

that night, the little girl was so lively.
she danced around the house and jumped around with glee.
she played games and sang songs while her mom watched with a smile.

but soon, it was time for bed.
the little girl said goodnight and went to her room.
she brushed her teeth and put on her pajamas.
she lay in bed, happy and content with the knowledge of her weight.

once upon a time, there was a smart little girl called lucy. she loved to explore her garden and she often found special things. today she found something even more special - a sparkling object. when she picked it up, she went to tell her mom.

"mom, look what i found in the garden," lucy said, excitedly holding up the shiny thing in her hand.

"oh, that's mine," said her mom. "it's a special necklace. i must have dropped it when i was gardening earlier."

lucy beamed. she was so happy to have found it for her mom.

"thank you for finding this for me," said mom. "you're so smart and i'm so proud of you."

lucy smiled and gave her mom a big hug. she would never forget this special moment and the mine she had found in the garden.

once upon a time there were two happy friends, jax and lola. one day, they decided to explore a nearby forest. 

as they walked, they saw lots of cool things. soon they reached a big tree. jax was curious and started to climb up it. as he reached the top, he was surprised to find a long cord! he quickly shouted down to lola, "look what i found!"

lola was very excited. she shouted back, "let's share it!" 

the two friends decided to have a tug of war with the cord. they pulled and pulled, each one trying to win. eventually jax pulled the cord so hard that it snapped in half! 

both jax and lola were surprised, but also very happy. they split the cord so that each one could take half. they each had a piece of the cord to remember their fun day. 

the two friends laughed and said goodbye, each one taking their own happy piece of cord.

once upon a time, there was a lonely guard. he watched from far away, every day. he was there to help people and support them.

one day, a little boy was alone in the woods. he was scared and looked for someone to help him. the guard saw the boy and ran to him. he talked and played with the little boy until the danger was gone.

the guard was there to make sure the little boy was safe. he was the boy's protector and he helped him find his way back home. from then on, the guard was the little boy's best friend. he would always support him, no matter what.

the guard was always there to help, and he always felt better knowing he was protecting someone who was so lonely. he was so happy to make a difference in the little boy's life.

once upon a time, there was a little squirrel. he loved to climb trees and find tasty acorns to eat. one day, he found the tastiest acorn he had ever seen! he was so happy and wanted to eat it right away. 

but then, a sneaky bird came and stole the acorn right out of the squirrel's paws! the little squirrel was very sad and didn't know what to do. he looked up at the bird and said, "that's not fair! you stole my tasty acorn!" 

the bird felt bad and decided to share the acorn with the little squirrel. from that day on, the squirrel and the bird became friends and shared all the tasty acorns they found together. the end.

izzy was playing in the garden. suddenly, it began to rain. she saw the rain and said, â€œyay!â€ she liked playing in the shower.

her mom saw izzy and said, â€œcome inside now, izzy. youâ€™re getting wet.â€

izzy asked, â€œcan i take a shower?â€

her mom smiled and said, â€œyes, of course you can.â€

so izzy went inside and her mom offered her a warm shower. she brushed her teeth and washed her face. then izzy felt nice and clean.

when she was done, her mom said, â€œthat was a good shower, izzy. now youâ€™re ready for a normal day.â€

izzy smiled and said, â€œok! iâ€™m ready!â€

once there was a charming elephant called amanda. every day, amanda enjoyed walking through the forest. the sun was shining, the birds were singing, and she felt so happy. everywhere she went, she trumpeted loudly with her big trunk. she loved hearing the sound of her own horn!

one day, she walked past a pond and saw a big, fluffy duck swimming in the water. amanda was so excited, so she walked over to say hello. the duck was very friendly and they began to play together. they had so much fun!

together they waded in and out of the water, and ran around in circles. every time amanda trumpeted with her horn, the duck answered back with a cheerful quack. it was the best day ever!

amanda enjoyed her day with the duck so much that she decided to come back to the pond every day. she always looked forward to playing with her new friend, the charming duck.

there was a young girl who loved pastels. she was always looking for ways to play and have fun with her favorite colors. she found an old blanket one day and thought it would be perfect for her. she started to fold the blanket, making it into different shapes. she made a thick blanket for a house and a thin one for a bridge.

the young girl was so proud of her creations. she added a few of her favorite pastel colors to the blanket and then folded it again and again. pretty soon, she had a big box of different shapes and sizes. she was so excited by what she had made with her blanket that she started to jump and dance around.

the girl had so much fun playing with her blanket and pastel colors. she never wanted the day to end. what a wonderful way to use her imagination.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and color. one day, she drew a funny picture of a cat with big ears and a long tail. she wanted to show her picture to her mom.

"mommy, look at my picture!" lily said excitedly.

"that's a very nice print, lily. you are very talented," her mom said.

lily smiled and felt proud of herself. she continued to draw more pictures and show them to her family and friends. she loved to make people happy with her art.

mum and dad were getting ready to go out on their bikes. they put on their helmets and dad checked the tires to make sure they were working. then they were ready to go.

they cycled through the park, going up and down the big hills. it was very rough but they held on tight. dad was careful to avoid all the bumps in the road.

after a while, they stopped in the clearing. dad took off his helmet and looked around. he was so happy to be in nature.

they explored for a while, climbing the hills and looking for special things. then it was time to go home again. mum and dad prepared for the journey back. they put on their helmets and started cycling. they were back in no time and were very happy to be home.

once upon a time, there was a big flower. it had a yellow bulb and was very tall. one day, a butterfly came to visit the flower. the butterfly was very graceful and flew around the flower. then, the butterfly landed on the flower and the flower had to kneel down to let the butterfly rest. the flower was happy to help the butterfly, and they became friends. from that day on, the butterfly would visit the flower every day and they would have fun together. the end.

once upon a time, there was a greedy farmer who loved to keep all the chickens to himself. he was very master of his chickens, never letting them go anywhere or eat anything but what he said. he was always very selfish.

one day, he was watching all of his chickens in the yard, when one of them suddenly flew away! the farmer was so angry and immediately set out to find his lost chicken.
 
as he followed the footprints of the chicken, he eventually found it. but the farmer was surprised to discover that the chicken had found a family of its own. the chicken was having the time of its life, running around, playing and eating with its new family.

the farmer realised that he had been selfish, keeping the chicken all to himself. he knew that it was more important for the chicken to be with its family. he decided to let the chicken go to stay with its family and learn to be free.

the farmer walked away with a smile, knowing that his lost chicken had revealed the true value of happiness and family.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play all day and didn't like to do his job. his job was to clean up his toys after he was done playing. 

one day, timmy's mom asked him to clean up his toys before dinner. timmy didn't want to do his job and said he would do it later. he went outside to play with his friends instead. 

later that night, timmy couldn't find his favorite toy. he looked everywhere but couldn't remember where he put it. his mom reminded him that if he had done his job and cleaned up his toys, he would know where his toy was. 

timmy felt sad and learned that it's important to do your job and keep things high and tidy so you don't forget where things are.

once upon a time, there was a doggy named max. max was very playful and loved to run in the park with his ball. one day, max's collar broke and he couldn't play anymore. his owner, sarah, decided to send max's collar to the store to get fixed. 

max was sad without his collar, but sarah promised to get it back soon. while they waited, sarah and max played games inside. they played hide-and-seek and chase. max was so happy to play with sarah, even without his collar. 

finally, the store sent max's collar back. sarah put it on him and they went back to the park to play with his ball again. max was so excited to have his collar back and play with his ball with sarah. they had so much fun together! the end.

once upon a time, there was a brown bear. the bear loved to record the sounds of the world.

the bear carried around a special recorder that was made just for him. everyday, he sealed up his home, grabbed the recorder and went off exploring. everywhere he went, the bear would do his best to record the sights and sounds.

one morning, the bear came across some beautiful singing birds. immediately he lifted up his recorder to get a perfect recording, but the birds flew away before he could do so. he tried not to be too sad and continued his day.

finally, the bear stumbled across a pond. after listening closely, he heard a gentle trill coming from the water. he quickly pulled out his recorder and recorded the sound of the water. the bear was very pleased with what he had recorded. 

he went home a happy bear with a new recording to add to his collection.

sara likes to play with her cards. she has many cards with different pictures on them. she likes to find two cards that have the same picture. she calls this game "match".

one day, sara plays match with her brother tom. tom is older than sara and he knows more words. he picks a card with a big red car on it. he says, "this is a car. it goes vroom vroom." he looks for another card with a car.

sara picks a card with a yellow duck on it. she says, "this is a duck. it goes quack quack." she looks for another card with a duck.

tom finds a card with a car, but it is blue, not red. he says, "this is a car, too. but it is different. it is blue, not red." he puts the two cards together and says, "i have a match."

sara finds a card with a duck, but it is green, not yellow. she says, "this is a duck, too. but it is different. it is green, not yellow." she puts the two cards together and says, "i have a match, too."

tom and sara look at each other's cards. they see that they have different matches. they laugh and say, "we have different matches, but we both have fun." they keep playing match until they have no more cards.

once there was a little girl who loved to see new things. everywhere she went, she looked around her with happy eyes. one day, she saw something bad. it made her sad.

the girl wanted to make it better, so she put love into her heart. with her love, she saw that the bad thing was gone.

in its place was something wonderful. the girl was filled with joy. she ran around in the sun, feeling the love all around her.

the little girl was happy to see that love had made everything beautiful. she knew that love was the most powerful thing she had ever seen.

one morning, a little girl called lucy woke up early and saw the sunrise. its orange rays filled the sky and she was so excited, she knew something special was going to happen that day.

â€˜what should i do, mama?â€™ lucy asked her mum.

â€˜you can join the sunrise and have lots of fun,â€™ mama said.

so, lucy put on her shoes and her coat, and rushed outside to join the sunrise. the sky was bright and warm and lucy ran as fast as she could until, at last, she was standing at the top of a big hill. 

â€˜jump!â€™ shouted mama, so lucy took a big jump and flew through the sky. the wind was blowing through her hair and for the first time, she felt really safe and free. 

she soared through the sky and when she eventually came back down to earth, she gave a huge hug to mama.

â€˜i loved joining the sunrise today,â€™ said lucy as she hugged her tightly.

â€˜me too,â€™ said mama. â€˜and thereâ€™ll be plenty more chances to join together again soon.â€™

once upon a time there was small shrimp. she was so tiny and high. everywhere she went, she heard of a lovely land called slip.

one day shrimp decided to go visit slip. along the way she met a lot of friends. everyone wanted to travelling with her to slip.

they walked and walked until they reached a big hill. shrimp's friends were scared; they told her to turn back. but shrimp said, â€œi must go to slip.â€ 

so shrimp began to climb up the big hill. when she got to the top, shrimp looked down. she could see the land of slip was waiting for her.

suddenly shrimp started to slip down the hill. as she tumbled and rolled, shrimp used her little claws to grab onto the grass and slow down her slide. when she reached the bottom, shrimp saw she had arrived at slip - the land she had heard so much about. 

shrimp and her friends stayed in slip for many days. they played and laughed and the sun kept them warm. it was the best time of their lives.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to peek. he peeked around every corner, into every bush and behind every bench.

one day, he was peeking around a bench and he saw something delicious. it was a big, juicy red apple! the little boy slowly crept over to the bench and peeked around to make sure no one else was there.

he then grabbed the delicious apple, took a bite and smiled. he had never tasted anything as delicious as this apple. he quickly ran over to a nearby tree, tucked the apple into a hollow, and ran off again to peek some more.

the little boy was so delighted by his delicious discovery and had the biggest grin on his face. he would come back to peek around the bench many times in search of another tasty surprise!

sara and ben are playing in the park. they like to run and jump and slide. it is a sunny day and they feel hot and thirsty. they see a big tree with many green leaves. they run to the tree and sit under it.

"ah, this is nice," sara says. "the shade is cool and soft. i feel better now."

"me too," ben says. "the sun is too bright and hot. the shade is dark and calm. i feel happy now."

they look up and see a bird in the tree. the bird is singing a pretty song. it has red and yellow feathers and a black beak. it hops from branch to branch and looks at them.

"hello, bird," sara says. "you have a nice voice. do you like the shade too?"

"tweet, tweet," the bird says. "yes, i do. the shade is my home. i feel safe and cozy here. do you want to hear more of my song?"

"yes, please," ben says. "we like your song. it makes us feel glad. can we be your friends?"

"tweet, tweet," the bird says. "of course, you can. you are kind and polite. i feel friendly and open to you. come and visit me anytime."

sara and ben smile and clap their hands. they listen to the bird's song and enjoy the shade. they feel peaceful and grateful. they have a new friend in the park.

once upon a time there was a foolish boy. he wanted to take something but he was too scared. one day he saw a big steel box. he thought he could take it and no one would notice. but when he tried to take the box, it was too heavy for him. he fell to the ground and made a loud noise.

suddenly, a big man appeared. he saw the foolish boy and the steel box and knew immediately what had happened. he said: "that was a foolish thing to do. you shouldn't try to take something that is too heavy for you."

the man took the boy home and told him to never try to take something that he could not carry. the boy learned his lesson and never tried to take something without permission ever again.

lily and ben are twins. they like to play in their dad's lab. their dad is a scientist. he makes new things with his tools and machines.

one day, lily and ben find a big bowl of white stuff on the table. it looks like snow, but it is not cold. lily wants to touch it. ben wants to stir it.

"can we play with it?" lily asks.

"i don't know. maybe it is for dad's work." ben says.

"let's try it. it looks fun." lily says.

she puts her hand in the bowl. the white stuff is soft and smooth. she makes a ball with it. ben takes a spoon and stirs the white stuff. it makes a funny sound. he makes a hole with it.

they have fun with the white stuff. they make shapes and letters and animals. they laugh and giggle.

but then, something happens. the white stuff starts to bubble and fizz. it grows bigger and bigger. it spills out of the bowl. it covers the table and the floor and the chairs.

"oh no! what did we do?" lily says.

"run!" ben says.

they run out of the lab. they see their dad coming. he looks angry.

"what did you do to my experiment?" he says.

"we are sorry, dad. we just wanted to play." lily and ben say.

they hug their dad. he hugs them back.

"it's okay. i love you. but next time, don't touch anything in my lab. it can be dangerous." he says.

"okay, dad. we promise." lily and ben say.

they help their dad clean up the mess. they learn a new word: polymer. they say it is a hard word. they prefer to call it the white stuff.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. she had a big box full of things. one day, the little girl opened the box and inside she found a stamp. it was huge, bigger than anything else in the box! the little girl was so curious about the big stamp and decided to take a closer look. when she did, the big stamp magically revealed a secret picture â€“ it was a picture of her mom and dad! the little girl was so happy and excited to see the big stamp reveal the picture of mom and dad. she was so happy, she hugged the big stamp and never let it go!

once upon a time there was a little girl named anne. she was three years old and loved to have adventures. she had a great idea!

one day she woke up and was full of energy. she decided to go outside and explore. as she was walking around, she saw a big tree with lots of leaves. she stopped and couldn't believe what she saw. it was a big, fat caterpillar! 

anne began to get excited and started to talk to the caterpillar. she asked it what it was doing. the caterpillar said it was going for a walk, so anne walked with it. 

as they walked, anne saw something else she wanted to explore. she started to squish the caterpillar around her fingers, it was so soft and gentle. but soon then anne got louder and louder and squeezed too hard, the caterpillar didn't like it and hopped away.

anne was sad and cried. but then all of a sudden, she had an idea! she grabbed some leaves and put them in a big jar and put it near a window. some days later, the caterpillar came back to the same spot and anne was so excited to see it.

the caterpillar had made friends with some other bugs and they all stayed in the jar. anne had made a new family of bugs and was happy. she continued to squeeze them gently and play with them every day. 

anne and her bug family

tom and anna like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but their favorite is the hammer. the hammer is big and colorful. it has red, blue, yellow and green on it. they use the hammer to make noise and to pretend they are builders.

one day, they decide to march around the house with the hammer. they hold the hammer high and say, "we are the hammer team! we can fix anything!" they march to the kitchen, to the living room, to the bedroom and to the bathroom. they bang the hammer on the floor, on the table, on the bed and on the door. they make a lot of noise and have a lot of fun.

but then, they hear their mom say, "what are you doing, tom and anna? you are making too much noise! you are bothering me and the baby! and you are damaging the house! put the hammer away and play quietly!"

tom and anna feel sad and sorry. they did not mean to make mom angry or to hurt the house. they say, "we are sorry, mom. we just wanted to play with the hammer. we like the hammer. it is colorful and fun."

mom says, "i know you like the hammer, but you have to be careful and respectful. the hammer is not a toy. it is a tool. it is for fixing things, not for breaking things. you can play with the hammer outside, but not inside. and you have to wear a helmet and gloves, and ask me or dad for help. do you understand?"

tom and anna nod and say, "yes, mom. we understand. we will be careful and respectful. we will play with the hammer outside, and wear a helmet and gloves, and ask for help. can we still march with the hammer?"

mom smiles and says, "yes, you can still march with the hammer, but only outside, and only when it is not too loud or too late. and you have to share the hammer with each other and with your friends. now, give me a hug and a kiss, and go play nicely."

tom and anna hug and kiss mom and say, "we love you, mom. thank you for the hammer. we will be good." they take the hammer and go outside. they march with the hammer and play with their friends. they are happy and proud. they are the hammer team. they can fix anything.

once upon a time, there was a green car. the car was driving on a road. suddenly, the car hit a big bump and fell into a deep hole. the driver was scared and shouted, "help me! help me!" 

a little girl heard the driver's voice and ran to the hole. she asked, "are you okay?" the driver replied, "no, i am hurt. please call for help." 

the little girl ran to her house and called for help. soon, the ambulance arrived and took the driver to the hospital. sadly, the car was too damaged to be fixed. the driver was sad because he loved his green car very much.

once there was a little girl named may who liked to draw pictures. she had a box full of crayons and she was obedient. every day she was given a new eraser to use.

one lovely spring day, may was excited about her day. she wanted to use her eraser for a special surprise. she looked around her garden and chose all the prettiest flowers, then she used her eraser and drew them onto a piece of paper.

when may finished her picture, she showed it to her parents. they were so impressed! they said may was so obedient when it came to her doodles. may was very proud, and she put her picture up on the wall to show her friends.

every spring day, may likes to use her eraser to draw more pictures. she is so obedient and can't wait to do it again!

once upon a time there was a generous old lady. every day she looked after all the animals in her garden. she was especially kind to a little rabbit. one day she demanded the little rabbit to help her with a task. she had a needle and needed the rabbit to help thread it.

the little rabbit was scared at first but he was curious to help the old lady. he cautiously jumped over to the old lady and took the needle. he studied it in his tiny paws as the old lady watched. then carefully he started to thread the needle. he concentrated very hard but eventually he managed to thread it!

the old lady was proud of the little rabbit. she praised him and gave him a big hug. in return the little rabbit gave her a warm and generous smile. everyone was happy and they knew they could all depend on each other.

the little girl was very stubborn. she was very determined to do everything her own way. she found a cute little hat one day and she just had to have it. she asked her mom if she could keep it and of course, her mom said yes. she was so excited to wear it.

the little girl had a friend. she asked her friend if she wanted to go outside and play. her friend said yes. the little girl invited her friend to her house so they could play with the hat. her friend said yes and they had lots of fun together.

the little girl was so excited that she invited her friends over to play with the hats. she wanted to show them the hats and have them have fun with her. soon, many of her friends came over and they all had a great time playing with the hats. they laughed and smiled and had a lot of fun! 

the little girl was so happy that she had been stubborn and kept the hat. she was glad she had invited her friends to come and play with her. she knew that she would keep it forever.

one day, there was a little girl named lucy. she was 3 years old and very curious. she went to an ordinary classroom everyday to watch her teachers and friends. lucy loved to watch her teachers do things. she was amazed by the things they could do. 

sometimes the teachers would read stories, draw pictures or even play games. lucy watched closely and followed the instructions. every day was an adventure and there was so much to learn. 

at the end of the day, lucy felt excited. she couldn't wait to tell her parents all about what she had observed in the classroom. 

lucy was so happy to watch her teachers and friends in her ordinary classroom. she couldn't wait to see what tomorrow would bring.

lily liked to draw with her pencil. she had a modern pencil that was red and shiny. it had a button on the top that made the lead come out. lily thought it was very cool.

one day, lily went to the park with her mom and dad. she brought her pencil and a paper to draw on. she saw many things that she wanted to draw: a big slide, a yellow duck, a green tree. she was very happy.

but then, a boy came and took her pencil. he said it was his pencil and he ran away. lily was very sad and angry. she cried and told her mom and dad what happened.

her mom and dad cared about lily. they hugged her and said they would find her pencil. they looked around the park and asked other people if they saw the boy. they found him near a bench. he was trying to draw with lily's pencil, but he did not know how to use the button.

lily's dad went to the boy and asked him to give back the pencil. he said it was not his pencil, it was lily's pencil. he said lily was very nice to share her pencil with him, but he had to return it. he said he was sorry for taking it.

the boy gave back the pencil to lily. lily was very happy. she thanked her dad and smiled at the boy. she said she would let him use her pencil if he asked nicely. the boy said thank you and said he liked her pencil. he said it was very modern.

lily and the boy became friends. they drew together with lily's pencil and paper. they had fun and learned from each other. lily's mom and dad were proud of lily. they said she was very kind and smart. they said they loved her very much.

once upon a time, there was a brave and adventurous kid who decided to enter a jungle. the kid was so excited to explore the jungle and could barely contain his enthusiasm. the kid went deeper and deeper into the jungle and stopped to watch the animals. for a moment, the jungle seemed wonderful. 

then, out of the corner of the kid's eye, the kid noticed a strange creature. this frightening creature stalked the kid as he went deeper into the jungle. the creature was huge and menacing and seemed to be following the kid. the kid was so scared, but was determined to keep going. 

finally, the creature was too close for comfort and the kid decided to run away. as soon as the kid started to run, the creature easily caught up. the creature bared its sharp teeth and the kid knew it was in trouble. the creature lunged at the kid and the adventure in the jungle ended with a loud roar.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her rubber ball. one day, she noticed that her ball was not as bouncy as before. she asked her mom, "why is my ball not bouncing high?" 

her mom looked at the ball and noticed that it had a thick layer of dirt on it. "your ball is dirty, lily. let's wash it," her mom said. 

they washed the rubber ball with soap and water. after that, lily noticed that her ball was bouncy again. she was so happy and thanked her mom. "thank you, mommy. my ball is bouncy again!" she said. 

from that day on, lily made sure to keep her rubber ball clean so that it would always be bouncy.

one day, a kind man named tom lost his wallet. he looked for it everywhere, but he could not find it. tom was very sad because the wallet had all his money and a picture of his family.

a little girl named lisa found the wallet on the ground. she opened it and saw the picture of tom's family. lisa recognized tom because he was her friend's dad. she knew she had to give the wallet back to him.

lisa went to tom's house with the wallet. when tom saw lisa, he was very happy. he thanked lisa for being so kind and giving his wallet back. tom and lisa became good friends, and they played together every day.

once there was a busy family. they had a big freezer filled with ice cream. it was the favorite snack of the family.

one day, the family heard a loud noise. it was coming from the freezer. they opened it and saw that the freezer had split open! all the ice cream had melted and was on the floor.

the family was very sad. their favorite snack was gone.

they quickly went to the store and bought a new freezer. this one was bigger and better. they filled it with new ice cream and it was ready to eat.

the family was happy again. they enjoyed eating the ice cream from the new freezer. and they learned to be more careful with their snack!

mama and her little one were in a bakery shop. the little one saw a big and sexy pie. his eyes shone and suddenly his mouth also watered. he asked his mama: "can i get the pie, please?" his mama shook her head and said: "no, little one, you can't get the pie today." 

the little one was so upset. he begged and pleaded but mama said he could not get the pie. suddenly, the mama noticed people were looking at her and her little one with curiosity. she became embarrassed. 

she grabbed the little one tightly and dragged him away from the shop. the little one kept shouting and crying. mama said sternly: "no more pie for you, little one." 

the little one was so disappointed - he had been looking forward to tasting the delicious pie. he felt so embarrassed that he had to shout and cry in front of everyone.

sara loved to cook with her mom. they would make yummy things like cookies, soup, and pizza. sara liked to help mom stir, pour, and cut. she also liked to look at the images in the cookbooks. they showed her what the food would look like when it was done.

one day, mom was very busy. she had to work on her computer and talk on the phone. she told sara to play by herself for a while. sara was bored. she wanted to cook something. she remembered the cookbook on the shelf. she took it down and opened it. she saw an image of a cake. it looked so good. she wanted to make it.

she went to the kitchen and found the ingredients. she did not know how much to use, but she tried to copy the image. she put flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and milk in a big bowl. she stirred them with a spoon. she did not have a cake pan, so she used a pie dish. she poured the batter in the dish and put it in the oven. she did not know how to set the timer, so she guessed. she waited for the cake to bake.

she heard mom finish her phone call. she ran to the living room to tell her the surprise. "mom, mom, i made a cake for you!" she said. mom looked surprised and happy. she followed sara to the kitchen. she smelled something burning. she opened the oven and saw a black, gooey mess. the pie dish was cracked and the batter was overflowing. smoke filled the air. mom turned off the oven and took out the dish. she coughed and waved her hand.

"oh, sara, what have you done?" mom said. she was not happy. she was angry and sad. sara felt bad. she wanted to make mom smile, not frown. she wanted to give her a yummy cake, not a nasty one. she started to cry. she was miserable. she hugged mom and said, "i'm sorry, mom. i wanted to cook with you. i wanted to make you happy." mom sighed and hugged her back. she said, "i know, sara. i know. but you can't cook by yourself. it's dangerous and messy. you have to wait for me to help you. cooking is fun, but only when we do it together." sara nodded and wiped her tears. she said, "okay, mom. i'm sorry. can we cook something else later?" mom smiled and said, "yes, sara. we can. but first, let's clean up this mess." they took the dish to the sink and threw away the burnt cake. they washed their hands and faces. they looked at each other and laughed. they were not miserable anymore. they were happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a big building with her mommy and daddy. one day, lily and her family went into the elevator to go up to their apartment. the elevator was big and shiny.

suddenly, the elevator stopped and the lights went out. lily was scared and her mommy and daddy looked serious. but then, the lights came back on and the elevator started moving again. when they got to their floor, lily's mommy and daddy surprised her with a big hug and a kiss. lily felt happy and safe again. from that day on, she loved riding in the elevator with her family.

it was time for dinner and mommy was in the kitchen. little sam ran around the house and saw a ball on the floor. he picked up the ball and made a motion to his brother nathan.

"let's play ball!" sam said.

nathan shook his head and said, "no, not now. we need to eat dinner."

sam was worried and asked nathan why they couldn't play.

nathan smiled and said, "it's almost dinner time and mommy is waiting for us. we can play after dinner."

sam smiled and said, "okay!"

so, the two brothers quickly got ready for dinner, and soon enough they were sitting at the table with mommy. after dinner, nathan and sam went back to the living room where the ball was and started to play a game. they laughed and enjoyed themselves until it was time to go to bed. 

nathan and sam thanked their mommy for dinner and she gave them a big hug. 

she smiled and said, "it's time for bed now!"

the boys said goodnight and went to bed. 

they were happy and satisfied and the night ended with smiles on their faces.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved airplanes and rockets. he always dreamed of flying high in the sky.

one day, timmy found a missile in his backyard! he was very scared and didn't know what to do. he went to his mommy and said, "mommy, i found a big rocket in the backyard. i'm scared."

mommy said, "don't worry, timmy. i will manage it. we will call the police and they will take care of it." timmy felt happy that his mommy was there to help him. 

the police came and took the missile away. timmy was very happy that everything was okay. he hugged his mommy and said, "thank you, mommy. you always make me feel safe."

lily and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they find a big net in the grass. they think it is funny.

"look, ben, a net!" lily says. "what can we do with it?"

"maybe we can catch something," ben says. "like a bird or a bug."

they run around with the net. they try to catch a bird, but the bird flies away. they try to catch a bug, but the bug is too fast. they are not happy.

"let's mail the net to someone else," lily says. "maybe they can have fun with it."

"good idea," ben says. "but who can we mail it to?"

they think hard. they remember their teacher, miss lee. she is nice and kind. she always helps them learn new things.

"let's mail the net to miss lee," lily says. "she likes animals. maybe she can use the net to help them."

"ok," ben says. "but how do we mail it?"

they look around. they see a big box near the trash can. they put the net in the box. they write "to miss lee" on the box. they carry the box to the mailman.

"hello, kids," the mailman says. "what do you have there?"

"we have a net for miss lee," lily says. "can you mail it to her?"

"sure, i can," the mailman says. "but why do you want to mail a net to her?"

"because she likes animals," ben says. "and we want to make her happy."

the mailman smiles. he takes the box. he puts it in his truck. he drives away.

lily and ben wave goodbye. they feel good. they have done something nice for their teacher.

the moral of the story is: it is better to share than to be greedy. you can make someone happy by giving them something they like.

anna wanted to try something new. she decided to try a carrot. it was crunchy and orange. 

mum brought a regular carrot from the supermarket. anna watched as mum peeled off the green skin. she wanted to try it. 

mum gave anna a small piece of the carrot. it looked funny, but anna put it in her mouth and tried it. 

it tasted so good! anna didn't know why she hadn't tried a carrot before. she finished her piece and asked mum for another one. 

mum got a bigger piece of carrot this time. anna liked it even more than the last one. now, anna made sure to eat carrots every day.

once upon a time there were two friends, bill and jill. bill had something that he was excited to show jill. he said to her, "i have something you will like, come and see!" jill followed him and saw a big pot filled with beans. she said, "what are those?" bill said, "they are spicy beans, try one!" jill tried one, and it was delicious. she said, "this tastes great! what do you call it?" bill said, "i call it spicy bean surprise!" jill said, "that's a funny name, do you have more?" bill smiled and said, "yes, i have lots more, let's eat!" they both ate the spicy beans and had a great time. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to look at the stars in the sky at night. he would spend hours outside, staring up at the twinkling stars. but one night, it was very gloomy outside and timmy couldn't see any stars. he was very sad and went to bed feeling disappointed. 

the next day, timmy decided to ask his mommy if they could spend the day together looking for stars. his mommy said yes and they went on a fun adventure to find stars. they looked in books, on the internet, and even went to a planetarium. finally, at night, they went outside and saw a beautiful star shining brightly in the sky. timmy was so happy and thanked his mommy for helping him find the star. they spent the rest of the night looking at the star and talking about how amazing it was. from that day on, timmy knew that even on gloomy nights, there was always a star shining somewhere.

once upon a time there was a little bunny. she was very cute with soft pink ears and sparkly eyes. the bunny was hopping in the garden and she heard something. she stopped and listened to the sound. it was coming from the ground!

she looked down and saw a spade. it was digging in the soil and it made a noise. the bunny hopped closer and closer to the spade. she leaned down to look at it more closely. 

the bunny thought the spade was very cool and she wanted it to be her friend. she hopped over to it and started to say hello. she said hi and the spade said nothing back. 

suddenly the bunny remembered that the spade was not alive. she giggled and then hopped away into the sunshine. she made sure to listen carefully to other sounds in the garden and to have a lot of fun.

once upon a time there was a grumpy cat called tom. tom loved having fun but he didn't want to share his favourite things.

one day, tom heard about a fabulous new place. it was a magical shop full of exciting things. tom rushed to the shop and spotted a beautiful bottle of ink. tom quickly grabbed it and ran home.

tom was so excited to try the ink, but he realised he didn't have anything to try it on. so he popped back to the shop to ask the shopkeeper for help. the shopkeeper told him he should use some paper.

tom was so pleased and thanked the shopkeeper. he raced home, grabbed some paper and tried the magical ink. as he used it, the ink created beautiful pictures and he couldn't stop using it.

tom loved it so much he started to recommend it to all his friends so they could enjoy it too. everyone agreed it was the best ink they had ever used, and they wanted to use it all the time.

tom was very proud of himself. he had made a great discovery and shared it with everyone.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who really liked to take care of her garden. every day she would go out to water it and use the hose. she loved new plants and would buy them from the store. one day, the girl bought a special plant which was supposed to grow very easily.

the little girl was excited and wanted to take special care of it. she worked hard and kept giving it lots of water with the hose. but no matter how much she watered the plant, it wouldn't yield. she felt so sad and tried even harder.

but after a few weeks, the girl realized it was no use. the plant was dead. she felt so sad and discouraged and cried. the easy plant was not so easy after all.

mummy was not happy when she saw the kitchen floor. it was very messy. she said to little johnny, "little johnny, please wipe the kitchen floor." little johnny did not want to do it but he knew that he must. 

he looked in the cupboard and found a newspaper. he unfolded it and started to wipe the floor. little johnny was almost ready when he heard a strange sound. he had ripped the newspaper.

mummy was angry. she said, "little johnny, how can i trust you to do anything now?" little johnny was sad and he ran out of the kitchen and into his bedroom. mummy did not follow him and she finished the wiping herself.  little johnny had not been very careful, and the kitchen was not clean.

sara and ben were playing in the farm. they liked to see the animals and feed them. they saw a big mule in a pen. the mule had long ears and a brown coat.

"can we pet the mule?" sara asked.

"i don't know. maybe he is nice," ben said.

they went closer to the pen. the mule looked at them and made a loud noise. he sounded angry.

"hello, mule. we are your friends. don't be scared," sara said.

she reached out her hand to touch the mule's nose. the mule did not like that. he moved his head and poked sara with his teeth. sara cried out and pulled back her hand. it hurt a lot.

"ow, ow, ow! the mule bit me!" sara said.

ben ran to sara and hugged her. he was scared too.

"are you okay, sara? let me see your hand," ben said.

he saw a red mark on sara's hand. he was sorry for sara.

"i'm sorry, sara. the mule was mean. he should not poke you," ben said.

he took sara to the farmer. the farmer saw sara's hand and gave her a bandage. he also gave her a hug and a cookie.

"i'm sorry, sara. the mule is old and grumpy. he does not like strangers. you should not pet him. he might poke you again," the farmer said.

sara nodded. she felt better. she thanked the farmer and ben.

"thank you, farmer. thank you, ben. you are nice. the mule is not nice. i don't like him," sara said.

they went to see the other animals. they saw a cow, a pig, a sheep, and a chicken. they were nice and did not poke them. sara and ben had fun in the farm. they learned to be careful with the mule.

lily did not like cauliflower. she thought it was white and boring and smelled bad. she always pushed it away when her mom gave it to her on her plate. one day, her mom said, "lily, you have to eat your cauliflower. it is good for you. it makes you strong and healthy. and it is not boring. you can pretend it is a cloud or a flower or a snowman."

lily did not listen. she said, "no, mom. i don't want cauliflower. i want cookies. cookies are yummy and sweet and fun. they make me happy."

her mom said, "lily, you can have one cookie after you finish your cauliflower. but you have to eat your vegetables first. that is the rule."

lily did not like the rule. she was angry and stubborn. she said, "no, mom. i want cookies now. i don't care about the rule."

her mom said, "lily, if you don't eat your cauliflower, you will not get any cookies. and you will go to bed early. and you will miss your favorite show. is that what you want?"

lily did not think. she said, "yes, mom. i don't care about anything. i just want cookies."

her mom said, "okay, lily. you made your choice. but i think you will regret it later."

lily did not believe her. she said, "no, mom. i will not regret it. i will be happy with my cookies."

her mom sighed and took away her plate. she gave her one cookie and said, "good night, lily. i hope you enjoy your cookie."

lily ate her cookie. it was yummy and sweet and fun. she smiled and said, "see, mom. i told you. i don't need cauliflower. i have cookies."

but soon, lily felt sick. her tummy hurt and she felt thirsty. she wanted some water and some milk. she wanted her mom to hug her and kiss her. she wanted to watch her favorite show and play with her toys. she wanted to say sorry to her mom and eat her cauliflower. she realized she was wrong. she realized she was silly. she realized she was anxious. she realized she regretted her choice.

but it was too late. her mom was busy and did not hear her. her show was over and her toys were away. her cookie was gone and her plate was empty. she had nothing but her bed and her pillow. she cried and cried and cried. she wished she had listened to her mom. she wished she had eaten her cauliflower. she wished she had been a good girl.

the moral of the story is: listen to your mom and eat your vegetables. they are good for you and they are not boring. they can help you avoid being sick and being anxious. they can help you enjoy your cookies and your show and your toys. they can help you be happy and not regret your choices.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named mia. mia wanted to go on a journey. she asked her mom, "can i go find something new?" her mom said, "yes, but be back before dark."

mia walked and walked. she saw a big tree. she was upset because she could not climb it. then, she saw a small hill. she went up the hill and discovered a pretty flower. she was happy.

but then, the sky got dark. mia was scared. she tried to go back home, but she was lost. she called out, "mom! help me!" but her mom could not hear her. mia stayed lost and sad. the end.

once there was a little boy called jack. he was 3 years old and very curious. he wanted to learn all he could.

one day, his mum told him he should be careful. but he was feeling brave and he decided to dare to do something new. he went exploring in the big old wood behind his house. 

jack wandered around the wood and found a big tree. sitting at the top of the tree was a little bird. the bird called down to him and said, "hello jack! would you like me to teach you something special?" 

jack was excited and said, "yes please!" so the bird taught him how to fly. jack was very careful and he listened to all the bird's instructions. 

the bird also warned jack to be careful when flying because other animals in the wood might be careless and not look out for him. so jack flew carefully until he found his way back home. 

he had a wonderful time and never forgot what the bird had taught him.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy's dad bought a new gun. timmy loved playing with his dad's old toys but he didn't like the new gun. 

one day, timmy's dad left the new gun on the table. timmy wanted to play with it but he knew it was dangerous. he asked his dad if he could play with the gun but his dad didn't permit him to. 

timmy was sad but he knew that his dad was right. guns are not toys and they can hurt people. timmy promised himself that he would never touch a gun and he would always listen to his dad.

one day, ben and lily went to the park with their mom. they saw a big open field with many flowers and trees. they also saw some rabbits hopping around and eating grass. ben and lily loved rabbits. they wanted to pet them and play with them.

"mom, can we go see the rabbits?" ben asked.

"sure, but be gentle and quiet. rabbits are shy and scared of loud noises," mom said.

ben and lily nodded and ran to the field. they saw a brown rabbit with long ears and a fluffy tail. it looked very soft and cute. ben and lily walked slowly and carefully towards the rabbit. they reached out their hands to touch it.

but the rabbit did not like that. it saw ben and lily and felt afraid. it thought they wanted to hurt it or catch it. it did not want to be touched or played with. it wanted to be free and safe. so the rabbit did something that surprised ben and lily. it screamed.

the rabbit screamed very loud and high. it sounded like a whistle or a siren. ben and lily were shocked and scared. they did not know rabbits could scream. they jumped back and covered their ears. they looked at the rabbit with wide eyes.

"mom, the rabbit screamed!" lily cried.

"shh, it's okay. the rabbit was just scared. it was trying to warn you and the other rabbits. it's a way of saying 'leave me alone'," mom explained.

"really? i'm sorry, rabbit. i didn't mean to scare you. i just wanted to be your friend," ben said.

the rabbit heard ben and lily. it saw that they were not mean or bad. they were just curious and friendly. it felt a little sorry for screaming. it stopped screaming and looked at ben and lily. it twitched its nose and wiggled its ears. it was a way of saying 'it's okay'.

ben and lily smiled and waved at the rabbit. they understood that the rabbit wanted to be left alone. they respected that. they decided to watch the rabbit from a distance. they saw it hop and nibble and play with the other rabbits. they thought it was very happy and cute.

"mom, can we come back to the park and see the rabbits again?" lily asked.

"sure, but remember to be gentle and quiet. rabbits are shy and scared of loud noises," mom said.

ben and lily nodded and hugged their mom. they learned something new and had fun. they loved the park and the rabbits. they hoped the rabbits liked them too.

once upon a time there was a dry barn. every day, a special mailman came by with packages for the barn. he always wore a big hat and had a friendly smile.

one day, the mailman had a very special package for the barn. it was a surprise for everyone in the barn! all the animals were so excited to see what it was.

the mailman carefully opened the box and out popped a funny looking cat! all the animals squealed with delight. the cat was orange and white and had bright green eyes.

the mailman gave the cat a big hug, thanked the animals for having him, and then left in a hurry. from that day forward, the cat lived at the dry barn and brought joy to all the animals.

tim and his daddy were in the bedroom. tim saw something on his daddy's bed that he hadn't seen before: a hanger. tim asked his daddy what it was.

"it's a hanger," his daddy said. "it's used to hang up clothes." 

tim was excited. he saw his daddy take out a screwdriver and then watched as his daddy tried to fix the hanger.

after a few minutes, his daddy got frustrated and stopped. he put the screwdriver down and growled.

"what happened, daddy?" tim asked.

"my screwdriver isn't big enough to fix it," his daddy replied. "i need to get a bigger one." 

tim was disappointed that the hanger wasn't fixed, but he was grateful that he had learned something new.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tom. tom was a kind and happy little boy. one day, tom was playing in his room when he heard a loud noise outside. he opened his window and saw a hairy fire burning. tom was scared and he started to panic. the fire was getting bigger and moving closer to his house!

tom quickly ran downstairs and shouted to his father, â€œdaddy, thereâ€™s a hairy fire outside!â€ tomâ€™s father rushed outside to see what was happening. he shouted, â€œeveryone stay inside! i need to get help!â€

tomâ€™s father ran to call the fire brigade. the firefighters came quickly and used big hoses to put out the fire. they also gave tom a big hug and praised him for telling his dad.

tomâ€™s father sighed with relief and thanked the firefighters. tom and his father hugged each other and went back inside. tom was so excited that he wasnâ€™t scared anymore. from then on, tom was brave and never panicked again. the end.

lily and max liked to play in the park. they had a big box that they used as a castle. they painted it purple, because it was their favorite color. they put a flag on top of the castle, and pretended to be king and queen.

one day, a boy named ben came to the park. he saw the purple castle and wanted to play with it. he ran to the box and tried to open it. lily and max were inside the castle. they did not like ben. he was mean and loud.

"go away!" lily shouted. "this is our castle. you can't play with it."

"yes, i can!" ben said. "i want to be the king. you have to yield to me."

"no, we don't!" max said. "you are not the king. you are a bad knight. we will not yield to you."

ben got angry. he pushed the box and made it fall. lily and max fell out of the castle. they were scared and sad. their purple castle was broken.

a lady who worked at the park saw what happened. she came to help lily and max. she scolded ben and told him to say sorry. ben did not want to say sorry, but he had to. he did not like the lady. he ran away.

the lady helped lily and max to fix their castle. she gave them some tape and glue and stickers. she said they were very brave and kind. she said they could play with the castle as long as they wanted.

lily and max thanked the lady. they hugged each other. they were happy again. they went back to their purple castle and played. they did not see ben again. they did not care. they had each other. they were the best king and queen.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who really wanted to help her mom with the cooking. she asked her mom if she could help her, and her mom said yes. she said to the little girl, "you can lend me a teaspoon!" so, the little girl went to the kitchen cupboard and found a regular teaspoon. she brought it to her mom and said, "here is the teaspoon you wanted!" her mom thanked her for her help and gave her a big smile. the little girl was so proud of herself for lending her mom the teaspoon, and she knew she had been a big help.

in the morning, the sun shone brightly and wake woke up very early. he yawned and rubbed his eyes. he felt so restless!

wake got up and looked around. he saw the bowl of beans on the table and smiled. he quickly hopped out of bed and grabbed the bowl.

wake looked at the beans and decided to try one. he took a red bean and popped it into his mouth. "mmmmm," he said, smiling. he was so happy that he decided to try another.

wake's mom saw him eating the beans, and said, "no more beans, wake. they will make you too restless!" wake looked disappointed, but he did as his mom asked. he put the bowl back on the table and looked for something else to do.

once there was a wise old man who loved to watch the sunrise each morning. one morning, he decided to mix something special for his breakfast. he got out his bowl and carefully put two eggs in it. then he added some milk, sugar, and spices. he stirred the mixture with a spoon and smiled. 

just then his little granddaughter ran into the kitchen. "what's that, grandpa?" she asked, pointing at the bowl. 

"it's a special breakfast mix," the old man said. he carefully spooned some of the mix onto a plate and handed it to her. 

the little girl took a big bite and smiled. "mmmm! this is yummy! i love your special sunrise mix!" 

the old man smiled, too. he was happy that he'd been able to share his special breakfast mix with his granddaughter.

one day, a little boy named tim went to the park. he saw an amazing big red ball. tim was so happy! he wanted to play with the ball. but he had a worry. he did not know if the ball had an owner. 

tim saw a girl named sue. he asked her, "do you know who has this ball?" sue said, "i do not know. but you can play with it if you want." tim and sue played with the ball. they had a lot of fun. they did not worry about the owner.

then, a big dog came. the dog was not nice. it took the amazing red ball from tim and sue. the dog bit the ball. the ball was not amazing anymore. it was broken. tim and sue were sad. they should have worried about the owner.

tim and kim were twins who liked to play in the woods. they saw a big pile of lumber that someone left there. they wanted to build a fort with the lumber.

they took some lumber and carried it to a spot under a tree. they tried to stack the lumber to make walls, but it was too heavy and hard. they got tired and frustrated.

then they saw a bird on a branch. the bird was singing a pretty song. tim and kim listened to the bird. they liked the song. they tried to repeat the song, but they could not. they asked the bird to teach them.

the bird was happy to help. he sang the song slowly and clearly. he showed them how to make the sounds with their mouths. tim and kim followed the bird. they repeated the song over and over until they learned it.

they thanked the bird and sang the song together. they felt happy and proud. they forgot about the lumber and the fort. they realized that they did not need to build anything to have fun. they just needed to enjoy the nature and the music.

the moral of the story is: sometimes the simplest things can make us happy. we can learn from the animals and the plants. we do not need to take what is not ours. we can share and be kind.

one night, a mom was cooking dinner. suddenly in the window she saw something. it was a big, black spider! she was very scared. 

"what should i do?" she wondered aloud.

then her three year old son, jimmy, ran in. he saw the spider and pointed. "there's a spider!" he said.

"don't touch it, jimmy," warned mom. "spiders can be dangerous."

but jimmy reached out and grabbed the spider.

"jimmy, no!" shouted mom.

but it was too late. mom carefully took the spider outside and returned to finish dinner.

"that was very brave of you, jimmy," said mom. "but it was also very dangerous. please don't do it again."

jimmy smiled. "i won't," he said.

mom smiled too, glad the danger was gone. time for dinner.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to climb trees and play with her toys. one day, her mommy took her to the theater to watch a show.

lily was very excited and couldn't wait to see the show. when they got there, they sat down in their seats and waited for the show to start. suddenly, a nosy boy behind them started to talk loudly and disturb everyone.

lily's mommy asked the boy to be quiet, but he didn't listen. lily got very upset and wanted to climb on stage to tell the boy to be quiet. but she couldn't because it was not allowed.

sadly, the show was ruined by the nosy boy and lily didn't enjoy it. she went home feeling sad and disappointed. the end.
