once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she wore a pretty apron when she helped her mommy bake cookies. she was excited to mix the flour and sugar together. lily wondered how the cookies would taste when they were done baking. she watched them in the oven and waited patiently. finally, the cookies were ready! lily and her mommy ate them all up and they were delicious.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the garden, especially when it was sunny. one day, she saw a fairy sitting on a flower. the fairy had pretty wings and a shiny dress.

lily was surprised to see the fairy. she asked, "who are you?" the fairy replied, "i'm a fairy. i live in the garden." lily wanted to know more about fairies, so she asked the fairy to explain. the fairy said, "fairies are magical creatures. we make flowers grow and spread joy."

lily was happy to learn about fairies. she said, "i hope i can see you again." the fairy replied, "if you ever need me, just call my name and i will come." lily waved goodbye to the fairy and went inside. she told her mom about the fairy and how clear her wings were.

mia and leo were playing in the snow. they made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. they wanted to give him gloves, but they only had one glove. they looked for another glove, but they could not find it.

"where is the other glove?" mia asked leo.

"i don't know. maybe we lost it," leo said.

they were sad. they wanted their snowman to have two gloves, not one. they looked at the snowman. he looked cold and lonely.

then they heard a voice. it came from the snowman.

"hello, mia and leo. thank you for making me. i like your hat and scarf. and i like your glove. it is very unusual."

mia and leo were surprised. they looked at each other. they looked at the snowman. he had a smile on his face.

"did you talk?" mia asked the snowman.

"yes, i did. i can talk because you gave me a magic glove. it is not a normal glove. it is a glove that makes snowmen talk. do you want to hear a secret?"

mia and leo nodded. they were curious.

"i can also count. do you want to count with me?"

mia and leo nodded again. they liked to count.

"okay, let's count. one, two, three, four, five. how many fingers do i have on my glove?"

mia and leo looked at the glove. it had five fingers.

"five!" they said together.

"very good. you are smart. now, how many gloves do i have?"

mia and leo looked at the snowman. he had one glove.

"one!" they said together.

"very good. you are right. i have one glove. but i don't mind. i don't need two gloves. i have you. you are my friends. and friends are better than gloves."

mia and leo smiled. they hugged the snowman. they were happy. they had a talking snowman. and he had a magic glove. it was a very unusual day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw with her crayons and make colorful pictures. one day, she went to the store with her mommy to buy more crayons. 

as they walked through the store, lily saw a big bucket of colorful paint. she wanted to buy it so she could make even more pretty pictures. but her mommy said no because the paint was wet and it might make a mess.

lily was sad, but then she saw a pack of new crayons that she could buy instead. she was happy again and couldn't wait to go home and color with them. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. one day, as he was walking by the river, he found a penguin. the penguin looked very sad and lost.

timmy felt sorry for the poor penguin and decided to take him home. he made a cozy bed for the penguin and gave him some fish to eat. the penguin was very grateful and happy to have a new friend.

but as the days went by, timmy noticed that the penguin was not doing well. he was not eating or playing anymore. timmy tried to make him feel better, but nothing seemed to work.

one day, timmy woke up to find that the poor penguin had passed away in his sleep. timmy was very sad and missed his friend very much. he learned that sometimes, even when we try our best to help, things don't always turn out the way we want them to.

it was a cool day. john went to the park. he grabbed a flag and waved it around. he laughed as he spun in circles, twisting the flag behind him. the flag flew through the air, catching the cool breeze. as he twisted and turned, the colors of the flag looked like they were spinning with him. john smiled from ear to ear. he was having so much fun! then, he decided to take a break and lay in the grass. he looked up and saw the flag still spinning in the sky. he thought it looked so cool! he closed his eyes and felt the sun and wind on his face. what a wonderful day to be outside.

once upon a time, there was a man who wanted everything to be perfect. so he polished and polished every day. he polished his clothes and his shoes, and even the doorknobs. but one day, the man made a terrible mistake. instead of polishing only his things, he tried to polish his friend. he scratched and scrubbed, but soon realized that his friend was not an object!

the man was very sad. he knew he had done something wrong. all his friends felt terrible. the man realized that some things can't be polished, no matter how hard he tries. he learned an important lesson that day - you can't change people, and it's wrong to try.

one day, there was a harsh mark on the floor. a little girl saw the mark and wanted to close it. she grabbed her toy hammer and pounded the mark. she pounded and pounded until the mark was gone.

the girl was happy, but then she heard a loud voice. it was her father. he asked her why she had made a harsh mark on the floor. the little girl explained how she had only been trying to close the mark.

her father was very impressed with her clever idea. he said that next time, she should use a proper tool instead. but he said he was proud of her.

the little girl felt so happy. she ran off to play with her hammer, feeling happy that she had managed to close the harsh mark.

one day, it started to rain. a little girl named sue went outside to play. she wore a big red coat and yellow boots. sue loved to splash in the puddles. she jumped in one puddle, two puddles, three puddles, and more!

sue saw a cat under a tree. the cat was wet and looked sad. sue wanted to help the cat. she took off her coat and put it on the cat. the cat was happy and warm. but now, sue was wet and cold. she felt embarrassed.

sue's mom saw her from the window. she came outside with a big umbrella. sue, her mom, and the cat went inside. they all sat by the fire to get warm and dry. sue was happy she helped the cat, even if she was embarrassed at first.

mimi was a brave little girl. one day, she set off to explore the world around her. she went through a forest and then slowly made her way to a mountain.

as mimi got closer to the mountain, she started to feel something strange. as if there was danger in the air. she stopped for a moment, her heart beating faster than usual.

suddenly, mimi heard a loud voice. "to reach the other side, you'll have to balance across this step!"

mimi came around a corner and saw an old man on the other side of a large, wooden step. he gestured for her to come closer.

mimi carefully stepped onto the step, her heart beating even faster. as if it was warning her of something. but she wanted to cross the mountain, so she took a deep breath and started to balance across the step.

with each step, the old man shouted instructions. â€œslowlyâ€¦ balanceâ€¦ take a deep breath.â€ mimi tried her best, but still felt a bit scared of what might happen if she made a mistake.

in the end, she made it to the other side of the step. but the old man didn't smile. on the contrary, his face was expressionless.

once upon a time, there was a bird. the bird was very sad because it was having a bad day. its wings were tired from flying and it was not happy. 

the bird flew around the sky, looking for somebody to help it feel better. finally it found a friend, a rabbit. the rabbit suggested that the bird find somewhere nice to take a break. 

the bird thanked the rabbit and flew to a nearby tree. there it rested and felt better. the bird also sang a happy song that made all the other animals smile. 

the bird flew away, feeling much better. it waved goodbye to its friend, the rabbit, and they were both happy. the bad day was over.

one day, a young penguin looked around. he was looking for something. he knew that if he could gather enough things, he could find it. he ran around and started to gather anything he could find â€” rocks, stones, sticks â€” but none of it was what he was looking for.

suddenly, he heard a noise behind him. he turned around and saw another young penguin. â€œwhat are you gathering?â€ the other penguin asked. the first penguin smiled and said that he was gathering things to find what he wanted.

the other penguin smiled and gestured for the first penguin to follow him. together they waddled off to find what the first penguin was looking for. they looked around and eventually, they saw it. it was bigger than anything they had ever seen. the two young penguins cheered in excitement. they had found it! 

the first penguin was relieved and thankful to his new friend. without him, he would still be looking for what he wanted without success. together they had gathered enough things to find what they wanted and now they both could have it.

once upon a time there was a happy little boy named bob. he had plenty of toys to play with and he was always eager to have fun.
one day he wanted to go outside, so he quickly rushed over to the door. he opened it and outside he saw a tall, green tree. its branches had loads of delicious peaches and it made bob's tummy rumble.

bob was so eager to get his hands on one of the peaches that he jumped up and down in excitement. but then he heard a voice.

"be careful, bob!" it said. bob looked around and he saw his grandma standing at the door. "there are lots of ants around the tree and you don't want them to rush up your arms!"

bob quickly stepped away from the tree and smiled shyly. he was a bit scared of the ants, so he carefully tiptoed away.

but bob still wanted to grab a peach. so he went back to the tree and grabbed one with his hands. the peach was so juicy and sweet that bob quickly gobbled it up with a smile on his face.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named anna. she wanted to play so she asked her big brother for ideas. her big brother said, "i have a great game we can play. i'll invite my friends over and we can all play with the large rope." anna was excited and quickly ran and got the rope! 

when all the friends arrived, they were so excited to see the large rope! they couldn't wait to play. anna's brother said, "let's start a game of tug of war!" and the children all cheered. 

anna's brother made two teams of equal numbers and the children had so much fun. but soon anna's team was losing! anna's brother called out, "come on, anna, we need you to help us win!" 

anna gritted her teeth and pulled with all her strength until her team won! everyone cheered and anna smiled wide. it was the best game ever!

once upon a time there was a kitty. she was a modern kitty and she liked to explore. one day she went to explore a shiny red door. she wanted to go in, but it was closed shut.

so she sat down and started to rub her paw against the door. suddenly, the door opened! the kitty was so excited! she meowed and peeked inside the room. it was full of modern toys and the kitty had so much fun!

she played all day in the room. whenever she got tired, she would take a nap and rub her paw against the red door. the kitty was so happy! she stayed there until it was dark outside. then she went home and cuddled up in her cozy bed.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. today was her birthday, and she was very excited. she wanted to invite all her friends to her party. so, she went to her mom and asked her to help her make some invitations.

"mom, can you help me make some invitations for my friends?" asked lily politely.

"sure, i can help you, but don't forget to remind your friends about the party," replied her mom.

lily was happy and started to make the invitations. she wrote all the details about the party and gave them to her friends. but one of her friends forgot about the party. lily was sad because she wanted all her friends to come to her party. she then remembered what her mom said and politely reminded her friend about the party. her friend was happy and came to the party. they all had a great time and ate lots of cake. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called ella. ella was very excited when she heard her mommy say it was time to mix something unique. 

ella and her mommy went out to the garden and got a big bowl. they took a few ingredients from the kitchen and put them in the bowl. then, mommy said with a smile, "now, ella, let's mix it very slowly until all the ingredients are combined."

ella was amazed how quickly the ingredients became something special. she looked at the bowl and asked, "what is it mommy?"

mommy laughed and said, "it's a surprise! we are going to put it in the drain so it can cool off." 

ella watched carefully as mommy put the bowl in the drain. she waited patiently until mommy said it was time to see their unique surprise. 

ella and mommy opened the drain and they saw that they had made a delicious cake! that day, ella learned it was fun to mix and create something unique.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved dessert, especially chocolate cake. one day, timmy's mom made him a big slice of chocolate cake. timmy was so happy and he ate it all up.

after he finished his cake, timmy went outside to play. he saw his dog, max, and wanted to show him how fast he could run. but when he looked down, he saw that his shoes were filthy. timmy's mom had told him to always clean his shoes before going outside, but he forgot.

timmy didn't want to show his dirty shoes to max, so he went back inside to clean them. when he was done, he went back outside and showed max how fast he could run. max was so proud of timmy, and timmy was happy to have a clean pair of shoes. and he couldn't wait for his next slice of chocolate cake!

the sun was shining high in the sky and the grass was green and full of flowers. on this day, little john wanted to explore the woods.

he grabbed his hat and began walking down a long and winding path. suddenly the sky darkened and it began to rain. it was an enormous downpour!

little john was soaked and decided to surrender. he ran back to his house and grabbed an umbrella.

he opened it up and stepped out into the rain. little john enjoyed the rain and continued to explore the woods.

suddenly he noticed a bright rainbow peeking through the trees. he smiled and kept walking until he reached the end of the woods.

the sun was shining again and little john was safe and dry. he was happy that he had the courage to surrender to the rain and enjoy the enormous beauty of the rainbow!

once upon a time, there was a young girl named lily who loved to explore the jungle. one day, she met a crocodile who was very big and green. lily was scared at first, but the crocodile was friendly and they became friends.

"i like your shiny scales," said lily.

"thank you, i like your pretty dress," replied the crocodile.

as they walked together, the crocodile told lily about his life in the river. he explained how he used to be small but he had become big and strong over time.

lily was amazed by the crocodile's story and they continued to explore the jungle together, enjoying each other's company. from that day on, they were the best of friends and went on many adventures together.

once upon a time there was a little boy. he was walking in the park with his mom. they stopped to look at a big tree. the tree had a trunk that was very big and very dirty. the little boy wondered why the trunk was so dirty.

his mom saw his face and said, "that trunk has been dirty for quite a while. i remember when it was clean. maybe you can help make it cleaner."

the little boy said, "yes, let's do it!" so he and his mom began to clean the trunk. they stopped when the trunk was clean. the little boy smiled and said, "look how much better the trunk looks now that it's clean!" 

his mom said, "yes, i'm proud of you for helping to clean it." then they hugged and went on their way. the little boy was glad that he was able to help make the trunk look better.

once upon a time, there was a modest ghost called jenny. she was kind and always thought of others before herself.
one day, jenny had an important meeting to attend. she was so excited and spent a long time getting ready for it. but when it was time to leave, she forgot her bag! 
jenny was very sad. without her bag, she couldn't go to the meeting. 
then a funny thing happened - a little fairy flittered by and said, "don't worry, i will help you!" the fairy waved her wand and jenny's bag floated all the way to her. 
jenny was so happy and thanked the fairy for her kind help. she never forgot that moment and always thought it was so special. 
the end.

once upon a time, there was a little car named red. red had four wheels that helped him go really fast. but one day, red's wheels started to struggle and he couldn't go very far. 

red felt sad because he couldn't go on adventures anymore. his friend blue saw that red was not feeling comfortable and wanted to help. blue asked red what was wrong and red told him about his struggling wheels. 

blue had an idea! he knew someone who could fix red's wheels. they went to the mechanic and the mechanic fixed red's wheels. now red was happy again and could go on adventures with his comfortable wheels. the end.

once upon a time, there was a shy green flower. the flower was very lonely, until one day it bloomed! as it bloomed, the petals opened up and the green flower wasn't so lonely anymore.

the flower was happy and proud it had bloomed. it was a beautiful flower, with green petals that waved in the wind. everyone in the garden noticed it and smiled.

the shy green flower saw other flowers blooming and waved to them. now it had lots of friends to talk to. they told the shy green flower lots of stories, and it learnt so much.

the shy green flower stayed in the garden, enjoying its new friends and the sunshine. when winter came, it curled up and went to sleep, until the next spring and the sunshine returned. then it was time to bloom again!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to use her crayons to draw pictures of flowers and animals. one day, she asked her mommy if she could write a poem. 

mommy said, "sure, lily! a poem is like a special story that rhymes. you can use your crayons to draw a picture to go with it."

lily was so excited that she ran to get her crayons and paper. she drew a picture of a bird and wrote a poem about it. 

when she showed it to her mommy, she said, "wow, lily! that's a beautiful poem and drawing. you are very talented."

lily smiled and felt happy. she didn't feel ignorant anymore, because she had made something special with her own hands.

once upon a time, there was a very patient girl called lucy. she loved to create things, and enjoyed playing with her toys. 
one day, lucy wanted to build something that was a bit more challenging. she wanted to make a big castle with a moat and drawbridge.

lucy tried her best to create the castle, but it was hard and it was taking her a long time. after many hours of hard work, she was almost finished building when something unexpected happened. the drawbridge fell down and she was embarrassed!

luckily, she was very patient. she took a deep breath, and started carefully putting the pieces of the castle back together. finally, her castle with a drawbridge was complete.

lucy was proud of herself for never giving up, even when she was embarrassed. she had worked so hard and it was worth it in the end.

tommy loves to play with his trumpet. he likes to make loud noises and pretend he is in a band. but one day, he falls down the stairs and hurts his arm. he cries and cries and his mom takes him to the doctor.

the doctor says tommy has a broken arm and puts a big white thing on it. he says it will help his arm heal and he has to be careful. tommy feels sad and scared. he can't play with his trumpet or his other toys. he misses his band.

every day, tommy asks his mom when his arm will heal. his mom says it will take some time and he has to be patient. she gives him hugs and kisses and reads him stories. she also lets him watch his favorite shows and play with his soft toys. tommy feels a little better, but he still wants his trumpet.

one day, tommy wakes up and sees his mom smiling. she says it is a special day. she takes him to the doctor again and the doctor takes off the big white thing. he says tommy's arm is healed and he can play with his trumpet again. tommy feels happy and excited. he hugs his mom and the doctor and runs to his room.

he picks up his trumpet and blows it as loud as he can. he feels a little anxious, because he hasn't played it for a long time. but he remembers how to make the sounds and he has fun. he calls his mom and says he wants to show her his band. his mom says she is proud of him and she loves him. tommy feels loved and proud too. he plays his trumpet and smiles. he is happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a pale face and was feeling sad. her mom asked her, "what's wrong, lily?" lily replied, "i lost my cell phone." 

her mom said, "don't worry, we will find it together. where did you last mind having it?" lily thought for a moment and said, "i had it when i was playing with my dolls in the living room." 

so, they went to the living room and looked for the cell phone. they checked under the couch, on the table, and even in the toy box. after a while, they found it under the pillow on the sofa. lily was so happy and said, "thank you, mommy! you're the best!" 

her mom smiled and said, "no problem, sweetie. i'm glad we found it." and they hugged each other tightly.

once upon a time, there was a clever girl called sue. sue had lost her sunglasses and she was feeling sad. sue looked everywhere for her special glasses - she looked in her room, the garden and in the park. but, she couldn't find them!

sue went to see her friend, joe. joe was very kind - he said, "maybe i can help you find your sunglasses!"

joe and sue looked all around, in the trees and in the pond. suddenly, sue shouted "look, i found them!" it was so exciting - sue had found her sunglasses.

joe and sue were both so happy. they hugged each other and sue put on her sunglasses. "thank you joe, you are a very clever friend." joe smiled and said, "that's ok, i'm glad we found them."

the end.

molly had a reliable radio. it was a very special radio because it could zip around the house. it was better than a normal radio because everywhere molly went, the radio would come too! everyone thought it was so cool.

every night, molly would take the radio to her room and snuggle up in bed. she would turn it on and spin the dial until finally, just the right song was playing. her days were made better by hearing the radio sing to her.

one day, the radio got loose and started to zip around the room. molly chased the radio, giggling and laughing as it whizzed around the furniture. after a while, she finally caught it and hugged it tightly to her chest.

the radio was such a reliable friend who had been with molly through all of her adventures. she was sure that wherever she went, the radio would follow and make her days brighter.

tom and lily are friends. they live on a farm with many animals. they like to play with the animals and feed them.

one day, they see a big red fox near the chicken coop. the fox looks hungry and sneaky. tom and lily are scared. they want to protect the chickens.

"go away, fox!" tom shouts. "you cannot eat our chickens!"

the fox does not listen. he tries to jump over the fence. lily runs to the barn and gets a broom. she waves the broom at the fox.

"shoo, shoo, fox!" lily says. "you are not welcome here!"

the fox sees the broom and gets scared. he runs away from the farm. tom and lily are happy. they hug each other and the chickens.

"good job, lily!" tom says. "you are very brave!"

"thank you, tom!" lily says. "you are very smart!"

they go back to the house and tell their parents what happened. their parents are proud of them. they give them cookies and milk. tom and lily smile. they love their farm and their animals.

once upon a time, a little birdie fell from its nest. it was so small and helpless. it couldn't fly or even walk. it needed help. 

a kind girl saw the birdie and wanted to help. she picked it up and held it gently in her hands. she whispered to the birdie, "don't worry, i'll take care of you." 

the girl took the birdie home and made a cozy nest for it. she fed it and gave it water. the birdie felt safe and happy. it chirped and sang a sweet song. 

days passed and the birdie grew stronger. it learned to fly and explore the world. the girl was happy to see the birdie grow up. she whispered to it, "you will always be my little friend." and the birdie chirped back, "thank you for helping me."

once upon a time, there was a little bridge over a tiny river. this bridge was very upset because it felt small and unimportant. it saw the big bridges with cars and people and wished it could be like them.

one day, a little bug with wings came to the bridge. the bug was very tired and could not fly. it needed to cross the river, but it was too weak. the little bridge saw the bug and said, "don't worry, i can help you." the bug blinked its eyes and smiled. it walked across the bridge to the other side of the river.

the little bug thanked the bridge and said, "you may be small, but you are very important to me." the bridge felt happy and proud. it understood that even though it was not big, it could still help others. the moral of the story is that no matter how small you are, you can still make a difference.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a new dress that her mommy bought for her. it was shiny and had pretty flowers on it. lily loved her new dress very much.

one day, lily's mommy asked her to stay in the living room while she went to cut some vegetables in the kitchen. lily agreed and sat down on the couch. she looked at her new dress and smiled.

suddenly, lily heard a loud noise coming from the kitchen. she wanted to go and see what was happening, but she remembered her mommy's words and decided to stay on the couch. after a few minutes, her mommy came back with a big bowl of salad. she was happy to see lily sitting on the couch, and she praised her for being a good girl. from that day on, lily always remembered to stay where her mommy told her to stay.

once upon a time, there was a little kid who asked a lot of questions. everywhere the kid would go, wherever the kid would look, the kid always asked questions. one day, the kid was in the park and saw two people arguing. the kid asked one of them, "what's wrong?"

the person answered, "that other person is not being very nice."

the kid was curious and asked, "why?"

the person answered, "well, because they're not being lucky enough to do what i'm asking them to do."

the kid made an observation, "that doesn't sound very nice."

the person shrugged, "what can you do? some people just aren't lucky." 

the kid thought about this for a moment, then asked, "what do you mean by 'lucky'?"

the person thought for a moment and said, "it means that some people get to do what other people don't get to do. or maybe even get something that other people don't get."

the kid nodded. "i understand. so, what do you do when you're not lucky?"

the person's face lit up. "you find other ways to get what you need and you never give up."

the kid smiled. "thanks! that's helpful"

little did the kid know, this advice would help them soon enough. the following day in

once upon a time there were two best friends: sam and jack. sam was very proud of her skills in baking the most delicious cakes.

jack asked, "sam, can you teach me how to bake a cake?"

sam laughed and said, "yes of course! let's get started!"

sam and jack worked together to bake the most scrumptious cake. when it was finished, they put it in the oven.

jack said, "i'm so excited to see what it looks like when it comes out of the oven!"

moments later, their cake was done baking. it was so delicious that everyone cheered for it! as a prize for their hard work, sam and jack got to share the cake. 

jack was a bit jealous because sam was the one who made it. but in the end, they enjoyed eating the cake together and shared a big hug.

the end.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play at the park. they see a big slide. it is bright red and yellow. they want to go on the slide.

anna and ben run to the slide. they take turns to go down. anna goes first. she sits on the slide and pushes with her feet. she slides down fast. she laughs and claps. ben claps too. he says, "good job, anna!"

now it is ben's turn. he climbs up the slide. he sits on the slide and pushes with his feet. he slides down fast. he smiles and claps. anna claps too. she says, "good job, ben!"

anna and ben go on the slide again and again. they have fun. they clap and cheer for each other. they are happy. they love the slide.

one day, a little girl named lily went for a walk in the forest with her mom. they saw a bush that was very thin and almost looked like it was going to fall over. lily said, "mommy, look at that bush! it's so thin!" 

suddenly, they heard a noise and saw a rabbit running towards them. the rabbit was very scared and said, "please help me! a fox is chasing me!" 

lily's mom said, "don't worry, little rabbit. we will watch out for you and protect you from the fox." they all hid behind the thin bush and waited for the fox to pass by. after a while, the fox gave up and ran away. the rabbit was so grateful and said, "thank you so much! you saved my life!" 

lily and her mom felt happy that they were able to help the rabbit. they continued their walk in the forest, feeling proud of themselves for being kind and brave.

ben and mia were playing in their room. they had many toys and books, but they were bored. they wanted to see what was behind the big door in the hall. their mom had told them not to touch the door, because it was the door to her office and she had important work there.

but ben and mia were curious. they sneaked out of their room and went to the hall. they saw the big door. it was shiny and had a lock. ben reached out his hand and touched the door. he felt a shock and pulled back his hand. he cried out loud.

mia was scared. she ran to ben and hugged him. she asked him, "are you okay? what happened?"

ben sobbed and showed her his hand. it was red and sore. he said, "the door hurt me. it was uncomfortable. why did it do that?"

mia looked at the door and saw a sign. it had a picture of a lightning bolt and the word "danger". she said, "i think the door has electricity. it is not safe to touch. mom told us not to touch the door. we should have listened to her."

ben nodded and said, "you are right. we should have listened to mom. she knows what is best for us. let's go back to our room and play with our toys and books. they are fun and safe."

mia agreed and helped ben to their room. they learned their lesson and never touched the door again. they also said sorry to their mom and hugged her. their mom was happy and proud of them. she said, "i love you, ben and mia. you are good children. always remember to follow the rules and be careful."

once upon a time, there was a big bull. he had a red nose and lots of fur. one day, the bull was walking in a field when he saw a little girl. the girl had a boo-boo on her knee and it hurt.

the bull went over to the girl and asked, "are you okay?" the girl said, "no, my knee hurts." the bull said, "i can help. i will kiss your boo-boo and make it better." the girl was scared at first, but then she let the bull kiss her knee.

after the bull kissed her boo-boo, the girl felt better. she said, "thank you, mr. bull. you're nice." the bull smiled and said, "you're welcome. i like to help people." from that day on, the girl and the bull were friends and they played together in the field.

once upon a time there was a boy named sam. he loved to play in his garden and watch the flowers grow. he was very excited when his mom got him an adorable ornament for his garden.

he placed the ornament in the middle of the garden and every day he watched it grow. he watered it and took care of it until it was so big and tall. sam enjoyed bragging to all his friends about his new ornament.

every morning sam would go out to the garden to check on his big, beautiful ornament. he was so proud! he felt like it was a magical place as he watched the birds flying around the ornament. 

one day, samâ€™s mom presented him with a new, even more adorable ornament. it was small and sparkly, and sam couldnâ€™t help but smile. he placed it right next to the big ornament and watched them both grow together. 

sam was so happy that his garden was full of the adorable ornaments. he couldnâ€™t wait to show it off to all of his friends.

once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little deer. the deer had many friends, but sometimes, he felt bored. he wanted to find something new and fun to do.

one sunny day, the deer met a squirrel. the squirrel said, "hi, deer! let's start a race!" the deer thought it was a good idea, so they began to race through the forest. they ran fast, jumped high, and laughed a lot.

at the end of the race, the deer and the squirrel were both tired but happy. the deer said, "thank you, squirrel! that was not boring at all!" from that day on, the deer and the squirrel played together every day, and the deer was never bored again.

once there was an enormous dinosaur. he marched and stomped up and down the land. he whistled and sang all day long.

one day, he saw a butterfly flying above the trees. the dinosaur thought it was so beautiful. he wanted to make it a present, so he whispered a sweet song to it. 

the butterfly liked the dinosaur's song. she flew down and sat on the enormous dinosaur's snout. the dinosaur was so happy and he whistled even louder.

the butterfly flew away and spread the dinosaur's beautiful music across the land. everywhere the butterfly flew, the dinosaur's happy whistling followed. 

from that day on, the enormous dinosaur was known for his happy whistle!

once upon a time, there was a girl called harper. she had a big box of crayons, so she wanted to write. she drew a picture of herself and a butterfly on the paper.

suddenly, harper felt a shake. it was an earthquake. she was scared, so she ran outside. but when she got home, something strange happened.

harper found that the table was rudely moved. it was moved away from the wall! she wondered what happened. it couldn't be the earthquake.

harper wrote it down in her notebook so she could find out one day. she was very curious.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she woke up in the morning and felt uncomfortable because her bed was too hot. she got out of bed and went to the kitchen where her mom was making breakfast. her mom said, "good morning, lily! welcome to a new day!" lily smiled and sat down to eat her breakfast. 

after breakfast, lily went outside to play with her friends. they played tag and hide-and-seek. suddenly, it started to rain and lily's friends went inside. lily felt uncomfortable because she didn't want to go inside yet. but then her mom came outside with an umbrella and said, "welcome back, lily! let's go inside and stay dry." lily felt better and went inside with her mom. 

later that day, lily's grandma came to visit. she brought cookies and said, "good morning, lily! welcome to my house!" lily was happy to see her grandma and ate some cookies. they played games and had fun. when it was time to go home, lily's grandma said, "goodbye, lily! see you soon!" lily waved goodbye and said, "thank you for a fun morning, grandma!"

tim and liz were twins who liked to play with their toys. one day, they saw a big box in the living room. it had a bow and a tag that said "for tim and liz, from grandma and grandpa". they wondered what was inside.

"let's shake it and guess what it is!" tim said. he picked up the box and shook it hard. he heard a loud noise and felt something move. "maybe it's a drum or a car!" he said.

"no, don't shake it! it might break!" liz said. she was more modest and careful than tim. she put the box down and looked at the tag. "it says 'do not shake'. we should wait until grandma and grandpa come and open it with them."

but tim did not listen. he shook the box again and again, trying to figure out what it was. he did not notice that the box was getting torn and the bow was falling off. he did not hear liz telling him to stop.

suddenly, the box burst open and a big surprise came out. it was a fluffy white puppy with a red collar. it was a gift from grandma and grandpa. but the puppy was scared and angry. it barked and bit tim's hand. it ran away and hid under the sofa.

tim cried and liz hugged him. they felt sorry for the puppy and for themselves. they wished they had been more modest and patient. they learned that shaking a box can ruin a surprise and hurt a friend. they hoped grandma and grandpa would forgive them and help them find the puppy. they promised to be more careful and respectful with their gifts.

sam and mia like to play with their toys. they have many toys, but their favorite is the big plane. the plane is red and blue and has wings and wheels. they can make the plane fly in the air or roll on the floor.

one day, sam and mia are playing with the plane in their room. sam wants to fly the plane high and fast. he throws the plane in the air and makes zooming sounds. mia wants to roll the plane on the floor and make beeping sounds. she grabs the plane from sam and puts it on the floor.

"give me the plane!" sam says. "i want to fly it!"

"no, it's my turn!" mia says. "i want to roll it!"

they pull the plane from each other and start to cry. they are both angry and sad.

mom hears them and comes to their room. she sees the plane and the tears. she picks up the plane and covers it with a blanket. she puts it on the shelf.

"stop fighting!" mom says. "the plane is empty now. it has no fun and no love. you can't play with it until you say sorry and share."

sam and mia look at the plane and the blanket. they feel sorry and ashamed. they hug each other and say sorry.

"can we have the plane back, mom?" sam asks.

"yes, you can," mom says. "but only if you play nicely and take turns."

sam and mia nod and smile. they take the plane from the shelf and uncover it. they see the red and blue and the wings and wheels. they feel happy and excited.

they play with the plane together. sometimes they fly it, sometimes they roll it. they make zooming and beeping sounds. they have fun and love. the plane is not empty anymore.

jack looked for his bear, who was named teddy. he couldn't find him anywhere, but then he remembered that he had put teddy in his toy box. 

when jack opened the toy box, he was disgusted by what he saw. there in the box, teddy was covered in mud. 

jack said, "what happened teddy? you look awful!" 

teddy replied, "i went to the park and found this really disgusting mud. i thought it looked like fun, so i rolled around in it." 

jack laughed and said, "well, let's go outside and find something else to do. i don't think i want to remember this mess!" 

the two went off and had a wonderful time, playing and exploring together. jack was so glad he remembered where teddy was.

once upon a time there were two friends, betsy and max. every day, they played together and had lots of fun.

one day, max and betsy were playing, but they started to quarrel. max said he wanted to go one way and betsy wanted to go the other way.

betsy said to max, "let's not quarrel. we can still have fun." max said, "okay, let's just enjoy the day!"

they held hands and ran and laughed together. they played with blocks and enjoyed themselves.

betsy said, "max, let's never quarrel. i love you!"

max said, "i love you too, betsy. let's always have healthy fun together!"

and they did just that! the two friends have remained close ever since, and they still have lots of healthy fun.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was called emma. she was very naughty and one day when she was running fast she tripped over and broke her napkin. emma started to cry because she liked having a napkin.

her mommy came and hugged her. she gave her a new napkin. then she said: "be careful and don't run too fast."

emma nodded and smiled. she was happy to have a new napkin and she promised to be more careful. from then on, emma remembered to walk slowly and she never broke her napkin again.

once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweet. tweet loved to sleep on the ground. one day, his friend, a little mouse named squeak, came to visit. squeak said, "wake up, tweet! let's go play!" but tweet was grumpy and didn't want to get up.

squeak went to play by himself and found a big, juicy piece of cheese. he ate it all up and felt very full. later, squeak went back to see tweet and found him still sleeping on the ground. squeak said, "tweet, i ate a big piece of cheese and now i don't feel so good." tweet woke up and said, "i told you not to eat too much cheese, squeak."

squeak learned his lesson and promised not to eat too much cheese again. tweet was happy to have his friend back and they went to play together. from that day on, tweet never slept on the ground when his friend was coming to visit.

once upon a time, there was a little car. the car was red and shiny. one day, the car went for a drive. it drove down a bumpy road and over a deep puddle. the car splashed through the water and got all wet. 

later that day, the car met a friendly bean. the bean was green and had a happy smile. the car and the bean became good friends. they played together and went on more drives. the car loved driving with the bean because they always had fun. 

one day, the car and the bean drove to a deep forest. the trees were tall and the air was fresh. the car and the bean explored the forest and found many new things. they had a great adventure and were very happy. from then on, the car and the bean went on many more drives and had many more adventures together.

on a bright wednesday, two friends, alex and sarah, decided to go on an adventure. the sun was shining, the sky was blue, and the birds were singing. alex thought the day was brilliant.

first, the two friends went for a walk in the park. they laughed and talked their way through the trees and grass. they stopped to watch the ducks, who splashed in the pond.

then, alex and sarah went to the playground. alex wanted to ride the swings, and sarah wanted to go down the slide. they both had lots of fun playing on the playground.

when they were finished, they stayed in the park to have lunch. the sun was still shining and it was a wonderful afternoon. as they ate, the friends talked and laughed.

finally, it was time to end the adventure. both alex and sarah said goodbye and agreed that their wednesday had been brilliant fun.

once upon a time, there was a big, furry bear. he loved to explore and have adventures. one day, he went to the forest to find his next adventure.

as he was walking, he spotted something in the trees. it was a big saw! he wanted to grab it, so he reached up to grab it. he was able to grab the saw and held it in his claws.

the bear was so excited about his big saw. he thought maybe he could use it to make something. he started to use the saw to cut down some trees. with the saw, he was able to cut down bigger logs and branches than ever before!

the bear was happy with his big saw. he now had lots of new, big logs and branches to explore and make other adventures out of. he was so grateful to have such a cool saw!

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to cook and bake yummy treats. one day, he decided to make a cake. he mixed flour, sugar, and eggs together in a big bowl. 

as timmy was putting the cake in the oven, a lawyer knocked on the door. the lawyer was looking for timmy's mom and dad. timmy didn't know what a lawyer was, but he knew he didn't want to talk to him. 

after the cake was finished baking, timmy gave a slice to the lawyer. the lawyer took a bite and said, "this cake is yummy!" timmy was happy that the lawyer liked his cake, but he still didn't know what a lawyer was.

once upon a time, there was a squirrel named sammy. she was small and furry, and she lived in the tallest tree in the forest.

sammy was very bossy. she was always telling the other animals what to do.

one day, two huge turtles were walking by the tree. they said hello to sammy. she was curious, so she asked if they wanted to play.

the turtles said yes. sammy had an idea. she told them they could play a game called shake the shells.

they each put a shell in the middle of the path. then sammy shook them, and they tried to guess which one was rattling the most. they laughed and shook the shells until all the animals in the forest had gathered around.

the game went on until they all agreed that sammy had been the most bossy. she had shaken the shells the best! everyone had fun and they all happily agreed, sammy was the best at shaking the shells.

today was a very special day. mum and dad went to the beach to get a surprise. dad said, "let's go and order something special." they went to a shop and dad ordered a funny looking thing. it was pink and green and had funny tentacles. mum said, "that's a jellyfish!" 

dad said it was going to be something special for dinner. when he got home, he cut the jellyfish. then he added some sweet things like sugar and honey. dad mixed it all up and put it in a bowl. it looked funny and smelled sweet.

mum and dad said, "it's time for dinner!" they all sat at the table and ate the sweet jellyfish. it was different but delicious. they laughed and smiled. they were so happy to have such a special dinner.

once upon a time there was a little rabbit who was very small. the rabbit was looking for a safe place to stay but it was not easy to find. suddenly, the rabbit saw a shelter and decided to go inside. it was a little dark, but the rabbit felt happy to finally have somewhere to stay. 

as the rabbit explored, it came to a door. the door was unlocked and so the rabbit opened it. on the other side of the door was a long tunnel. the rabbit thought it might lead somewhere special. the rabbit stood still for a moment. then, it took a deep breath and started to walk down the tunnel. 

the tunnel was long and uncomfortable. it seemed to never end. but, after a while, the rabbit saw the light at the end of the tunnel. the light was beautiful and the rabbit felt relieved. the tunnel had lead the rabbit to a wonderful meadow. the meadow was full of flowers and the air was filled with the sweet smell of honey. 

the little rabbit was so happy. it knew that this meadow would be its safe home.

once upon a time, there was a big, clean field where lots of animals lived. one day, a zebra came to the field to play. the zebra was very happy because the sun was shining and the grass was green. 

the zebra wanted to run and play, so it started to jog around the field. the other animals saw the zebra running and they wanted to play too. they all started to run and play together. 

after a while, the zebra got tired and decided to take a rest. it lay down in the grass and looked up at the sky. the other animals came over to the zebra and said, "you are such a good jogger! we had so much fun playing with you." the zebra smiled and felt happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to watch the birds fly in the sky. one day, her mommy gave her a lollipop. it was big and round and colorful. lily was so happy and she ate it all up. 

later that day, lily's friend came over to play. they played with their toys and ran around outside. but then, lily's friend saw that lily had a lollipop. her friend didn't have one, and she started to cry. 

lily felt bad, so she gave her friend a lollipop too. they both had lollipops and were happy again. it was a normal day, just like any other day.

lily and max are twins. they like to play in the bath. they have many toys: a duck, a boat, a frog and a ball. they splash and giggle in the water.

one day, mom gives them a new shampoo. it is pink and smells like strawberries. lily and max want to try it. mom puts some shampoo on their hair and rubs it gently. the shampoo makes many bubbles on their heads.

"look, lily, you have a bubble hat!" max says and laughs.

"look, max, you have a bubble beard!" lily says and laughs.

they look at each other and laugh more. they think they are very funny. they make faces and noises with the bubbles.

mom smiles and watches them. she thinks they are very cute. she takes a picture of them with her phone. she wants to show dad how much fun they have.

she rinses their hair and wraps them in towels. she hugs them and kisses them.

"you are my sweet and chubby babies," she says.

lily and max hug her back. they love mom. they love bath time. they love to laugh.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play with her ball. she would throw it up in the air and catch it, trying to balance it on her head. one day, while playing in her backyard, she accidentally threw the ball too hard and it went over the fence into her neighbor's squash garden.

lily was upset because she knew she wasn't supposed to go into the neighbor's garden. she tried to reach the ball by standing on her tiptoes, but she couldn't quite get it. just then, her neighbor, mrs. brown, came outside and saw what had happened.

"hello, lily," said mrs. brown. "what's wrong?"

"i accidentally threw my ball into your squash garden," explained lily. "i'm sorry."

"that's okay," said mrs. brown kindly. "i can help you get it. let's go get a ladder and i'll hold it while you climb up to get your ball."

together, they retrieved the ball and lily thanked mrs. brown for her help. from then on, lily made sure to be more careful when playing with her ball near the fence.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called suzie. she was feeling very fearful one day and didn't know why. she asked her mom what was wrong and her mom said she had to go to the hospital. suzie was very scared but her mom said she had to go to the hospital to match her with a doctor. 

when they arrived at the hospital, suzie was so fearful that she didn't want to go into the building. however, her mom said it was very important and they had to go. she gave suzie a hug and they went inside.

at the hospital, the doctor asked suzie a lot of questions and checked her eyes, nose, and even her heart. she was very brave, however. the doctor matched suzie with some medication to make her feel better. 

when suzie left the hospital, she felt much better and not so fearful anymore. she thanked the doctor for taking care of her, and then went home with her mom.

from then on, suzie was not so fearful and was able to enjoy life again.

jim was very excited to see the clown at the circus. he couldn't wait to see all the jokes the clown would tell. but when the clown arrived, jim did not laugh. he and the clown started to disagree.

jim said the clown was no fun. but the clown said jim was wrong. he said he was the funniest clown in the world.

the clown said he could make jim laugh. so he told lots of jokes and did silly things. the clown spun plates and jumped around. he even juggled three balls at once!

jim laughed so hard that he almost fell off the seat. he clapped his hands, and he was excited. the clown and jim were friends. they no longer disagreed.

anna and ben were twins who liked to play in the woods. they had a secret spot under a big pine tree, where they hid their toys and snacks. one day, they found a shiny box under the pine tree. it was locked, but they could hear something inside.

"maybe it has money or jewels," ben said. "we could be rich!"

"or maybe it has a monster or a snake," anna said. "we should not touch it."

ben did not mind anna. he wanted to open the box and see what was inside. he looked for a key or a way to break the lock. he did not see the man who was watching them from behind a bush.

the man was bad. he had stolen the box from a house and ran away. he hid the box under the pine tree and went to look for a car. he did not know that anna and ben had found his box.

he came back and saw ben trying to open the box. he was angry and scared. he ran towards the twins and shouted, "hey, you! leave my box alone!"

anna and ben were scared too. they did not know who the man was or why he wanted the box. they ran away from the pine tree and towards their home. they did not look back.

the man tried to catch them, but he was too slow. he got to the pine tree and grabbed the box. he did not see the police who were following him. they had seen him steal the box and run away. they had a key to open the box.

they caught the man and opened the box. inside, they found a lot of papers and a picture. the papers were bad. they had lies and secrets that hurt people. the picture was of a family. the family was sad. they had lost their home and their money because of the man.

the police took the man and the box away. they gave the family their papers and their picture back. the family was happy. they thanked the police and hugged each other.

anna and ben got home and told their mom what happened. their mom was glad they were safe. she hugged them and gave them cookies. she said, "you are very brave, but you should always mind your sister and brother. and you should never touch things that are not yours. you never know what they might have inside."

anna and ben nodded. they learned their lesson. they did not want to be rich. they wanted to be happy. they ate their cookies and played with their toys. they did not go back to the pine tree. they found a new secret spot under a maple tree. they lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he went to a class every day with his friends. the class was very big and had lots of toys to play with. timmy liked playing with his friends and sharing his toys with them.

one day, timmy brought a big piece of gum to class. he started to chew it and blew a big bubble. all of his friends laughed and wanted to try some gum too. timmy shared his gum with everyone and they all had fun chewing and blowing bubbles.

after a while, the teacher told them it was time to clean up and go home. timmy and his friends put away their toys and said goodbye. they left the class feeling happy and peaceful, knowing they had a fun day together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and dance around the room. one day, she accidentally spilled her juice on the floor and it made a big mess. lily tried to clean it up, but she couldn't get it all.

her mommy came in and saw the mess. she got anxious because she didn't want anyone to slip on the wet floor. she told lily to stay away from the area and she would clean it up. lily felt sad that she made a mess, but her mommy told her it was okay and accidents happen.

after her mommy cleaned up the floor, lily hugged her and said thank you. she learned that it's important to be careful and if something does happen, it's okay to ask for help to get it fixed. from that day on, lily made sure to be extra careful with her juice and toys.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she loved to ride her bike all around the park. one day, she saw a boy named max riding a bike that was very smooth. 

lily: "wow, max! your bike is so smooth! i wish mine was like that."

max: "thanks, lily! my dad got me a license to ride it."

lily: "what's a license?"

max: "it's like a special paper that says you can do something. my dad got me one so i can ride my bike on the road."

lily: "i want a license too! how can i get one?"

max: "you have to show that you value safety and follow the rules. then, maybe your parents can get you a license too." 

lily decided to always wear her helmet and follow the safety rules so she could get a license too. she practiced riding her bike every day until she could ride it smoothly like max's bike. and finally, her parents got her a license too!

one day, alice saw a bright horse. she wanted to pet it, but the horse was running away. she tried to catch it, but it was too fast.

then, she had an idea. she gathered all the brightly colored flowers and put them in a field. the horse was attracted to the bright colors and started to come closer.

alice had an even better idea. she started to sort the bright flowers by color. the horse was so intrigued, it stopped and looked at alice. it started to come closer and closer still. 

finally, alice was able to pet the horse. it was so happy to have a friend! from that day forward, alice and the horse were the best of friends. and whenever alice needs a friend, the horse is always there.

once there was a little boy called jake. one hot day he wanted to go to the market. at the market he saw lots of lovely things he wanted to buy. but he didn't have any money. so he started to shout. "i want this, i want that!" his mummy heard him and was not happy. she said "we don't shout in the market, jake. it's not polite". so jake stopped and smiled. he was glad he didn't have to buy anything. it was much more fun just to look at the things for sale. so he had a wonderful time and after he went home very happy.

charlie and jake were playing baseball together in the park. charlie liked to be the catcher and jake liked to be the thrower. they were having a lot of fun, when suddenly a rude boy wanted to join in.

"hey, can i play too?" he said.

"no," said charlie, shaking his head. "we want to play just by ourselves."

the rude boy crossed his arms and stared at them, trying to look tough.

"go away," said jake, "we don't want you here."

but the rude boy didn't listen. he started pushing and shoving them, trying to take the ball away.

"no, stop!" yelled charlie.

jake and charlie knew they had to fight back. so they grabbed the baseball and held it tight. jake threw it at the rude boy, but he dodged it. then charlie threw it, and it hit the rude boy right in the stomach. the rude boy fell to the ground and ran away.

jake and charlie cheered with joy. they had won the fight! they gave each other a high-five and went back to their game of baseball.

once upon a time there was a smart dog named max. he loved to play fetch but one day he hurt his bone. max knew he needed help to repair his bone, so he went to find his friend sam.

when max found him, he said, "sam, help me repair my bone. i want to play fetch again!" sam said, "don't worry, max. i will help you."

so sam got some bandages and wrapped them around max's bone. he said, "this will help your bone repair quickly." max was so happy and thanked sam.

sam said, "you did a smart thing, max! now you can go play fetch again."

max smiled and said, "thank you, sam. that was very kind of you!" with that, max ran off to go play fetch again, with his bone all repaired.

once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. he loved to listen to music. one day, tim's mom played some clean music for him. tim was happy and danced around the room. suddenly, he saw a toy that he wanted. he tried to reach it, but it was too high. so, he decided to grab a chair and climb up. he got the toy and was even happier because now he could dance and play with it while listening to his favorite music. the end.

once upon a time, a little dog named max lived in a small house. he loved to wear his favorite red vest every day. one day, max met a big dog named buddy. buddy was very alert and always paid attention to everything around him.

max wanted to be like buddy, so he asked, "can you teach me how to be alert like you?" buddy smiled and said, "of course, max! just watch me and do what i do."

buddy showed max how to listen and look around carefully. they practiced being alert together. max learned how to be alert, and he wore his red vest proudly.

tim and sam are friends. they like to play with toys. tim has a clever toy dog. the toy dog can bark and run and do tricks. sam has a toy car. the toy car can go fast and make noises.

one day, tim and sam go to the park. they bring their toys with them. they have fun playing with their toys on the grass. they make the toy dog chase the toy car. they laugh and clap.

"look at my toy dog!" tim says. "he is so clever. he can catch your toy car."

"look at my toy car!" sam says. "he is so fast. he can escape your toy dog."

they play until it is dark. then they hear their moms call them.

"tim, sam, it is time to go home!" their moms say. "you need to sleep."

tim and sam pick up their toys. they say goodbye to each other.

"bye, tim. bye, clever toy dog." sam says.

"bye, sam. bye, fast toy car." tim says.

they go home with their moms. they brush their teeth and put on their pajamas. they hug their toys and go to bed.

they sleep and dream of playing with their toys again.

once upon a time, there was a farm. everyone on the farm prayed every day. one day, something funny happened. a little pig got stuck in the mud! all the other animals on the farm prayed for help. suddenly, the sun shone bright and the mud dried up. the pig was free! the animals on the farm were so happy that they hopped and skipped with joy. everyone was glad that they had prayed and that the pig was okay again. the end!

once upon a time, there was a bird named jazz. she was very loyal and always stayed close to her family. she liked to sing her family her own special song, which they always enjoyed listening to.

one day while flying around, jazz noticed a big shiny thing in the sky. interested, she flew towards it and logged how she felt. but as she flew closer she heard a loud noise, making her scared. she saw that the big shiny thing was a plane, and discovered she was too close.

jazz was flying in the plane's way, so it was very hard to turn around. despite her loyalty, jazz was worried and confused, so she didn't immediately value what was most important and flew away from her family.

while she was alone, jazz realised that her family was the most important thing. taking her own loyal advice, she quickly flew back to her family, who welcomed her with open wings. from then on, jazz always valued and protected her family, singing her special song whenever they needed a reminder.

tom and lily were playing with their toy planes in the garden. they liked to make them soar in the air and pretend they were pilots. they had a long runway made of sticks and stones, and a big tree that was their airport.

one day, a big dog came into the garden. it saw the toy planes and wanted to play with them too. it ran towards the runway and grabbed one of the planes in its mouth. it shook it and tore it apart.

"hey, that's mine!" tom shouted. he ran after the dog and tried to get his plane back. but the dog was too fast and strong. it ran away with the plane and jumped over the fence.

lily saw what happened and felt sorry for tom. she had an idea. she took her plane and flew it over the fence. she made it soar high and low, and made noises like a jet engine. the dog saw the plane and dropped tom's plane. it chased lily's plane instead.

"quick, tom, get your plane!" lily said. she flew her plane over the fence again and landed it next to tom. tom picked up his plane and hugged it. it was broken, but he was happy to have it back.

"thank you, lily, you are very brave and smart," tom said. "you helped me escape from the dog."

"you're welcome, tom, you are my friend," lily said. "and you have a very nice plane."

they smiled and hugged each other. then they went back to their runway and played with their planes again. they made them soar in the air and pretend they were pilots. they had a lot of fun.

tim and kim were twins who liked to play outside. one day, they saw a big ladder near their house. it was leaning on the wall. tim had an idea. he urged kim to follow him. he wanted to climb the ladder and see the roof.

kim was scared. she did not want to go up the ladder. she said it was too high and dangerous. but tim did not listen. he said it would be fun and exciting. he said they could see the whole street from the roof. he started to climb the ladder.

kim did not want to be left alone. she followed tim up the ladder. she was very nervous. she held on to the ladder tightly. she looked down and felt dizzy. she wished they did not go up.

when they reached the roof, they were disappointed. the roof was not fun or exciting. it was filthy and hot. there was dirt and dust and leaves and bugs. there was nothing to see or do. they wanted to go back down.

but the ladder was gone. someone had moved it. they did not know who or why. they were stuck on the roof. they were scared and sad. they started to cry. they hoped someone would hear them and help them. they learned a lesson. they should not have climbed the ladder. they should have listened to kim.

one day, the sun was shining brightly in the sky. mom and dad said it was time for a walk. as they stepped outside, the sun made baby's eyes squint. mom and dad smiled, but baby frowned.

baby was feeling nervous. everywhere they went, baby's eyes wondered. there were so many new things to look at. dad noticed the frown and asked baby what was wrong. baby said they were feeling scared of the sun.

mom laughed and said the sun was nothing to be scared of. she said the sun was like a big hug that always made her happy. dad stepped close to baby and gave them a big hug. baby smiled and started to feel better.

when they returned home, the sun was still shining. but this time, baby was no longer nervous and just enjoyed its warm feel. they waved goodbye to the sun, until the next time it shone.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy cars. one day, he went to the park with his mom. while playing, timmy saw a ball and wanted to play with it. he asked the other kids if he could play, but they said no. timmy felt sad and sorry for himself.

suddenly, a little girl dropped her number card and it flew away. timmy saw it and decided to grab it for her. the little girl was very happy and thanked timmy. timmy felt proud of himself for being helpful. from that day on, timmy made a new friend and they played together with the ball and timmy's toy cars.

once upon a time, there was a little birdie named tweetie. tweetie was very hungry and wanted to eat an egg. but it was dark outside and tweetie couldn't see anything. 

suddenly, it started to rain. tweetie didn't like the rain because it made her feathers wet. she looked for a place to hide and saw a little house. 

tweetie went inside and saw a little girl named lily. lily saw tweetie and said, "hello little birdie, why are you here?" tweetie replied, "i'm hungry and it's dark outside. can i please have an egg to eat?" 

lily smiled and said, "of course, i have some eggs in the fridge. let me get you one." she gave tweetie an egg and tweetie was very happy. she ate the egg and felt full. then, she said goodbye to lily and flew away. the end.

once upon a time, there was a tall judge. every night, the judge went to bed and he would sleep. but one night, something strange happened. as the judge was trying to sleep, he heard a noise. he followed the noise until he arrived in front of a door. he opened the door and to his surprise, he saw a lot of little animals in the room.

the animals were very happy to see the judge. they asked him to stay so that they could play together. the judge was pleased and he decided to stay with them all night. so the judge and the animals had lots of fun until it was time for the judge to go to bed.

the animals tucked the judge in and said goodbye. then, the judge fell asleep. when the morning came, the judge was so refreshed and happy. he thanked the animals for their kindness and said goodbye. the judge went off to work and the little animals watched him go. they waved goodbye to the tall judge, who then went on his way.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she wanted to go for a swim and begged her mom to let her. her mom urged her to put on her swimsuit and little girl did, eager to go in the water. 

when she got to the water, she splashed and jumped in. she swam fast around the pool. her mom encouraged her to keep swimming and the little girl was happy. 

when the little girl was done, she urged her mom to join her and so they both swam together. they had lots of fun swimming and playing until the sun went down. 

at the end of the day, the little girl and her mom were exhausted but smiling. they had a great day of swimming!

lily is a cute dog. she has a pink collar with her name on it. she likes to play with her ball and run in the park. one day, she sees a new dog in the park. he is big and brown and has a blue collar.

"hi, i am lily. what is your name?" she asks the new dog.

"i am max. i am new here. do you want to play with me?" he says.

"yes, i do. you look nice. do you like my collar?" she says.

"i do. it is pretty. i like your name too. it is like a flower. do you like my collar?" he says.

"i do. it is cool. i like your name too. it is like a strong name. can we be friends?" she says.

"yes, we can. you are cute and friendly. come on, let's chase the ball!" he says.

they run and play and have fun. they share the ball and the water. they are happy. they are friends.

one day, a little girl named molly was late for school. she had to hurry quickly! she said good-bye to her mom and was off to catch the bus.

on her way to school, molly stopped by the market to buy some delicious treats for lunch. she tasted each one until she found the one that was the finest. she grabbed it and rushed to the bus stop.

the bus was about to leave when molly arrived. but lucky for her, it waited just a few moments longer for her. she ran on board and the bus drove away.

molly was very glad that her mom had told her the night before to get up early. if she didn't hurry that morning, she wouldn't have made it to school in time.

one day, a gray cat named tom went to the beach. tom saw people do a fun thing called surf. he wanted to try it too.

tom found a surf board and went into the water. he tried to do the surf, but it was hard. he fell down a lot, but he did not give up.

after many tries, tom could do the surf. he was happy and had a lot of fun. the people on the beach cheered for him. tom had a great day at the beach.

willow was so excited! she was going to the library for the very first time.

when she arrived, she was amazed. everywhere she looked were neat rows of books. she spotted a table with a chair next to it and ran over to it.

suddenly, willow heard a voice.

"hello! welcome to the library! i'm going to close soon, so please make sure the library is nice and tidy when you leave," said the librarian.

willow nodded and smiled. she said she would.

willow spent hours at the library, reading book after book. when it was time to go, she made sure to stack all the books she had used neatly.

the librarian smiled and thanked her for leaving the library so tidy. 

willow smiled as she left. she couldn't wait to return to the library again.

anna loved to soar in the sky with her kite. she made the kite with her dad, using paper, sticks and a long string. she painted the kite with many colors and shapes. she was very proud of her kite.

one day, she saw a fancy kite in the park. it was bigger and shinier than her kite. it had ribbons and bells and glitter. anna wanted that kite very much. she thought her kite was not good enough.

she saw a boy holding the fancy kite. he was not looking. anna had a bad idea. she took a pin from her pocket and ran to the boy. she poked the fancy kite with the pin. the kite popped and fell to the ground. the boy cried.

anna grabbed the fancy kite and ran away. she thought she was happy. but she was not. she felt bad for the boy. she felt bad for the kite. she felt bad for herself.

she looked at her kite. it was still flying high and bright. it was still her kite. she realized she made a big mistake. she ran back to the park. she gave the fancy kite to the boy. she said she was sorry. she asked him to forgive her.

the boy was surprised. he was still sad, but he was also kind. he forgave anna. he thanked her for giving back his kite. he said his dad gave him the kite for his birthday. he said he liked anna's kite too. he asked her if she wanted to fly kites together.

anna smiled. she said yes. she learned a lesson. she learned that fancy things are not always better. she learned that being mean is not fun. she learned that being sorry and kind is good. she learned to soar with her kite and her friend.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily wanted to get a snack from the fridge. she opened the door and saw that there was no more juice left. she felt sorry because she really wanted some juice.

lily decided to ask her mom to get more juice from the store. her mom said she was sorry too, but they would have to wait until tomorrow to get more juice. instead, they had some yummy fruit from the fridge. lily was happy because she got a tasty snack and her mom was happy because they didn't have to go to the store. the end.

once upon a time, there was a loving family. they designed a plan to go on an exciting journey. the parents packed a bag and the kid grabbed their favorite plush animal. 

when they arrived at the destination, the kid was amazed. there were lots of reindeer! the reindeer were so big, friendly and organized. the family was thrilled and started taking pictures with the reindeer.

the kid asked his parents, â€œcan i ride a reindeer today?â€ 

the parents answered with a smile, â€œnot today. but soon, if we design the right plan!â€ 

so, that evening the family all gathered together and designed a plan to ride the reindeer. they drew out all the details and packed a bag of supplies. the next morning they awoke with the sun and headed to the field of reindeer. 

the kid was so excited he could barely contain himself. they followed the plan and the organized reindeer all marched with them through the beautiful forest. the kid made new friends and had the time of their life. 

the plan designed by the family had worked out perfect and the kid had a wonderful time riding the reindeers.

ben was feeling sad. he had hurt his leg and it made it hard to play. he asked his mom for help. she brought out a twig and told him it would help him heal.

ben took the twig and held it tight. all of a sudden, he could feel the twig getting warm. he could see a smile on his mom's face, so he knew he was doing the right thing.

the twig worked its magic. ben's leg started to feel better. he was able to move it and run around again.

ben was so happy! he thanked his mom for the twig and gave her a big hug. she told him that if he ever needed help again, the twig was always available.

lily and tom were playing in the garden. they liked to dig in the dirt and make mud pies. they were very messy, but they had a lot of fun.

"look, i made a big cake!" lily said, showing tom her mud pie.

"it looks yummy!" tom said, pretending to eat it. "but we should wash our hands before we go inside. mommy will be angry if we make the house dirty."

lily nodded. she followed tom to the tap. but when they turned it on, the water was very cold. lily gasped and pulled her hands away.

"brrr! the water is too cold!" she said. "i don't want to wash my hands!"

tom looked at her. he knew she was scared of the cold water. he was scared too, but he wanted to be brave.

"come on, lily. it's not so bad. we can do it together. we can count to three and then put our hands under the water. it will be over soon. and then we can go inside and have a snack. are you ready?"

lily nodded again. she trusted tom. she held his hand and they counted together.

"one, two, three!"

they put their hands under the water. it was very cold, but they did not cry. they rubbed their hands with soap and rinsed them. they felt proud of themselves.

"see? we did it!" tom said, smiling.

"we are brave!" lily said, smiling too.

they dried their hands with a towel and ran inside. mommy was waiting for them with some cookies and milk. she hugged them and praised them.

"you are very brave, lily and tom. and very clean. well done!" she said.

lily and tom smiled. they ate their cookies and drank their milk. they were happy. they liked to be brave and clean. and they liked to play in the garden.

once there was a girl whose name was lilly. lilly loved to explore and one day she decided to go on an adventure. she set sail in her boat and looked out to the distant horizon. there were so many places to go and discover.

lilly's boat started to travel towards the reef. as she got closer she could see that it was full of colourful fish and other creatures. she knew she had to be careful so she stayed near the surface of the water and eventually she reached the reef.

there were many things to explore in the reef, from coral to soft sand. lilly was delighted to find it provided so much joy. she swam around and discovered so many things. 

eventually it was time for lilly to go home. she was so happy that she had been able to explore such a wonderful and distant reef. she promised herself that she would go back one day.

once upon a time there were two sisters, jasmine and lizzie. they were playing in the meadow, picking flowers and running around in the sunshine. 

"look, jasmine, i found a needle!" said lizzie, holding it up with a big smile. 

"what are you going to do with that?" jasmine asked.

"i don't know. but i think it is different," said lizzie as she turned the needle over and around.

at that moment, they heard their mom call out to them.

"girls, it's time to go home!"

jasmine and lizzie hugged each other quickly and raced back home. they knew it was time for dinner and that their mom would need their help.

lizzie remembered the needle and she put it in her pocket.

"i'll keep it and maybe we can use it for something later," she thought.

the girls helped their mom prepare dinner and soon the family was eating and laughing around the table.

at the end of the meal, lizzie remembered the needle.

"mom," she asked, "do we need the needle for anything?"

their mom smiled. "no, sweetheart. but it is nice to have different things around the house." 

so the needle stayed put in lizzie's pocket, waiting for a

once there was a little girl who was very curious about the world. she liked to study everything - the trees, the flowers and the birds! one day she saw a big hill in the distance and she decided to go and study it.
