the little girl was so excited that she ran as fast as she could up the hill. but when she reached the top of the hill, she was surprised to find only a silly old tree. she was very disappointed and started to walk away. 

suddenly, she heard a voice call to her. it was the tree! "come closer," the tree said. 

the little girl was a bit scared, but she walked closer to the tree. the tree said, "if you study me carefully, you'll find something special." 

the little girl examined the trunk of the tree and sure enough, there was a surprise! it was a beautiful little nest with three baby birds! she was so happy that she had taken the time to study the hill.

molly was a happy young girl. she loved to play in the park and look for new things. one day she was walking around in the park when she saw something white in the grass. she ran over and saw it was an envelope. the envelope was white and it was very special. molly picked it up and opened it. inside was a special surprise - a spring! it was a beautiful silver spring that shone in the sunlight. molly was so excited! she quickly added the spring to her collection. then she ran back to show her mom the envelope and the spring! molly was so happy she had found the white envelope. she had never seen anything like it before.

once upon a time there was a girl named cat. cat was very brave and she wanted to help others. one day she was walking in the park when she saw a little black kitten. the kitten meowed and cat knew it needed help.

she picked up the kitten and saw it was scared. she made it a nice bed and gave it something to eat. soon the kitten was happy and it became her best friend.

the next day cat thought of a plan to reward people who were kind to animals. she painted a black rock with cute little paw prints and placed it in the park. the reward was that whoever found the rock would get a special treat.

people started finding the black rocks and cat gave them treats. eventually cat's reward idea became famous and she was thanked by everyone for her kindness. cat was happy because she was able to help other animals with her plan.

one day, a boy named tim went to the park. he saw a girl named sue sitting on a bench. sue looked sad and bored.

tim walked over to sue and asked, "why are you bored?" sue looked at her arm and said, "i hurt my arm, and now i can't play."

tim wanted to help sue feel better. he thought of a game they could play that didn't need her arm. "let's play 'i spy'!" tim said. "i'll start. i spy something green."

sue looked around and saw the green grass. "is it the grass?" she asked. tim smiled and said, "yes, you got it!" they kept playing, and soon sue wasn't bored anymore.

lily and tom were playing in the park. they saw a big basket under a tree. they were curious. what was in the basket?

they ran to the basket and looked inside. they saw many things: a ball, a book, a hat, a doll, a car. they were happy. they wanted to play with the things.

"can we play with the things?" lily asked tom.

"yes, we can. but we have to be careful. maybe the basket belongs to someone else." tom said.

they took out the things and played with them. they had fun. they threw the ball, read the book, wore the hat, hugged the doll, drove the car.

after a while, they heard a voice. it was a woman. she was looking for the basket.

"where is my basket? i left it under the tree. i have to complete my shopping." she said.

lily and tom heard the woman. they felt sorry. they had taken her things. they quickly put the things back in the basket. they ran to the woman and gave her the basket.

"here is your basket, lady. we are sorry. we were curious. we wanted to play with the things." lily said.

the woman smiled. she was not angry. she was kind.

"thank you, children. you are very honest. you can keep one thing from the basket as a gift. choose what you like." she said.

lily and tom were surprised. they were grateful. they looked at the basket. they chose one thing each. lily chose the doll. tom chose the car.

"thank you, lady. you are very generous. we like the things. we will take good care of them." tom said.

the woman nodded. she was happy. she completed her shopping. she waved goodbye to lily and tom.

lily and tom waved back. they hugged their new things. they went back to playing. they were happy. they learned a lesson. they were curious, but they were also honest.

once upon a time, there was a small girl named ellie. she really loved her hat and wore it everywhere she went. one day, ellie was playing in her garden when she saw something yummy. it was a big, delicious cookie. she quickly grabbed it and began to spin around with it in her hand. 

suddenly, a big gust of wind came and blew off ellie's hat. she screamed and ran after it, but it was too late. the hat was gone. she was so upset, she just sat down and started to cry. 

but then, out of nowhere, a nice man came with a big smile. he said "i have your hat!" he handed her the beautiful hat, and she was so happy. 

but then, the man said â€œiâ€™m afraid i have to take something from you as a payment.â€ he grabbed the yummy cookie from ellie's hand and said â€œthis will do nicely.â€ 

ellie was so upset. she just wanted her hat back, and didn't know what to do. she watched in despair as the man walked away, eating her yummy cookie.

once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named jane. she loved exploring the world around her. one day, jane found a problem. there was a big tower of celery in the middle of her living room and she wanted to reach the top. she tried to jump and stretch as high as she could but she could not reach it.

jane asked her mom for help. "mom, can you help me solve this puzzle?" mom smiled and said, "sure honey, let's figure this out together."

mom and jane worked together to solve the puzzle. mom decided the best solution was to break the celery into smaller pieces. she was very careful not to break the fragile celery.

once the celery was broken into smaller pieces, jane was able to stack them and build a tall enough tower to reach the top. jane was so excited and said, "yay! now i'm tall enough to reach the top!"

mom smiled and gave jane a big hug. "great job solving the puzzle, honey," she said. jane was very proud of herself for solving the puzzle and she knew that with her mom's help she could solve any problem.

john was excited. he was going to get toast for the first time. his parents had promised him he could have some toast and he was very enthusiastic.

john's mom said "find your plate. we will pass you some toast!" john was quickly able to find his plate and took a seat at the table.

john's dad then passed him two slices of toast. one of them had butter and cherry jam, and the other one had peanut butter and honey. 

john was so excited he began to eat without saying thank you. but his mom said, "john, don't forget to say thank you when someone passes you something."

john looked up and said "thank you!" his parents smiled and gave him an enthusiastic thumbs-up. and with that, john enjoyed his first experience of toast.

once upon a time there was a big worry. it kept growing bigger and bigger every day. one day, the worry got so big that it filled up the whole sky. it was so big that no one knew what to do.

then, a brave little girl stepped up and said,"i'm going to finish this worry". she started working hard right away. she worked and worked until one day, she finished the worry.

the sky became so clear, and the sun shone brightly. everyone was so happy. this brave little girl had finished the worry. the end.

lily and ben were playing with their toys in the living room. they had a big board with holes and pegs of different colors. they liked to make patterns and shapes with the pegs.

"look, i made a flower!" lily said, showing ben her board. "it has red and yellow and green pegs."

"that's nice," ben said. "but i made a car. it has blue and black and white pegs. it can go fast and beep."

he picked up his board and pretended to drive it around the floor. he made loud noises with his mouth.

"ben, be quiet!" lily said. "mommy is sleeping. she has a headache. she told us to play nicely and quietly."

"i don't care," ben said. "i like to make noise. it's fun. you are boring with your flower."

he drove his board closer to lily and bumped into her board. some of her pegs fell off and rolled away.

"hey, stop it!" lily said. "you ruined my flower. that's not nice. that's mean."

she grabbed his board and tried to pull it away from him. he held on tight and pulled back. they both tugged and shouted.

"give it back! it's mine!"

"no, it's mine! you can't have it!"

suddenly, they heard a loud voice from upstairs.

"enough!" mommy said. "what are you two doing? you are making so much noise. you are not playing nicely. you are fighting. come here right now!"

lily and ben dropped their boards and looked at each other. they knew they were in trouble. they felt scared and sorry. they walked slowly to the stairs, holding hands.

"mommy, we're sorry," lily said.

"we didn't mean to," ben said.

they saw mommy standing at the top of the stairs. she looked angry and tired. she had a frown on her face and a hand on her head.

"sorry is not enough," mommy said. "you disobeyed me. you disturbed me. you hurt each other. you need to learn to share and be kind and be quiet. you are going to your rooms. no more toys. no more fun. think about what you did."

she pointed to their rooms. lily and ben walked to their rooms, feeling sad and ashamed. they closed their doors and sat on their beds. they started to weep. they wished they had played nicely and quietly. they wished they had not fought. they wished mommy was not mad at them. they wished they could hug and say sorry. they wished they could have their toys back. they wished they could make up and be friends again.

once upon a time there was a girl who loved to skip. she used to go outside into the garden and spend hours skipping around. she loved the peace she felt when she skipped and it made her very happy.

one day she decided to go somewhere new and so she skipped off down the road. she kept going until she came to a modern park that she hadn't seen before. she skipped into the park and explored the new sights and sounds.

she soon came across a pond that was filled with beautiful coloured fish. she loved looking at them and watching them swim. then she suddenly remembered that her mother had asked her to come home. so the girl began to skip back home.

when she arrived she felt calmer and very content. she was now at peace. the skipping had made her feel wonderful and she knew she would always remember the modern park she had visited.

lily liked to dance. she danced in her room, in the garden, and in the kitchen. she danced when she was happy, when she was sad, and when she was bored. she danced with her dolls, her teddy, and her mom.

one day, lily wanted to dance with her dad. she ran to his office and knocked on the door. "dad, dad, can you dance with me?" she asked.

her dad looked at his computer and his papers. he looked very serious. "not now, lily, i'm busy. i have to work. maybe later," he said.

lily felt sad. she wanted to make her dad happy. she had an idea. she ran to her mom's room and found her mom's purse. she put on her mom's hat and scarf and shoes. she looked very funny.

she went back to her dad's office and opened the door. she held the purse in her hand and said, "dad, dad, look at me! i'm mom! can you dance with me now?"

her dad looked at lily and smiled. he saw how silly she looked and how much she tried. he closed his computer and his papers. he got up from his chair and said, "of course, lily, i can dance with you. you're the best mom ever!"

he took her hand and they danced around the office. they danced fast and slow, high and low, left and right. they laughed and hugged and spun. they forgot about work and worries. they had fun.

lily and sam were playing in the snow. they wanted to make an igloo, a house of snow. they rolled big balls of snow and stacked them together. they left a hole for the door.

they were almost done when they heard a bark. it was rex, their dog. he ran to them and wagged his tail. he wanted to play too. he jumped on the snow balls and made them fall. lily and sam were sad. they worked hard on their igloo.

they were also anxious, a feeling of worry. they wanted to finish their igloo before it got dark. they did not want to be cold. they looked at rex. he looked sorry. he licked their faces.

lily and sam decided to include rex, to let him join them. they said, "it's okay, rex. you can help us make the igloo. but you have to be gentle. no jumping or biting."

rex barked happily. he helped them roll more snow balls and push them in place. he also dug a tunnel under the igloo. he made a secret entrance.

soon, they finished their igloo. it was big and cozy. they crawled inside and snuggled with rex. they were proud of their igloo. they were not sad or anxious anymore. they were happy.

once upon a time, there lived a calm fairy. she lived in the forest and loved to play all day.

one day, the fairy had a new idea. she wanted to twist around in the air! she zoomed around, twisting, turning and spinning. she felt so happy as she moved!

but soon, she got a bit dizzy. the twirling had made her tired. she landed in a nearby clearing and lay there, feeling calm and relaxed.

the fairy lay in the grass, and twisted her tiny toes in a graceful star shape. she smiled and laughed, feeling the sun on her face. then she took off again, back to the trees, ready to start a new adventure.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved the color purple and always wore a purple dress. one day, she went to a restaurant with her mommy and daddy. 

the waiter came and asked, "what would you like to order?" lily said, "i want spaghetti please!" 

when the spaghetti arrived, lily took a bite and made a face. "this spaghetti is disgusting!" she said. 

her mommy and daddy laughed and said, "maybe you should order something else next time." lily nodded and said, "i want purple ice cream instead!" 

the waiter came back and lily ordered her purple ice cream. she took a bite and smiled. "this is yummy!" she said.

once there was a very clever boy named max. he loved books and loved reading novels. one day, max found a new novel that was very interesting. but, when he opened it, he saw that a few of the pages were torn.

max wanted to fix the pages, and he went looking for help. he knew his daddy was very good at fixing things. he ran over to his daddy and said,â€daddy, please help me repair this book!â€

his daddy said, â€œof course, max. thatâ€™s a very clever idea. letâ€™s get to work!â€ so, max and his daddy made sure that all the torn pages were fixed.

max was very happy when he saw that his novel was fixed because he could now enjoy it properly. he said thank you to his daddy and ran off to read his novel!

once there was a little girl called lola. she loved playing with her balls. her favorite one was bright red and very smooth. lola liked to roll it across the livingroom floor. she was very competitive and tried to go as far as she possibly could. so every day she would try and beat her best distance.

one day, lola wanted to try a challenge. she decided to roll the ball around the kitchen table. it was an inch thick and made of wood, so it was tricky to roll around. lola got down on her belly and tried to roll the ball underneath the table. after several attempts, she managed to roll it all the way around! she shouted with joy.

lola's mum was in the kitchen and heard her shouting. she asked her, "what are you doing, lola?" lola replied, "i just rolled my ball around the kitchen table and it was really hard, but i did it!" her mum smiled proudly and said, "well done, that was very clever of you".

lola kept playing with her red ball and from that day onwards, she was even more determined to beat her best distance in the living room. she kept practising, never giving up until she succeeded. lola had proved to herself that she could be competitive and that she should never underestimate her own ability.

once upon a time, in a small house, lived a boy named tom. tom loved to eat jelly. one sunny day, tom and his mom went to the park. at the park, tom saw a gentle cat. the cat was soft and kind. tom wanted to play with the cat.

"hi cat!" tom said, waving his hand. the cat looked at tom and waved its tail. tom's mom smiled and said, "tom, let's give the cat some jelly." tom was happy to share his jelly with the cat. 

tom and the cat ate the jelly together. they laughed and played all day. the sun began to set, and it was time to go home. tom waved goodbye to the cat, and the cat waved its tail. tom and his mom walked home, talking about their fun day with the gentle cat.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to play outside with her friends, but she always had to go home when the sun went down. her mom had a smart lock on the door, which meant she needed a special key to unlock it.

one day, lily's mom gave her a special key of her own. lily was so excited to have her very own key to unlock the smart lock! she ran outside to play with her friends, but she kept her key close by.

as the sun started to go down, lily knew it was time to go home. she ran to the door and used her special key to unlock the smart lock. when she got inside, she saw that her mom had made her favorite dinner. lily was so happy that she had her key to unlock the door and come home to a delicious meal.

once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a group of animals. they were all friends, but they did not always get along. one day, they had a big fight about who was the best at running. they all wanted to win, so they decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.

before the race, the wise old owl told the animals that they should unite and work together. he said that their goal was not just to win the race, but to be friends and help each other. he told them that being friends was more important than winning.

the animals listened to the wise old owl and decided to unite. they all ran the race together, helping each other along the way. in the end, they all crossed the finish line at the same time. they learned that working together and being friends was the most important goal of all.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a long, curly hair and loved to wear a pretty dress. one day, lily's mom asked her to bring her watch from the bedroom. "can you bring me my watch, lily?" she said.

lily ran to the bedroom and searched for the watch. it was a long time before she found it under the bed. "here it is, mommy!" she shouted with joy. but as she ran back to her mom, she tripped and fell. the watch broke into pieces and lily started to cry.

"oh no, my watch!" her mom said sadly. "i'm sorry, mommy," lily said through tears. "it's okay, lily. it's just a watch. i'm just glad you're not hurt," her mom said, giving her a hug.

lily learned that accidents happen, but it's important to be careful when we bring things to someone.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat cherries and would always ask her mom for some. one day, her mom brought home a big bag of cherries and lily was very happy. she ate so many cherries that she started to feel sick.

her mom told her, "lily, you need to be fit and healthy. eating too many cherries is not good for you."

lily replied, "but i love cherries!"

her mom said, "it's okay to love cherries, but we need to eat them in moderation. welcome a healthy lifestyle and you will feel much better."

lily learned her lesson and started to eat a balanced diet. she realized that being fit and healthy was much more important than just eating cherries all day.

once upon a time, there was a little gray cat. the cat liked to play and run. one day, the cat found a big ball. the ball was soft and fun to rub.

the cat did not know who the ball belonged to. the cat asked a dog, a bird, and a frog. they did not know either. so, the cat kept the ball and played with it.

the cat and the ball became good friends. they played together every day. the cat was happy to have a ball to rub and play with. and they lived happily ever after.

once there was a little girl called jane. jane was very curious, and loved to explore the world around her. one day, she went to a house to play, and she saw a beautiful big toy box in the corner of the room. she wanted to have the toy box, so she decided to hide it, so no one else could find it.

she quickly pulled the box behind a sofa and pushed it to the floor. she looked around, feeling a little bit envious that it was hers now, and that no one else could play with it.

the box was too big to stay hidden, so jane decided to find another hiding place. she looked around and found a small gap beneath the carpet. she lifted the carpet and placed the box in the gap.

jane smiled with satisfaction. no one will ever find it here! she thought, as she made her way back to her little corner of the room.

once upon a time there was a boy named bob. he liked to play with his cards. one day, he got out his cards to play. but his sister had a fake card and put it in with his cards. bob was very sad because the fake card made it harder to play. he tried to take it out, but it was too hard.

then, his mom came over. she saw the fake card and knew it wasn't real. she said it was wrong to put a fake card in with the real ones. she kindly took the fake card away.

bob was grateful and continued playing with his real cards. he was so happy, and learned an important lesson. from that day forward, bob only played with real cards!

once, there were two friends named sarah and joe. they liked to play together every day.

one day, sarah felt grumpy because she didn't get to go outside and play. she complained to joe and asked as to why she couldn't go outside, but joe didn't know.

"things on earth remain the same," joe said, gently. 

sarah was sad and asked, "why?". joe explained that all of the people on earth must work together to make changes.

sarah understood and decided to help the people around her make a change. she stopped being grumpy and started smiling.

the moral of the story is that if we all work together, anything can change for the better.

tommy was a happy 3 year old. he loved to play outside in the sunshine and jump in the mud puddles. but one day, he awoke feeling very alert. he realized that he had a problem - his face was suffering from a very bad rash.

tommy was worried and didn't know what to do. he asked his mom for help, but she said she didn't know how to make his skin feel better. 

tommy's mom took him to the doctor and the doctor was very kind. he said that he could make the rash go away. he gave tommy some medicine and told him to take it four times a day. 

after a few days, tommy's face was feeling much better. he was so happy that he was able to play outside and make mud pies again. now, his face was happy and free from suffering.

lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play together, share toys and help each other. one day, they found a shiny ring in the park. it was very pretty and sparkled in the sun.

"look, lily, i found a ring!" ben said, holding it up.

"wow, it's so nice!" lily said, admiring it.

"let's play a game. i will be the prince and you will be the princess. i will give you the ring and ask you to marry me. then you will say yes and we will be happy," ben suggested.

"ok, that sounds fun," lily agreed.

they went to a quiet spot under a big tree. ben knelt down and held out the ring to lily.

"lily, you are my best friend and i love you very much. will you marry me?" ben asked.

lily looked at the ring and at ben. she felt happy and scared at the same time. she did not know what marriage meant, but she knew it was something important and special. she wanted to make ben happy, but she also wondered what would happen next.

"ben, i love you too and you are my best friend. but what is marriage? what do we do if we marry?" lily asked.

ben thought for a moment. he did not know much about marriage either, but he had seen his parents and other grown-ups do it.

"marriage is when two people love each other and want to be together forever. they wear rings and say nice words and kiss and hug. they also live in the same house and share everything and take care of each other. they are happy and sometimes they have children," ben explained.

lily nodded. she liked the idea of being with ben forever and doing nice things with him. she also liked the idea of having children, like her baby brother. she smiled and took the ring from ben.

"ok, ben, i will marry you. you are my prince and i am your princess. we will be happy and have children," lily said.

ben smiled and put the ring on lily's finger. they hugged and kissed and said nice words. they felt very happy and proud. they did not notice that their parents were watching them from a distance, smiling and laughing. they had seen the whole thing and thought it was very cute and sweet. they decided to let them play and enjoy their game, knowing that they were too young to understand what marriage really meant. they hoped that they would always be friends and love each other, no matter what.

lily was a little girl who liked to wake up early and play with her toys. she had a lot of dolls and cars and books that she enjoyed. but sometimes, she woke up too early, before the sun was up, and she felt sleepy and bored.

one morning, she woke up and saw that it was still dark outside. she yawned and rubbed her eyes. she wanted to play, but she did not want to wake up her mommy and daddy. she tiptoed to the kitchen and saw a big pot of coffee on the table. she had seen her mommy and daddy drink coffee every morning. they said it made them feel awake and happy. lily wondered if coffee would make her feel the same.

she climbed on a chair and reached for the pot. she poured some coffee into a cup and took a sip. it was hot and bitter and made her face scrunch up. she did not like it at all. she spit it out and coughed. she heard a voice behind her.

"lily, what are you doing?" it was her daddy. he had heard the noise and came to see. he saw the coffee cup and the pot and the mess on the table. he was not happy.

"lily, you should not drink coffee. it is not good for you. it is only for grown-ups. it can make you sick and jittery. you need to drink milk or juice or water. they are good for you. they make you strong and healthy and charming." he said.

lily felt sorry. she did not mean to make her daddy angry. she wanted to be strong and healthy and charming. she wanted to make her daddy happy. she hugged him and said, "i'm sorry, daddy. i won't drink coffee again. i love you."

her daddy hugged her back and said, "i love you too, lily. now, let's clean up this mess and go back to bed. it is still too early to play. you need to sleep more. sleep is good for you. it makes you grow and learn and dream." he said.

lily nodded and smiled. she helped her daddy clean up the table and the cup and the pot. then, they went back to her room and tucked her in. she yawned and closed her eyes. she felt sleepy and happy. she dreamed of playing with her toys and her mommy and daddy. she learned that coffee was not for her. she learned that sleep was better. she learned to listen to her daddy. he knew what was best for her. he was charming.

tom and lily were friends who liked to play on the farm. they liked to feed the chickens, pet the cows and watch the pigs roll in the mud. but their favorite animal was the large goat named billy. billy had a long beard, big horns and a loud voice. he liked to eat grass, hay and sometimes flowers.

one day, tom and lily found a jar of jam in the barn. they wanted to have a snack, so they opened the jar and spread some jam on two pieces of bread. they were about to take a bite, when they heard a noise behind them. it was billy, who had smelled the jam and followed them. he wanted some jam too, so he pushed tom and lily aside and stuck his head in the jar. he licked the jam with his tongue and made a happy sound.

"hey, that's our jam!" tom shouted. "go away, billy!"

"no, that's our jam!" lily said. "you can't have it, billy!"

but billy did not listen. he kept eating the jam, and soon the jar was empty. he looked at tom and lily with a smug grin and bleated loudly. then he ran away, leaving a trail of jam behind him.

tom and lily were very angry and sad. they had no jam left, and their bread was ruined. they chased after billy, but he was too fast and too smart. he hid behind the hay, under the tractor and in the pond. he laughed at tom and lily, who could not catch him.

"come back here, billy!" tom and lily cried. "you are a bad goat!"

but billy did not care. he had had a delicious snack, and he was having fun. he was a large goat, and he could do what he wanted. he was the king of the farm.

tom and lily were twins who liked to play together. one night, they decided to play hide and seek in their room. tom said, "i will count to ten and you hide. then i will find you." lily nodded and ran to find a good spot.

tom closed his eyes and counted out loud. "one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten. ready or not, here i come!" he opened his eyes and looked around. he saw lily's bed, her closet, her dresser, and her toy box. he thought, "where is lily? maybe she is under the bed." he walked to the bed and bent down to look.

but lily was not under the bed. she was in the closet, behind the clothes. she heard tom's footsteps and smiled. she thought, "i will scare tom when he comes near the closet. he will be so surprised." she waited and waited. she was impatient. she wanted to scare tom now.

she saw tom's shadow on the closet door. he was getting closer. she held her breath and got ready to jump out. she opened the closet door and shouted, "boo!"

but tom did not hear her. he was too busy looking under the dresser. he did not see lily coming out of the closet. he did not see her face or her hands. he only felt something touch his back. he was scared. he screamed and ran to the light switch. he turned on the light and saw lily standing in the closet. she was laughing.

tom was angry. he said, "lily, that was not funny. you scared me. i did not like it." lily stopped laughing. she said, "i'm sorry, tom. i was just playing. i did not mean to scare you. do you want to play again?" tom shook his head. he said, "no, i don't. i don't like the dark. let's read a book instead." lily nodded. she said, "ok, let's read a book. but next time, i will hide better." tom said, "and next time, i will find you faster." they hugged and went to their bed. they picked a book and read it together. they were not scared anymore. they were happy.

once there were two twin brothers named sam and mike. sam was always organizing things very neatly whereas mike was always nosy and trying to get into sam's things. 

one day, sam was organizing his room and mike had come around to be nosy as he usually was. "what are you doing?" he asked. 

"i am organizing my room," sam said. 

mike's eyes sparkled. "can i help? i could organize too!"

sam smiled. sharing his organizational skills with his twin was always fun. "sure, mike! let's organize together."

sam and mike had a great time putting all of sam's stuff in neat little piles. by the time they were done, sam's room was neat and tidy and it had never looked better. mike was proud of the job he had done.

"what great organizing!" mike said.

sam smiled and gave his twin a high-five. "yes, it sure was!"

sara and tom are playing in the kitchen. they want to make a cake for mom. sara finds a big bowl and a spoon. tom finds a basket with eggs and flour.

"let's stir the eggs and flour together," sara says. "it is easy and fun."

"ok," tom says. he cracks an egg and puts it in the bowl. sara cracks another egg and puts it in the bowl. they take turns to add flour and stir with the spoon.

they stir and stir until the batter is smooth and yellow. they are happy and proud.

"look, we made a cake!" sara says.

"yay, mom will love it!" tom says.

they pour the batter into a pan and put it in the oven. they wait for the cake to bake. they smell something sweet and yummy.

the cake is ready. they take it out of the oven and let it cool. they decorate it with frosting and sprinkles. they put it on a plate and carry it to mom.

"surprise, mom!" sara and tom say. "we made you a cake!"

mom is surprised and happy. she hugs sara and tom and thanks them.

"what a lovely cake!" mom says. "you are very good at stirring and baking. how did you do it?"

sara and tom smile and point to the basket.

"we used the eggs and flour from the basket," sara says.

"and we stirred and stirred with the spoon," tom says.

mom smiles and cuts a slice of cake for each of them. they eat the cake and enjoy it.

"it is delicious!" mom says.

"it is easy and fun!" sara and tom say.

once upon a time, there was a clumsy dog named spot. spot lived in a small house with his family. he loved to play with his ball and run in the yard. one day, spot saw a pretty sweater that his mom had made. he wanted to wear it, but he was too clumsy.

spot tried to put the sweater on, but he was not careful. he got stuck in the sweater and started to feel very hot. he tried to take it off, but he could not. spot began to feel scared. he did not know what to do.

spot's family heard him cry and came to help. they tried to take the sweater off, but it was too tight. they had to cut the sweater to get it off of spot. spot was sad because he had ruined the pretty sweater. he missed the sweater and wished he had been more careful.

once there was a boy called tom. he was very small, but he wanted to grow bigger. every night his dad would take him outside to watch the stars and play with the crickets. 

one night, his dad said "let's make something special for tea!" 
tom asked "what are we making, dad?" 
his dad said "we're going to make delicious crickets!"

tom smiled and said "yum!" 
his dad laughed and said "first, we need to find the crickets. let's go!" 

so, with his dad, tom went outside and searched for the crickets. soon, he spotted a big one and he carefully scooped it up. together, they took it back inside and made the delicious crickets. 

tom ate and ate until he was so full. he had had a fun night and he was happy because his dad had helped him grow bigger and bigger.

once upon a time, there was a bunny named flopsy. flopsy was very eager to try something new. one day, flopsy went outside and saw a calendar in the grass. the calendar was glowing in the sunshine. flopsy hopped over and asked, "what's that shining thing?"

the calendar replied, "i'm a calendar. every day, something special happens on this day. would you like to try something new today?" flopsy was filled with excitement and said, "yes!"

the calendar then opened and showed flopsy something amazing. it was a rainbow of colors, and it glowed brightly. flopsy was so excited that he jumped up and down with joy.

that night, as flopsy went to sleep, he saw something special in the sky. he was filled with joy as he realized it was the same rainbow he had seen in the calendar! flopsy knew he had made the right choice and thanked the calendar for helping him.

once upon a time, there was a happy girl named lily. she loved to run and play outside with her friends. one day, at noon, they were playing in the park. lily's friend, timmy, was feeling sad.

lily asked, "why are you not cheerful, timmy?"

timmy replied, "i lost my toy car. i can't find it anywhere."

lily said, "let's help you find it!" and they all ran around the park looking for timmy's toy car. after a while, they found it under a tree. timmy was so happy and cheerful again.

from that day on, lily and timmy continued to run and play together every day at noon. they were always cheerful and happy because they had each other to play with.

once upon a time, in a big park, there was a jolly player named tim. tim loved to play ball with his friends. every day, they would run, laugh, and have fun together.

one sunny day, while playing, tim saw a little girl sitting alone. she looked sad. tim stopped playing and went to her. he asked her a question, "do you want to play with us?"

the little girl looked up and smiled. she said, "yes, i would like that." tim took her hand and they went to play with the others. the little girl was very happy, and so was tim.

from that day on, the little girl became a new friend and played with tim and his friends. they all had a great time together. the park was filled with laughter and joy, and everyone was jolly.

anna and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys and books. but sometimes they fight over them. they do not like to share or take turns.

one day, mommy gave them a new order. she said, "you have to tidy up your room before lunch. put your toys and books in the right places. if you do not, you will not get any dessert."

anna and ben nodded. they wanted dessert. but they did not want to tidy up. they started to argue over who would do what. they grabbed and pulled each other's toys and books. they shouted and cried.

then, ben did something bad. he pinched anna's arm hard. anna felt a lot of pain. she screamed and hit ben's head. ben felt a lot of pain too. he screamed and kicked anna's leg. anna and ben were very angry and hurt.

mommy heard the noise and came to their room. she saw the mess and the tears. she was very sad and cross. she said, "what are you doing? why are you hurting each other? you are not being nice or kind. you are not following my order. you are not getting any dessert. you have to say sorry and hug each other. then you have to tidy up your room together."

anna and ben felt ashamed and sorry. they said sorry and hugged each other. they said they loved each other. they helped each other to tidy up their room. they learned to share and take turns. they learned to be nice and kind. they made mommy happy and proud. they got dessert after all. they had a lively and fun lunch. they smiled and laughed. they were happy twins.

once upon a time, there was a girl. she was a very special girl because she had a very special umbrella. it was an original umbrella with lots of pretty colors.

the girl wanted to show her umbrella to her friends, so one day she took it with her to the park. when she arrived, she could see all her friends playing. she waved her original umbrella and everyone said "wow!"

her friends wanted to try the umbrella too. so the girl shared it with them, and they all had fun spinning around with the umbrella. they were all laughing and having a great time.

when it was time to go, everyone said goodbye. the girl held her original umbrella tight and happily went home. she was very lucky to have such a special umbrella to share with her friends.

once upon a time, there were two best friends, lily and jack. every day they would share a bean together. one day, the bean was very wide, so wide that it wouldn't fit in either of their hands.

lily said, "wow, this bean is so wide. how are we going to share it?"

jack said, "it's ok, i know what to do. follow me."

so, the two friends went to a very big field with lots of grass. they both laid down on the grass and held the bean between them. they both smiled, because the bean was so wide and it felt like it was their own special bean that they were sharing.

they laughed, they shared stories and they had a lot of fun. from that day on, they would always share a bean in the wide field, and be the best of friends.

once upon a time, there lived a little girl named jane. jane loved to borrow things from her friends. one day, she decided to borrow a planet from the sky. she asked her friends, "can i borrow a planet from the sky?"

her friends didn't know what to do. they all replied, "no, you can't borrow a planet from the sky!"

but then jane thought of a way. she asked them, "what if i just borrow some light?"

her friends thought it was a great idea. they agreed to help her. so, they all pointed to the sky and helped her borrow some light from the stars, which she used to make the planet shine bright.

when the planet was lit up, jane was so pleased. she thanked her friends for helping her borrow the light.

the end.

mia was skating on the ice. she wanted so badly to learn how to play hockey. she was pushing her skates around and around, going faster and faster. suddenly, mia stopped. 

"why do i need to stop, daddy?" mia asked her dad.

"it is very important to listen to the coaches. they need to make sure you understand why hockey is so important," said dad.

mia was so excited to learn about hockey. she listened closely to the coaches and worked on her skills. when she was done, her dad noticed how hard she worked.

"i am very proud of you, mia. you are becoming a great hockey player!" said dad.

mia glowed with pride. she knew that with a lot of practice and hard work, she would be an amazing hockey player someday.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to draw with his markers. he drew on everything he could find, even on the walls! his mom would always tell him to stop, but he didn't listen. 

one day, timmy found a marker that was different from all the others. it was a fake marker that he got from a toy store. he was so excited to use it, he ran to his room and started drawing on his bed sheets. 

suddenly, timmy started feeling sick. his mom took him to the hospital, but it was too late. the fake marker had poisoned him and he passed away. his mom was heartbroken and wished timmy had listened when she told him to stop drawing on everything.

once upon a time there was a girl called lucy. she was very thoughtful and loved to help her mom and dad in the garden. 

one day while she was playing in the garden, she saw her mom rush inside. she wondered what was going on and decided to follow her.

when lucy got inside, she saw her dad with a runny nose. she realized that he was feeling poorly and wanted to help.

so, lucy went to her bedroom and came back with some tissues and her favorite soft blanket. she put the blanket around her dad and gave him the tissues to wipe his nose. 

her dad thanked her for being so thoughtful and gave her a big hug. lucy was so happy to have made her daddy feel better.

once, there was a cube. it was small and blue. in the cube, was something special. it was sour!

every day, the cube would go to the store. it would get all kinds of things from the store. there were different colors, shapes, and sizes. but the cube loved sour the best!

one day, the cube spotted something very sour in the store. it was a sour apple! the cube was so excited. it couldn't wait to have the sour apple.

it took the sour apple back to its special cube. the cube ate the sour apple and was so happy. it loved how it tasted.

from then on, the cube always went to the store to find something sour. it had found its favorite thing!

zoe and her dad were in the car. they were going to the store. zoe was so excited to go!

dad said, "we will go very fast!" he pushed down on the gas and the car began to speed.

zoe looked out the window. she watched some birds fly by. then, she saw an enormous tree.

the car stopped at the store. dad said, "let's get a file!" they went inside and found the file they needed.

dad grabbed the file and they went back to the car. he said, "hold onto the file, zoe!" then, he pressed down on the gas and the car began to speed again.

soon, they were home. dad said, "thank you for holding the file, zoe."

zoe smiled and said, "thanks for the ride, dad!"

one day, tom and lily went to the park with their mom. they saw a big lake with ducks and fish. they wanted to feed the ducks, so mom gave them some bread. they walked on the path by the lake and threw the bread to the ducks.

but then, they saw a big dog. the dog was black and had sharp teeth. it barked loud and ran towards them. tom and lily were scared. they ran back to mom, but the dog was faster. it wanted the bread in their hands.

mom saw the dog and shouted, "stop!" she picked up a stick and waved it at the dog. the dog stopped and looked at mom. mom was not scared. she was powerful. she said, "go away, bad dog! this is not your bread. this is for the ducks. you have your own food at home."

the dog knew mom was right. it felt sorry and wagged its tail. it turned around and ran away. mom threw the stick away and hugged tom and lily. she said, "you are safe now. i will always keep you safe. i love you."

tom and lily smiled and said, "we love you too, mom. you are the best. you are powerful and brave." they gave mom a kiss and then went back to the path. they fed the ducks and had fun. they had a good day at the park.

once upon a time, there was a puppy named bob. bob was an intelligent puppy and he loved to play. one day, bob's mom took him for a walk. she gave bob a leash and he happily bounded ahead. 

as he was walking, he met a little girl named lynn. she was playing with her doll, and bob thought she was really nice. he wanted to play too, so he sat down next to her and started to bark. 

lynn stopped playing and looked at bob. "are you asking me to play?" she asked. bob barked, and lynn smiled. she grabbed the leash and they started playing together. 

bob soon found out that lynn was very intelligent. she taught bob lots of new skills and he was so happy. they played together until it was time to go back home. 

bob was so sad to say goodbye to lynn, but they promised to meet again soon. he waved goodbye as he walked away, with a happy heart.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. one day, she went on a walk in the forest and saw a wild rabbit hopping around. "hello, little bunny!" she said. "what are you doing?"

"i'm trying to find my way home," the rabbit replied. "i'm lost!"

lily wanted to help the rabbit, so she took out her clock and showed it to him. "i can use my clock to help us find our way back," she said. they followed the clock's directions and soon they were back at the rabbit's home. "thank you, lily," said the rabbit. "you're so kind!"

lily smiled and went back home, happy that she could help her new friend. from that day on, she always carried her clock with her, ready to use it to help anyone who needed it.

tommy was very excited to see the fireman. he liked the big red truck and the loud siren. he wanted to be a fireman when he grew up. he ran to the window and waved at the fireman.

"hello, fireman!" he shouted. "can i see your truck?"

the fireman smiled and waved back. he parked the truck near tommy's house and got out. he walked to the door and knocked.

"hello, tommy," he said. "i'm here to check your smoke alarm. can i come in?"

tommy nodded and opened the door. he followed the fireman to the kitchen, where the smoke alarm was on the ceiling.

the fireman took out a ladder and climbed up. he reached for the smoke alarm and pressed a button. it made a loud beep.

"that means it's working," he explained. "it will warn you if there is a fire in your house. fire is very hot and dangerous. it can make you suffer. you have to get out of the house and call 911 if you see fire."

tommy listened carefully. he did not want to suffer. he did not want fire in his house.

"i understand," he said. "thank you, fireman. you are very brave and helpful."

the fireman smiled and climbed down. he put the ladder back in the truck and gave tommy a sticker. it had a picture of a fireman and a truck.

"here you go, tommy," he said. "this is for you. you are a smart and polite boy. maybe you can be a fireman someday."

tommy was very happy. he stuck the sticker on his shirt and hugged the fireman.

"thank you, thank you, thank you!" he said. "you are my hero. i want to be like you."

the fireman hugged him back and waved goodbye. he got in the truck and drove away. tommy watched him go and smiled. he was very excited to see the fireman. he liked the big red truck and the loud siren. he wanted to be a fireman when he grew up.

lily and ben were twins who liked to help their mom cook. one day, mom asked them to make some soup for dad, who was sick. lily and ben put some water, carrots, potatoes and chicken in a big pot. they stirred and stirred with a big spoon.

"soup is good for dad," lily said. "it will make him warm and happy."

"yes, and we can give him a scarf too," ben said. "a scarf will keep his neck cozy."

they looked for a scarf in the closet, but they could not find one. they saw a ball of wool and some needles. they had an idea.

"let's make a scarf for dad," lily said. "we can knit it with the wool and the needles."

they tried to knit, but it was hard. they made many knots and holes. the wool was scratchy and the needles were pointy. they got frustrated and sad.

"knitting is not fun," ben said. "it hurts my fingers and makes me angry."

"me too," lily said. "and our scarf is ugly and small. dad will not like it."

they heard mom call them from the kitchen. "lily and ben, the soup is ready. come and taste it."

they left the wool and the needles on the floor and ran to the kitchen. they tasted the soup and it was delicious. they smiled and hugged mom.

"mom, you are the best cook," lily said. "your soup is yummy and smooth."

"thank you, my loves," mom said. "you are very good helpers. i'm sure dad will love the soup too. and look, i have a surprise for you."

she showed them a big, soft, colorful scarf that she had knitted for dad. it had stripes of red, blue, green and yellow. it was long and warm.

"wow, mom, you are the best knitter too," ben said. "your scarf is beautiful and big."

"thank you, my loves," mom said. "i knitted it while you were making the soup. i used the wool and the needles that you left on the floor. i'm sorry, i hope you don't mind."

lily and ben looked at each other and felt ashamed. they had wasted the wool and the needles and made a mess. they had not finished their scarf and had given up.

"mom, we are sorry," lily said. "we wanted to make a scarf for dad too, but we could not do it. we did not know how to knit. we made a bad scarf and a big mess."

"mom, we are sorry," ben said. "we should have asked you to teach us how to knit. we should have tried harder and been more patient. we did not do our best."

mom hugged them and kissed them. "it's okay, my loves," she said. "i'm proud of you for wanting to make a scarf for dad. that was very kind and thoughtful of you. but knitting is not easy. it takes time and practice and skill. you can't learn it in one day. you have to be willing to make mistakes and learn from them. you have to keep trying and not give up. that's how you get better at anything."

lily and ben nodded and understood. they felt sorry for their bad scarf and their big mess, but they also felt happy for their good soup and their mom's scarf. they learned a lesson that day. they learned that cooking and knitting are both ways of showing love, but they also require effort and perseverance. they learned that they can do anything if they try hard and ask for help.

they gave mom a big hug and said, "we love you, mom. thank you for teaching us how to cook and knit. we want to learn more from you. we want to do our best."

mom smiled and said, "i love you too, my loves. you are my best gifts. come on, let's go and give dad the soup and the scarf. he will be very happy to see you."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat spicy food and would always ask her mommy to make her food spicy. one day, lily's mommy made her a spicy chicken sandwich for lunch.

lily took a big bite and her mouth started to burn. "mommy, this is too spicy!" she cried. "it's okay, lily," said her mommy. "i can make you a sandwich without the spicy sauce."

lily smiled and said, "thank you, mommy. you always know how to make me happy." her mommy hugged her and said, "that's because i love you, my little lily." from that day on, lily knew that her mommy would always make her food just the way she liked it, without any spicy sauce.

tommy was scared. he had gone to the beach with his family and saw the wild reef of rocks in front of him. his dad said, â€œdonâ€™t be scared tommy. itâ€™s just a reef. see? no one is going to hurt you.â€

tommy was still scared. he had never seen anything like it before. he asked, â€œwhat is a reef?â€

his dad explained, â€œa reef is a rock formation. theyâ€™re alive and full of colourful fish, like a giant jungle in the sea. itâ€™s wild and beautiful. you donâ€™t need to be scared tommy.â€

tommy smiled and stopped being scared. he went closer to the reef and saw the wild, colourful fish swimming around. he said in wonder, â€œitâ€™s so cool! iâ€™m not scared anymore!â€ 

his dad laughed and said, â€œsee? i told you it wasnâ€™t scary.â€ 

tommy looked happy and excited as he watched the reef and its wild fish. he was no longer scared.

tom and lily were friends. they liked to play together. one day, tom said to lily, "i have a big secret. do you want to know?"

lily said, "yes, please. tell me your secret."

tom said, "my dad has a passport. he goes to far places. he brings me things. he has a mysterious box. he said i can open it with a friend. do you want to come to my house and see the box?"

lily said, "yes, i do. that sounds fun. when can we go?"

tom said, "we can go now. my dad is not home. he will not know. come on, let's go."

tom and lily went to tom's house. they ran to tom's room. they saw the mysterious box on the bed. it was big and brown. it had a lock and a key. tom took the key and opened the box.

lily said, "what is inside the box?"

tom said, "i don't know. let's look."

they looked inside the box. they saw many things. they saw clothes and toys and books and pictures. they saw a shiny thing. it was a gun.

tom said, "wow, look at this. it is a gun. it looks like the ones on tv. can i hold it?"

lily said, "no, don't. it is dangerous. put it back."

tom said, "no, it is not. it is fun. i want to play with it. i want to be a spy like my dad."

tom picked up the gun. he pointed it at lily. he said, "bang, bang. you are the bad guy. i am the good guy. i win."

lily said, "stop it, tom. that is not a game. that is scary. give me the gun."

tom said, "no, you can't have it. it is mine. go away."

lily said, "no, i won't. give me the gun, tom. please."

tom said, "no, i won't. you are mean. you are not my friend. go away or i will shoot you."

lily said, "no, tom, don't. don't shoot me. i am your friend. i am sorry. please, tom, please."

tom said, "too late. bang, bang."

tom pulled the trigger. the gun made a loud noise. lily fell down. she did not move. she did not talk. she did not breathe.

tom dropped the gun. he looked at lily. he saw blood. he saw a hole. he saw her eyes. they were open. they were sad. they were scared.

tom screamed. he cried. he said, "lily, lily, wake up. i am sorry. i did not mean it. please, lily, please."

but lily did not wake up. she was gone. tom was alone. he was scared. he was sorry.

the end.

lily was sad. she wanted to see her grandma, but grandma was sick. mommy said grandma was in the hospital and they could not visit her. lily missed grandma a lot. she wanted to hug her and play with her and hear her stories.

one night, lily had an idea. she took her favorite glass from the kitchen. it was pink and had flowers on it. she filled it with water and put some lemon juice in it. she said it was lemonade, but it was very sour. she did not mind. she took the glass to her room and put it on her nightstand.

she knelt by her bed and closed her eyes. she prayed to god. she said, "dear god, please make grandma better. please let her come home soon. please let her drink this lemonade i made for her. it is sour, but it is good for her. it is a gift from me. i love her very much. amen."

she opened her eyes and smiled. she felt better. she believed god heard her prayer. she kissed the glass and said, "good night, grandma. i hope you like the lemonade." she crawled into her bed and fell asleep.

the next day, mommy had good news. she said grandma was feeling better. she said the doctors said she could go home soon. she said grandma wanted to talk to lily on the phone. lily was so happy. she ran to the phone and said, "hi, grandma. i miss you. i made you lemonade. it is in my room. do you want it?"

grandma laughed. she said, "thank you, lily. you are very sweet. i love you. i love your lemonade. it is very sour, but it is good for me. it is a gift from you. you are a good girl. you know what? i think your prayer helped me. god listened to you. he loves you too. he loves us all."

lily smiled. she said, "i'm glad, grandma. i prayed for you. i love you. i love god. he loves us. he loves lemonade too." they both laughed. they talked for a while. they felt happy. they felt close. they felt blessed.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved soup and he ate it every day. one day, his mom made him a soup that he didn't like. timmy said, "mommy, i don't want this soup. can i have something else?"

his mom said, "timmy, you need to try new things. you might like it. be smart and give it a chance."

timmy didn't want to try it, but he knew his mom was right. he decided to accept the soup and take a small bite. to his surprise, he loved it! he said, "mommy, this soup is delicious! thank you for making it."

from that day on, timmy learned to be smart and accept new things, even if he wasn't sure about them at first. and he continued to enjoy his favorite soup every day.

anna likes to swim in the pool. she wears a pink swim suit and a hat. she has a big floaty that looks like a fish. she holds on to the floaty and kicks her legs.

one day, anna sees a frog in the pool. the frog is green and slimy. it hops on the water and makes a loud sound. anna thinks the frog is funny. she wants to play with the frog.

she lets go of the floaty and swims to the frog. she reaches out her hand and tries to touch the frog. but the frog is fast and snaps at her finger. anna feels a pinch and cries out. she is scared and hurt.

mom hears anna and runs to the pool. she picks up anna and hugs her. she sees the frog and shooes it away. she says, "it's okay, anna. the frog was just scared too. he didn't mean to snap at you. let me see your finger."

mom looks at anna's finger and sees a small mark. she kisses it and puts a band-aid on it. she says, "there, all better. you are very brave, anna. but next time, don't try to touch the frog. he likes to be alone. let's go inside and have a snack. you need to be clean and dry."

once upon a time, there was a small boy who was playing in a park. he looked around and noticed a perfect jail. it had 4 walls, a door, and 2 windows. he was very curious and went up to investigate it. 

suddenly, he heard a voice coming from the inside. "who's out there?" the voice asked. the boy was startled and said "it's me, i'm just a little boy". 

the voice replied, "oh, hello there! would you like to come inside? i'm so lonely in here".

he didn't know exactly what to do, but he eventually opened the door and entered the jail. inside he saw a small bird in a cage. the bird said "my name is bob and i've been in this jail for years. i'm so bored of this place, i need a friend."

the little boy knew he had to help. he smiled and said, "don't worry bob, i'm here now. we can make this the perfect jail for you."

and so, the little boy and his new friend bob, created a wonderful jail full of fun and games. they both had so much fun that they didn't notice the time flying by. 

the end!

once upon a time, there was a young crocodile named coco. coco loved to study. every day, he would sit by the river and look at the fish, the birds, and the bugs. he wanted to learn about everything.

one day, while coco was studying, a little bird named benny came to sit near him. benny asked, "what are you doing, coco?" coco said, "i am studying. i want to learn about everything." benny thought that was a good idea and decided to study with coco.

together, coco the young crocodile and benny the little bird studied every day. they learned about the fish that swam in the river, the bugs that crawled on the ground, and the birds that flew in the sky. they became very smart and were happy to learn together. and they were the best of friends.

once upon a time, there was a clever girl. she wanted to explore the world and find new things. one day she decided to explore the mountain. she began her journey and could not wait to see what she would find.

as she neared the peak of the mountain, she heard the sound of music. she followed the sound and came across a beautiful meadow. in the centre was a fire and around the fire were a group of people singing and dancing.

the girl walked up to them and asked what they were doing. one of the people in the circle replied, â€œwe are celebrating! celebrating the beauty of the mountain, and the happiness it brings us. would you like to join us?â€

the girl was so happy. she smiled and said yes. she clapped and jumped around the fire with the group. they spent the whole night singing and dancing until the sun came up. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a purple engine. it was always very quiet, so everyone called it the purple whisper. the whisper began to travel around the world, and more and more people wanted to ride it. with each adventure, the number of people who wanted to join the fun began to increase.

soon, the engine was becoming very busy. people were coming from all over to take the purple whisper for a ride. to keep up with the growing demand, the engine had to work hard. it increased its speed, and eventually it could whisk people away in the blink of an eye!

the people in town were so happy to have the purple whisper. because of the engine, they could explore places they had never been before. everyone loved it and its adventures seemed to never end.

once upon a time, there was a mommy who loved to cook. she wore a big apron to keep her clothes clean. one day, she was making spaghetti and meatballs for dinner. she needed some tomatoes, but she didn't have any. 

the mommy asked her little girl if she could go to the garden and provide her with some tomatoes. the little girl was happy to help and ran outside. she found some big, red tomatoes and brought them back to her mommy. 

but, when she got back inside, she accidentally dropped one on the floor. it was now filthy with dirt and needed to be washed. the mommy washed the tomato and thanked her little girl for providing her with the tomatoes she needed to make a delicious dinner.

once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named spot. spot was a very good dog. he loved his family and always listened to them. he had a big head and a waggy tail.

one day, spot's family went to the park. spot was so happy to play in the sun. he ran and jumped and played with the kids. then, spot's mom told him to sit. spot sat down and looked at her with his big head.

spot's mom gave him a big hug and said, "you are such a loyal dog, spot. i am so happy you listen when i tell you what to do." spot wagged his tail and smiled. he loved his family and was happy to be their loyal dog. they all played in the park until the sun went down and then went home together.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to go on journeys through the forest. one day, he met a little bird named lily. they became friends and decided to go on a journey together.

as they walked through the forest, they saw a big, soft cloud in the sky. benny said, "i wish i could touch that soft cloud." lily replied, "maybe we can find a way to get up there."

they continued on their journey until they came across a tall tree. benny said, "maybe we can climb this tree to get closer to the soft cloud." so, they climbed and climbed until they reached the top. benny looked up and said, "i wish i could kiss that soft cloud." suddenly, a gust of wind blew and lifted benny up into the sky. he flew up and gave the cloud a soft kiss. then, he floated back down to the ground, safe and sound. benny and lily were so happy they went on this journey together.

once there was a thin mouse called pat. pat liked to dream. one evening, pat had a wonderful dream about a sparkling machine. the machine was very big and it made all sorts of things. pat was so excited and wanted to see the machine but it was too far away.

the next day pat suddenly had an idea. he decided to use his legs to walk to the machine. but it was very far away. pat was worried he would not be able to reach it. after a long time walking, he finally saw the machine and it was even more amazing than he imagined in his dream.

pat was happy but he now realized that he should not always only dream. he should also take action. things he dreamed of achieving wouldn't come true until he worked hard. pat was very proud of himself and he learned that dreams come true when you are brave and work hard.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to play with his hoop. he would jump through it and roll it around. 

one day, benny was playing near a pond when he saw a little fish struggling in the water. benny knew he had to save the fish, so he gently scooped it up in his paws and put it back in the water. 

benny felt very proud of himself for saving the fish. he realized that it's important to be kind and help others when they need it. from that day on, benny made a promise to himself to always be gentle and helpful to others. and he continued to play with his hoop, but now he knew that there were more important things in life than just playing.

lily likes to swing on the big tree in her garden. she has a rope and a board that make a swing. she can go up and down and feel the wind on her face. she laughs and sings when she swings.

one day, she sees a big bird on the branch above her swing. the bird is brown and white and has a long tail. it makes a loud noise like "caw caw". lily wants to say hello to the bird. she swings higher and higher and reaches out her hand.

but the bird does not like lily. it thinks she is trying to take its nest. it flaps its wings and pecks at lily's hand. lily feels a sharp pain and lets go of the rope. she falls off the swing and lands on the grass. she cries and runs to the house.

mama hears lily's cry and comes out. she sees the bird and the swing and lily's hand. she hugs lily and takes her inside. she puts a bandage on lily's hand and gives her a kiss. she says, "you are a brave girl, lily. but you should not touch wild birds. they can hurt you and make you sick. you should only swing on the swing, not try to fly like a bird."

lily nods and says, "i'm sorry, mama. i just wanted to be friends with the bird. but it was mean to me." mama says, "it's okay, lily. the bird was just scared of you. it did not know you were friendly. maybe you can watch the bird from the window and learn more about it. but you should not swing too high or too close to it. you should be careful and healthy."

lily agrees and cuddles with mama on the armchair. she looks out the window and sees the bird fly away. she says, "bye bye, bird. maybe we can be friends another day. but now i will swing on the swing and be happy." mama smiles and says, "that's a good idea, lily. i love you." lily says, "i love you too, mama." and they hug and watch the sky.

mary was running upstairs. she was in a hurry to get to the top. she needed to find mommy and daddy. their voices sounded angry.

mary finally made it to the top of the stairs. when she opened the door, she saw mommy and daddy in the kitchen. mommy was wearing an angry face.

"where have you been?" mommy asked.

mary had been running. "i was going up the stairs, but i was going fast," mary said.

mommy looked away and said, "maybe you should slow down the next time." 

daddy said, "maybe it's time for a break. let's all go for a walk."

mary smiled. maybe angry faces could turn into happy ones.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the snow with her red mitten. one day, while playing, she accidentally dropped her mitten and it scattered away. lily looked for it everywhere but couldn't find it.

suddenly, she saw a lively squirrel running towards her with her lost mitten in its mouth. the squirrel dropped the mitten at her feet and ran away. lily was very happy and thanked the squirrel for finding her mitten. from that day on, lily always made sure to keep her mittens safe while playing in the snow.

sara and ben are playing in the yard. they have a big box of toys. sara likes to fill the box with her dolls and cars. ben likes to fill the box with his books and balls. they take turns to fill the box and empty it.

one day, sara finds a file in the box. it is shiny and sharp. she does not know what it is. she shows it to ben. "look, ben, what is this?" she asks.

ben looks at the file. he thinks it is a tool. he wants to try it. he takes it from sara. "it is a file. you can use it to make things smooth," he says.

he rubs the file on a stick. the stick becomes smooth. he is happy. he rubs the file on a rock. the rock becomes smooth. he is happier. he rubs the file on his hand. his hand becomes hurt. he is not happy. he cries.

sara hears ben cry. she runs to him. she sees his hand. it is red and bleeding. she is scared. she hugs him. "ben, are you okay? your hand is hurt. let me help you," she says.

she takes him to the house. she finds a band-aid. she puts it on his hand. she kisses him. "there, there, ben. it will be better soon. do not play with the file. it is not a toy. it is dangerous," she says.

ben nods. he is sorry. he thanks sara. he hugs her. "you are a good sister, sara. i love you," he says.

they smile. they go back to the yard. they play with their toys. they do not play with the file. they are happy.

tim and sue like to play in the sand. they have a bucket and a shovel. they dig and fill and make shapes. they have fun.

one day, they find a shiny thing in the sand. it is round and has a hole. they look at it and wonder what it is. they show it to each other.

"maybe it is a ring," tim says.

"maybe it is a coin," sue says.

"maybe it is a treasure," they both say.

they are happy. they want to keep it. but they are afraid someone will take it. they have an idea.

"let's bury it," tim says.

"good idea," sue says.

they dig a deep hole. they put the shiny thing in it. they cover it with sand. they pat it down. they look around. no one can see it.

"we will come back tomorrow and dig it up," tim says.

"ok," sue says.

they are proud. they have a secret. they hug and smile. they are reliable friends. they go home.

once upon a time there was an angel who lived in the sky. the angel was very organized and always kept things neat and tidy.

the angel had a special job - every day she would provide everbody in the world with love and joy. she would sprinkle it over everyone and make them feel cheerful.

one day, the angel decided to surprise the people by giving them something extra. she used her magic and provided them with a fun time.

everybody had a good time! they played lots of games and ran around like crazy. it was the most fun they'd ever had!

when it was time to go home, the angel provided everybody with warm hugs and goodbyes. everyone thanked the angel for the great time she provided.

the people were so thankful for the angel and all of the love and fun she provided. she was the best!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her cards. every day, she would take out her cards and lay them on the floor. sometimes, she would even make a big tower with them.

one day, lily's friend came to visit her. she was so excited to show her friend her cards. but first, she had to get them ready. she picked them up and put them in a neat pile. then, she waited for her friend to come.

when her friend arrived, lily showed her the cards. they played a game with them and had so much fun. at the end of the day, lily was happy that her friend had come to play with her cards.

once upon a time there lived a little girl named lily. she lived in a beautiful palace near the forest and she loved playing outdoors. every day she would go out in the garden and whistle.

one day, lily heard a special whistle coming from the woods. she walked towards the sound, being very careful of the trees and animals around her.

when she reached the edge of the forest, she saw a big palace with tall walls and an enormous door. curious, lily walked to the door and knocked. a kind old man opened the door and welcomed her inside.

"what is this place?" she asked, looking around in amazement.

"it's a very special palace - it's a magic palace!" the old man replied, with a twinkle in his eye.

lily was filled with excitement and asked, "can i learn the magic too?"

the old man smiled and said, "of course. just keep whistling and you'll learn all the secrets of the palace!"

so every day, lily would go back to the palace and whistle. she was careful to listen and learn, and soon she knew all the secrets of the magical place. 

the end.

once upon a time there was a lovely girl called amy. she loved to skip everywhere. she skipped around the park, the house and down the street.

every day when amy skipped down the street, she saw a secret door. every day she wanted to open up the door and see what was inside. she skipped closer and closer to the door until one day she plucked up the courage to open it.

when she opened the door she found a lovely garden. inside it were lots of animals, brightly coloured flowers and lush green trees. amy was so delighted by the garden she skipped happily with joy. every day she came back to the garden to see the animals and flowers.

amy loved her secret garden and was so glad she opened the door. she was thankful for the lovely place she was able to visit each day.

the sun shone brightly in the sky, making the grass very dry.

tommy and his dad were outside playing football. tommy enjoyed playing football with his dad very much.

suddenly, tommy started to sneeze. he sneezed so hard that he dropped the football.

his dad said, "bless you, tommy. take a break and have a drink of water."

tommy sat down and drank his water. after a few sips, he felt much better.

he said to his dad, "can we play some more football now? it's a lot of fun!"

his dad smiled and said, "yes, let's go!"

they started playing football again and had a great time. tommy never wanted the day to end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named melissa. she wanted to open a special door but it was locked. so, she looked around and found a key. she was so excited, she held the key tight in her hands.

down the hallway, melissa saw her mom. she quickly ran to her and said, "mom, i found a key! can i open the door?"

her mother smiled. "yes, you can use the key, but you have to be careful. inside is a toy car, but it's very fast. so make sure you don't get run over!"

melissa nodded and stuck the key into the lock. she took a deep breath and turned it. the door opened and the car zoomed out. she held her breath, it was moving so fast!

but melissa was brave, so she held the key tight in her hand and eventually the car slowed down. she laughed as she watched it little car go around in circles. she was so proud of herself for holding the key tight!

jim was playing in his room, when he heard something. it was his brother. he was laughing. jim peered around the corner to see what they were up to. his brother was playing with a toy car and was making engine noises. jim smiled. he always enjoyed playing with his brother. 

jim slowly sneaked into the room and tiptoed up to the toy car. his brother must have sensed nobody was around because he jumped with a fright. jim laughed and grabbed the car from his brother. 

jim's brother got restless. he started hopping from foot to foot and making engine noises with his mouth. jim started to giggle and soon the both of them were running around the room pretending to drive a car. 

they continued to play for a while, until his brother started to get tired. jim said it was time for him to go to bed soon. jim's brother listened to him and slowly calmed down. jim gave his brother a hug and making sure his brother was safe in his bed, he waved goodnight and left the room. 

jim smiled and nodded to himself, pleased that his brother minded him.

once upon a time there lived a little girl named nellie. she was always very hungry. one morning, nellie was very excited because she was going to go on an adventure. she opened the door to her house and ventured into the woods. 

nellie soon found a small pond and there was an apple tree beside it. nellie was very hungry, so she picked and ate one of the apples.

a few minutes later, a hungry fox happened to come by and asked nellie if he could have one of the apples. nellie thought for a moment and then said 'no.'

the fox was very sad, but nellie smiled and kindly explained that while she was very hungry herself, it was wrong to take all the apples. she said that if everyone just took what they wanted, soon there wouldnâ€™t be enough for anyone. 

the fox thanked nellie for her wise words, then she waved goodbye and returned home. from that day onwards, nellie always remembered to share and think of others even when she was very hungry.

one day, a little girl named lucy and her mom went to the city. they were very excited because they were going to visit a lawyer! lucy asked why they were going to see a lawyer, but her mom told her not to worry and to just enjoy the ride.

when they arrived, the lawyer asked lucy to have a seat. he smiled a big smile and said, "i'm going to help your mom with something hairy." lucy was eager to know what he meant, but before she could ask, the lawyer told her to go out to the waiting room and stir her strawberry lemonade.

so lucy went out to the waiting room, stirred her lemonade and waited. after a few minutes, her mom and the lawyer came out of the office and told lucy to drink the lemonade.

when she sipped it, lucy noticed the sweet taste of strawberry had been replaced with a sour one. lucy looked up at her mom in confusion and her mom said, "i think we just solved a very hairy problem".

it turns out the lawyer was helping them with a legal problem! he had advised her mom to mix a sour lemon into lucy's lemonade in order to teach her an important lesson. and lucy now knew to always think before making decisions. 

the lawyer shook lucy's hand and said, "good job problem-solver!", and lucy beamed with pride. she was so glad she had been able to

timmy was a greedy boy and he always wanted more. he only thought about himself. one day, he found a piece of candy in his room. he was so excited and paid no attention to his friend, who he had been playing with just before. his friend had now gone.

timmy quickly picked up the piece and started to eat it. his friend watched from the doorway, feeling very sad because he had been so selfish.

just then, mommy came in. she saw what timmy had done and scolded him. then she made him pay by taking away his toy.

timmy was very sad now because he had been so selfish. he realized he had been wrong, but it was too late. he had to pay the price.
