once upon a time, there was a pigeon. this pigeon lived on a farm with lots of other animals. one day, the pigeon became very bossy. he wanted to be in charge of everything! he told the cows where to go and the pigs what to do. the other animals didn't like the bossy pigeon, but they didn't know what to do. 

one day, a little girl came to the farm. she saw the bossy pigeon and knew what to do. she picked up the pigeon and took him for a walk. as they walked, the pigeon became less bossy. he realized that he didn't need to be in charge of everything. he just wanted to be friends with the other animals. 

from that day on, the pigeon was much nicer to the other animals. he didn't try to be bossy anymore. the other animals were happy to have their friend back. and the little girl was happy to have made a new friend too.

tom and lily are twins. they go to school for the first time. they wear uniforms. they have blue shirts and black pants. they look amazing.

they meet their teacher, miss rose. she is very nice. she says, "hello, children. welcome to school. i am your teacher, miss rose. you will learn many things here. but first, you need to listen to me. listening is very important. can you listen to me?"

tom and lily nod. they want to be good students. they sit on the floor with the other children. miss rose reads them a story. it is about a dog and a cat. the dog and the cat are friends. they have fun together. they help each other. tom and lily like the story. they listen carefully. they smile and laugh.

when the story is over, miss rose says, "well done, children. you listened very well. now, it is time for recess. you can go outside and play. but remember, be careful and kind. and come back when you hear the bell. do you understand?"

tom and lily say, "yes, miss rose. we understand." they get up and hold hands. they go outside and play. they make new friends. they have a lot of fun. they are happy. they love school.

once there was a little girl called rose. she was very excited because her mom was taking her out for the day.

one day, lucy was walking in the park with her grandma. she was feeling quite brave and powerful. suddenly, lucy heard something, she stopped to listen carefully. what was it? it was a noise coming from the tall tree nearby. lucy slowly walked towards the tree and found a small oat lying on the ground. she bent down to pick it up.

at that moment, a squirrel came down from the tree. lucy was a bit scared, but grandma told her it was ok and to trust it. 

lucy was hesitant, but she held out her hand with the oat in it and the squirrel took it with its little paws. lucy felt very proud of herself. she understood that being brave and trusting can be powerful. 

grandma then took her home, giving her a big hug, and told lucy that she was very proud of her too.

once there was a very pretty girl called lucy. she had a little sandwich for lunch, so she went to the park to eat it.

at the park, she laughed as she watched the birds fly. suddenly, she felt something wet on her foot. it was a big puddle!

lucy screamed and ran away. but it was too late. she was so wet that her sandwich was ruined.

lucy started to cry. "why did this happen to me?" she asked. 

a kind old man saw what happened and he felt sorry for her. he gave her a new sandwich and smiled.

but when lucy opened the sandwich, she screamed with horror. it was filled with worms!

lucy started to cry again. she was so disappointed. no matter how much the old man tried to cheer her up, she just couldn't stop crying.

in the end, lucy went home sad and empty handed. she never laughed again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going on car rides with her mommy and daddy. one day, they went to the store and the driver of the car was a nice man with black hair. 

as they were driving, lily's mommy asked her to remind her to buy milk. lily nodded her head but soon got distracted by a bird outside the window. she forgot to remind her mommy about the milk. 

when they got to the store, lily's mommy realized she forgot to buy milk. "oh no, i forgot!" she said. the nice driver overheard and offered to drive them back to the store. lily was happy they had a nice driver to help them.

once upon a time, there was a girl named emma. she was a happy little girl. one day, emma got a very special invitation in the mail. her eyes lit up when she saw it because it was beautiful. emma was invited to a party. 

right away, emma started to polish her dress so it was nice and shiny for the party. she was so excited and couldn't wait to get the party. 

when emma arrived at the party, she was a little embarrassed. everyone was dressed nice and she was nervous. but then the party started and she forgot all her worries. she had a wonderful time and even won a prize! 

at the end of the night, emma was so happy she was invited to the party. she thanked the host for such a wonderful invitation, and said goodbye to all her friends. 

the happy little girl went home with a smile on her face, content with how the night turned out.

once upon a time, there was a little puppy, who was very anxious. she wanted all the tummies in the world to be full. one day, she decided to go on a mission to feed everyone.

the puppy walked into the living room and hopped on the couch. she looked around, anxious to start her mission. suddenly, she heard a voice behind her, "what are you doing?"

the puppy turned around to see mama standing there. mama said kindly, â€œyou want to feed everyone? thatâ€™s so sweet of you. letâ€™s see if we can find something for them.â€

mama opened the pantry and pulled out a jar of cookies. she put them in a basket and said, â€œletâ€™s take these cookies outside and feed everyone.â€

the puppy was so excited! she followed mama and together, they fed everyone with the cookies. when they were done, the puppy felt very happy and satisfied. she had helped make everyoneâ€™s tummy full and that made her feel really good.

once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named tom. tom had to go to the airport. his family was going to send him to his grandma's house for a visit. tom did not like the airport. it was big and loud.

at the airport, tom saw many people. he also saw other animals. they were all going on trips, too. tom felt a little less grumpy. he made a new friend, a dog named max. max was going to the park with his family.

when it was time to say goodbye, tom and max were sad. but they knew they would see each other again. tom went on the airplane to his grandma's house. he was not grumpy anymore. he was excited to see his grandma and tell her about his new friend.

once upon a time there was a lion called tommy. tommy was very brave and loved to roar. he was always proud of his roaring because it was loud and strong.

one day, tommy was walking in the forest when he saw an amazing video. he had never seen anything like it before! he was amazed at all the pictures on the screen.

tommy watched the video until it was finished, and then he turned around and gave a big roar! he was so happy and he knew no sound was louder than his.

that night, tommy fell asleep happy, dreaming of roaring and being amazed by fantastic videos.

molly and jack were very excited. they were going to the hospital to see their new baby brother. they couldn't wait to meet him. but when they got there, the doctor said that the baby needed to stay in the hospital for a little longer. molly and jack felt anxious and sad. 

the doctor said that the baby was very small, and the doctors wanted to make sure that he was healthy before sending him home. molly and jack waited and waited, but the baby seemed to be taking a long time to get better. 

finally, after what seemed like forever, the doctor told them that their baby brother was ready to go home. molly and jack were very happy. they had been so anxious, waiting all that time. but in the end, the baby was happy and healthy, and molly and jack took him home with them.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her favorite cube toy. one day, she went out to play with her friends and left her cube toy on the ground. when she came back, her cube was gone!

lily was very sad and scared. she thought someone might have taken her cube. she was fearful that she might never see it again. but then, she remembered that she had locked her cube in her toy chest.

lily learned that it's important to keep our things safe by locking them up. she felt happy that her cube was safe and she could play with it again. from that day on, she made sure to always lock up her things when she was done playing with them.

one day, a little boy named tom wanted to go to a big event with his mom and dad. the event was at a park with many people, games, and balloons. tom was very excited and ran to get his shoes.

but tom did not tie his shoes well. he was in a hurry and did not listen to his mom, who told him to make a knot. he just made a loop and hoped it would stay.

when they got to the park, tom saw a big slide. he wanted to try it and ran to the line. he waited for his turn and climbed to the top. he smiled and waved to his mom and dad.

but when he slid down, his shoe loop came undone. his foot slipped out of his shoe and he lost his balance. he bumped into another kid and they both fell off the slide. they landed on the grass, which was soft, but they still got hurt.

tom and the other kid cried and their moms and dads came to help them. they had scratches and bruises and felt very sorry. tom's mom gave him a hug and a band-aid. she said, "tom, you should have tied your shoes well. then you would not have slipped and hurt yourself and the other kid. next time, please listen to me and do what i say. it is for your own good."

tom nodded and said, "i'm sorry, mom. i'm sorry, other kid. i learned my lesson. i will tie my shoes well from now on. and i will listen to you and do what you say. i don't want to slip and hurt anyone again."

the other kid forgave tom and they became friends. they played together at the park and had fun. tom was careful and did not slip again. he enjoyed the event and thanked his mom and dad for taking him. he also thanked the soft grass for breaking his fall. he was happy and learned a moral value.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and run around with her friends. one day, lily's mom gave her a chubby teddy bear as a gift. lily loved her new teddy bear and hugged it all the time.

one day, lily's friend came over to play. she was wearing a mask on her face because she was sick. lily asked her friend why she was wearing a mask. her friend explained that she didn't want to get lily sick too. lily said, "oh, i understand. welcome to my house anyway!"

lily's mom was very proud of her for being so kind and understanding. she told lily that it's important to be nice to others, even if they look different or have to wear a mask. lily learned that being kind and welcoming to others is always the right thing to do.

once upon a time, there was a little mouse named max who lived in a big field. max loved to explore the field and play with his friends. one day, max saw a shiny cheese that was glowing in the dark. max wanted to eat the cheese, but he knew it was a trap. 

max's friend, lily the rabbit, saw him looking at the cheese and asked, "what is it, max?" max replied, "it's a trap, but the cheese is so pretty and it's glowing." lily said, "don't worry, max. let's be patient and find some other food to eat." 

max listened to lily and decided to be patient. they searched the field and found some delicious carrots to eat instead. max was happy that he didn't fall into the trap and was grateful for his patient friend, lily. from that day on, max and lily explored the field together, always being patient and careful.

once there was a girl named lucy. she was three and she loved to explore new places.
one day, lucy decided to go on an adventure and see what she could find. she had to leave her home and so she said goodbye to her mom and dad and went off on her own.

as lucy walked through the woods, she saw dark clouds rolling in. all of a sudden, she noticed something strange in the sky. it was steam! it was billowing up from the ground like a cloud. lucy was excited and ran over to see what was making the steam.

when she got closer, lucy realized it was a hot spring! it was warm and the steam felt nice in the cool air. she watched as the steam rose up out of the spring like a dark mist. she was fascinated and smiled to herself.

lucy decided to take a closer look and jumped in the spring. she splashed around and laughed. she was having so much fun. after a while, she said goodbye to the steam and left to go back home.

the sun was bright and warm. an ant was scurrying around in the grass. suddenly, it felt something urging it to go faster. it ran at a quick speed and felt alive.

the ant moved up a hill and saw a big pond at the top. it wanted to reach the pond but was worried it would get there too slow. so it kept running and running.

the ant's legs were getting tired but it kept going. it kept its focus on the water and ran faster and faster. finally, it arrived and saw a healthy looking pond with lots of little creatures swimming around. 

the ant stepped into the pond and felt thrilled. it had used its energy to reach its goal and felt much better for it. it felt proud and happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved waffles. she ate waffles for breakfast every day. one day, her mom made her waffles with spicy syrup. lily didn't like it because it was too spicy.

lily said to her mom, "mommy, this waffle is too spicy. can you please make me another one without the spicy syrup?"

her mom replied, "i'm sorry, lily. we don't have any more waffles. but i can make you something else for breakfast."

lily didn't want anything else for breakfast. she really wanted a waffle without the spicy syrup. she started to cry and said, "i want a waffle without the spicy syrup. please, mommy."

her mom thought for a moment and said, "i have an idea. let's go to the store and buy some more waffles. we can lock them in the pantry so we always have some on hand."

lily was happy with her mom's idea. they went to the store and bought a big box of waffles. they locked them in the pantry so they would always have waffles without spicy syrup. and lily never had to eat spicy waffles again.

once upon a time there was a mighty reef out in the ocean. one day, a little fish wanted to open it. he had heard lots of stories about what was inside the reef and was determined to find out! he swam up and knocked on the reef, but it did not open. he swam back and forth, pushing against the reef and trying to find a way in. just when he was about to give up, he heard a loud rumble, and the reef began to open.

inside the reef was a wonderful surprise! there was a big cave filled with treasures, and colourful creatures were swimming around. the fish was so excited! he saw a beautiful pearl and picked it up with his fins. he held it in his fins and carefully swam back out of the reef. as the reef closed behind him, the little fish felt very proud. he had opened the mighty reef and found a wonderful surprise inside!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a glass cup that she loved very much. it was her favorite cup to drink juice from. one day, lily's mom asked her to support her little brother, tim, while she was cooking dinner. lily felt very grown-up and happy to help.

while they were playing, tim saw lily's glass cup on the table. he wanted to touch it, but lily knew it was breakable. she felt a little guilty for not putting it away. so, she decided to support tim and help him play with something else. they played with soft toys and had lots of fun.

at the end of the day, lily's mom thanked her for being such a good helper. lily felt proud that she was able to support her little brother and keep him safe. she also learned to put her glass cup away when she was not using it. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a fat cat named tom. tom loved to play outside with his friends. one day, tom and his friends found a big tire in the yard. they all wanted to play with the tire.

tom had an idea. he said, "let's cover the tire with soft grass and make a bed for us to sleep on." his friends liked the idea. they all worked together to cover the tire with grass. the tire became a soft, cozy bed for them to rest on.

after they finished, they all lay down on the tire bed. they were very happy and tired from playing. the fat cat tom and his friends closed their eyes and took a long nap on their new tire bed. they dreamed of more fun adventures they could have together.

little dan was playing in his yard, organizing all the toys so they were easy to find. he heard his mom calling him inside, but he wanted to stay outside to keep playing.

suddenly, dan spotted a small, colorful, object on the ground. he went to take a closer look, and realized it was a piece of candy. he put it in his pocket, thinking he could eat it later.

when dan went inside for dinner, he still had the candy. he asked his mom if he could eat it, and she said yes. little dan tasted the candy, and found it was very sweet, so he ate it all up.

unfortunately, the candy did not taste as sweet as it had looked. in fact, it tasted very bitter. little dan had swallowed something poisonous!

despite his mother's calls for help, dan was too sick to get out of bed the next day. although the doctors worked hard, they were unable to save dan.

little dan's ordeal was a lesson for us all: be careful with random objects in the yard, and never taste something you don't know.

pete and his dad were in the garage, fixing a toy car. the car had some old wires that needed to be replaced. pete watched as his dad took out some new wires - they were soft and smooth.

dad said, "we can restore this car with these new wires."

pete was excited. he helped his dad connect the new wires. after a few minutes, the car started to move!

the two of them cheered. dad said, "look at how much better this car is, now that we replaced the harsh old wires."

pete gave a big smile. the car was fixed, and it was much better than before.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. sue loved to create things with her hands. one day, she found a thin cactus in her yard. she thought it would be fun to make something with it.

sue took the thin cactus and put it in a pot. she gave it water and put it in the sun. the cactus started to grow bigger and bigger. sue was very happy to see her creation grow.

but one day, sue tried to touch the cactus. it had sharp points and hurt her hand. she cried and cried because it hurt so much. in the end, sue had to throw the cactus away. she learned not to touch things that can hurt her.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play together. one day, they go to the park with their moms. in the park, they see a big house. it is white and shiny. it has many windows and doors.

"wow, look at that house!" anna says. "it is so pretty!"

ben nods. "it is a palace," he says. "a king and a queen live there."

anna and ben want to see the palace. they run to the gate. the gate is closed. there is a sign. it says: "do not touch. do not enter."

anna and ben are sad. they want to touch the palace. they want to enter the palace. they want to meet the king and the queen.

"maybe we can ask them to let us in," anna says.

"maybe," ben says. "but how?"

they see a man. he wears a hat and a coat. he has a badge. he is a guard. he watches the palace.

anna and ben go to the guard. they smile. they say: "hello, sir. we are anna and ben. we are friends. we like the palace. can we touch it? can we enter it? can we meet the king and the queen?"

the guard looks at them. he shakes his head. he says: "no, you cannot. the palace is not for touching. the palace is not for entering. the king and the queen are not for meeting. they are very busy. they have important things to do. you are just normal kids. you have to play somewhere else."

anna and ben are sad. they do not understand. they think the palace is for everyone. they think the king and the queen are nice. they think they are not normal. they are special.

they say: "but we are not normal. we are special. we have big dreams. we have good hearts. we have fun ideas. we want to see the palace. we want to meet the king and the queen. please, sir, please."

the guard looks at them. he smiles. he says: "you are right. you are not normal. you are special. you have big dreams. you have good hearts. you have fun ideas. but you still cannot touch the palace. you still cannot enter the palace. you still cannot meet the king and the queen. they have rules. they have security. they have privacy. you have to respect that. but you can do something else. you can imagine. you can pretend. you can create. you can make your own palace. you can be your own king and queen. you can have your own adventure. that is more fun. that is more special. that is more normal."

anna and ben think. they nod. they say: "thank you, sir. thank you for your words. we will do that. we will imagine. we will pretend. we will create. we will make our own palace. we will be our own king and queen. we will have our own adventure. that is more fun. that is more special. that is more normal."

they hug the guard. they run to the playground. they find some sticks and stones and leaves and flowers. they build their own palace. they crown themselves king and queen. they invite their moms and other kids to join them. they have a lot of fun. they are happy. they are normal. they are special.

once upon a time there was a man named bob. bob was reliable and he always wanted to help everyone. everywhere he went, he was always looking for someone he could help. 

one day, bob was in a house which was full of things. he saw a nail which was stuck in the wall and he wanted to help. so he went over to the nail and used his hammer to hit it. with a few simple hits he managed to get the nail out of the wall.

bob was so proud of himself but then he noticed something strange. behind the nail there was a big secret door. bob didn't know where it led but he knew he wanted to help and so he opened the door. 

behind the door he discovered a tiny secret room. inside were two little kids. they were so excited to see bob and he said to them: "hey, i'm here to help!" the kids smiled and said: "thank you, bob. you're so reliable!" 

bob had opened the door and helped them have their secret room. he was so happy that he'd been able to help that he jumped with joy. from that day on, bob would always use his reliability to help people.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily went to the park. she saw a boy playing with a ball. she said, "hi, can i play with you?" the boy said, "yes, you can play with me."

lily and the boy played catch with the ball. they were having so much fun. suddenly, lily saw a man grilling beef on a barbecue. she said, "that smells nice!" the boy said, "yeah, my dad is cooking for us."

after a while, lily wanted to try something new. she said, "can we balance on the curb?" the boy said, "sure, let's try it!" they both stood on the curb and tried to balance. they laughed and had a great time. 

when it was time for lily to go home, she said, "thanks for playing with me. it was nice to meet you!" the boy said, "you're welcome. let's play again soon!" and they said goodbye with big smiles on their faces.
